Todoist is a great tool to sort your to do list by projects, due date and 
priority while having a clean look that can be used during work time. 
However, at least as a premium function, I am missing two things. 1. One is 
to show some tasks only after a prior necessary task was fulfilled instead 
of showing all at once making the list overwhelming. 2. The other is a dark 
widget theme with dark background and white font color. I have everything 
set to dark, but the todoist list widget on my phone's desktop shines 
blindingly white.

The multiple ways of organizing and tracking your Todo lists makes 
everything easy. I am able to use the "Getting Things Done" method, 
pioneered by David Allen, with ease. Can't say enough good things about 
this product.

Able to set up complex subcategories which helps dividing huge assigments 
into less scary subtasks. Hope they separate plan-to-work-on-it date and 
deadline so that we could prioritize our task based on time constraint more 
easily.

Love it! I wish the task bars weren't so big I don't like to scroll to see 
all of my goals but that's me nit picking. One other tool I'd like to see 
is a calendar so I can click a day in the past and see all of the things I 
did that day. Again, me being extra. I love it! Best app I've tried and 
I've tried a lot of apps!

I was a bit reluctant about getting the paid version of this app. Now that 
I have it, I can't believe I waited! I am now LIVING out of this app. It's 
the one I use for organizing my days, prioritizing what to do first, 
second, third, etc. But the biggest critierion I use for judging an app is 
"Does it help me?". And in the case of Todoist, the answer is YES. My days 
are more productive, I'm getting more done, and it keeps me motivated. 
Probably the best app I've ever purchased. And it's awesome that I can 
switch between my PC, iPad, and Android phone - all seemlessly. Just get 
it. :-)

It took me a while to set it up for myself, but I love using it. I find it 
highly motivating. Addicting almost to get those Karma points. The app 
works really well for GTD.

For the features it provides its a fairly solid app. There are a couple 
things i wish you didn't have to pay for, but I guess thats what premium 
for.

No subtasks but amazing interface. The desktop is very sleek and the mobile

This app is fantastic. It's a task management system that doesn't go 
overboard like Jira. Collaboration is super easy and gives a great view 
over a large project like moving house. There was a bug with sharing 
projects initially but that got resolved pretty fast. My only problem with 
the app is making things sub tasks. The interaction where you hold a task 
and drag it up or down to rank it is useful but it's so sensitive to 
left/right movement you accidentally make things sub tasks all the time. If 
I had to drag a task further to the left or right that'd be great.

The phone app is good but the Wear OS app is pretty much useless. You can't see your to-do list on your smartwatch. You'll get 5 star the day I can have my Alexa shopping list on my wrist.  Edit: ready to 5 star the hell out of your app as soon as it is released on wear OS. +1 star for replying nicely to my comment. Welcome to my personal list of awesome devs who take time to answer comments in a constructive way. I'd be happy to beta test the Wear OS app

Updating my feedback. Its still the best/logical ToDo App out there. 
Unclutered, straight forward, lots of sensible extras, but the WearOS App 
is dragging far behind. Its time to put more functionality in it where you 
can see at least the 7 Day outlook, be able to check off things, and of 
course continue to add as is the only thing you can do now. Smart watches 
are flooding the market, and Dev's need to step up the pace.

The app is so close to perfect, of only you could get the productivity 
chart without going to premium. Or if it just let you see what you'd done 
that day, as it removes completed tasks. The other premium content, I can 
take or leave, but I need to see what I've accomplished as part of my 
therapy. If that part wasn't behind the paywall I would have been ecstatic. 
It seems such an integral part, so I'm confused as to why it's locked away. 
Otherwise, this is a brilliant app.

No dark theme. Worse yet, this app does not work unless you are logged in 
and online. With your online registration info, Todoist will then send you 
junk email for the rest of your life, until you unsubscribe. In response to 
these last complaints, the developer says, "The sign-up process takes 30 
seconds, then you can use the app offline and unsubscribe from any emails 
anytime." Fair enough, I suppose, but I still don't find the app as 
practical as others out there, such as EPIM or BusinessCalendar2.

Updated my review after several years of using Todoist...from 4 stars to 5 stars after going premium.  I don't work for Todoist and was given no promotion. They didn't even ask me to write this review, and I have only written a few reviews. If I don;t like an app I just delete it, which I think most people do.   Started using Todoist after trying several others. There was a learning curve but not bad. Being all online is great. Still don't quite have the hang of getting all my tasks organized under their projects and labels.   I used the free version for a long time (years) and they never bugged me much about going with premium. I finally went premium after I decided I needed the extra features.  Doesn't seem to ever be down. I also attached it to my Chrome browser and have it on my android phone. Works great on all devices. Not buggy at all.  Having it on all my devices and the browser is essential to the core idea of getting tasks accomplished. I don't have time to log onto one device and work on my tasks. I need to be able to log on to any of my devices and add, delete and organize my tasks. Todoist does all this.  I have no negatives to say about this app.

This has helped me sleep better at night! There always seems to be a 
thought that pops into my head after I've finished working for the night, 
or when I'm out shopping. It's easy to add it to Todoist so I remember by 
the deadline of my choice. It's been great to plan my tasks out and with a 
bit more clarity and I get a sense of satisfaction when I can tick 
something off. After a few weeks of using it, I have been more productive 
than usual. That doesn't mean I've managed to complete every task every day 
but I've been able to organise each day to productive and if something 
comes up, it's easy to reorganise it.

After searching for a long time for a todo app that does exactly what I 
want, I finally found one. Simplicity with an underlying and accessible 
advanced feature set to let me do everything an task management and 
planning app should do. I have recommended this app to multiple people that 
have all been positive.

Being a productivity geek for almost a decade now, I can safely say that I 
have been through a LOT of task managers. And after using Todoist for 
nearly a half a year now, I can safely say that it is without a doubt, both 
the one that is best and outlasted the rest. THE NUMBER ONE KILLER FEATURE 
is the natural language due date input. I will never be able to use task 
managers any other way after this. Rich with all the features you might 
want, definitely well suited for power users, and an amazing rewards 
program for Premium and the sweetest customer service.

I'm giving this app 5 stars despite the fact I'm not going to use it again 
and I will tell you why. It is well designed, has really fantastic features 
like calendar sync and I could not point to anything wrong with it. I was 
trying it out, after using another a more visual to-do app however I just 
can't get used to not seeing all my tasks ordered on one page - this is no 
fault of todoist. And true to their word, I asked for the 30 day money back 
guarantee and they replied immediately and obliged. Great service! Thanks

Highly recommend for anyone who has tasks to complete. No one tool is 
perfect, but this comes really darn close, and few times have there been 
things that aren't possible in my system. I picked up this app while 
learning the GTD system, and it has seriously improved my happiness and 
stress. I now see tasks and actionable things that I can do instead of a 
dread of vauge projects. If you are going to be serious, premium is well 
worth it. Personally, I have a @waiting and @next_action tags as well as 
several location ones that help me look at exactly what the work I can do 
right now is. Comments are suprisingly useful, mostly for attaching PDFs. I 
don't have a ton of other apps to compare it too, but it runs incredibly 
smooth, useful, works across all my devices, and I feel like I owe them 
this review after all the good this app has brought me.

In project view I cannot hide completed tasks and my projects stay 
cluttered with completed tasks. I really want to like this app and have it 
become my primary tool for getting things done but this is a huge flaw for 
my use. If you think about a physical pen and paper todo list, there's 
something satisfying about crossing a line through the item or checking a 
once-blank box, that isn't there in this app. I want to feel like I can 
clearly see what I have left to do for the day. I would really appreciate 
if completing tasks made the task significantly different (strikethrough or 
making the text of completed tasks more transparent). I want to see that 
I've completed something (for the day). I think another fun addition for 
the programmers would be visually rewarding recurring tasks being completed 
with a little fireworks display or a little cute puppy or something next to 
the task. Please consider these additions to the app as it would really 
improve my life. I will still use this app but I would love for the app to 
respond more to my little successes each day. Thank you!

Good looking and easy to use. Practical features. Helps me stay organised 
studying and running my business. Love that it links to other apps on 
laptop ( though the link to gmail doesn't give you the specific message). 
Saves me loads of time and I can update on the run from my phone.
Tried a lot of task systems, this is certainly the winner.  Works great with GTD.  Also connects with Asana and other apps via Zapier for larger projects
A well thought out app for keeping organized and on task. I like that I can make lists on the computer and view or update them on my phone.

Very well made. Easy to use. I would have liked being able to see details

I really like the simple layout of this app and the daily reminders and

Love the app but they still have not resolved my issue that started after version 12. I have to keep rolling back to version 11.  The todoist team kept working on my issue and continued to stay in contact with me until corrected my problem. Yeah for the support!

Would still like a bit more versatile/adaptive widget, but for all I use it for, it's a joyful interface and an all-in-all solid app.

Made it very easy and intuitive to embrace GTD, and build habits and tools

Loved the app but on my recurring tasks (every 30th) it skipped the month

I would really like the ability to define an estimated time to complete each task, then to be able to sync those tasks to Google Calendar. If you didn't complete some, the app could then help you set it up for another day. To do lists are nice, but it's a pain to manually write up your day on the calendar. An app like this could be so powerful if it could help manage that. If it could see what's on your calendar already and work around that... If it could know what things could be done indoors vs outside and in what weather and during what hours, it could work around that... So many possibilities. I get a boost by managing my list, but I lose productivity when I have to react to the environment and schedule things and not get behind. It could even help you figure out how long it takes for you to do certain tasks and then suggest realistic amounts of time for you. These are features I would pay for!

I'm using todoist for many years and the premium is well worth the money. I can see constant improvements over time and while the team seems unresponsive in some cases, I think they do a very good job at keeping the product simple and help to get productivity high. The best things for me are the possibility to nest tasks (decomposition helps me beat procrastination), flexible reminders and karma.

I used to switch between different to-do apps but I've now been using Todoist for several years without thinking about changing. The app is updated regularly with small but worthwhile improvements and it just suits me very well. I would like to see better management of project deadlines added and a few other small changes but Todoist will be my to-do app for the foreseeable time.

Was great until updating my phone to Oreo. The widget no longer works which makes the app near useless for me. I paid for premium too so really good this gets fixed. It's not really acceptable for a paid service though.  Edit: The widget still doesn't work on Oreo on Go Launcher. Does anyone care about this? I'm paying for something I can't use anymore. Latest update: Thanks, the last reply I got a few months back was that you knew about the issue and working on a fix so I didn't provide any extra info. So on my Oneplus 3t on Oreo using Go Launcher I use the full widget on the next 7 days view. It doesn't scroll at all. If I add a new task using the plus sign then sometimes it displays the list part way down or a few days ahead so I can see the current day. I can select an item to edit it or tick it off but I can't drag or reorder tasks.

Well, I am very frustrated with one and only one thing... slow customer support. I have this issue with reminders where I can't add reminders anymore. Even though I have only few reminders, it keeps giving me an error that I can't have more than 700 reminders. I definitely don't have 700 reminders, it's not even close. My total number of tasks are little more than 100 only. It's been couple weeks since I have contacted them with this issue and they don't have a solution for me yet. I get an email from them every 3-5 days asking for some information and then I here back from them after few days. It's too bad as I like everything else about this app. If they can't fix it for me in time, I will try another app for my needs.  Update: Still no fix after weeks of wait. I am moving on to different todo app "ticktick" now.

Very simple to use due to it understanding natural language and shortcuts are easy to get acquainted with. Android widget allows me to quickly screen out irrelevant projects during work hours. Still itching to try out the location specific reminders but it's great knowing I have the feature. Love that I can add and work on tasks from phone or on my Mac. Something that could take this to the next level as a productivity tool is the ability to add a "Done list" feature that tallies the completion of repeating tasks so that you can chart and work on habits or see how your cumulative training in one aspect is going across a calendar or by minutes/hours spent.

Too bloated, takes the long way round to do the simplest of tasks. March 12/18: I was asked by Todoist to provide additional info on how this app could be improved with regard to speeding up the time it takes in order to do simple;  here is one example. Adding a simple task via Google Home is a chore. You add the   Task, set the project, priority etc. and once that is done is takes far too long to excite the damn program. "Do you want to make any changes?" and  if no, it then asks if there is anything else. This is unnecessary and the pauses are ridiculous. Why can't you just say, "ok I'm done" or I'm finished, instead, bypassing the wait time. Also, the Google Home support is poor, it doesn't recognize plurals, the help files are unhelpful and MOST OF ALL designating date and time is confusing and rarely works for me. And for God's sakes, if the program doesnt recognise a command it goes through the whole damned shpeel (?) about what it actually CAN do EVERY TIME. This app was too expensive to have such easily correctable issues. You can't even dictate notes or memos. For shame.

I've been needing some organization in my life and they provide it! It's so great that I can literally be anywhere in the world and use this software. My work is not too keen on letting unauthorized software come on to the computer so it's great to have a webapp when I don't feel like using this small phone screen.

Despite all the high ratings, this was not useful at all for me. I have to pay just to set a simple reminder! I couldn't find a help section to instruct on how to use the app and had to come to play-store for that. I set a task after two minutes and waited, and after two minutes, nothing happens, no reminder no action. What is the point of this app then. It might work well for others but not for me.

This tool is fantastic ! I cannot believe that I didn't discover it earlier, had tried so many others, always quickly abandoned. Todoist is extremely simple to use, very user friendly, but nevertheless it has a wide range of possibilities and really helps you get things done. I love how easy it is to create repetitive tasks. It is multi-platforms, synchronisation between devices is automatic and instantaneous. The support section is very helpful and there's a lot of instruction videos on YouTube. I suscribed for the paid version, it's worth the price for me, but you can get very well along with the free version.

I am new to this kid of app. So far I love it! Especially the abreviations you can just type in to decise the time and the category. They are so intuitive you can almost just guess them! Only thing missing is a full adapted app to the samsung gear watch. It shows the tasks through notifications but only wjen they are due and you dont have a lot of options on it.

Great app, simple to use and very intuitive! Helps me keep all my tasks in line & make sure I have done everything I need to do for work. Only issue is occasionally the app does not sync properly with the website & chrome plugin, which can cause some tasks (usually those inputted directly into the app) to be overlooked without intentionally looking at the app. Other than that, it would get the full 5⭐

Would love a simple way to set a simple reminder. e.g. Remind me to put the bins out at 8pm, and have various beeps etc try to get my attention at this specific time. Perhaps this disagrees with the App's philosophy, but I would certainly love this feature.

Love this app. Its helped me a lot in noting down things I need to do or remember and doing so not have to juggle as many tasks in my head. Its great a really great productivity tool. However there are features that could be added that I think users would find really useful like a way to put subtasks under one larger to do task. And a better folder system to organize things needed to be remembered for today as vs in a week, month, or year.

Like nearly every other Task List app these days, its idea of "Themes" is changing the color of a bar across the top of the screen; the theme doesn't alter the black on white text style of the application.  Nothing beats white on black for easy on the eyes and since I'm literally in my task list ALL DAY LONG, the absence of that display feature is a deal breaker. I currently use a very simplistic app with a "night mode" that coverts the display from black on white to white on black. That free app also integrates with Google Tasks for seamless portability across all of my devices. How is it that this vendor decides that integration is a PREMIUM feature? I certainly not PAYING just to discover that I don't like how it integrates with Google!  Uninstalling the app after I submit this review.

Came to me as a recommendation from another entrepreneur. Thought it would be tacky as I'm not really into apps but am I ever blown away. Productivity has soared and turned small tasks into a game. It's actually pretty fun but super helpful

Love this app, is perfect for keeping on top of assignments and the fact 
that it scores you on how well you are doing creates a sense of motivation 
to do tasks that you keep putting off. Apart from certain features being 
restricted for free accounts, I can't fault this app :)
Probably one of the best To Do list apps left. Other good ones have been bought and closed down. Hopefully Todoist will survive.

This app single handedly teached me how to organise my life. I noticed how 
important it is to worry less about your system like colors of your tasks 
and instead focus on doing them and figuring out the next step. Awesome 
team and app design. Highly recommend!
Encouraging thoughts after completing tasks is particularly what made me choose Todoist over other applications.  Also, the display colours are good.

paid version seems great, but I'm not willing to pay that much to find out.   I would like some of the functions (text reminders, calendar integration) without paying so much.   Otherwise good interface.
The most awesome Part is that e.g. For the reminders you can write 'every 2 days' and you will have your reminder every second day

Great app! Really allows me to lay out tasks and projects in a way that works for me, and I love that I can have it up on my computer while at work, then walk away and use it on my phone. I just wish there were more color-coding options for projects!
Best task list app I've tried. Especially nice for repeated tasks like bills as the task order can be resorted by date.

The 2-way Google Calendar sync is the killer feature that made me switch to this app.  Still missing: a GUI for setting recurrence of tasks. The natural language input is ok, but a GUI like Google Calendar would be a good complement!
I really loved it. I actually tried 1-2 similar app for setting goals or Todo list, but I find this one very convenient and simple.
I don't need complex app..but compared to a previous one, at least this can do different project lists which is fab.
Love this app. Almost immediately bought the premium version because it was useful and practical. They do a really good job of making it easy to use

This app is absolutely great. It is quite intuitive after reading about application functionality on the website. I wish that there was a lifetime subscription option rather than a yearly option. Premium is completely worth it.
It's a good App. Only missing thing is reminders in free version. Premium price is very high as I don't think other than reminders I need any other premium feature. Overall very useful app
This app motivate you to work hard or to do tasks properly at the r8. Time...lazy people   should definitely try this app
Very good app. In this day and age when things are so fast, it helps me stay on track. Also love the email reminders every morning.
Very happy with this app. Well thought out, feels so intuitive to use and has really helped me be more productive with very little extra effort on my part.

It is very easy to use to do list app. Sends reminders promptly. Helps me track activities regularly. the concept of karma also makes u finish your tasks. All great except sometimes browser extensions provided by todoist doesn't sync unless we relogin
I've been using the premium version of this app for some time now and the only thing I wish it had was a progress bar and an amoled black theme

Very good for larger goals or things done on an intermittent basis. For things you want to do daily, use a habit tracker. There is a huge difference and you will ruin your experience with this app if you ask it to do things it isn't meant for.  If it could integrate with my calendar, that would be the holy grail.
I am still confused. My level of confusion is less now, but it is getting better.
Very user-friendly and I absolutely love the priority feature, it helps me manage my day a lot better.
This is the perfect App for us OCD folks.  I especially love the way it works across multiple devices.
Great app, but the widget (functionality that i consider to be essential for daily usage) is broken and needs bug fixing before I'll award a 5 star rating.
Absolutely love it. The extensive integration all the way from browser to laptop to smartphone really has kept me on track because my to-dos are always at my fingertips. Highly recommend!
Todoist is a very user friendly and practical app for creating and tracking tasks, complete with email reminders to help you stay on task!
Just can't live without it. It's become my second brain for all sorts of trivia and daily stuff. It's become my trusted system. Absolutely love it.
Love the simplicity of it -- a view of your to-do list for today and for the week, and that's it. Also love the natural language processing for when I create a to-do item.
The best todo app I've used by far. It has a few shortcomings but nothing serious. I would love if you added dark theme for night use - similar to what Twitter and Medium do.
Awesome! please keep improving adding tasks as efficient as possible. i think that smart input widgets could do the job better than the text commands in some cases.

Super tool for remembering and prioritizing tasks. I especially like that I

text option
A fantastic tool that helps you to be productive and reminds you if you have any tasks that you didn't complete so that it holds you accountable to complete your tasks for the day.
I've begun to realize that I'm the type of person who needs to be reminded of things due to a hectic schedule. This app keeps me on track with everything.
I wish you could allow time logging for tasks and in turn allow the user to understand planned vs actual results. Willing to fund development of feature! Get the two features and it's 5 stars.
Its good. The time and repeating set up is nonintuitive when you first use it but you get accustomed to it.

This has to be one of the most intuitive and flexible task applications I have ever used. The number of features implemented by this application is insane. It had features I didn't even know I wanted.
I manage my entire business and personal life through this app.  Don't know what I'd do without it.
I tend to use Todoist as a shared task / grocery list with my partner. My only gripe is when you add an item it goes to the bottom of the list, but I would prefer it goes to the top.

I was looking for an app that handles reoccurring events, allows me to collaborate with my wife, has good android widgets, is simple to use and most importantly did not require me to spend money to have those features. I tried any do, trello, and some others and this one fits the bill!
An awesome app. My productivity has such an increase since I actively use this app. Perfect also to organize our small team for a YouTube channel and assign tasks for planned trips etc.

Very useful and easy to use tool. I use it for everything. I upgraded to the premium, I don't really see the point, but I figured I'd try it out.

I use the basic version of this app for all of my to-do items across my life.  It is wonderful.  I sync it with my Google calendar to schedule when I complete each task during my day; it's highly effective. The only thing I wish they had was the ability to postpone one occurrence of a reoccurring task without changing the series itself.

This is exactly what I am looking for, for a personal to do list. It helps me stay on top of daily tasks so I can build habits. Haven't used it for work but it looks good for that too.  I don't know if I would get the premium version. The price seems a bit steep when I can get Microsoft office for 20 to 40 bucks more.

This is one of my top 5 apps I use daily. It keeps me productive and helps me get all of my 'to dos' out of my head so I can put it in this app, give it a date & category, and not worry about it again until Todoist reminds me to do it. Before I found this I was endlessly overwhelmed with tasks that needed to be done and not knowing where to begin. Other apps and calendars have never touched what Todoist has helped me to accomplish and the peace of mind it gives me to know I've got a plan for keeping up with my priorities.

I wish I could give this app 4.5 stars. If it integrated smoothly with Google Inbox, I would give it 5 stars for sure. It integrates very smoothly with Gmail (but I really like Inbox) so if you use Gmail, you'll love this.   You can add emails to your task list. You can say "Ok Google and a task_____" by way of an IFTTT applet, you can categorize your tasks as 'projects', and you can collaborate with others.  I bought the premium (not too expensive) and that allows me to add reminders...to my phone or via email. I use the chrome extension, though, so who needs an email when the icon is staring at you 24/7 from the top of the page! I was disappointed that I couldn't add a reminder without buying the premium, but the way the app syncs with my phone and my desktop, reminders are really not needed.   Tasks are added to my google calendar (which I toggle off, since it's so cluttered).   So far, very efficient. After I use it for another month or so, I'll re-review.

100% recommended : It is an essential app to have in your phone to have your day to day tasks or even  your sporadic tasks organized.  Tip: Let the app worry what you need to do all day so that you can focus on the task at hand.  You guys have done a fascination job developing this vital app.

I used to use an app that had many more options and was reluctant to switch but now I really enjoy the simplicity of Todoist. Labels can be used if you wish to add more tracking options such as context or goals. I find myself spending more time getting things done now vs organizing tasks. Biggest plus for me is that it is cross platform and has an API that is easy to work with so I can import my tasks from the prior app I was using. The Google Home integration is also fantastic!

Loving using the basic version. Really like the fact that you can categorise them into dufferent projects, add the priority and set recurring tasks. It's very intuitive and easy to use. Keeps me on track and I'm more productive because of it.   Much prefer this to Trello.

This app has changed my life. I now have everything i need to achieve all in one place and am so much more productive. It's really simple to use and I can organise all aspects of my life, from a simple shopping list to large complex work projects. love it!

Awesome app. Great UI. Well built logic which makes it flow even better. The team did a great job. I do wish that comment didn't come as a premium feature but I completely understand. I'd suggest a student pricing model. Thank you for the app.

Awesome. Moved to this from ASANA because of better pricing. Missing some features but overall has changed the entire way I do task mangement. Instant sync with calendar and good integration into Gmail make it all worth it.

switched to this from Any.Do and it's gotten my life in order so much. helps with college life like you wouldn't believe. also helps me organize my personal life and projects to a whole new level. definitely worth paying premium. this app will change your life .

I love this app, though I wish I could set long time goals. I tried to write my chores for my allowance on it, and every single day I get the notification my chore is overdue. Maybe add a feature where the goal doesn't have a due date. (Unless I have not found the feature yet)
Love this Todo app. So simple and focused on the task at hand. Google calendar integration is great as well. Would like to see that improved with links directly to the task

I will never pay $30 for a app like this. Just like Google to make this the only reminder app other than the stock one on my phone. Always money! Always about GOOGLE GREED. This apps developer is not to blame for Google's choice and making them the only other alternative default reminder app on Android OS. Actually I would congratulate this apps designers because they successfully signed on to deal with Google to make some money. Well it won't come out of my wallet.
Advertises itself as a free app, yet keeps begging me to upgrade to premium to unlock even the most basic features.
Really nice to use and I like the grouping of tasks using projects. Only thing I think it is lacking is the ability to have a greater depth of sub tasks.

Initially all went well and have used the app for months. Even tried the Premium but its too expensive. Unable to use the free version with google calender sync. If the free version cant even remind then whats the use.

"Free forever" is incredibly misleading when every other button you push nags you to upgrade to Premium. As far as i can tell there is no way to even view my completed years. There are plenty of free alternatives that serve my needs just fine.
Best app to stay focused and get things done. Just be loyal to it and things will start happening (:

Wow, you are not able to write longer texts / details under your "notes" (which would then only be their name). The app is basically works only for managing one liner type of notes. This is ridiculous. TickTick is much better alternative.
It's one of those apps I can't do without especially on my journey to master productivity, focus and discipline
This app is amazing; it helps you achive your goals and remember important things in your life. This app is so helpful that it made me not forget anything!
I have been using productivity apps for years and have used no less than half a dozen different apps. So far this works the best for me. Love the ability to have subprojects.
Great app. I like the functionality of changing the list from widgets which most of other apps lack. They just open up the app. Increased productivity. Thanks 👍🏼
Platform ambiguous so I can get notified on my Mac, iPad, and Android phone. Great stuff
I don't rate apps, just because I'm lazy. But, Todoist is a wonderful app when used properly. Has changed my life and outlook on how I complete tasks.

Great app but it would be better if we could customize the report. It would be great to sort by date or collaborators. Being able to select what is shown on the report i.e. the full name of the collaborators, date and time. Otherwise very easier to access and use. The support team are very efficient and always willing to help.
Best to-do app. I love its minimalist design and the fact that it supports almost all platforms is a bonus. I got the premium version which unlocked even more cool stuff.

Enjoying the free version. Understandably there are many features only in the paid version which are missing so I can't comment on them.

The user interface is a nice balance between easy to use and powerful features. I like the availability on many platforms and ability to share projects. Also the IFTTT integration rocks.

It has Google calendar genuine two way sync. Karma concept encourages you to keep checking in. Lots of flexibility with labels / projects. I've tried all the main other apps available (toodledo, 2do spring to mind) but this is by far the best and good value for money.
The karma points really encourage you to do things. The premium version is worth it.  it weren't for todoist, I don't know how I would deal with my routine.

I like the app but a few things would make it better, in my opinion. One is a history of accomplished tasks, the other would be to show the tasks scheduled for tomorrow (I plan my day the previous night and have to manually check every project to know what I should prioritize). A third would be a way to see unscheduled tasks all at once. Still very useful.

With its quick and intuitive "add" feature, you don't have to go through several menus to say what time, date or where your task is supposed to be happening. You simply type in "Meet John Doe at Place on Tuesday at 10am" and it creates a task "Meet John Doe" at Place for tomorrow at 10am.  Total game changer for a person like me who forgets things super easy.

Pretty easy to use, however reminders could be a bit annoying, since you can't edit right away when you want it to ring. It automatically sets at 30 min before task. I'm new to it so it could be something I 'm missing.

I really like this app because it notifies me when things are overdue, and also brings me reminders.  Very good app to use when you plan out your weeks on a calendar and write the to do's on this app. Helps me remember when I have so much going on.  I recommend anyone to get this app.

This app was a major disappointment. My main issue is that you can't manually change the recurrence of an event or thing to do. If you can't figure out how to phrase it correctly when you create the event, you're SOL.   I wanted to create a thing to do that occurred every 4 weeks on Sunday, but the phrasing to do so wasn't intuitive and once I figured it out, it would change it to "every Saturday" for some reason.   Also, when I assigned a parent task, it would put it under the parent and then also list it separately as it's own thing, making it look like I had twice as many things to do. Also, it kept reassigning parent tasks when I moved tasks and since there's no way to edit multiple tasks at once, I had to individually reassign the parent to each task. Overall, my experience with the app was incredibly frustrating.

Todoist has helped me get my life organized so that I can get to some of the most important things that I've wanted to do. Since I've been using it, I've started learning Spanish, practicing guitar, and doing more regular devotions with my wife. It's been a great way to get more focused.

I have asked todoist to add indents like what Wunderlist has to make subtasks easy to see on an Android phone, yet they still don't seem to get it. The Web version has it, so why not the mobile version. Also I questioned how it was hard to see priorities with a tiny slice of colour on an Android phone which was met with the same response. These guys don't care about things that would make it easier for its end users. If they fixed these, then I would certainly give it 5 stars.

I can't say enough good things about this.  I've been using for a long time and every update is better.  I'm totally lost with it.  I use it with my spouse to organize our lives,  I use it to organize my kids and homeschooling, I use it to track my housework, my laundry- I use it for everything.  It's the simplest format that somehow still does everything I need.  Premium is awesome and the new student/teacher discount is fantastic.

New user, 1 week in. Easy to use in comparison to Outlook, To Do, or Remember the Milk (all which I have used). Some good features are paid and so not enabled, it would be nicer if at least some of that useful functionality could be available. Otherwise, the cross platform seamlessness will be nice when I eventually use it.

After ten years of trying to make other tasks lists work, I found this. This nicest part is the amount of integration with other apps I already use: Chrome, Firefox, eM Client calendar.  It's on my Android Tablet and on Android phone.   Reminders are easy, they can be pushed out easily, tagged, multiple comments, attachments, the whole bit.  If you need a task manager that does some heavy lifting, this is it.

Having used a variety of To Do tools in the past Todoist is by far the best tool. The use of natural language to enter task scheduling (rather than using a cumbersome drop-down calendar approach) is what makess Todoist a great app. Overall anjoybto use and The reminders are persistent yet not obtrusive, but also  suggest rescheduling uncompleted tasks which were due in the past.

Use of this app has resulted in a significant increase in productivity.  I now use it instinctively to quickly schedule actions and tasks, no matter how trivial as they arise so nothing is overlooked. Great at helping you "eat the frog" by defining projects and breaking them down into tasks and subtasks. Can provide a summary of your day ahead and a recap of what you achieved that day, which is motivating. You can also use it to timeblock if using the Pomodoro time management technique. Have mine synched to my Huawei band to get notifications and use IFTTT to extend the functionality. Took me only an hour using the free version to see the potential and buy the paid version. Cannot  recommend highly enough as a reformed procrastinator.

I use it all day every day. As soon as I hear a due date or make an appointment it goes straight into todoist which syncs with my calendar. I love it. There are a few little bugs here and there but I work around them. For instance if I want to make a reminder at 10am to say "prepare report for 2pm meeting" it glitches and moves the reminder to 2pm. I get around this by using Spanish or typing t.w.o.p.m.

I read all the reviews and tried tons of alternatives. This is the first time ever, I'm able to have my personals and work tasks on the same platform AND have my work and personal calenders synced. Even made the Productivity tab on my KeyOne relevant again. I swear by this app now

Pros:  awesome widget, slick text shortcuts, good availability of apps w/ sync across different platforms, & pro version allows email-to-task creation.  Cons:  poor options for sorting tasks & some of their apps/plugins are buggy and crash occasionally.

I used to use Google Tasks with a multidevice app but Android added policies that disabled the app.  This app appears to work well for tracking the numerous things that I plan to do in retirement.   Since my schedule is flexible, I sometimes don't get things done on the intended date.  But the app will reschedule them very easily in as little as one click to shift every thing to the next available date. It mails me a reminder every morning but also puts a notification in the screen space provided by Android.

This task manager has everything I need from a task manager to the level I use it currently. The only thing I would like is the ability to change a task into a project if I find out it needs multiple steps. Being able to do this with a quick menu button would be a lot nicer for me than deleting the task and creating a project separately.

Something happened to the widgets every time we tap it, it asks to choose the view... I'd also wish the first priority tasks would be moved automatically on the top of the list (otherwise the prioritising hasn't got much sense to me) Can we set it up somehow?  EDIT @todoist :  I know we can sort it up that way, but it won't stay sorted. Every new "first priority" task goes down the list anyway...
Great, simple design I have the basic one but thinking of upgrading. I use this for keeping my business and mind in sync so things get done love it.

I downloaded this to use with my Google home since they removed the to do list function and replaced it with Todoist. Should be a basic function of "add clean garage to my to do list" along with the ability to have her read back the list. Unfortunately when used with my Google home it is relativity pointless. While it takes note of what I say, half the time it misunderstands. It also will not repeat back my list to me,  there is no way I have found to make separate lists with different names, and the dialogue with the Google home runs on and on meaning I have to wait for it to finish it's song and dance every single time I want to use it. If planning to use with the google home, I do not recommend it.

Offers pretty decent functionality despite being free. Premium adds so much more good stuff that are useful to me (especially labels). Has really high customisation availability compared to other to-do apps I use. Good integration with the GTD system too.  What it needs is better integration with Google Calendar. The built in integration did not work that well for me as it forces two way integration with no choice to opt out for one direction. Resorted to using ifttt for the time being.

It's a very good app and service.   Yes the fact that it is a subscription service for the premium stuff is a bit annoying, but understandable.   The only down side to the app is that if I have switched from one project to another, pressing the back button will just exit the app, since it sees all projects as equal, it would be nice if it went back to either the previously open project, or the inbox.   Overall however, great app

Look no further: Todoist is hands down all the task management tools you need, and then some. I feel qualified to judge, having given each of its competitors fair test drives. This app & service is a pleasure to use and useful beyond measure. Todoist is a testament to what a bit of vision and persistence can achieve in the digital world. Congratulations guys and don't stop making me glad I chose you.

Good. Nearly, but not quite great app. Using the free app works well as a simple to do list. Project/ task/ subtask structure is good. Integration with Google calendar work OK as a display. Could be improved with more granularity of projects to integrate (rather than all / one). Adding start date to tasks (maybe for the premium version) would also add a star to my rating.

Ive been using paid todoist for years. It is my favorite note app but I also store other information I can share lists with others. The free app is also awesome and those I share lists with only have the free app.  Besides shopping lists, I use todoist to keep household I formation such as air filter sizes, paint colors, dimensions of things, etc. It syncs across all devices and the app is available for all devices, desktops, internet browser plugins, & and phone/tables.

Clearly does what I need. I was a little confused at the start about what was a project and what was a label but I guess I over thought it. I wonder if tips could be turned on for beginners... Like a tutorial or wizard to ask questions to set up functionality. I think most people would just reuse something simple that works. Getting productive is the idea, misuse the app and you're just busy.

It's simply effective for a making a quick list for things that we need to do today or any other days in the future. The fact that it has its own calendar, cool layout and so easy to operate and get myself familiarise with every feature provided.

The interface, usability etc is quite good. But I felt it to be useless until you get the premium features. In the simple package you cannot even set reminders or add notes. But once you get the Premium features its hands down the best to do app.

It's not an all in one package, but to be honest nothing exists like that yet. And maybe everyone needs something different and a complete life management system is too difficult to make for more than one person. This tool will facilitate tracking and remembering the action items you have to do on a specific day or at a specific time and also the next action items you can do during any discretionary time you might have. I still use manilla folders and a labeler for projects support files that I need to give to people in person. I'm also not satisfied with managing any project information in this app, other than simple association to know what an action is for. And I track my "someday/maybe" items, "waiting for" items, and triggers elsewhere. But when used in an already working personal productivity system that is your own, this app is the bee's knees for managing simple physical actions. So despite all the negativity I just gave it, I use this app every single day and wouldn't use anything else. It makes sense, as most of what we do everyday are just a bunch of simple actions. I've only have success when I track one action for each project. Just a tip. That's why I manage projects elsewhere. Only the very next action for each project goes in todoist, for me.

Loved the app until my tasks ended up deleted... No undo, and auto backup is a PREMIUM function. In the middle of making Christmas Presents on Dec 23 (I know my fault so late) and huge parts of my list vanishes!!  Did not like spending tonight stressed and rushed, because I couldnt remember what I had to do.

Sorry, 1 star was uncalled for, but the timezones thing is super confusing.... how many people really know their Time zone relative to Greenwich Mean Time GMT ??  Some direction is called for in that error pop-up ...   Right off the bat asks cryptic question : 'change time zone to GMT - 7: 00' what the heck is that? Why would I want to change the time zone on my phone? it's tied into the appropriate time and works fine...  And if you do want to change the timezone why wouldn't you just say Mountain standard time or Pacific Standard Time why make it super confusing....

My favorite productivity app. I tried others, like Trello, and Evernote (I still use Evernote for other things) but they didnt have the features I needed, or the features were inconvenient and ineffecient. Todoist resolves all the issues i had with other apps.

Love the app. Would love it more if it would remember my sorting option and automation sort accordingly. When I enter and prioritize a new task, I don't want to constantly go back and resort to group my prioritized takes together
Fantastic app for applying GTD principles, very powerful.  My only problem is I can't use it for work.  Totally worth the price.

I really enjoy Todoist. It is a great platform that syns to my emails and keeps me on track. I won't deny that the subscription is very expensive and I wish there was some way to just have a one off payment or no to have to pay at all!

Tried this versus AnyDo, and it wins, for me. Both great apps, but Todoist is easily searchable, plus integrates with Zapier...I just created a sweet new business process which will probably make it hard for me to leave Todoist because of this. Great work, thanks guys!
This app has been really useful. Perfect for jotting down all the things that I need to do during the week. Even useful for making future wish lists and project planning

Great app! Easy to use on phone, tablet, ChromeBook,  and desktop.    The only thing that I feel this app is missing; is a dark theme option.  I'll never understand why software developers don't make this a standard option. The white backgrounds kill your eyes.
Its like a powerpack to keep you on track. It helped me alot to schedule my assignments, projects, submission and other personal works.

I've been using it for 20 weeks now. This is an excellent way to unload the tasks that are on your mind so you can think about other things and be in the moment. I use it on IPhone, outlook, win 10 and Android. It always stays in sync no matter how I access it. This app is my trusted place to put my tasks.

Excellent to do list and task manager which syncs with multiple devices and 
Google calendar, you do have to pay for all the features like comments for 
tasks.
This app is amazing when it comes to keeping track of your assignments. It also is useful for things like personal reminders. I love this app, no doubt about that !
Tried them all.  If you can't keep it all in your head, this is the best.  Well worth paying for premium features.
The most reliable, flexible task management app as per my knowledge. I have try any.do before, not as comprehensive as Todoist. I employ GTD approach and working well for me so far.
Juggling as many projects as I do takes either a great memory or a great list system. Todoist has made me very successful at the juggle, despite my ADD.
Very intuitive interface. User friendly and simple to pick up, but also deep and nuanced when you take the time to interview yourself in the features. I couldn't handle life without it!
Single best productivity tool I have ever used. I've been a premium user  for several years and will continue to pay for this app without even a second thought.
I started using it for day to day tasks which I forget easily and Todoist has helped a lot so far. Looking forward to use it for projects as well!
Makes my life handy... When I remember something at home, at the gym or in the office I just introduce the task and it synchronizes with all devices. Really love it and I recommend it to anyone

Intuitive.  Good simplified alternative to OmniFocus.  -1 for 1. Tech Support. Lacking.  Not really interested in solving your problem and 2. For annual fee versus 1 time pay.  Makes it  more expensive than OmniFocus   Otherwise, I would given it 5 stars.
I have tried many task apps and Todoist is by far my favorite. It integrates with many other apps and services and has an excellent interface.
Great to manage your time, you can make sub tasks which is a really useful tool. Better than anything I used before. Recommend this 100%!

Избавляет от стресса четкость планирования с этим приложением. А функция раздачи поручений помощникам вообще делает его классным - отпала необходимость напоминаний людям о задачах, оно их долбит само)

I have been using this valuable app for nearly a month now. It is really useful and helps me effectively organise my tasks. Just one note.. Organising a task with a specific time put out directly on top of the list, even before the highest-priority tasks. Sometimes this is unnecessary. It is a great app in general and I enjoy using it..

This could be good but it is designed for working people who are working on multiple projects with multiple people. It's designed in such a way that it's not useful for anyone else. Google doesn't give me enough space here to explain what I mean. You could jerry rig this to make it work for simple to do lists, but with all the to do apps out there, there's no reason to do that. The repetitive mentions of "to do" are not intentional :).

Thanks to Todoist, and its powerful simplicity I have become increasingly efficient both at work and at home.  Instead of trying to remember every little intention I have I immediately add it to Todoist (and to OneNote for history using IFTTT).  I do probably 50 percent MORE overall 'things' now.  Thanks Todoist Team!

I have tried most of the todo apps on the market, including toodledoo, nozbe, trello, jira, asana etc.     For me, todoist is the perfect combination of structure and flexibility for my use. Very east to implement gtd systems with projects and contexts. It works great on both android and web (it seems all functionality is in both places), and the premium version is affordable enough for home use.    Very easy to create hiearchies such as subproject and different projects for work and private, while at the same time being able to create queries and views across all folders.   Possible to perform searches for just the subprojects of a given project, so you can ask for all the next actions for just work or just home.   Very easy to share projects/lists with others.  Good reminder feature.  If I have to point at anything negative, it would the lack of recursive sharing, and the fact that there is no suggestion/tab-complete when defining folter queries. Took a bit of research to find the query syntax, but was easy once I found it.

Todoist replaced my scattered to do lists on post it notes, with the added bonus of giving me "karma points" for getting things done. It was a ridiculously motivating way to get me hooked, and now I will never go back to post its.

Simple tool for organizing your business and personal tasks.  It needs to make filters and recurrent options easy through selecting from windows or dropdown lists without the need to type specific rules.  Solving this problem will make it the greatest.
I love this app.  I have only had for 3 days and still trying to get the hang of it, but it seems to be so simple to learn.

Ive been using it for a long time now on Android, windows and Pebble. One of the most comprehensive platforms and its really smart. You can forget about it when you don't need it but really intuitive when you do use it. Great work and pleasing design.

Pretty basic features in free version. Like the UI/UX tho. Need more advanced time/project manager features: Task description/notes, status (waiting, delegated, in progress), progress board (to-do/in progress, done, custom), task's labor intensity in hours, Gannt timeline/calendar, open plan for ANY day in future. Also, android back button quits app where it should not. Not all important features present across Android/Pc/web. Will keep looking for a more advanced app (something more like Jira)

Good for getting yourself going after a long streak of inactivity. I'd never use the premium options on subscriptions. Give me a chance for a one time purchase and I might go for it. 2020 update: lack of reminders without a subscription is a nonstarter.
Great multi platform task management program that works well for teams.  I love the free version and plan to purchase the reasonably prices paid version.
Only app my family uses for sharing tasks besides SMS. This is better than text messaging because of the level of organisation it brings.
It's simple and easy to use. Just that if I can have a log to check when did I completed things, it definitely can have a full star rating! Keep it up ❤
Not sure why I use this app over other ones I've tried but this one actually has me following through with things I need to do. Been using for a month now and my productivity has shot up
Best productivity app around - you need the premium version to fully appreciate what the app offers, but it's excellent value for money.
Please make REMAINDER feature free. Without remainder this app is not competitive from other apps like Any do. Please Add this feature.We all are looking for this .
Todoist is great for basic day-to-day to-do lists, and for more complicated projects. Recommended for anyone who prefers an electronic to-do list.
Very nice features at the paid level. The only to-do list app that has actually helped me to get organized and keep track of all the little day-to-day responsibilities.
Makes my work life less complicated by tracking all the to-dos and also helps me by notifying the upcoming calls, meetings and time sensitive tasks.

Simply the best to do list app available.  Great customization with alarms and reminders and organization.  Very person. It truly feels like your to do list not a cut and past of everyone else's just with your tasks.  A very smart input setting. That is very fast. Easy to use and understand and it keeps you extremely organized!

I love Todoist but I have to report a syncing issue. Tasks marked completed on my Outlook extension are updating the online version however are not being synced with the Android app. I'm using a OnePlus phone.

Good, but too many features are locked behind the premium subscription. I understand a company has to make money, but I would rather at least some of the features be available to unlock for a one time price, such as color customization. I would definitely pay for that, but the subscription model is preventing me from doing that.
Great app! Helps planning ahead, and made the organization of each day so much easier. It made me much more efficient, wouldn't want to miss it!
I have worked with other to-do application for years, and after tried this one I really can see how much more this excellent tool can give. Thanks for introducing me with GTD.
If used correctly this is a very powerful organising tool. It's especially good for making sure you get all of those obscure, one off items off your to do list
For a free to do list app it's great, you can have multiple lists, set things to do, it makes me organised without feeling stressed - one of my most used apps
Great app, a little hard to get used to using it consistently but that had nothing to do with the app.
Has genuinely helped me become more productive. Incredibly useful, now I couldn't live without it
Great app. Takes a minute to get used to the tagging and deadlines. But once I got the hang of it I was creating tasks every chance I got.
This app is so easy to use. You have as much control as I could possible want over organizing tasks.

Amazing app. I'm a the end of my free 30 days trial and I will surely pay for the premium. It's my favorite Todo app so far it integrates well with many other apps (such as Trello which we use at work).

I've been a productivity fanatic for years. I've tried dozens of tools and Todoist is, by far, the best todo list app I've found. Todoist strikes an excellent balance between ease of use, functionally and availability on all platforms.
excellent app. The free version is quite limited, but okay for basic use.
The only TODO app I've ever used for more than a few weeks. It's easy, it's intuitive, I can separate tasks out by projects yet see what I have to do next easily.
This app has become crucial to my productivity, I use it everyday. One  thing is the lack of colours for projects, would be nice if there were some more colors.

Really great app. Love the ability to reschedule any task. Love the tags, just wish you did have to pay for them. The yearly cost minimal compared to others and it does interface with Alexa so it might worth a try.
Wonderful. I dont like the karma thing and would like to take it off. Otherwise its great.
Love this app, I use it for small tasks I don't want to forget (pick up milk) and for project management, very flexible and incredibly useful!
Killer to do list, best I've tried and might be best 30£ spent on store. Work amazingly on phone and pc. A bit more integration with slack or Evernote would be amazing to fit into my work flow.

I found it very useful when arrived back in school and for remembering tasks that i would personally not remember.

Doesn't have a feature to sort tasks. I mean, it sort of does, but the only workaround is to tap Menu > Sort > Priority (or however you'd like to sort) after adding any task. Also, if you accidentally complete the wrong task or tasks, you have to subscribe to premium to see your history. Doesn't seem worth it.
Pretty good imo, it suits my style of working, would love to have a place to see everything you finished
