Worthless. Contacted "support" through the app over a week ago, and still no reply. I paid for the year, but I will be cancelling it, as paying to have basic features on this app is a ripoff for the customer. Crazy to think I paid and still get no support. Go with another app and save yourself the money an the hassle of Todoist. THANKS. UPDATE: THEY HAVE FINALLY REPLIED, SO UP TO 4 STARS, AS AT LEAST THEY GOT BANK TO ME.

The best Todo app I've used, and I've used a lot. The premium is worth it, and actually only with it you get all the important features. Great for GTD. So easy to add tasks on the go. Some small abilities are missing in Todoist and seem kind of basic, so this is a little bit annoying, but the pros beat the cons. Anyway, worth trying the premium since it has money back guarantee.

The free version is somewhat limited, and there are other apps that give you Todoist's paid features for free. However, I still use Todoist because of the natural language processing and the ability to use symbols while typing a task name to assign it to a project and add a label or priority. Eliminating extra clicks really speeds things up. The Google assistant integration seals it for me, but the limited features are still a bummer during those times when it would be really useful to have a paid feature like task comments.

Been looking for this todo list app all my life. Love it love it love it. Quick entry, quick scheduling and rescheduling of items on your list. The projects feature integrates really well with the main list. It's fast, which is the most important thing if I'm actually going to use the app. Thanks developers, you killed it with this one.

Everything is awesome about this app, the layout is simpler but elegant to see.. when there too many items its UI handles it easily no strain on eye. But one thing I would like if it implements the feature.. when a new reminder notification comes it's doesn't repeat continuously until I check the notification, this is only feature I think it should have.

Nice UI and layouts. I appreciate all the features you get with the free version. The integration with Google assistant is a bit messy having to switch back and forth with Google assistant and todoist (a word I find difficult to pronounce!) and therefore makes the app a little too frustrating for me to continue to use.

Free version is useless with no place to put details. I thought I would try it out with planning for an upcoming trip, but I can't even add a simple packing list without making each item a separate task. If all I wanted was a calendar/reminder, I already have several. On to the next app.

This is a good app and it has helped me be more proactive. Unlike a paper list, I'm less likely to lose my phone. The only con for me I would say is that unlike a paper list I can't see the tasks I have completed, because seeing what I've accomplished motivates me more than seeing just the mountain of work I have to do. Still a good app.

The app is amazing and makes syncing easy for PC and Mobile Device. I love it! Just one thing ToDoist, the free version is a bit limited (like that of notifications) and the premium is quite costly. My request is that if you could set up different kinds of packages available providing few basic services too. Else is nice.

This app is amazing! It's constantly reminding me of the things I forget to do. It's a very helpful app. One thing I would improve on is that you don't have to upgrade to premium to get some of the themes. My favourite are the amethyst, blueberry and sky but I don't want to upgrade to unlock a few colours. Overall this is a really good app.

The app is really useful for collaborating on a project with other people, simply by adding their email address. I feel it also motivates you to get things done when you add a completion date to tasks. It's not like a calendar app because it seems more suitable for tasks. Excellent work!

One of the best to do apps I've tried so far. Lots of support from third party programs too such as IFTTT and Google Chrome extension. Lot's of useful features like inserting comments straight from other apss and creating templates for easy project management. Highly recommended.

I use the app for my university assignments and it's just perfect. With the widget it's very easy to add new things to the list and I see what has to be done until when. Like that on busy days I just do the most urgent things and when I have some free time I can prepare for the next week.

It's buggy when it comes to creating parent tasks. The daughter tasks are just doubling themselves. It makes it impossible to operate or check quickly. Also it'd be great to allow to skip some daily tasks and track it in the weekly review. They must automatically move to the next day schedule and not in the overdue group.

Amazing app. It's simple yet totally customizable and can be as dynamic as you want. I've been using it for one week only and my productivity has increased exponentially. I've tried several other applications but they were always missing something. Todoist is 👍!

I think this apps single greatest weakness is the total inability to have a task repeated. Pretty useless in this regard. If I am wrong and have simply missed something, please let me know and I will give it another try. Also not a fan of the user interface.

My needs are met by this app - listing to dos, categorizing & prioritizing them and sending me reminders. It's simple enuf for a middle aged person w no interest in learning complicated systems. TY todoist for helping me organize my life.
So simple, and just the right amount of reminders.  Makes me feel great, getting things onto Todoist and off my mind, helps me sleep.
Does not work on Samsung Galaxy S8 phone, when you try to add a task it just freezes and then says it has crashed.

I'm a new customer coming from IQTell, which did more, but is closing its doors. :(  After evaluating around 30 apps, this one came out on top. I'm enjoying using it and its clean easy to use interface.

Probably the best to do app there is. I've been using GTasks for more than ten years. Intensively. I love its intuitive simplicity and speed. Now I need more advanced functionality and have tried a lot of different alternatives. Microsoft to do is in development and seems to aim for good stuff, but it's definitely not there yet. Dgt GTD is great. The next iteration, Soda, might be awesome, but with Todoist I found the same simplicity and intuitive interface that I loved with GTasks, a very extensive package of functionality, total flexibility of how to make my own system, and it works across all platforms, with almost identical interface. I'm impressed. I'm still in the process of digging into it's core and moving my big amount of notes into Todoist, but it's already working way better for me than any other I've seen. I'm still on the free version, which I think is plenty for most users permanently. I'll most likely move onto the paid version, since I'm a heavy user and probably can find enough value in the added functionality to make it worth the small amount of money. Spotify costs more than 4 times as much, so not much of a question....
labels and filters are in the premium tier... cannot decide if it would be good for me or not.  They should really give a 30 days trial to test or something like that.
Simple but very effective, reminds you, let's you know what is overdue too.  Free version is more than enough for me.

The user interface looks very nice and easy to use. The free version however has extremely limited functionality. You can't add and comments or have a description for a task other than the title. You can't set reminders and you can't add any labels. All you can really do is add shells of a task.
Helps organize tasks and get them done. Social media aspect is there, but not essential if you don't want to use it.
Simple and easy to use.. But this is not for me at the moment.. Coz feel like more suitable for ppl who need to do project or task together

I bought premium because it's a great product and it keeps me on task!  Constructive criticisms:  I strongly encourage Todoist to offer a proper dark theme and a transparent widget. If you consider the amount of electricity being wasted by white backgrounds on ten million phone screens, Todoist has a pretty nasty ecological footprint!  Some if the functionality is clunky (i.e. inputting bulk tasks can only be done through a csv upload) and the # should denote tags rather than the @ symbol which should denote location or time.

Great app! Works well with a gtd mindset. I even purchased the upgrade subscription, which I never do for apps. It was a good price for the year and the extra bells and whistles help me stay organized, but it is definitely not needed to use the app effectively

It is not relaible in that it doesn't give notifications either by email or the reminder tune it's supposed to make when the time for a set task reaches which is the main purpose of a to-do-list in the first place.

Awful, user-hostile interface.  Accidentally mark a few tasks as completed? Too bad, so sad. There's no simple way to "Undo" such mistakes.  Company doesn't seem to care at all about fixing issues like this.  UPDATE: company response is "just go to project and undelete"...So what happens if I accidentally hit "complete" instead of reschedule on the Today screen???  Instead of being able to go to completed tasks and "undo" the tasks easily, I'd have to visit dozens of projects individually, many of which, from experience, won't show the recently deleted tasks. Ridiculous for a "productivity" app.
My most favourite app and website. Todoist helped me to organise my tasks and did it very effectively. Now I reached the addiction level.

Simple user interface Design. Agility, Customization makes it an appealing app. Would have loved more if Notification feature is enable in free edition, at the bare minimum a basic notification. Hope you would consider.
Great app, but per-project karma scoring would be awesome for someone like me who tracks work Todo and personal Todo in the same app.

All contact and support screens in the app are not working; I tried several times.  We really really NEED A DARK THEME for Todoist; it is painful to use often/extended periods, and I avoid using it because there is too much white. I need to feel drawn to my todo list; instead of Todoist which is what I actually need, I've been using Google Keep checklists because I can color the background (still not as dark as I'd prefer, yet way better than white). I use theming on my desktop Chrome so Todoist is properly dark there, yet on mobile it remains awful and prohibitive and I really need to be using it on mobile. This makes a bigger difference for people than you seem to realize, or you would have developed this a Long time ago.  Thank you for your consideration.

Use it for GTD, and it's perfect. Especially the integration with other time management tool, makes it really easy for reviewing. One suggestion is to enter the task config page when quick tap it, or long tap will select it. Currently a single tap is select, that I have to click the edit pencil to open the config page. Seems like a one tap behavior is more intuitive.
Luke it. Wish there was a repeat task function for tasks to be done every day or week for example. Find the reminder function unusable.

This app makes keeping everything you need to do very simple, other apps I have tried cram everything together and make it look extreme. This app also doesn't intensely pressure you to get it all done. All in all a wonderful app.
A genuinely beautiful and well thought out Todo list app. Over the years I've used many and for me this is by far the best.
It really helps me get through my day. Usually I'm going a mile a minute so having this app keeps me organized especially with the timer & reminders
Got the app right after getting an echo device. Excellent integration/syncing across all my Android devices. Very pleased
Great intuitive interface, have tried various tools for my to-do lists over the years and this one is the best I've tried so far. Went for premium upgrade too. Highly recommend!
Really like this app especially when you add some ifttt stuff to it. Hopefully voice control will be added natively soon. When this happens, the fifth star goes on

Hated having to replace Wunderlist due to Microsoft killing the separate app, but quickly came up to speed with Todoist. Android app with web interface works great. Task and project grouping works great. Big push for clearing your tasks for the day. Great app.
Can you add a feature like any.do where the tasks always remain in the notification panel and can't be cleared that would be awesome thanks
The date is all messed up, on Windows app or Android, all my tasks' date will be bumped to the next day, eg 4th Oct will become 5th Oct, Web version is fine. Now it's almost useless to me
Will be good to have setting up of recurring tasks more user friendly. Would also love to have the option of a dashboard with pie charts showcasing the diferent priorities achieved.
Todoist has turned my life around. I can see all my tasks and move them around, but only have to look at today's tasks so I don't get overwhelmed.
Simple, powerful. Has replaced my calendar app for most things, and keeps me much more organised. Highly recommended.
You can, plan everything by time or also every second day. This is very helpful. The best thing is you are able to connect it to Google calendar
Helps me keep up to date with what I need to get done. Love the fact this is also available on the web so use it for work and personal tasks I need to  complete.
This app has done an incredible job of managing my ADHD at work in the short amount of time that I have used it. I've recommended it to many people already!

The price is rather steep for such simple (and widely available) functionality, and free version is so limited that it defeats the purpose of using it: eg. you can't set reminders. It's also rather buggy, for instance you can sort tasks in your inbox by priority, but once you add another one, it's not sorted and you have to repeat the sort manually.
I haven't fully utilized Todoist to it's full potential yet but it has been a big help so far. It kinda sucks to be restricted by a paywall but I'll manage.
It's a simpler way to stay organised, the priority tag, project helps to manage the tasks. Mail notification is one of the important feature.
I enjoy using voice text making to-do lists on my drive to work Monday morning. Once I get to work it's really easy to sort out all the various things battering around my head on a day-to-day basis.

looks great and stuff is organised nicely. however, whenever I try to put in a memo for tomorrow, it initially puts the task in the right place, and then after a beat it will move to the day after tomorrow. i don't know why this happens. it is super frustrating and is making me miss deadlines.
It's a really good app. It help's a lot in realization of my todos. I just hope that they put more tools in a free trial.
Very good app Need additional features of voice to text. Which will help addition very easy Please please add this feature
Good app, runs very well but could have at least completed tasks in last 4 weeks free.
Great way to keep things organized. I use it for mostly daily to do tasks but this would also be great for work projects, school, etc.
Great app, perfect for keeping organised. Additional functions in paid version are worth the cost, but perfectly functional without paying too!
Needs an account though my smartphone has a lot of storage and I do not want to share my lists.

I have been using todoist for the last one year with premium account and it's lot easier to manage the day to day activities. I would suggest the payment mode be changed from yearly to monthly as this will not be heavy on the pockets.
Really fast and sleek. I love the powerful home screen widget, and just being as fast as it is makes this app perfect for me so far. Adding tasks is almost effortless :)

I get so much more done with this app than I did before. Seriously considering paying for the premium version but/because the free version is already that helpful. I can organize things by priority, project, and have recurring items on specific days and times!! Love it!
This app is a life saver - no more multiple lists written on numerous bits of paper, just one place to add to when necessary and the reminder is very helpful - thank you 🙂
My son introduced me to it. Never too late to learn something new. Use it for so much. Love ability to collaborate.
I hope it can make more usefully to organize my self. I sad because cost for more feature is too expensive for myself.

Very simple and easy to use. It makes keeping track of tasks very easy and efficient. Love the way the it records your task with a simple text; orienting it's time and date just from key words in text.
I liked todoist a lot but I switched to wunderlist because their widget is opaque which looks a lot neater. I'd encourage todoist to add functionality for widget customization
Fantastic app. The only improvement I can think of is to sync the individual calendars to specific projects (in terms of two-way sync woth google calendar).
Only just got started but find it very useful and flexible.  Love being able to organise tasks into groups and very helpful to have automatic sync between my computer and my phone.
Can be improved on modifications option. It's confusing between a tick for deletion and modification is not visible sever times.
Its good. I wish there was a notification option that wasnt extra. Also a calendar, but other than that its good for both your computer and phone to sync and edit the tasks you need to complete
Love the free version, would actually hope if you could remove the bar which asks us to switch to premium. Otherwise, this app is just too good.
I think it's great, but a lot of the things that should be free are paid, like reminders and labels.
Good app so far only been using it for a couple of weeks. I'm a Superintendent for a general contractor, it helps everyone get on the same page with multiple jobs going..
Great app with many many features (pro) to help task managing on projects. The app in very fairly priced for the results it can deliver to the user. I've tried other 9 apps and no other satisfied me.
Great, even without premium. Would like to have a general list of tasks with no due date, or to have an option where things due in the future will still show up on your list for the current day.
Easy to list and organize things you need to do. Very flexible in changing due dates and categories of items.
Simple easy to use interface and offers a lot of organization. Being able to understand natural language to create reminders is one of the best features.

I love Todoist, however I'd love more integration with Google Calendar. I'd love to see maybe a separate feature where my Google calendar events can be at least seen on the Todoist dashboard, even if the event isn't a task.

Q simple to use and a great way to capture the things I might otherwise forget!! I'd like it to be a bit easier to get a full task list. Haven't used integrations much yet so can't comment on that aspect
Keeps me on track. Although not 100% intuitive like Ike, it gives me the seamless flexibility to manage to dos on the PC and phone.
Amazingly easy to plan out my tasks at work; in fact, it's difficult to be unorganized with this app. Highly recommended

Great app, highly accessible across platforms, which has been essential for me to capture all tasks at any given moment. However, I would really like to see some improvement to identifying the difference between a due date and a planned start date or working date.
It's a great way to keep all your tasks organised no matter what platform. Works great on Windows, Mac and phone.
like it lots, would like a dark theme and the capacity make it in to a outline journal, but for work and task manager it fits my needs. thanks guys you make my life a bit more organized:)
This app has made a big change in my life. Has helped me get organized and control the different projects I have going on. I even introduced it to my work and we now use it to keep track of items.
It's a great app, I I just wish I could have access to my previous done tasks in the basic app.
I love todoist's approach. Very comfortable way of adding tasks, quite few get it right
One of my favorite apps. Simple to use and very helpful. Helps me to stay organized without overcomplicating, but it still has many cool features.
Great app. Thinking about paying annual subscription, depends how much I heavily rely on the app. A dark theme would be appreciated.

This app is pretty useful. I will say that I love the incentive of the points you get after completing a task. It adds some excitement for me beside doing the task itself. Im sure the full version of the app is great!
Generaly, the app is really good, the only necessary improvement I can see would be to support "alarm" for our tasks.
I don't know what I'd do without this app. For me it is an absolute must have. Thank you for making my life more effective!
Good, not sure paid would help me at all Basic features work for keeping track of projects and not missing daily abnormalities
Great tool to have close by to assist a busy work-from-home mom prioritize "to-do" tasks and track what's been completed and what's still pending.

I am using free edition, its practical simple smart interface makes tracking, follow up and update easier than ever! I only miss a bit reminders, still can leave without it! For those who really need it you can find it for a very affordable price in the paid editions + much more.
Once I got it set up, it works great. Syncs with my Alexa and google calendar.  My own personal assistant

This is the best replacement for wunderlist, I love the fact that there is a firefox addon for it. I just have 2 requests, one please add support for Samsung Gear S3 and second in the settings can you please add a feature to view all projects in the start page like wunderlist.
Nothing has kept me on track as much as todoist has.  It's cross-platform support ensures my tasks are out of my head and in the app getting planned and completed. Thanks!
Look no further: this is the definitive multi-platform Get Things Done tool.
Todoist has helped me a lot. It is a great to do list tracker and has lots is useful features. The app also makes it run well on phones. Nicely done.

So far it's working great for me. Very easy to use and genuinely helping me organise my life. I'd give 5 stars but I can't seem to set reminders for a future date that will also repeat. I've tried every combination I can think of.
A very versatile app, yet simple enough to be easy to use and navigate.  Even the options in the free version are fantastic!

A great tool to keep track and execute tasks. And they keep adding features! The only reason I rated 4 out of 5 is because there are premium features - thus free accounts don't get the full experience. (Premium features are legitimate in my opinion by the way)

Best tasking app I have ever used. So quick and easy to add a new task, change the date, track notes and comments, organize by project. As a coach, consultant and project manager I recommend it to many of my clients. All around awesome and simple!
Easy to use, annoying enough to get me started but not too much in order to hate the app
This is very simple. It keeps me organized. I am even motivated to set and keep goals. I  can break down large projects into much smaller daily steps. I really like this app.
It's not exactly how I would have made the app, but as I use it more I find it very handy to get stuff out of head and into Todoist
Its a Wonderful application. However, I have a suggestion. Please try bringing the projects under the search option. The desktop version does that job, unlike the Android application.
I love the interface. The only con is, even the notification reminder option is in premium version. Please, atleast give the notification reminder option in the free version.

This is an app that you can tailor to work in a way that works for you, for example being able to put in 'every Tuesday' or setting something to occur every 4 days. All in all Ive used this everyday for the past month and it's very helpful.

So far out of all the task management and to-do list apps I've used this is by far the most complete terms of sharing and delegation. Creating and sharing (sub)projects, (sub)tasks, updates on them as well as reminders for each one. All this comes with the premium of course but it's the best deal for your buck. Highly recommended.
Disappointed in the lack of functionality and organization in the free version.  Only good if you want a bullet point , no sub-task functionality. Cannot alphabetize, cannot set priorities.
Simple UI, and help getting tasks done in a timely manner, are pro's. Limited functions are the only con so far.

I think this is the best Todo-App out there! I love it. It's simple to use and is really helpful. Although I wish I could upgrade to premium version but I can't afford that. Still, in my opinion it's a great app. Definitely would recommend
Ideal combination of practical, useful and fun... The only thing I would add is DURATION for task planning
One has to admit it is the best To do app but the only problem is that its too costly if you consider in Indian Rupee. They should consider pricing according to Indian competitors & nothing like it!
So easy to use, so helpful and works amazingly to quickly plan your week, even if you don't usually like app planners.

Very useful app! It helps me organize everything in lists, you can set reminders and even share your lists with others. I also like that you can have it both on your phone and PC and they sync when you write something in one if them.
It's very simple to use and it's not annoying and it has everything I need so i love it and find it useful
Useful for capturing those random tasks that come to you at odd times, and prioritising workload when you can't see the wood for the trees
The app is great but the widget is horrible and can't be customized (it would be easy to add the option to change the colors and background)

Awesome functionality at a sustainable price. If I have to tighten my budget during school Todoist will be the last subscription to go.  The option to make checklists within the note section of a task would be a cherry on top of this great app.
This app continues to keep me on track after three years of use! Every person I have suggested it to has found it to be just as useful as I have.
Very easy to use. I'm able to add to the list easily as I go and send it to others to keep them on track.
It's easy and simple to use; and allows me to prioritize my tasks from most important to least.

I tried several others before finally finding todoist a few years ago. It's so simple and efficient, and the syncing actually works well (unlike so many others I tried). In my opinion it's the perfect to-do list app.
So far so good, I feel like there are a lot of great featured I'm still discovering
The automatic time/day tags when you type something such as '11-3' is a bit inconvenient but a good app besides this, I use it all the time.
I wish it was also reminding me my projects through the day.
I love that I can link to Alexa and just ask her to add things to my to-do or shopping list.

Helps keep me on task and assign as little or as much work as I want to do for my upcoming week. Can send me text reminders. Easy to reschedule tasks, which can be sorted by broad category, specific project, or date. Can make nested lists and recurring tasks. Recommended for all people who need help keeping track of entrepreneurial ventures or chores for home.

The app is fantastic, super clean and. I love the widget. The only thing I would add would be a calendar function so you could see future due dates and events and some sort of function to keep track of something you need to do daily, like take a pill everyday. Or else you would have to create a new task every single day and honestly that's kind of a hassle

Really wanted to like this app, but not being able to see appointments from my Google calendar is a deal-breaker for me. The point of my use of a to do app is to stop setting unrealistic goals, which often happens when I plan w/o considering the other commitments I have of a day. I also have a few tasks that I do a couple times a week & could not effectively find a way to schedule this.

I was sceptical about using a to do list app but this is fantastic. There's a little bit of work to get going (setting up projects etc.) but you can drag and drop projects and subprojects easily to optimise as you go. I went straight in with the premium version to get reminders and notes, which are completely worth it.

The coding of this app is amazing.  Its a tool that can be developed for each individual circumstance.  FAQs on website are crazy helpful and am impressed with every aspect.  I miss percent complete... But without it I'm forced to break the task down into steps which I think will work better for me anyways.  Andriod and windows 10 apps were strong for me, having a bit of issue with win 7 but website works just as well.

So far so good,  got it to use with Alexa (echo dot), and I love that i could just tell her to add things to my shopping list and it's on my phone when i get to store. ...no need to buy expensive refrigerator to do the same thing.

It's really helping me to do the things I need. I do feel more productive after start using Todoist. One thing you could improve though is to add a section for habits that don't show up along with the tasks but that are still somewhere so you can see them and that don't disappear after you mark them as done.

Overall is good. But i found out 1 missing feature (super awesome if have this). It will be great if there is a function that can link between 2 or more tasks from same or different projects so that we know they're inter-related. Sounds cool right!

UPDATE: The customer service answered super fast! And was very helpful. Contact them, they listen you :)  ORIGINAL: I like it. Very convenient but it could have more features, since it's a paid app I expect it to cover all my needs. 1. Support for repeting tasks that are X times per week or X times in Y days. 2. Possibility to show all tasks and subtasks indented in Today.

Requires account, no thank you!  EDIT: It is good to see that you are sorry, but even better would be for you to make the account optional. It's fine to offer a service, it's definitely not fine to force your users into it. Not to mention the hazzle of having to create five different accounts for five  different apps just so i can try them all. NO!  I want to be in control of my data, and if you can't respect my privacy then I can't respect your ratings.

Todoist has changed the way I work. With todoist, my task management has reached another level. With premium features, todoist can be converted into an automated reminding system that will enable regular chasing and follow up with your subordinates and Co workers.

I am trying to find a replacement for Wunderlist that MS will discontinue shortly. I can't see how to make a simple shopping list I can share with others unless I buy the premium plan.  If I count the seven devices where I want to share lists this will be a fortune! I can't seem to get support for my most basic questions or find any sort of introductory user manual online. At least the Wunderkinder would respond quickly to questions.  I can to potential for Todoist if only I can get started with the free version.  Update 9/15/17:  I see that only one paid version would be required for me and anyone else who shares lists with me. I have tried to create a simple grocery shopping list and then deleting items as if I bought them.  I will need to see if the feature of Wunderlist that lets people add things while I am actually in the store can work.  Much testing remains so I will hold off on a better rating until I can really complete a full evaluation.  I know this seems unfair but for those in my position, this rating will serve as a caution that your have a lot of work to do in making the switch.  #$%^@ MS!

I really like this app. My fiance an I have been using a shared list while planning our wedding and it has been so helpful!  Just a few little things that would be nice to maybe see updated. The widget on the screen won't let me assign a task to a person and I have to actually open the app to do that. Not a big deal just inconvenient.  The other thing that would be nice is if when you assign an order to your list, ie order by priority, that new events added would automatically go into place rather than piling up at the bottom. I always have to keep telling the app to reorganize my list.  But I totally love this app and would recommend it!

I've tried so many to do list apps but this one nails it: email integration is its strongest selling point, plus there are so many ways to organise the lists simply and quickly. I'm finding it so easy to keep track of my life now I'm using this app!
The best personal organiser so far encountered by me. Fantastic natural language date recognition makes entering tasks an ease. Rely on it daily for work, projects, and university.
Really good for students. Helped me not procrastinate and had made me finish more than I intended to accomplish. However, I think it should have more features under the free account. ☺

I have seen many to do applications that are far too simple, and some that are complex but with a ridiculous learning curve. This packs all the features I could possibly want, and the advanced features are still easy to use. My search is over.
Great, just helpful. Made a huge difference to me as I am normally so forgetful.
I don't want to create an account to write down a few notes I don't plan to share or sync. It's ridiculous that one is required

Karma thing drives me crazy by adding more clutter to my life when  I downloaded the app for the opposite purpose. Looks like I have to buy the app, which I don't mind doing, to turn it off... but I subconsciously hate the app already . Lol.

If you are bored or  tired of to do's apps that does not help!!  This is an inteligent enough app who can work with me rescheduling tasks, replicating info in various devices/platforms and a very elaborated costumer support crew. Here you also are going to find discussion forums very helpful. Seriously recommended!!
The interface is dated and requires way too many clicks (see Keep or Wunderlist). Also it is too expensive when other apps offer similar features at no cost (see prior referenced apps).

This has come in very handy. It has replaced written list. Helping me keep track of everything i need to get done. I intend on keeping on using it. I like getting the emails of my daily progress. I am keeping the emails for future references. This app is very helpful.

The subscription price is a bit on the steep side (todoist is pretty useless in non premium form) but it is well worth it for the productivity gains I have experienced. I used to be an anydo user and todoist is simply far more powerful. I also love how well they have adopted the material design language and truly made their apps look native on each platform they're on.

Quite simple to use once you have the hang of it, however it is a little unintuitive at first. The premium features are nice but not necessary and don't get annoying if you are a free user. If you are using a simpler Todo manager, it is worth switching to this one if you are willing to spend half an hour or so to figure out your optimum setup. After using it for longer it becomes an amazing and necessary part of your life.

Love watching my tasks topple over as I smash through them. The colour coding is great too, you add your general tasks to a main list which is one colour, then anything that matters or important in bright colours, so it tells you if your spending too much of your days on the day-to-day rather than the big stuff that will make you happy!

One of the cleaner task managers I've tried, both on desktop and mobile. I'd be so excited to have support for multiple accounts for work and personal (we use Google Apps for business at my company).   Android wear support is still light. I should be able to view tasks by project or at least inbox by default and not "send to wearable" which is clunky.

I've used a number of tasks systems, from Taskwarrior on the Termux CLI, to Gtasks and Tick Tick, to Wunderlist on the web, etc. While Todoist seems to lack some of the great integrations of the aforementioned apps, the IFTTT integration makes up for it. The entire package is intuitive and beautiful. One complaint, the text parser doesn't seem to handle multi-day tasks...

I loved this app! not sure what all the features are but it's a great app for reminding me what tasks I have to do and letting me check them off, please though PLEEAAAAASE, if you see this devs; can you add like a sound that plays when you check or a different one for when you finish all tasks? not sure if there is as I usually keep my sound off but that would be cool. One more thing, can you make it so when you complete your daily tasks the message instead reads like, Done or congratulations! you've completed your daily tasks! then maybe something like now you can sit back, relax, and order pizza, that'd be funny

I can't figure out how to make repeatable tasks.  I'm sure it's there I'm just missing it. The knowledge base wasn't any help either.  Edit: the developers were very quick to respond to my review and the issue I was having and they solved it. I now give this app a solid 5 stars. Well worth it especially with the quick responses!!

2015: Natural language task due dates, attractive design, priorities, and other features are all great. Unfortunately, you can't delegate tasks on the fly but must add someone to an entire project. Despite my issue with delegation, I live and die by this all though mostly on desktop. Good stuff.  2017: Though I still wish I could delegate on the fly, this app continues to be the most important tool to organize my personal and professional life. I can't say that there have been any game changing features. The true two way calendar sync is nice though there wasn't an iftt recipe to do something similar. I have not invested in todoist business as it doesn't have features that I'd like to see on a true business class app - analytics to understand worker productivity and easily manage overdue tasks (ie. Notices to managers when a team member has an overdue task). I use premium and that works fine for me and most of my team with an exception or two is on the free version.

Best To-Do list app by far. I have tried almost all of them and this one takes the cake. It has a clean, simple, and minimalistic UI with lots of available customization and hidden features. The free version is a bit limited but the Premium offering is well worth it for the price. The way of writing a to-do, in a text message format, is brilliant and very well thought out. However, it does take a bit of getting used to. Once you do, though, the shortcuts available and smart date suggestions are incredibly useful. The ubiquity of platforms, great features, and amazing UI/UX make this app amazing!
Just tried the basic version, works well but with some limitations in terms of flexibility in managing tasks, given that it's free I can't complain. Very nice integration across devices too.
Very simple to do app. There are thousands, I have tried a few and this one is great. It is done on a metodology GTD (Get Things Done). Easy to collaborate with others.
Fantastic tool. Minimal interface, but well design and powerful. I'll be using this for a long time
Except for the design, the functionality is super amazing. I use it for team work and cross syching. Exceptionally simple to use but tremendously powerful for team work
This app is the only one that keeps me on task. It is convenient and easy to use. The reminders aren't annoying and the display gives you everything you need at a glance. Great app.

Amazing todo list app. Been using it for over couple of years. Really like the user interface. It is very nice, smooth and easy to use. Love the natural language for creating tasks. And full support for recurring tasks is nice. Not really into folders because you can only see one at a time which is why I really like using labels. Too bad labels and reminders are only available in Premium version. And it does not make sense to me to pay $28 per year just for the couple of features I want to use.

I was a long time use of another GTD app but don't regret switching to Todoist. I Love the browser and email integration, project sharing, and am oddly inspired by Karma points. Natural language scheduling isn't flawless - I wish there were more manual overrides - but this is by far the best task manager I've ever tried (and I've tried a lot of them).

Would be perfect with Barcode scanner for building shopping lists.   I just ordered Amazon Alexa wand, just because it can scan UPCs and add to cart or list.  But this would be better as I get older, I find that I'm  forgetting, but this app with location awareness and notification. I can pick items on my list and save a trip. I know that tons of product UPCs databases are accessible through the net, and the option scan a Barcode to shopping list, and Google VR and transcription is good but far from perfect. I will say that the app has a little bit of a learning curve and is not as intuitive as I would've hoped, but the app I used before  changed the old UI and forced an update, but it integrated well with Google core products.   UPC code reader and list builder would be awesome.

About two years ago i was looking for a good to do list app to keep track of my stuff. Checked out todoist and it was pretty lame so I adopted Trello. Two years later, i read that todoist would be fully integrated with Google calendar. So i checked it out. Boy has it come a long way! Great app for staying organized.

Todoist has completely changed the way I operate at work. I used to think i was as efficient as possible. However, what I didn't realize is how much I was trying to get done in one day. Todoist has forced me to be realistic about and aware of what I have to do and in turn get more done. It's also WAY WAY more user friendly and efficient than any other app and I have tried them all! Thank you Todoist, you saved my life!

It was a good app, but sadly the function to write in renewed things partially stopped working, so at random reoccurring things disappear and I don't appreciate having to add them again. Changing app now, because that is one of the most essential functions to me.  Addition: Disabling Google Calender integration does not do anything to solve the issue (as it was already disabled), nor does enabling and disabling it. This exact issue was why I also stopped using the app on different platforms, but it was still working on my Android devices until recently so I was still using it until the Android application started having the same issue.

I LIVE, BREATHE & LOVE Todoist. Bought a year subscription after about 20 days of using it. I was an Outlook tasks user for YEARS, it was the ONLY way to manage my workload, until I found Todoist & never looked back. I've been using it for over 6 months now, I believe. 😊 Todoist is an awesome, almost flawless, near PERFECT task manager. If using Outlook, I HIGHLY, HIGHLY recommend that you download the Outlook add-in. I use the add-in daily & if I'm on the go I use the app on my phone (shortcut to add a task is AWESOME btw!). However, I hardly touch the Windows 10 app. I would love to use the Windows 10 app more, however it lacks the ability to attach emails to tasks easily. Todoist wouldn't work for me without the Outlook add-in, it's definitely an essential must-have feature.  Todoist, please incorporate some sort of implementation of Outlook &/or Office 365 into the Windows 10 app. Also, please fix the issue with subtasks (I don't understand why the parent task shows as a separate item randomly, even when I * to make it "not a task", but a title). I'd like the parent task to show, then I need to expand to see subtasks, not have subtasks listed randomly everywhere. I hope that makes sense. I guess maybe like a checklist function? I'd also like the ability to set my own default filter to filter out a certain project or label from my running to-do list.  Other than those few requests, I have NO issues with Todoist. It helps me be efficient & on top of my workload daily.  Thank you Todoist!

One of the first apps I've found that not only has increased my productivity but also allows me to use GTD without having to force it. There is a learning curve, but the design is such that it's still easy to use for the most basic of functions.

Application is really good but there is a huge bug that appears often. After update it appeared again. All the notifications appear since the original app instalation! After update today this happened again. I installed this app in February and all the notifications from February started to pop up, ring and vibrate. If you guys fix this, app will be awesome.

I feel like I have tried them all.  This is "the one".   Simple enough to make it intuitive, powerful enough to make it useful.  Clean design for crystal clarity.   Powerful integrations.  The quick add function helps capture inputs quickly and easily.  The Outlook integration works flawlessly and enhances my productivity.  Perfectly seamless across all my devices.....web browser, in Outlook, on Android phone, and on iPad tablet.  I honestly don't know what I would change.  For me, it is exactly what I have been looking for.

Used a Todoist probably a year ago and liked it, but at the time didn't need it. I just decided to start using it again as tasks at work pile up. Seems that a massive number of features that used to come free are now "premium". I'm generally fine with this and may ultimately purchase it for some of the cooler features. HOWEVER - I find it ludicrous that viewing completed tasks from the Inbox is a premium feature. I expected the free version of this to-do list app to be (at minimum) as functional as a physical list that has been jotted down on a piece of paper. Hiding competed tasks from the default Inbox behind a paywall makes pen and paper (or at least another app) seem like an attractive alternative.

The best organizer I've found so far. Worth going premium. Tried at least half a dozen and this is the one that fit my thinking/organizing style best. Good balance of form and function. The interface is not the most intuitive, but it's simple enough and gets the job done.

Edit: it's 7/7/2017 and with the latest update the app is now back to its original state and I'm ecstatic about it. Adding items is once again fluid and a joy to complete  Original: As of 7/3/2017 this great app was made annoying by now forcing you to select a "project" every time you just want to add an item. Crazy thing is this is a recent unnecessary change; adding items used to be as easy as typing it in and pressing the arrow. Extra hurdles add up the more you use
Good for simple reminders. Would prefer different notification options. Eg a pop-up with vibration and/or tone on my phone at a specific time

After going back and forth between Todoist and TickTick for the past year (TickTick being my main ToDo app for several years), I have finally settled on Todoist. Quite simply, Todoist is the better app. It just does more. In fact, the more I really get into it the more it seems to do. This and I do prefer Todoist's UI. I like the way it looks and it just seems to flow better. It does (for the most part) everything that I need it to do...and then some. I like the ability to create projects and sub-projects within sub-projects. While TickTick does offer a Project feature (called Folders), as well as sub-projects (called Lists), they do not allow sub-projects within sub-projects.  With Todoist I can choose a different color for each individual project. This is not currently an option with TickTick. I also like the ability to create subtasks. However, I am missing the ability to create checklists within a single task, which is a TickTick feature that I used regularly. I especially like (with TickTick) that I could (within a single task) add different times for individual items on checklist. After every item was checked, the task was set to repeat, along with the checklist. I'm not sure why Todoist doesn't offer this feature but I am hoping they will add it. Still, Todoist is packed with a multitude of features, some of which I am still discovering. To get the most out out of Todoist, I do recommend visiting their website, as well as watching YouTube tutorials by seasoned Todoist users. My new favorite thing is the ability to create filters. I also like the ability to create uncompletable tasks. Not to mention, I am making serious use of the label feature. Needless to say, I'm all in. I officially love Todoist!

I've tried them all.  Only Todoist incorporates so many great systems right out of the box, such as the Eisenhower quarters (priorities) and Getting Things Done (main Inbox bucket, projects).  The simple language to add tasks, even with complex recurring reminders,  is the best I've seen. Shortcuts and completions really speed up adding tasks as well!  Todoist is the best app for organizing, prioritizing, and getting through the ever-growing task list of my adult life.  I've been lost without it.

I usually don't rate apps, but this one definitely deserves a review! It's very simple and efficient and it's my top choice for a reminder app. I love it because it's compatible across multiple device: my phone, tablet, and PC.

Very good app. Works on all devices and operating systems. Integrates well with Newton Email and Google Calendar.   Only request is to keep the formatting when adding emails to the comment section, including hyperlinks.

Fantastic app for organizing a busy life! I use Todoist to implement the GTD method, plus I keep a bunch of other lists like shopping lists for specific stores, gift idea lists, books and movies that friends recommend, and so much more. The features in the free version are a great place to start if this is your first time using an app like this to organize your life, but I came over from many years as a Wunderlist user, and within the first hour of using Todoist I knew that the Premium level was going to change my life!  Premium has so many amazing features and it's completely worth the totally reasonable annual fee. I was not looking forward to changing task management apps, but Todoist made it so easy and I am so much happier with Todoist than I ever was with Wunderlist! Thank you Todoist Team! You've rocked my world!

Beautiful Todo list app that you have to pay a monthly subscription for basic Todo list functions that other apps give you for free.  They have some nice looking subtask functions, but they're buggy and hard to control.  This is the second time I've tried this app and found it lacking. I'd pay $5 for an app that works well, but I'll never pay $25 a year for an app that barely goes beyond the basic options of many free apps.  Looks are nothing compared to functionality and value.

A truly awesome app, it's extremely helpful. The only ideas I can think of would be​: An option to change the name of Karma and an option if you have completed a task, but forgot to cross it off the list, it wouldn't count against you. Other than that I'm really impressed with the app.

The best to do app Ive ever used. My suggestion would be to add an option to use the app in a calendar format. So you can make to do and put it from 9 to 11. Lets say. And that youd be able to select the hours for the calendar (cause night hours are usually irrelevant.

A really great App! The interface is clear and simple to use, only subtasks sometimes can be annoying, especially when you add a separate due date to them. Other than that the app is almost perfect.  I'd like to see an integration with third party calendar apps (e.g.) Outlook and maybe another way to share files or access them, because if you have more than one file to share the comment section can get quite confusing.  I can only recommend the app, especially for the fair price of 28€ per year!
This is my favorite app of the ones out there, but PLEASE create an option to "add child" when you're editing a task. The handling of subtasks is really awkward and clunky right now.

The app concept is great and as long as it works - it works fine. That's why I give 2 stars, not 1.  Yet, when some issues emerge - many time You're lost. Sadly, don't expect big support from the support team:  1. Sometimes the order of tasks gets ruined for no reason - I reported it in Sep 2016 (ticket 72002), waited for the answer, bumped the ticket 3 times in May 2017 and got an answer: "So sorry for the delayed reply! We currently have a backlog of emails and this is affecting our response time. I apologize for the extremely delayed reply." (anyone has an idea what it means?) + "we'll get back to you with an update as soon as possible"  2. Multiple times I had to manually re-adjust dates of my task which has been "automagically" changed by Todoist - sadly, no real help from their support, had to do it on my own  3. Once they converted some of my recurring task into non-recurring, so after marking them done, they disappeared - again, the support admitted there was a bug and… suggested I find "disappeared" tasks on my own  4. Multiple times I ran into trouble when travelling between time zones.  If You're lucky and experience no issues - great. Otherwise - You're lost!
