This has the workings of being a great app, but unfortunately I can only speculate since many of the options were unavailable on the free version. The fact that reminders are considered a premium account benefit is ridiculous. Although I liked what I was able to try, personally I cannot justify paying the subscription fee when other apps offer just as much for less. I was looking for a replacement for Wunderlist, but this is definitely not it.

Just enough power. I've tried many apps and systems, but had always sought too much complexity, shunning services like Todoist as too simple.  Ironically, as I've gotten busier the complex tools became too complex to keep up with. Todist doesn't follow GTD precisely, but it offers just enough power to make it work, with great usability. After a few weeks with it I feel like I'm back on track for the first time in years.

One of the best apps around.  I find really useful the possibility of nesting everything,  from tasks to projects, apparently without limits. The only small things I regret are the lack of the possibility of setting a duration/start date for a task nor its stayus, the absence of a percentage/status bar of completion for parent tasks, and the fact that the "today" view doesn't show the high-priority unscheduled tasks.

Until recently, Todoist was hands-down the best app I'd ever found for android, and the only app for which I've ever been willing to pay annual fees to use the premium version. The new design is all about style over substance and makes it more difficult to manage tasks, so I'm looking for an alternative.

Like the connectivity across devices but still lacking with androidwear. Clicking on the app via my LG watch does nothing. So if Im at a store and want to  look at my grocery list I have to open the app first on my phone then go to settings to view the list on the androidwear device all while handling a shopping cart. Please update so that list /to do's auto sync with androidwear app to be pulled up directly from there .

At first I was skeptical about many features and most praises. But from the time I started using it, specially since I started subscribing to the premium account, I fell in love. And more and more I get impressed.  To new and even old users, i suggest Carl Pullein's video series called "working with todoist". He shows the power of todoist that it hides behind the curtains of simplicity, while it actually has features that other apps can only dream of.  It has an awesome support, great development, insane stability, magnificent tutorials and unbelievable user experience.

I've been using Todoist since early 2013. The Android app was the main reason I switched from an iPhone 3yrs ago - the quick add and snoozing work really well on Android. I have since tried a dozen other apps but have always returned back to Todoist. It just keeps getting better and better.

It's a glorified check list, but it's doing what it takes to get me on track for my busy day. Believe it or not, there's a little bit of a reward in the reward center in my brain every time I check off a task. And, it's actually gotten me through some very busy weeks. The most valuable aspect is that I don't have to use brain power to try and keep track of everything I need to do in a day. I can concentrate on one thing at a time, and when I've finished that I just check my Todoist to see what's next.

Needs one thing - I think you should have the option to be able to see the tasks within a project that youve already completed. Either with a strikethrough, or maybe a checkbox.   Hate to say this because I like the app, but if I find a to-do list app that has that, ill be switching to it. Thank you!!

The app I've been looking for since i got my first smartphone. Easy to use and keep on the front page of the phone. I use it as half of the front pafe and have been super organised ever since. Hoping to perfect it soon with some trial and error, and looking at some of the help ideas. Really good and I've got lots of friends and colleagues on to it. Thanks

I'm not one to place reviews unless they are warranted.  For years I've been looking for ways to mange my productivity and have now found it.  This app not only helps me manage my work tasks, but also my families tasks at home. We share projects, organize tasks, and even assign chores for the kids. We have shopping lists, temples for seasonal projects, and personal lists for our own productivity.  I could go on and on how this has helped, but you need to try for yourself to see.

Overall solid app. Great features, even the free ones. Intelligent parsing is perfect - "do X every other day" works exactly as expected. I do understand having a free/pro model but I'd prefer they make a separate free app without all the pro buttons. I constantly tap them by accident when learning the layout and its frustrating to dismiss pop ups every few seconds.

Todoist has a lot of features and is great for advanced users, but still easy enough to use for those just getting started with to do lists. Its main flaw is the lack of UI for repeating tasks. It is not obvious how to set a task to repeat and requires you learn the language the application is expecting. Even then, it is not clear if the app has understood your entry correctly and this can lead to errors or missed tasks. Overall I think Todoist is the best to do list service for all and well worth paying for premium if you are an advanced user.

Great program, been using it until recently upgraded my phone to Alcatel Shine Lite. Now the program crashes every time after I type in the password and it tries to login. No longer usable, hoping this would be fixed soon. And yes I've upgraded and been communicating with support, whom always said to wait for next version, Currently still not working!! Its been more than 8 month!

I have used serveral task manager apps, but because I am a chronic procrastinator, I got fed up of pretty much all of them. Todoist is different - it is simple, elegant and a great productivity booster when you break down your projects into small tasks. Also, props for incorporating instructions on using different productivity systems in your knowledge base. Great widget too!👍

This is an amazing app but you only get notifications if you pay for the full service. The paying subs works great for people and teams in business but as an individual I need none of the paying features apart from notifications. The app becomes pretty useless without this critical feature that we've come to need in any Todo app.

Tasks everywhere. Numerous platforms. UI fairly consistent across them all. Some quirks, but all in all a great app and service. Update 3/13/15: I have taken one star away due to lack of sorting ability. I have become dependent on this app, and have loaded a ton of tasks in it. I noticed this feature omission months ago, as have many others. I took another star away because no matter how many times sorting is brought up on their "support" site, the only response ever given is "we will consider this for future updates".  The issue was first brought up there over a year ago.

Easy to use. Attractive user interface. I would love to see productivity charts in the next version, so that you have a procrastination score and a chart. There are some tasks that I've been procrastinating for like a week now. Or maybe you can modify the already existing chart so that it counts each overdue and postponed task. Thank you.

Plenty of filtering and sorting options, but not many color categories to choose from and not very new-user friendly. Personally, I prefer Any.do's group-style layout and notification system. Todoist just feels like "Gmail lite" ...like I'm sending myself an email, labeling it, and dropping it into a folder with a reminder. Also, the PC version seems buggy and doesn't want to save dates at times.

It's really useful, has notifications and is linked to your email so if you have a lot of stuff to do in one day the overdue items are emailed to you. It's also great for sharing things with other people e.g. Places to go and movies to watch. Be sure to explore the different options and utilise the undo button!   It's better to label the icons first time or have a help, its a bit clumsy if you are first time user.

Bugs!   Telling me things are due in incorrect days (a day off). I checked time zones, actual due date set, and all matches up and isn't working.   Too hard to edit due dates besides words (nice for easy to set date, though). Will be trying other options for now.

By far, this is my favorite To Do app for projects, managing tasks, etc. My wife and I both have Premium Accounts and we put groceries, and other task lists together so we can be more productive. My wife still likes another one better, but she's weird. As a side note, the Windows app version doesn't always sync very well (I had to log out and in a couple of times to force it), but the Gmail, Web, Android (and even MS Outlook Plugins) work amazing! But this rating is for Android, so it suffices to say that I love it on Android! It really is one my most often used, and hands down one of my favorite apps.

A one-stop shop for all the things I need to remember in a given day. I like the organization of it, the friendly reminders of what's on my task list and being able to access this list from multiple devices. I also really love their blog with all the organizational tips.

It's a good app and would love to pay for it. $30 usd a year is nothing at all for Americans.... But for other countries, you can't just directly convert that to local currency.   In India its 1800 rupees per year which is pretty expensive for an app. My yearly Norton antivirus subscription is the same price!   You guys need to factor in the per capita income and cost of living Index of international countries when fixing prices for them. Direct currency conversion will not work.   This is a necessity if you guys truly envision yourselves becoming a big player globally.... Even in third world countries like India.    Atleast add the reminders functionality in the free version.

Good for a basic todo list including recurring tasks, but doesn't feel like a finished product. On Android, Gmail links open in the browser, not the app, which is a big minus for my usage. (And the Gmail integration does not work when you have multiple accounts on any platform.) Combined with lack of ability to track time and a much reduced functionality in the free version, and this app has me wishing I was back using Microsoft Outlook. And I hate Outlook....

Everything is perfect, wish you could make sub categories.  You can put tasks under other tasks but you have to share them all and sometimes they don't all show up. But very great for personal use, some minor changes would make it great for group use

Best todo app I've found and I've tried many.  Love the calendar sync option, exactly what I was looking for.  After 22,000 completed tasks it still amazes me....  I get puzzled at the 1 and 2 star reviews of folks complaining about not having features that it actually does have, read instructions people.... Keep up the good work!!

Smooth, user friendly, powerful. I especially love the hierarchy options, recurring tasks and possibilities for sharing. Sorting projects is a nightmare on a tablet though (drag and drop I mean). Other than that the only remark is that I wish Toggl and Todoist would just be synchronised. Now you need to manually add the projects in Toggl and they don't offer the same detailing. But all in all, the best app (and free!) to keep me from having a 1000 post it's hanging around. Might check out premium for the calendar integration. And I wonder if I can keep all completed tasks visible till the completion of a project, for the satisfaction of seeing 'to do' get shorter and 'done' get longer.

Not As Pretty or Common Sense As Wunderlist, But Gets Job Done.  Switched from Wunderlist for the ifttt integration with todoist. Not as pretty or user friendly. I make a permanent grocery list but it goes under a "projects" drop down? It's not a project, and it's permanent. Why can't it go right after inbox? But it works with ifttt which is a plus. Still looking for a prettier/more user friendly solution. Tried Trello, and that wasn't it either. If Wunderlist/whatever Microsoft turns it into had ifttt I'd jump back in a heartbeat.

Used many to do lists over the years and this one is (currently) top of my list.  One feature that is missing (hence 4/5 and not 5/5) is location awareness.  I would love to get alerts when I am in a specific location, area, store, etc that I need to do or purchase something.

I've only been using for about a week, but I enjoy it so far. I've also downloaded the chrome extension, and I like how it syncs so I can see my to do list on every device. I'm not quite sure what the purpose of Karma is, other than to gameify the app, and personally I don't use the different categories other than the inbox, but I can see myself using them as I get better acquainted with it. If I have any complaints, they might be that it's not an entirely intuitive app, but I'm sure there are tutorials somewhere on the internet that I could find--currently, I don't feel like I'm using Todoist to it's fullest extent. But I HAVE found it incredibly useful!

Started spamming me immediately after installation.  Update: Unsubscribe button on spam a useless placebo. Have to jump through hoops to get it to stop.   Wish I could give this app a 1 star review daily for eternity.

I do like this, (however today there is a glitch - it keeps asking do I want to discard/save when trying to set priority etc). My issue is that I already have apps which are free that offer more or less the same range of functions. As I am only using it for personal reasons due to illness & related memory issues, I do not want to pay so much for it. I can see how for colleagues & work it would be worth while paying for it, I don't think there is anything that unique that justifies paying in my circumstances though. I do recommend you try this for yourself - it is not a bad app, just not the best option for me.

The best organising app I've used.  Mind feels free no need to remember everything.  I can organise my work clearly as I freelance and juggle a day job. Great for adding reminders ahead of the year. I can't recommend it enough. I just use the basic free version I think that's more than enough

It's a simple to do list. You don't have to go through six screens to open and with one click the item is updated. Priority, reminders, and tracking is simple. Better than expensive "planning" packages to just keep stuff straight.
Works well, however reminders leave the task bar after a certain period of time and I can't work out how to change the time these reminders are on the task bar.
Use for work, my whole company is using it. Very good. I wish there was better ability to integrate with email programs on the Mac. To easily attach documents from Todoist to emails.

The app itself works great, tracks todos in a simple and very intuitive manner. I especially like that they kept it simple. You can use just the properties you need. For example, I use just due date and project. I don't need or want tags, priorities, reminders, etc.  The reason I rate it 3 is due to the painful integration of freemium reminders. If I push the wrong button, it pops up an annoying "buy me" screen, where the only way to dismiss is use the Android back button. I realise that the developing company needs to make money, but... does it have to be so intrusive? I would rather just not see the extra feature buttons.
Edit : Add duration field and Gantt chart integration which support dependencies. I will go premium. Its not possible to use multiple app for tasks and todo's.
Fantastic app.  Only possible improvement would be fully adding desktop functionality on mobile, such as easy was to grab email link in order to send emails to projects as tasks.
Easy to use and does the job without a lot of extra organizing work. Make lists and check them off. I would like to be able to sort and reorder the list easier, though.
Awesome app. Really helps me get things done and stay on track. All I would say is that the reminderz/notifications should be more customizable.

Better than Any.do, Wunderlist, or Trello. Paid for pro and I'm happy with it so far. -Update 2/24/2017- Some of the features that keep me using it are: -Recurring tasks to build better habits and as daily reminders -easy natural language input for due dates (like 'today', 'tomorrow morning', etc) which also apply to reminders -The Karma meter is kind of like a metagame (like xbox achievements), also the streaks (weekly and daily) which keeps me using it like fitbit's daily goals for getting things done. -The nesting feature within projects is a big helper b/c you can break up a task into its finer points and keep track of it that way. To me this is one of the best points of the app.  Still very happy with it and would recommend it to most anyone who wants to keep an organized and productive day to day scheduler in their pocket. ------end update--------
Simple but still delivers lots of features, all of them useful. Haven't tried premium yet but will switch pretty soon. Todoist is a joy to use.

I need to clarify my last review with an edit. Some functionality of the Windows 10 version of this app have gone away. The Windows 8 version worked perfectly, but when using the Windows 10 desktop version of Todoist, you can no longer search a task and then edit that task from the search results. Nor can you see or edit the reminder time once you have set it. If you have over a hundred tasks in your task list spanning 10 years as I do, this is an annoyance. Other versions of Todoist work well in these regards, including the Chrome extension and the smartphone app.  My work around it to go into the Chrome extension when I need to search and edit or check on a reminder. I wish Todoist would let you delete completed tasks.  They do not interfere with anything, and it is an intensional design feature so you don't ever loose tasks, according to the very responsive and helpful Todist support. Never the less, I find it annoying. Todoist support acknoledged the Windows 10 issue. All things considered, Todoist is still my favorite multi-platform task list program. The others multi platform task list apps don't come close. Yes, Wunderlist and Any.do, I mean you!
It provides a unique, easy to use and powerful interface for creating tasks and projects,  that I did not find in any other tasks and projects management applications
Works across all my platforms. I enter a task whenever and wherever it comes up and find it on all my devices.  Keeps me organized and accountable.
Todoist is really nice app... Me and my husband both are working so we make a list for things to purchase using this app and we remain coordinated with each other everytime.
ToDoList has been wonderful for work and personal organization. I started using for work as a way to collaborate with colleagues, and migrated to using for personal projects and general to-dos.
Simple interface does exactly what I need. Not many bells and whistles, but the mobile app keeps me on  track
It does what it says it does, nothing more and nothing less. I really like that if you say "Tell me to do this daily" it picks out the "daily" and automatically sets to remind you. Pretty cool.
Every one including myself are on the job to finish it off .And it's so productive and like playing a game to finish the task assigned.100 percent accountability

Complete, easy to use but most importantly very fast, which is an absolute necessity for a to do app. You need something that opens instantly and lets you add stuff simply otherwise you just stop bothering.
Absolutely love this entire program and app. Does everything a to do list should and more. The integration with Google is a life saver. Well worth the money.
Simple, easy to use, addictive. Perfect tool for collect all of my tasks and responsibilities into one place. Helps me to find my priority and my effectiveness.
I think It would be better if your tasks don't dissappear after you've done them and you have them crossed out
This app is super easy to use and keeps your list clear and organized. If you are a "to-do list" person I would recommend this app.
Great support across any platform you can think of. This is one of it's biggest advantages, apart from being very very good.
Links with Alexa great but would prefer a sound notification for an event rather than an email unless I've been missed it.
Setting up tasks is very easy, as is setting up reminders. For anybody who needs a consistent and reliable way to keep track of what they need to do, this app is definitely worthwhile.
Suits my purpose 100%. Being able to organise my day, reschedule and get email alerts on what tasks are outstanding, makes life easier.
Awesome! I get so much done and feel better while doing it by tackling each item one at a time. It also keeps the little things from falling thru the cracks.
Novice at the moment but am learning all the time with it. It's very easy to simply get started and then pick up features as you go along.
It's great, especially the little reminders it gives you. Very helpful if you've got a lot on and need a little help remembering.

I think it's a great little app for task management. I wish sync across platforms was more consistent. Adding a create task affordance to the context menus for emails and other stuff would be more  awesome.
Not able to log in using email. I use Todoist on pc, but unable to login in phone. Phone : Xiaomi Mi5.
UI is a little clunky but it's an extremely reliable and powerful to-do app. Mail integration is especially appreciated.
Nice App, hast everything you need and Premium Account is 100% worth it. It's a fair price. I love this app
What I love is that it's intuitive and doesn't do too much. It's just a simple project and task tracking app. Works well for me.
Does what I need it to do. I really appreciate the email reminders. They're not for everyone, but they keep me up-to-date. I even started using it for work!

Bug: In the Today list i cant attach 1 row to other. If i do it in the Inbox list, in the Today list rows dublicates: 1 attached and another unattached. If i delete unattached row attached deletes too. (Sorry for my crappy english)
This is seriously my favorite platform. I run everything through it: work, fun things, notes, everything. I don't know what I would do without it.
Im getting used to the UI after switching from Wunderlist. I love the IFTTT integration so I can use with my Google home. Will likely be five stars after I use it for a while.
Easy to add tasks and items and even easier to reschedule them when life gets in the way. Used this for my wedding planning but now I use it for work, home, and college.
I personally think that something could be more easy, as setting the time for a personal event. It's not so friendly for the user.

Works on my pc, that's the only reason I have it. Doesn't event understand the concept of deadlines. By deadline concept I mean it should remind you that you have to do it by that time. Not that it's scheduled for that time.
Keeps me focused, exactly what I need. Easy to use, easy to find your way around the app. Perfect for busy lives
A great way to keep organized. Used it to make sure I didn't forget to pack something for my trip. Worked wonderfully.
Helps me prioritize and organize what I need to do. And, offers the ability to share that with others. A must have productivity app.
Great app. Very useful even without going for the in-app purchases. The reminders have been very good in helping me stay organized.
Really simple and easy to use. Like the fact it breaks down large bullet pointed paragraphs into seperate tasks. Really has helped my productivity!
It can be a little difficult to set up and troubleshoot repeat tasks, but once you learn how it works, entering tasks is quick and efficient.
LOVE the tiny but full featured home screen widget. Overall best in class set of features for a free user, and I'll go paid soon  former RTM user.

Probably already written before but what keeps me coming back is the ability to type the date and time right into the note. Saves a step and tom is my favorite function as a procrastinator. Anyways excellent app!
Definitely worth checking out, haven't explored it enough to give better feedback yet.  Mostly use it for family grocery list linked with Amazon Alexa
This is one of my favourites. I use it on home and work devices. I just skim the surface of what it can do but no complaints. Thumbs up!
Simple to use and quite convenient - especially through the 'add a tast' gadget But I would like it even more, when done tasks stay visible and aren't deleted

I was brought here from cortex and I got to say, I only used this device for about a week and my productivity sky rocket to a whole new level. Definitely a must have for anyone looking to improve on productivity. Thanks for helping me get my uni life back in order.
Needs login information to allow me to take a note. Paper works better than this app. I dont want to have the notes online.
The app is amazing, easy to use and does what it says. I believe it either needs getting used to or the archiving feature is buried a bit far.
The best todo list app.  favourite feature: synchronisation between windows, web and android is very much useful for me.  Thanks todoist team

Great useful app. I like how i can add tasks above and below a specific taks under my general lists, but also gives me the ability to add tasks to different project lists. If u are looking for an app that separates ur job/business lists from ur personal list, it has the flexibility to do so because u can use a "project" list as a personal or business/job tasks list. Its very user friendly and i recommend it to everyone.

Best to do app out there. Allows you to keep it simple or create big projects as required. Just be careful as my first impression was it didn't do comments or sub tasks, but it does both in the free version (just share your project to get comments).  I tried loads of these apps and very pleased I made the switch
Took a bit to get used to, but really enjoy the functionality. Much easier than carrying around a planner.

I have used Google Keep, Evernote and five to seven other to-do apps. However, none can compare to Todoist. This to-do app is simply THE BEST. The best part about this app is the setting of priorities and deadlines, and then being able to see it in a seven day deadline sorted view...simply amazing.

Todoist does not allow the insertion of a date into a task.  Todoist did not reply to my emails asking for help.  Todoist sends too many emails but did not see fit to respond to my request for assistance
Great app. Feature-set perfectly aligns with GTD, with the labels and filters available. I wish it had filters referentiable in other filters though.
When they expect you to pay for premium version in order to get complex features such as notifications (sarcasm) you know something's very wrong. Uninstalled and never to be reviseted again.
Very happy with this app.  It's so easy to use and of course is usefully enough to manage your daily to-dos and projects. Thank you so much guys for this tool.
Sometimes we need external help to keep our life in order. This app does just that. It would be even better if it could be linked to our inboxes.
The app seamlessly integrates a to do list, a reminder app and a calendar app.  I especially like and use the recurring task and the project functionalities.

Simply the best to do list type app out there.  It has loads of features a special one being you can write the date in number of days. Simply amazing, I switched from all other forms of organization and bought the premium. It's so worth it too because of what this app can do. I would like to see a full calender though. Love this app 5/5 will use it forever.
This has radically improved my workflows for business, college and just personal life. I'll be a user for life I'm sure

This is a great app to keep you on track and focused. Helps me to out systems for priority and followup in place easily and conveniently. So good I even paid for a yearly subscription. Highly recommended!
Great app, held back by lots of features only available in premium version. Annoying.

Well, it is okay, but I just can't wrap my head around the decision to make viewing completed todos a premium feature? I sometimes complete a to-do by mistake but guess what - it costs money to view it and reopen. How is that so advanced to require $$$?
Great app that allows arranging tasks into groups. One downside is that the interface isn't the easiest to get used to.
Great app it keeps me on track. A few minor changes i would make but overall very helpful and pivotal in helping me get task done

The app works great once you figure it out. Some functions are easier  on the app than the pc version, but the reverse is also true. I use todoist for projects, to-do lists, and to track things. It works great for everything I use it for.
Definitely a good start to getting organized. I like detailed apps but it must be easy to use w/out instructions and this app does the trick!
Simple! Like the paper slips you've been carrying around,  only better
Committed to this tool for a 30 day trial to see how easy it could implement GTD and sync with Google calendar.  On a tablet, editing a task takes too many operations, and it is not ergonomic.
It's a great tool. It has some bugs like the widget for android keeps changing the order of my tasks but other than that minute issue it's great!
Crap. I was looking for something to create a shopping list easily with echo. This is beyond rubbish, it is far easier using a pen and paper.
I have been using todoist for over 3 years and been enjoying the experience. The simplicity of the UI is what keeps me at it and the availability on almost all the platforms. Awesome work team!
I like that I can break down different steps for different projects. Makes a big list not so overwhelming. Like eating an elephant ... One bite at a time!
Cool app, haven't really opened it up fully.  Kind of not into paying then app disappears.
Does everything I want. Premium is kinda expensive, but the the free version does everything I need.
Great stand alone functionality. Really have to pay for it if you want it to be worth a darn. Can't set reminders without payment. so it's as about as effective as a pen and paper until you do.
New layout with great synchronize function. Can help managing tasks list on different devices and workplaces. Good for speedy reminder too
Making life easy, no longer forgetting tasks and encouraging me to get more done.  Awesome app.
Tried many task management systems but none as friendly, powerful and fast as this one whether on mobile device or desktop. Thank you.
I don't want email just a simple To Do list. So this app does not do what it says on the packaging

Dubious Privacy Requires an account. No option to keep all your personal data local. Requires one to determine the privacy options and then totally trust the backend personnel and cybersecurity standards.
Amazing app! Add more 'smart' features so it can win the battle against apps like Ike
very good app, I use it on my PC as well as on android device. tracking work is now more easy. thanku
The functionality is great. The only thing missing is to cancel tasks that are no longer relevant. But I love the organisation and reminders.
Good app so far.  I'm still trying to understand all features.  Would like it to be a little more "persistent" in reminding me of task!
The best to-do list money can buy. The premium subscription is nothing consodering how much I use this app daily.
As a kid I was slightly autistic. As an adult Im so glad this exists I wouldn't be able to multitask ever
Very nice app to manage tasks. Best thing is that we can share tasks with our team members.
Great tool! Now to figure out how to sync with Google calendar.  Update. I'm liking this more everyday. It's been updated several times without glitches. Great development team.

Good app for to do list management, however, they don't yet have the split right re which and how many functions are available in the free version. Even basic time reminder functionality is reserved for the premium version...
A Great App to keep track of your commitments and projects!  So far, I am just using the free version, but it is pretty capable at keeping me on top of my Top List, rather than the other way around.

Very nice app and it give me very organise life. Its function to syn to all device is marvellous. I have to just check out when i do that work from any device and done. Thank you developer for these marvelous work.
It really is super simple to use. Now that I'm using it, I rarely ever miss an assignment or forget what I need to complete.
The only aspect limiting this application is the missing home screen notification widget, just like other competitors have
Any app that forces the user to create an online account without necessity does not deserve consideration.
Recently switched to Todoist from Pocket Informant due to thier lack of Android updates. Wow! Wish I would have switched a year ago. Well worth the Premium upgrade.
Takes a bit of set up, but this is my favorite productivity app. I love how easy it is to sm quickly type in a to-do item. Use the shortcut on your desktop for quick add!
Went premium after just a three week trial. This is easily the easiest to use, most comprehensive and interconnected task management app I have ever used. Love it.

Once again I am no longer able to change the order of the tasks on my android phone.  Makes this almost unusable.  Can still change the order on Chrome on desktop.  Tried reinstalling- still doesn't work.  Seems to have happened after a recent update or daylight savings time.
I use it it for home and work.  Love how I could send me reminders based on location. Couldn't live without.
Latest update is broken. Today/7 day view won't auto rearrange based on priority, and I can't manually rearrange it either. IPhone hasn't been affected, so at least I can use it there.
Awesome app that helps keep my life under control. Great interface, and works on all devices
Useful App but most important feature is used premium and premium is not cheap (reminding feature). So I'm gonna delete this App after submitting this comment bye

*Upgraded to 5 stars for adding project notes. * A note area in the project title is essential please. Ability to hover on project title and be reminded of the overall brief,  key info and aims. Thanks.

Program and website work great together. Also works perfectly with Alexa (Amazon Echo). Would prefer to see it  to also integrate with Google Calendar and Outlook. Wunderlist's integration with Outlook is horrible.

This app is really awesome - it has a very clear layout, easy organisation functions, and is really useful for remembering both my every day todos and more complex tasks. It has made me so much more productive.
Used a number of to do apps & methods over 10+ years... todoist is the only one that has stayed top of the list - my number 1 to do app / method for years!
Easy to use and keeps me better organized than anything else I've ever tried.
Easy to use, no clutter, but I reverted to my old app, it doesn't really help without reminders.
It takes a bit of time to learn how to use it, but it is worth it. I like that completed tasks gets you 'points' and let's you level up, so it's kind of like a task based game, but in real life.

Of the two options offered for integration with Alexa, this to-do app is the only one that worked.  So far, ToDoist has been seamless, even offering a separate shopping list dedicated to Alexa.  Also, all daily tasks scheduled by Alexa appear in your list annotated "Alexa."  No confusion as to where they came from.  If you have Alexa, this is probably the easiest to-do app to install and use.  Using the Amazon Tap device.

Love the simplicity of it. You can add priority, projects and deadline while entering task without having to press somewhere else. Easy to use on pc as well. Only downside is you have to update to premium to see completed task
I have looked for years for a to do app that actually helps make my life easier. This one does. Worth every penny!
Awesome cross platform tool. Being able to see tasks in Outlook, dictate a quick note to self on my phone, or check out tomorrow's agenda on my tablet has been fantastic.
Keeps me motivated all day.. Gives a feeling of satisfaction once I reach a goal or guilt if the app shows postpone.. UI is mot complicated and that's the best part..
I love this app and the web browser! I recommended it to my fellow teachers and my classmates! It's perfect for balancing work, school, and personal items!
Easiest of task lists I've used, integrates with email for notifications, repeatedly reminding you of what needs to get done.
This is the exact app I was looking for. It doesn't let you forget anything until you finish this task.
I just started using it, but in the last week, I've used it every day. Easy to use and gives me reminders. Love it!
The app should have an option to automatically display time sorted list of tasks in the widgets on home screen.

Great for keeping on top of tasks. Really motivating being able to see number of tasks completed at the end of the day and colour codes for projects. Reminders are really useful for specific tasks. Highly recommend

It really helps me organise my life. I have different list for work and home. It means that were ever i go i can update my jobs. It's especially good for my job as a PA as i get jobs in random places and random times. This app means i never forget the jobs.
I've been using Todoist for a couple years, it simply helps me get things done.
Poor Widget in Android went to TickTick bc of this.  Like everything else, even the online blog is great.  Good development support!
I have been using the paid version for a few years and I don't know what I would do without it.
First tracking app that has stuck with me. Great job!
Useful app, have used it for over a year, sometimes the more complex repeating tasks can be difficult to schedule, but I usually get it to work after a try or two

The very best to-do app on the market. Simple to use but powerful if you want it to be. Pleasing on the eyes. Available practically everywhere, so you always have your reminders with you. Free version feels complete, yet the premium version offers so much more.
Easy to use, sends reminders to remind me how overzealous I was in creating my to do list...
Great time management tool.  Could use more funtionality, but that can sometimes slow down interaction and increase learning curve...  I like it, i use it, its awesome..try it
It'd be nice to have check boxes and also show all tasks at the same time (more than 7 days out).  I like that it can sync with alexa
Nice app with all the main options I need... available in Premium only. Especially reminders - those make half of the purpose of the apps like this, should be available in free version!

Helpful but can't print?  Web broswer only spot with very limited option and prints blank page with title?  No auto sort?  Have to hit sort button every time to stay in priority order?  Feels like a beta program.
Generally good interface. A little hard to batch edit or customize views, but the website has the same problem.
Love the app (had the widget on my homescreen for years) but premium just seems a little overpriced for me, I'd happily upgrade if the price was lower...
Seems legit. It's just the event addition function that seems too complicated.
Very useful on individual and group level tasking. Love the rescheduling options, attach photos and comments features.  Using it second year now and loving it even more.
Incredibly crisp and honestly life changing if you use it well. I use this during meeting instead of a note pad.
Good app, schedules reminders and syncs across devices. I like that it suggests how or when to schedule a reminder with a unique design.
It's ok, as a new new user I'm still getting to grips with it but the free version is pretty limited.
Easy to use! Keeps me organized. I wish I could set off timers /alarms without paying for it though
Everything I need to know and do in one app available on all devices. Thank you! PS, love the Karma and Goal tracker!
Once I looked into the time tagging I found this to be an amazing to-do list app. Tried many, stuck with this!
Probably best-in-class and does what it does very well. Might try the premium features.

Its convenient. The app is user friendly, if you struggle to manage time, why havent you gotten this app yet? Its notifications are subtle yet still reminding you. Best app Ive come across for helpung to balancing your time.
Misses a timetrack for the app (only as addon fir browser). Other thne that really great tool.
It truly helps keep important tasks to the forefront of my brain, even when days get extremely hectic.

The most frustrating thing is the behavior of the back button. You change a project, press back—app closes. You change pretty much any view and after pressing back the app will close. This is very inconsistent with the behavior of the rest of the apps on Android e.g. Google Inbox. After accidentally closing the app for the 10th time I had to uninstall it.

This app has changed my life and is worth every penny for the premium version. I have tried other to do apps and this has the most features applicable to everyday life. I also love the help tools and articles available to help you maximize the potential of this app. I'm astonished at how much I can accomplish day to day.

It's a great app, I never forget to do anything, easy to use and simple. Just a suggestion, when crossing something out of the list, it shouldn't disappear, it should stay because it's satisfying to know that you're getting stuff done. Do that and I'll give you 5 stars.

Update - I love this app. It only keeps getting better!  1) I hate the super slow scrolling between the list of projects and the task list for individual projects (once a project is selected). It is too slow and if you accidentally select the wrong project then it is really painful to go back to the project list and then select another project 2) I wish that the tasks were listed in order of priority. Having higher ranked items at the dead bottom of the list kind of defeats the point of selecting the priority level for each task
It's quite convenient to use. Interesting thing is that all overdue tasks will always first appear when opening the apps
Its clear value is I no longer worry about stuff.  This app is so easy to write it all down and off my mind.
I never give my review for any app. But this time i forced to do because of this app . This is very good app which help to improve my quality of work ..
I am using this every day. I was using tasks on my calendar but then I changed my phone and couldn't find tasks so I got this and I really like it. Good work!
Great for keeping your lists on all your devices. I'm being way more productive than before and I stopped forgetting tasks.
Great App there is always room for improvements with setting time and date etc but it is great app and program. I am staying on top of things.
Nice, I like the integration with Alexa, but it seams a little too busy. I could do without the rating system and encouragement.

I like being able to set priorities. Well made app. Kind of bummed about the steep premium price, especially since you need that for reminders. This app is overall more easy to use than Wunderlist IMO, and more aesthetically appealing.
Simple and easy to organize my to-do list. As a workaholic, this is the perfect way to organize my tasks.

I love the Todoist organizational web and use it as the framework for my work.  Having an app that mirrors the structure I've established in my office so that I can always locate the next task before me at any time helps keep me grounded to my game plan.  Well designed, well thought out, and well executed.
Not told that you can't view completed tasks without paying for the app until you go to see what you've completed. Angry that I can't see my completed tasks without paying.
This app has made me very productive. I now get a lot of things done.
It works well, the only thing that is annoying is the email reminders. I don't need it and. I don't know how to shut it off
Extremely awesome app. The best thing I like about it is its simplicity and it's availability on multiple platforms helping me seeing my tasks everywhere I go. God bless you!
I love being able to add tasks on the go! Great app to help me stay on top of things, both at work and at home.
Useful. I was looking for something g to help me sort out my weekly schedules and it helped. Only it doesn't provide for a re-occuring schedule
Got bo quarrel with tis app. So far its been very helpful cool stuff
I can't figure out how to enter tasks for the next days. Not as user friendly as it could be.
Great app for organizing.  I've used Wunderlist too, they're both good; but Todoist seems to have more functionality and I like the design more.
Todoist is so easy to use and syncs seamlessly with the online, Mac app, and iPhone versions. The widget is SUPER customizable and the UI is so user friendly. 10/10 would recommend.
Easy format, the only thing I'd change is to make separate lists for tomorrow, 2 days from now, etc but that's something a calendar or another list can do fine
Neat little app. Got it pre-installed with my Huawei P8lite. Only using it a short time and so far, I've been pretty satisfied.
A little complex but worth the effort to master. Has definitely boosted my productivity yet reduce anxiety over what I need to get done.

Solid app with tons of integrations. Recurring tasks, attachments, notifications, and email task creation are all extremely helpful options. My only complaint is that there is no task detail field and all details need to be added as comments.
Easy to use. Love how my husband and I can share grocery list and project lists! Each of us can add to or check off the same list. Just what we were looking for.

I love the clean and simple experience. The interface is significantly less cluttered than most other to-do apps.   However, the latest update seems to have broken manual reordering. It doesn't work in the today and next seven days views and reinstalling the app doesn't help either.

Really wish the free version syncs with Google calendar.  The other premium features I don't need so much, but if I signed in with my gmail, why can't I just link to me calendar? Disappointed.  Might not even bother with this now. The premium $ to get my own calendar seems like a lot. Sorry. Other features seem great though.

I use this for daily tasks and also a wish list for books, films and places to visit. Works very nicely and easy to use across devices. Would suggest that sub tasks don't auto-expand each time a project is opened

Our video production company started to use todisit in place of expensive and complicated project management software. It's incredible how helpful it is to keep the whole team on track and focused on their deadlines. We are a small team to efficiently is critical.

Easy to use task tracking application.  The app adds a slightly easier to use interface over the mobile website e.g. one-click to add a task via notifications. Absolutely brilliant app.

Please Note: Most if not all of the favorable reviews are from users of the Premium (paid) App NOT the Free version! Pestered to review so...I just started using and had to pay for premium. Not sure it's gonna work for me yet but needed to see if it would and that required all the capabilities which meant buying Premium! :-\

Like it. Very simple to add and view items. Would like to be able to to in with my calender.... update: I've  been using your app for a month and it's not only a one stop shop but also easy to add to now I've got premium and it adds to our calendars.

Todoist : my go-to app, absolutely Todoist is the best productivity app in Play Store, thank you so much for 30 days of premium features, I wish Dev could add monthly subscribe, I can't effort for annual payment but free features is more than enough. Interface is the key, I like the way Todoist show the subtasks, show how many tasks already done. Statistics feature is motivate me to add more tasks and finished them. Can't live without it.

Really loving it, finally relieved to not stress about remembering things.. It still takes me a while to find the right buttons to use for the date and time or project type but I'm getting used to it, soooooo grateful for it

After almost a year of actively using Todoist Premium, I can give an informed review.  While I love the fact that todoist has incorporated a natural  flow for writing tasks all in one line, and for having filters for automagically sorting your tasks(!), I can't help but find myself at a loss when I check my Karma graph for the 100th time, I would love to be able to access comprehensive stats like the year in review. Hopefully you're planning to expand in that way?  I would also like some incorporation of RPG elements, because after using Habitica, I can tell you that their way of gamification is very impressive. But I can see Todoist doing this better. Hopefully you are the type of company that would do something like this! Another reference of something is LifeRPG. Again, Todoist could do this better.   Nonetheless, thank you for your amazing product and hard work! :-)

(Free version) Excellent implementation! Wishlist/Suggestions: - a dark background mode for both desktop and mobile - more vivid colors for projects (the current colors are dull and not proper for colorblind people) - tighter lists (less spacing between lines) - see more, do more - possibility to sort by projects (with a discrete separator with the project label) - a mode where a completed task simply gets ticked and grayed out, until manually dismissed (the tasks would therefore work as a checklist, useful for recurring list-based activies - eg supermarket, other routines or mini-projects)

I really like this app. The idea is amazing and all the things you can do like due date, and changing colour is all amazing! But I had to uninstall it because I need reminders. And I live in a different country so I dont use dollars. Paying $27 a month for reminders is horribly expensive.

Intuitive, user friendly, clean and simple. I'd like to be able to put my list in a certain order, regardless of whether it has a time label or not, but it won't allow that. That's my only complaint! Great app.
Super easy to use and does what I want. It makes planning out my week much easier and it is really easy to organise tasks, and related tasks, as they pop up.
Easy to use and has helped my productivity with better planning. I have not tried any of the sharing features as of yet so I can not comment.

I use it for business and personal purposes. It is great to avoid procrastination and make things done. The notification system is not a pain like others. I tried at least other four apps for task management and this is the best.
Good little app, works well with Alexa Echo Dot and on my android. Free version is good enough for me. Does what it says on the tin :)
So far so good. Paid for subscription, not very usable without those features. Will review whether worth paying for additional features over other apps once I've been using it longer.
I've only used this for a week or so, but so far it is really great. Lots of features that I need to study more. Good integration with the Google ecosystem.
Good app. Nice reminder emails. It would be good to be able to set times for the items on your list but mostly it's good.
I love how it syncs to my laptop. The system is brilliant and easy to use. It's also not intrusive--it doesn't send notifications to me.
So far, so good. Premium is user friendly and is totally assisting me bluff my way through pretending to be an organized go-getter at my new job. Thanks.

Great app. Wish the sync feature was or could be automatically linked to phone calendar. Its kind of a hassle to copy an URL into my Google calendar, when that specific calendar is already synced with my phone.
Great mobile version of a great service, so far. I wish the UI was a little more compressed to show more on screen, but otherwise no complaints.
This app could benefit greatly from a calendar view. Sometimes my to-do lists contain assignments that go beyond a week-to-week basis.
Would love to be able to add tasks from within Gmail and Inbox on mobile, but that might not even be possible. Desktop is unsurpassed.
I've used Todoist for only a few weeks, but so far I like it pretty well. I may bump it up to 5 stars after I have more experience with it.

I'm a premium and avid user, am satisfied with most features except that time altering UI. It's especially annoying when I'm trying to change the minutes without inadvertantly pressing the submit button.

Just started using this app.  Works well, but I would love to have all the functionality accessible on my phone instead of between my desk top and phone.  Asking for updates from the team is not intuitive to me, but overall, I like the app.
Not what I need. Looking for a list of suggestions, because I'm not motivated to make a list before I have to make a list. You make the list, and let me choose from it.
Unfortunately, I couldn't get the app to access Google/Facebook servers even though my Internet is working fine. I couldn't even sign up via the app.
Literally making my life right now. Love the ability to categorize (and nest) my tasks and also mark dates/times as well as priority levels.
The learning curve could be more intuitive. I may have missed something, but I had to watch a few YouTube videos to get the basics. Better instructions may help.

Wonderful app! Such a clean user interface and it does not interrupt you with countless notifications. I also tried Any.do before this and found this app better. Cheers to the UX designer of your team.

Mobile app is great, awesome to do list app with enough customizability to fit a lot of different lifestyles. Windows app is very poor however - download the Windows 7 version if you use Windows. The Windows 10 app has a ton of bugs.
It's pretty good, but I still feel like it needs something extra I can't identify to be perfect
The app works great! Does what I intended. It does have some limitations such as tags, reminders and filters for the free version.

Excelente todo list app. Sincronização multiplataforma em tempo real com interface simples e prática. Uso a versão gratuita e estou satisfeito. Sincronizo tarefas com a extensão no Chrome p/ desktop em tempo real. Ótimo app.
Works well for what it does, but doesn't give reminders with the free version, which is the main reason I wanted it.
Been using it for about a week and it seems pretty slick. If I still like it in a fortnight I'd consider upgrading to the paid service.
The free version is already pretty useful if you just want a nice to do list with a way to differentiate between projects! I also like how well it integrates with other apps.
Love the app, especially the chrome add on in my browser. Wish there was a share option with other users.
Great organization. It reminds you about your tasks, even if they are overdue. Its great.
Changed my life. I have never been more organized and up to date on my affairs/tasks. Perfect for anyone who is incredibly messy and needs to start getting their crap together
Nice and easy to use. It gives you the option to categorize and has email and notification reminders for your day.
Best task management app I've used, with every feature I could possibly want.
Almost akin to a gamification of your productivity. Clean and sleek design makes it very fun to organize your task and projects

The Karma and the reschedule feature really works otherwise it leads to a lot of tasks with due dates just lying untouched for ages!
Keeps me on track to keep progressing. I can do more in a day reach my goal.
Very useful now that I purchased pro version. Versital and across both PC & phone. Well done programmers!

Helps me crush tasks! Love the integration with Outlook too.

Me a LOVE IT. one of the best out of the MANY ive tried!

Better feature and UI than Wunderlist. Pro version totally worths the price.
Great app! It's really useful in daily work.
Excellent for task management. Recomended for people who want to remember tasks and track the progress.
Increased work productivity and organised task for around the house. Great mobile app
We couldn't have organised moving country without it

I enjoy the Premium version but used the free version for years and loved it.
