I like the app very much, it helps keeping you organized, but €28,99 per year is bizarre. I would have gladly paid anything under €10, but it's too much. Maybe you could add a level between premium and the free version for a reasonable price, with features like comments but perhaps without the option to collaborate on things, or whatever drives the price up so much.

I've been using Todoist for all my projects for 2 years. I like the projects focus,  the way of writing dates, the ease of adding tasks. I like that i can send emails to any project: this makes a difference.   Recently discovered the projects template feature so that I can set up all the steps of organising a training programme and then duplicate that for the next programme.   For a 5th star I'd like the possibility to email tasks or all tasks in a project from todoist ... either as pdf or just in an email.

There are lots of things to get done  everyday and I used to keep a paper to-do list, but I'd misplace it or forget about it. My phone is always with me (sadly) and the things I put on todoist stay on my front screen so I'm reminded throughout the day of what still needs to be done. It's easy and convenient.

Would be a 5 star review if there were a couple of team-friendly features  (like tagging in comments). Otherwise, it's great. Love using it for managing small projects and tasks. Things fall through the cracks less often now than before.

I love this app because it keeps my to do lists up-to-date across all my devices. The language I can use to set recurring reminders is far better than any other to do app I have ever used. The integration with IFTTT allows me to easily increase my productivity with this app.

Their development team has been non-stop in improving all versions of the product (mobile apps, web, etc) - especially over the last year. Just had a bug in the Android version and I was so impressed this was fixed overnight.

I almost never pay for software like this. But I've also never found a todo list that actually works for me. I'm fine at writing the list, but I never manage to remember to look at it..... I decided to take the plunge and try the Premium edition and so far it's fantastic. I'm much more efficient and on-target than previously and it's only been a week or so! I'm really still only using the basic functions but it has been a huge change for the better.

Finally a reminder app that actually works correctly!  Does what you set it to do and sends messages/reminder to the correct device, eg. Phone, computer, tv. Etc. works most platforms and cross platforn, eg. Microsoft to Android, to apple, to lonovo to asus, brands, and many more not listed. GREAT JOB APP DEVELOPMENT TEAM!

I have been diagnosed with Attention Deficit Disorder which makes being organised a big problem for me and this helps me know day to day what I'm doing. Diaries I forget to look out calendars take alot of work inputting what I want to do. This makes things simple and straightforward. So much so that I am able to set something as complex as a holiday for myself, my wife and twin 5 year old boys which before I'd leave all this upto my wife. It really unloads the brunt of daily life off her shoulders.

Asks for all the permissions from Google Play Services so if I don't have that it generates errors all the time. Other apps with the same functionality don't need these. Sometimes the input is buggy and the cursor skips to the start of the entry when making a new event. Otherwise good.

Simple, responsive,  intuitive. Allows you to get your thoughts out quickly but still offers the option to easily add them to folders and order them to your liking. Reminders and notifications work intuitively - they're there when you need them without being intrusive and are quickly completed and filed away. Great app:-)

Todoist's strength lies in its simplicity. Quickly add a task as it pops into your head, then sort it later by "project", assign it to someone else or pick the due date. I use it to manage my work tasks, but also keep a running list of books I want to read.

I got this (premium) off a humble bundle, and I really enjoy this app, it's a good to do list with some nice features and a productivity chart, but what saddens me is it's a year sub. You don't pay once and only once like I'd happily do, you gotta pay each year. And when this year runs out, I won't get another year, that's just how I treat these apps. It's their fault that the features are taken away after your initial payment, so I'll leave em with a year of use. Then I'll switch back to sticky notes..

Almost perfect.   Has a Gmail-esque interface, very clean and intuitive for the most part.  Very functional and useful, even in the free version. Wish I could give 4.5 stars instead.   Would like to see a system for setting tasks to every other day/week/month.  Would also like an option to set increasing priority on overdue tasks,  so if something is four days overdue, it has higher priority than something one day overdue.

I am self-employed and have about 4-5 different business streams that I am involved in at any one time. Keeping track of tasks and deadlines has been tricky, and I've used my phone's built in calendar, paper, post it's, etc to try to stay organized. With Todoist, I organize my tasks by project and it's much easier for me to keep track of deadlines. Push notifications are a real help, as us the ability to take notes on each entry.

Helps you take your life back into control. By itself this app is not enough. I am combining this app with making with a daily schedule on paper. Each morning  you can review your high priority items and the items that are due that day, and fit them in your schedule on paper. AFAIK there is no app which does a very good job of helping you make your daily schedule.

I utilise to-do list a lot, and I've tried many to-do list apps, but in terms of cross platform compatibility, user experience and lightweight-ness nothing quite beats this app, not to mention it syncs real fast too. The unique karma system is a neat ego feeder too.

It would be cool if the app had a voice identification tool so you wouldn't have to type out all the things on your list. I agree with some other people in their reviews saying that the reoccurring setting isn't very easy to manipulate. So that's not quite as user friendly. But in every other way this is an awesome app. I'm a college student so I'm constantly having to map out dates and activities that I wouldn't have room for in a planner.

Ugh. Don't fix what doesn't need to be fixed. The new quick add feature is seriously worse than the previous one. Highly small and unreadable. It takes also longer to start. What it used to be a really quick tool, now it's slow and unusable.

I paid for the premium membership. And I very rarely pay for any app. But this app makes life easy by keeping it organized, and I found myself more and more often. I've even got my roommates using it now and it helps organize our chores and tasks. I use it for work, groceries, appointments, etc... just amazing.  One thing I would LOVE to see in is the ability to sync tasks to a calendar like Google. Or sync to other apps that track groceries like EatThisMuch. Integration is going to be selling points in the future, and I was tempted to switch to Any.Do due to their Calendar synchronization with Google which I use a lot too. But ToDoIst has got me hooked on their organization.

Labels, reminders, location-based notifications, file uploads, and automatic backups are completely standard features for almost every form of app made for organization for free! hear that, free! Google app, Evernote, Google Keep, Microsoft OneNote ect ect ect all do this for free. If you want to come up with something new and charge for it, be my guest . but to take a standard feature act like it's something special and charge $30 for it your going to destroy your business fast. What a RIPOFF! U wont last

I've been using Todoist for 3 years now; I tried many productivity apps before settling on it. Even though it lacks some features I think would be helpful, like setting start times and dates for tasks, it's flexible enough to be useful to both the novice and the power user. It's built on GTD principles, is incredibly customizable, and the karma points is a simple accountability tool that somehow hasn't lost its appeal. I recommend Todoist to anyone serious about GTD.

As a final year student of a five year degree it can be easy to get overwhelmed with the amount of work we have to do, especially with synoptic subjects, each one a bit different to the next. ToDoIst has helped me to organise my modules into projects, have sub projects and separate work from health from personal tasks. I think it's great so far, and it helps a lot with procrastination too. The best feature is that it's very easy to schedule things (today, tomorrow, daily, next week).

It's a pretty cool organizing check list app. I know you have to be a premium member to have the full capacity to use this app and it's a yearly fee. But I think at least syncing the calender would be a cool thing with the free account. But then again it a great hook to get people to get the premium version. Just saying.

Todoist is hands down the best, not only ToDo list, but tool, to stay organized I've every came across. Absolutely amazing.  Things I like the most: - Really clean and easy-to-use design - Very useful integrations (loving the one for Outlook for example)  Keep up the good work!

I am loving the app and I got it so my family could keep up with chores and we could get them done at a decent rate but it doesn't have all the features  I would like but the premium version adds some of the features I need like reminders but not features like allowing multiple people to access the one account and only view what they need to do which is a lot to ask for but all in all great app helps me and my family stay organized

This was my favourite app for 2 years. For the last few weeks the widget has started to freeze. Can't add tasks or mark tasks as done. At first I used to remove and readd the widget. Now it is getting very frustrating. The team is also not responding to my ticket as well. So sad.

Definitely helping me when it comes to two remembering appointments that I'm always forgetting to schedule little things like that that are in your mind every second when you're at work. The reminders in ice and the fact that you can set it with no date so it stays there I'm enjoying it

Just downloaded. Looks great, powerful. Was attracted to the location reminders  (powerful tool) - just one suggestion: could you provide for a radius around a location? I missed a reminder this week because I was a block away from the address entered. If you did an adjustable radius to allow greater advance notice when driving highway speeds, for example, I'd give it 6 stars. Thank you. Looks great, and great support and network...

Easy to use on my phone, pc and tablets! (PC & Mac) Thanks for a great product that works.  Haven't upgraded to premium and I love that the basic app is so robust.  Todoist helps me get things done at the right times and allows me to focus on things when I need to.  I value the peace of mind that it's all on my to do list and I will see it when it is time to address it.

Very usable while still having flexibility and powerful features, there if needed, unintrusive if not. Recently an issue where the app opens blank and needs to be killed to restore the view, assume will be fixed though. Recommend above all others

All in all a very good app. I've been using this app for about a year now and it only gets better! Although recently I got a new phone (A9 Pro) and noticed that the app doesn't support split-screen view. Would love it if you guys can implement that feature for the next update! :)

I was a Wunderlist user for 3 years, but when I couldn't get my Amazon Echo to work with it, I switched to Any.do.  Turned out that sucked too and had all sorts of sync issues. I then switched to Todoist and it has been working great so far.

A nice balance between richness of features and simplicity of use and feel. I am not a power user and it has more than enough capacity for my needs. Helps me stay organized and to convert long term projects into a daily agenda.

It's a great app with some wonderful features. It is really annoying though just how much of it is restricted without premium. I frequently hit buttons that it ends up not letting me use and gives me the annoying premium popup. I wouldn't mind paying for the app but I don't do subscription services

Liked the app and got my lists set up trying out the free version for about a week, then in an update they took away a favorite feature (filters)  and restricted it to Premium only.  Was it sneaky that they didn't openly list this change but included it in the catch all last item "and more"?   How do you think that makes me feel?  I don't trust you. Uninstalling.

Excellent tool in mapping out my day and being sure thing s don't fall through the cracks. It was highlighted in Tim Challies book on Productivity. His help in  setting up the app has helped me greatly...it has so much to offer!

What a piece of junk (for our needs at least). ZERO customer support. No phone number to call and no emails returned. And you want to charge me money? Simple features are lacking such as being able to lock a list with sub-tasks. Nah, no one would ever want to actually lock a list of something they are constantly doing with ever changing sub-tasks. Put an asteric in front of it! After loosing my list twice trying that, nice one. The free version might be great for you, but do not waste your money, these guys clearly do not want to offer a service for a cost.

Finally, a time mgt app that I can use across all my devices, including an Android phone, an iPad, and a PC. And it allows me to tag and label each task with multiple labels. This means I can sort tasks according to category, priority, time required, due date, energy needed, etc, etc. Literally for me am answer to prayer.   My only frustration is that the repeat function for tasks doesn't appear with the calendar, so if I don't initially set up a recurring task as, say "monthly," it takes me some tweaking to modify it as such... But initial task entry, including an inbox feature for quick entry of any/all tasks that may come to mind, is dynamite!
Lets me drag and drop tasks into projects and days very easily. The scoreboard is fun and motivating. This is my first stop every workday. My productivity has improved 2000% since getting this app
Working great so far. I've only had the app for days, but have been using the browser version for months. The app is a bit smoother and very efficient.

Here is a review after I used the app for over two years (one year free, one year paid, back to free now).  The app is great, definitely my favorite to-do app after trying out over 5 others, and having a bad time managing my time.   Free version highlights: - good minimalistic interface  - frequent updates - shortcut support  - custom natural language queries - smart re-scheduling based on AI algorithms  - priority sorting - good search for custom filters - nice karma point system for game junkies  Paid version highlights: - supports @tags - calendar syncing - custom filter support - good project support for multiple users  What I would love to have: - custom and more complex keyboard shortcuts - custom priorities + colors - more custom colors for projects (see Life Calendar colors for example, I want to have those) - have the calendar sync be a free option (just to get people in) - add some icons, like in Wunderlist - would like to have more graphs - (Web version) Add a button to move to a project when editing a task  Leaving it at 5 stars knowing the devs like to listen and we'll see updates eventually. Recommend it to any programmer,  and others.
Glad I settled on the best after all my shopping of to-do apps. Always updating and improving and integrating.
Good app and good support from the developers when issues occur. I use the free version - I'm sure the premium version is more feature rich.
Good scheduling,  easy to postpone tasks to later date,  combines pretty well with outlook on pc.  It doesn't create an extra 8 hours a day  but otherwise pretty good...

Gone are the days of having a separate diary for a to do list. As this works offline, I can update my to do list one handed on the underground on the  way to the office and it syncs as soon as I'm above ground.
It's annoying that you have to pay an outrageous amount ($30 a year) for it to do anything more than a simple checklist. For example it won't do notifications or recurring tasks.
I think the options to view your tasks according to priority has been moved to the subscription service because the error "filter bot found" regularly pops up
Seems to have a lot of great functions for a free app. I can set due dates and work on just that day's list. I had a master list in another app and it was overwhelming.

I've used a lot of productivity apps, and this is one that I really like.  It's simple to use and I like the multi platform use.   The reminders are useful.   I'm still learning, so I'm not sure if I can link it to mapping apps to get reminders to leave for appointments based on traffic,  but will explore more.
Simple, clean & powerful task management. A little lacking if you don't go premium, but premium is well worth it.
Every sensible option is locked behid the paywall. Free version of the app feels barren, clunky and unintuitive.
This app has made me a more productive, organised efficient individual. Almost exhausting what I can get done with it.
I like it really much, though I think that it is missing some features. For example being able to add a task that should be done before some date.
I want alert for my tasks, like say half n hr before the task or 1 hour. I don't know how I could do that. Rest otherwise. It's good
Nice app didn't know you had to make a purchase for complete access guess I'll wait and see how useful it is before purchasing the full access
The program is a new reminder of tasks for which I have set a completion date. I wish it was a bit more flexible in the way tasks are added.
Enough options to organize multi-layers of multi-projects w/ multi-people but not so many bells &  whistles that it's cumbersome to use.
This has helped me keep on top of things I an thinking of upgrading to the premium service but will keep going with this version for a little while yet.
I'm able to keep track of all the things I need to get done, organise them well even without premium, and collaborate with my fiancé on our shared responsibilities. It's wonderful!
Todoist is the best tool to take you from handwritten scribbles around your apartment to well-organized personal task management! I love their connection with their customers, too.
Got the free version.  Difficult to organize tasks.  Then they locked my info and wanted me to pay $30 for a years use.
For me the killer features are a genuinely intuitive interface and the easy management of subtasks.
Easy to use.  Windows 10 app lags behind Android app in functionality, but am very happy in general.  Has helped me and my company track, share, and complete lists of todos.
Just started using it about a week ago. No complaints, looks beautiful and simple to use. Will update as I get into more of the features
The best task manager I've tried so far. Going to the second year in premium and lovin' it.  Missing a calendar view, although.  Edit to update: great, once added I'll probably rate 5 star.
The home page option should be customized to  show 4 to 5 project at a time (my suggestion)
I like the Inbox feature where you can just dump all your to do's so as not to miss anything.

This is a great app. It is easy to use and has everything I need for daily and weekly tasks. I don't use all its functions but the other sections don't get in the way of what I need which other app providers could take note of.
In conjuction with GTD methodology, I have finally gotten ahold of my life! I suggest reading "Getting Things Done" and implementing this app within that methodology.
Great note taking app with a great design that doesn't get in my way when im working. They also have a really good chrome extension that works well with the app.
I use it daily to stay on top of both important and mundane tasks.  Especially like the recurring features
I wish Google Keep did the same thing.  I use it just to make simple to do lists.  It looks like it does a ton more...
Reminder feature is the main feature of this type of app which is not available in free version otherwise everything is perfect. Gui is awesome.

Good app. A bit tricky at first, if you come from MS Outlook, for example. But once you get used to how it works, and how to program new todo's and reminders, it's very good.   For me, however, it lacks very important features. For example, let's imagine that ten notification reminders pop up in your cell phone at 8:00 a.m. For some reason, you have to restart your phone (e.g., it falls down and the battery slips off.) When you do so, your notifications are gone---and if they were a lot, you just won't remember which they were. Or, for example, let's imagine one notification pops up, and you take a look at the comment attached to it. After that, if you move to any other app or just return to home screen in your phone, notification is gone, even though you have not completed that todo.   There is no way to take a look at which todo's have notifications programmed for today (you can only see which todo's due dates are set for today.) Also it would be nice to have a way to take an easy look to a calendar when programming a reminder---currently you can only take a glimpse at a calendar when setting the due date.
I do not want to sign up. App thinks I must.  Deleted immediately.
Beautiful and simple design.  No distractions, quick and easy sync.  On another level I spotless love to see adding pictures and assigning tasks to persons
Easy to use for simple tasks management. It would be better if there was reminder alert feature in the free version.
Not used premium, but find it intuitive & useful tool for organising and scheduling to do lists. Using post it notes a lot less!
Near perfect. Needs next actions, simpler sub tasks and native Evernote integrations. Good Workarounds possible.
It's an adventure figuring out how to add repeating tasks, but RD keeps me in line fulfilling my obligations.
Very useful. Has most features you need. The pro version feels a little bit more expensive than I like, so I'm sticking with the basic.
I think it's a very handy app to keep a list of everything you need to get done. Very easy to use; and has never posed a problem for me.
Very handy app. I like that I can use it on mobile and desktop and it syncs perfectly. It has significantly improved my daily productivity.
Best productivity app ever. Im using to set my kids chores. Just setup recurring tasks and they get notified on their phones automatically. Sweet no nagging from dad!

I really like Todoist because it helps me to be more productive. Having it on both my phone and as a Chrome plugin is the best part because I can add something to my list whenever I need it. The text parser for times to do tasks at is also very cool and useful. Great UX and UI and it does everything it's supposed to
Helps me keep track of busy college life while separating different projects such as my car, shopping lists and more. Very useful app.
I got the premium in a bundle, i would normally just use Google keep to stay on track of things. So far it seems effective.
Um ótimo aplicativo, com design claro e intuitivo, recomendo para todos meus amigos. Para melhorar só faltou a visualização das atividades por um calendário.
Allows me to keep track of multiple things in personal life from must do's to ideas of things to do. Shared "projects" with significant other keep us on the same page when needed!

Clean and intuitive interface makes this app very easy to use.  Despite this simplicity it's amazingly fully featured  and takes care of everything I (and most users) could need in a project management / to do list application. Syncing across devices is almost instantaneous making it a doddle to move quickly from pc to mobile whenever the need arises.
I'm giving this 2 stars for now since I'm in the learning phase. Not sure of its full capabilities since I only have the free version. Will rate higher if I like and get the full version.
Am extremely selective in choosin planning and scheduling tools. Must say this is one of the best. Two years now, trird the premium and the free. Both amazing. Well done.

Nice interface, very intuitive, but the free version it's very limited. Overall, it's a good app to track your tasks and lists. Sadly, in the free mode, you can't link it to your calendar, therefore, I give it 3 stars.
Awesome that lists can be shared and I love being able to create lists within list items so easily.
Super simple to use and fast to add new tasks. Great keyboard shortcuts on the web app too.
I love how easy it is to setup recurring tasks plus plan out long-range projects. Love!

The paid version is outstanding.  The free app cuts out too many features. Sync is good and Alexa integration is fantastic.  If you are looking for free,  look at Wunderlist instead.   But if you are willing to pay,  Todoist is great.
Simple task-tracking app. Would love it if you could see beyond 7 days
Brilliant App to help organise my tasks. There are some good you tube video to help get the best from it. I use Carl Pullein working with todist, only because I know him but there are others.
I was looking for a product to help me organize my busy life in retirement.  I have many projects going on at any given time, and Todoist really helps me stay organized and focused.
Been using this app for almost a year with the premium, and I have already subscribed for the next. Best todo list app I've ever come across.
I am a terrible list maker but this has really helped me be more organized.  I highly recommend for anyone who is not inately organized.
It works well on any platform and gives me great reminders. I  recommend this tool to anyone looking for a modern tool.
Very useful app and premium version gives more use cases and very simple interfaces. My tasks getting done now.
It was great before last update. Currently I cannot work cause it crashes every time I put a task with date.
I use more the desktop version, but the mobile experience is really easy to use and helpful when I'm not in front of my laptop.
This app fit my needs almost perfectly, I just wish it was a one off purchase for the premium version instead of a subscription model. If it was so, I would buy it without hesitation.
Keeps me right on track to get things done. I was blessed  with a stroke 9 months ago so if i dont gave it in writing I dont get it done

Helps me stay productive and give positive feedback and a good feeling when you get to check a task off the list. The widget is nice because you don't need to open the full app to check on the day or mark something as done. Would recommend to all those list makers out there.

I originally wrote a review for this program a year or so ago and lamented the need to pay a subscription to be able to set alarms. That was before I understood the ubiquitous and wonderful nature of Todoist. I now have Todoist on my phone, tablet, Outlook, and both home and work PCs. It syncs perfectly amongst all locations and really keeps me on an even keel. I've even become a fan of karma points. This is a great program for implementing GTD.

Although it still has its issues, todoist is constantly improving, adding features and getting better. It is cross-platform, although sometimes the  differences between the different versions can be annoying. I wish it had import-export capabilities. I don't think the integration with Outlook is very good. Still using the program after a year and I sometimes marvel at its simple elegance.

I can easily add new items to my to-do list by using the short cut widget. The interface is clean and simple. I like how I can see the things I need to do in a week. The app automatically finds the key words in your writing to figure out when it is due. That is probably the coolest part. It really helps me remember to do important things. The karma points motivate me to complete my to do lists.

I'm enjoying the free version so far.  Only drawback is not having the option to set a reminder for a time sensitive task BEFORE the task is due to be completed.  But so far I'm satisfied enough to consider upgrading but ONLY if that option is made available even in the free version.  Cuz even the free calendar that comes with my phone allows me to set multiple reminders.  So it's kind of lame that I can't do that here.

This app is exactly what I have needed for a while now. No more lists that get lost in my purse! It's nicely organized and easy to use. I only gave it a 4 because there are many wonderful features that cost much more than necessary. I just won't pay that much for an app. Happy with the app but disappointed with the cost of half of the features.

Very good, though not perfect. Both Windows and Android apps have rather slow workflow. For example Windows app show sliding animations of all menus and use fonts for tablet, not desktop. On both systems, the board switching is also slow using the left side menu only. There are other issues as well. The app shows a lot of promise, but just isn't the fast todo app I need.

Only been using Todoist for about a week, but this is one of the best organization apps I've run across, and I'm a bit of a junkie. Interface is clean, simple, and easy to use. The ability to sub-categorize and the ease of sharing lists with anyone you like put it way ahead of others. First high-tech solution that beats pen and paper for me. Need to fix occasional stuck loading screen. Still some issues with making recurring tasks (recognizing "every other day" etc.), but more intuitive than expected.

Not only good user interface, but also excellent Karma system. It make the task management fun, where I used to think task management is boring. This app certainly helps me to imorove my productivity.

Been using this app for a week and it's great. We have rental properties so I can make materials list , what to check at the courthouse: etc.  Having trouble with fractions such as sizes for plywood.  App changes it to dates.

There should be a feature of adding levels of completeness of the tasks. If I began a task today and went halfway through, I want to mark that on my to-do list, or else I end up feeling like I did nothing the whole day.

An excellent free app. It does just what I want without complicated bells and whistles. I'm sure the paid version has more options, but all I needed was a simple to do list. I like that you can postpone or reschedule tasks that you didn't get to that day.

I downloaded this app after our lights got cut off because I wasn't receiving the bills and forgot to pay! I have many recurring reminder tasks from bills to cleaning and even for continuing education. This app is fantastic and helps me keep track of all the things I need to do in a user-friendly way!

Most to-do lists are either unintuitive or bloated with features. Todoist gets out of the way so you can focus just on your tasks instead! Some features need a subscription though, like commenting on tasks, setting reminders, and collaborating with others.

Best to-do list app I've used our of many. Clean design that is easy to navigate. I linked Chrome and Outlook to it and all works smoothly. No ads on the free version, however the premium version is well worth it.

Easy to use interface keeps tasks organized and lets me manage them and make changes quickly. No more long backlog because the timing of one tasks makes everything fall behind. Sub-tasks are very useful too.

Todoist caters to how my mind works. It enables me to spit out all of the things that run through my mind. At the end of the day, I take a look at the action items, organize and keep up with the momentum. It would be nice to have a zappier with expensify. Though, I jerry rigged the comments so that I can email my receipts in much like how the trello cards work. Also, I would love to still view what I've assigned to folks. I think that it gets archived on my end, perhaps? Keep it up, thanks!

I paid for premium, now I'm wasting my time figuring out why my premium is gone. Send him a service request but why am I wasting my time with an app that supposed to save me time. Even if they fix this I will leave it a one-star review because I'm wasting my time with an app that supposed to save me time get it yet? Get this s*** fixed

This app has turned our home into a well oiled machine with all parts functioning in unison towards the same objectives. We are just so much more efficient now, and communication is in real time. Couldn't live without it.

Being able to use English syntax in almost any format to input tasks is awesome. It makes it easy to schedule things when I think about them, no matter the context in which the thought occurs.  It's really neat.

This app really helps me organise and motivate myself, and remember those little things I'd otherwise forget! It's super easy to add tasks, customise categories, etc. to make it work for you, and the karma feature definitely helps motivate me to get as much done each day as possible. :P Thanks!!

Really simple and easy to use, but at the same time it's also really powerful and effective. I use Todoist for personal chores, grocery & shipping lists, keeping track of bills, and it's even made it's way into my work life via the Outlook plug-in. Quite simply, as soon as I started using it, Todoist quickly became an integral part of my daily life by helping me manage all of the "stuff" that can be overlooked so easily.
I've used about four other applications in the past year to manage my workload and my teams, and none are as simple, as good looking or as cheap as todoist. Wouldn't go back to anything else now.

Used many different apps. Each had something or the other missing. But this has everything I was looking for, simple to use and has been keeping me busy with work. Never realised I have so much stuff to do
This was the only app where I could find nesting to-dos, but it's a little complicated to use. More i just treat it like a running to-do list

Installed this app and played with it for a solid 2 hours and compared it to a few other similar apps. It seems decent, however I could not nest or create sub-tasks. Maybe this feature is in the paid version. But surely, even a basic alarm sound feature to notify should be available with the free version of the app! If I can not hear or get pop-up notifications for my due tasks, then I see little point using this app. Will unfortunately not be keeping this app.
Todoist is the tool I've been looking for.  It makes it virtually impossible to NOT know what I need to do next, today and next week. It's SO easy to use.

For me the deciding factor in keeping a to-do app is whether or not it becomes its own chore due to poor design. Tidoist excels in all categories - adding items, scheduling and organizing them, and completing them. It's a joy to use!

The App is just awesome. There are hundrets of possibilities that help you organize yourself. 4 Stars because you can't really use the app sensible without buying premium. But 28,99€ per year are definitely worth what you get for it!
Has all the functionality you need. The interface could be a little more intuitive - think Windows vs a Mac

this app does what you need, such as letting you put a specific meeting with a time in the description and it automatically synces with your list and notifications to help remind you. App is useful and needed for all planners.
The only thing that I want from them is to add a monthly or half a year subscripition, not just a yearly one.
Lacklustre offerings for a premium price. I would have bought in for a one time price, but no way am I being billed regularly for a digital planner.

This app is great for scheduling tasks and things that need doing. The only suggestion I have is to add a way to have tasks that don't have a dated deadline, just a simple to-do list for when one has chance to get to them
I was looking for an easy to use task tracking app, and this one is great. I really like the feature that allows me to set a task to be due in the future.

As a full-time college student this has been my number one organization tool. It would be much more difficult to stay on top of classes without this app. It is reliable and easy to use, so good job developers!

I like it, but I don't like finding out what I can only do in the free version by selecting an option presented to me only to find its only available in the premium version.  I realize that this is an effective tool, but it is no less irritating.
Love the natural language input, accessibility across platforms and integration to other services via IFTTT. Cannot function (well) without Todoist. A happy premium customer for years.
The widget I use keeps going back to let me choose a view a while after choosing one, hope you guys can fix it.

Awesome app..  Minimal and useful together.. Just wish there was an offline version available for Windows.. The Windows7 app is not as good as the chrome app.  Still that wud be nitpicking..  5 stars from my side
I use this app all the time because it is so easy to add a task with other associated info
I love love love this app.  I don't know what I did before I got it.  I can finally keep up with my very busy life and not fall behind.  There are not words to describe not much this app rocks.

Simple, effective way to keep tabs in an organized manner, collaboratively. Email notifications make sure you don't forget, and maintains its effectiveness by refusing to collect dust with all the novelties downloaded in the moment.
This is a very helpful app. I've only had a few days but I like it better than Trello.
constantly delightful and improving. my entire life is now wrapped up in todoist, and I can't imagine how I'd organize my life without it. Pro is totally worth it.

What's the use of a to do list which claims it's free but has reminders in the premium one only. And the premium is for ₹1800. Whopping rip off!!! Use wunderlist instead. This app has great organisation better than the others and a great Mac app, but reminders have to be a part of free!!!

Good service and app.  I like it enough to have paid for it, but there are a few things that I would like to see done differently. For example, there is no "start date", just a due date. I don't like to do things the day they are due.
I don't usually rate apps but when I do it's because they either suck majorly or rule royally. 5 stars because I can't give 6. 👊
For me it's an extremely helpful app as I work and always have a lot of things to do and it seems impossible to have time for everything. Thank you so much

After trying just about every task management service, I settled on Todoist. One of the things I wanted was to be able to view all tasks across all users and all projects, none of the others seemed to have this.
The best for universal compatibility, ease of use and features. Even has a plugin you can install into Outlook.
Thus far, I am enjoying use of Todoist.  It has yet to crash on me. The reminder notice is helpful. Thanks
Update : the app is dead.  White screen loading.     Slick app. Good work!  P.S. In your latest update you lost the icon and now it's generic android one
This is a very simple-looking app but the functionality is incredible. Especially now that they've added auto-rescheduling of overdue tasks. It's everything you want!
Everything is going to plan, thanks to Todoist. Only one thing missing - the ability to easily set tasks aside for smaller periods of time like 10 minutes, or an hour or two.
I've been using it for years and love it. All the features needed to implement GTD are there. Simple and efficient.
It's great having a todo list that's synchronized on all my devices. Being able to group tasks into projects is nice.
Todoist is an easy to use, simple, and elegant app no time manager should go without.
I would like to see a little better integration with outlook. This really helps me keep track of everything
Loving this app so far. Seems better than other todo apps that I've used in the past. Has great features around helping you manage your tasks better
Iuved it thoroughly... Enjoying the timely reminders. I need the app to put up a facility where everyday chores can be reminded viz.  medicines
Very slow in showing the updated tasks. I had to wait for 10-15 min just to see what are in my to do list. Pathetic experience.
only installed this as Amazon Alexa doesnt support keep. If you can make it easy to drag items up and down and  have a simple tick box to complete items then you would be wortg a 5

I don't know where I'd be without Todoist. As a student I've used it to organize my life weeks in advance and understand what needs to be done by when. Sync between PC and Mobile is incredibly useful too. Couldn't recommend it more.

I've stuck with Todoist for longer than any other system I've used in the past. It's available on every platform I need and provides a good balance between speed, simplicity and flexibility. Recommended.

After the last updates when creating a new note on the phone, pressing the enter button closes the note instead of starting a new line in the same note. I hate it. Please give at least the option to revert it back
Focused, clean, doesn't attempt to do everything and this is superior to anything more featured.
I am using it for the first time.  What's different from other programs to note task is that it graph measures your productivity and motivates you to get better

The deal breaker for me with the other apps is lack of outlook integration. This has it and the convenience of being able to categorize and organize the task as you type it, which is great. This app keeps me organized and on schedule. I wish the reminders were free but, i guess they got to make money some how.
I really love the app. I think the model of date/time notifications being paid for is not right. Wish it wasn't so, happy with app though.
Does what it says on the tin and is easy to use and the free one is more than enough. However I did like the humour in the carrot iOS app, it made me use it more.

Please make it possible to customize your home screen so that it displays all your projects right at the start when you launch the app. It would make adding tasks so much easier. I'll happily give 5 stars if you add that feature!

Still. The lack of weekly view and monthly view is a serious contra-productive matter. Weekly view and monthly view currently not presented as table, and I hate it seeing a list. Those lazy programmers never learns. I bought another app.
Love this app! I don't like paying subscriptions but the premium version is worth every penny. Highly recommended
To me, if an app is any good, it should be to some degree intuitive. I am a reasonably intelligent person but I cannot find how to delete a task. When I find that out rating may go up.
I find it works great if you use it in conjunction with the website on a computer.
Would give 5 stars if one could do frequent actions using swipe actions..For instance postponing the backlog sholdn't take 3 taps..
If you like the GTD method, you'll love this app.  Experiment with the project names and subcategories until you have what you want.   Google Todoist to learn about different set-up options.
It has everything you need for your to do list. The only thing I would like to make it better -  if it would send reminders to your phone, if a deadline was nearing.
Overall I like the app. I only use the free version right now but it does everything you would expect a to do list to do.
Requires you to purchase it to use reminders. And the cost is ridiculous.  It's a freaking task checklist.
Leaves a bit too many features for pro users only, but everyone's gotta make money I guess. No ads and no bugs.
I like the ability to make projects and set due dates for various tasks in the project. Very easy to use. It's very comvenient to have this on my phone and laptop.
This is the one I always come back to! Super simple, intuitive, and cross platform! Highly recommended to anyone
Since I use ToDoist in my daily work, my productivity has exploded.
Simple and confused at the same time. It's not the same procedure in different devices. Need equalizer UI for all devices. But works well.

I love how user friendly the interface is and how I can sync across all of my devices. This app is a great, no frills way to make sure all my tasks and deadlines are with me wherever I go and no matter what device I'm using. I never review, but here I am. Use it.
Todoist has helped me get organized, which is quite the accomplishment. Great product and a wonderful support team behind it.
It is a good way of organizing your plans. I personally use it for school assignments and it works great. Only wish some more features were unlocked without having to pay for the premium.
I've tried a lot of similar apps and this one easily out performs the rest. With IFTTT and Alexa integration it is the perfect productivity tool.

We are using Todoist in all functions of our business. As a CRM for our sales and marketing team, in the purchasing department for tracking orders and purchases, in the production  department for scheduling and tracking our factory and in the accounting department for ensuring timely payments and collections.

I spent some time to understand the basics.  I watched a few YouTube videos and suddenly I become more productive with less effort.  Pre organization of the tasks, on the go monitor and easy task updates, evening evaluation keeps me focused and productive.  One way solution for people who want to become and stay productive
Dont waste your time, all efforts went into material design. Dgt Gtd + Pure calendar brats it in almost every aspect except UI.

I have tried all the agenda, todo and habit apps and none worked for me. I was about to start learning android dev just to create a productivity app that fulfils my needs. Thank god i found todoist. This is the only app that does what i need!
Sometimes updates removes features which you are currently using but in general I'm a happy user with 4 years of experience.
Easy to use. Nice and simple. Just what I was lacking in a task app. Plus the widget is great.
This app reminds me of everything I need to do. Doesn't let a day go by if I forgotten something. I would recommend it for anyone who is on a tight schedule.
Has it been like other apps, charging a one  time price, it would have been justifiable. This is just..
Lots of options, multiple ways to use it. The only improvement to suggest would be a dedicated "next action" indicator to facilitate use for GTD applications.

Can't rate this enough. For someone like me it's a way to organise my millions of thought processes and increase motivation. Organise tasks into priority. The only downside is that you realise you don't have enough time to do everything! Haha...
Loving going digital with my to do lists on this app! Great to keep track of tasks and enjoy the message I get when they are complete each day. Highly recommend.

Even in free version it's very useful: though it doesn't allow to manage labels and filters I can still use Eisenhower's prioritization and organize tasks in projects. Great to see the tasks planned for the week and what's the next most important task. I started to use it as a browser extension a year ago, but found mobile app more convenient.  Recommend it to my friends.
Good for managing tasks in GTD method. Allows for critical assignment of PARENT tasks as opposed to less useful sub tasks
The todoist app has thought put into its design. I also really like the web app and it's one of the main reasons I continue to use it.

Has some great features but not a fan of the way reminders work. Premium accounts at the time i signed up were only offered yearly so 6 months on and I'm missing ticktick since they implemented their inline date parsing.
I've been through tens of different todo softwares,  but Todoist is by far it's the best I've used
Not using with anyone else. Helps me get daily tasks done, however. Enjoy the ability to see tasks on desktop without having to log in. Just link off the email that is sent.
Cross platform, flexible, and more useful than glamorous any. do if you have about one hundred tasks.
Exactly enough features for free to be very useful. Premium offers enough benefits for the price. Works well,  no issues in several years.
Sync of task let me track my work from anywhere & Karma has pushed me to do work more efficiently.
THis hearkens back to the wonderful simplicity and flexibility of the old paper-based Franklin Planners, and as a bonus, I can add items using the Alexa app and my Echo Dots.

Update 2: you removed this feature, so back to four stars Update1 : Thanks for adding this feature, much better now!   I have the premium version, will give it 5 stars after you enable reminders to be added when creating a task from the widget, rather than having to create the task, then manually select it and tap on the three dots and tap reminders
This app has seriously helped my organization and productivity. I can't praise it enough!
Easy to use for management and completion of tasks. Reordering and creating subtasks features are really good even if it takes a while to get the hang of it

It worths to buy premium version. I have access from anywhere from my Mac to my new Nexus phone. Also their app is compatible with the latest Android and Mac version. In addition, their intelligent text recognition and filters are unique features.
Very helpful for the very disorganised 😊
I use it to track home improvement projects and to help reinforce good daily habits. I love the way the tasks can keep repeating as long as I want them.
I've tried a number of task managers, and this is my fave. I'm a GTD fan, and Todoist allows a pretty faithful setup.
I'm a person  who always has to schedule out what I'm doing for a week and this is great. Most importantly it doesn't crash if you have more than 10 tasks in a day!
I work 4 jobs and this helps keep me organized. Since the last update, the app is incredibly and take multiple times clos ing and opening to work on my S7.
Dumping out everything in my mind into this app has been a huge relief. I use it religiously now!
Recently started to improve my productivity and this app has been a huge help in me organising my monthly and weekly goals. Huge help thanks
For someone who struggles with ADD and is Autistic, this app is a godsend. Give the free version a try, it may just revolutionize your life too!

Todoist is the perfect simple ToDo list app. I tested lots before I settled on this - I wanted something that would sync cross-platform, could be used offline, and where info entry and retrieval was quick and easy. I've been using Todoist for my grocery and shopping lists,  and personal and house ToDos for a few yrs now, and it suits me perfectly.

My Opinion to Enhance                                         1. Expand subtask levels from 5 to 10                        2. Allow to set timeframe instead of due date. Eg. From 15th dec2016 10pm to 20 thdec2016 5am
I love this app. I wish I could get notifications without paying for the premium version, but this free version is still great! Get it!
It's a great app. I was in search for an app that could help me organize and prioritize my work well... And it's perfect for the job!
So much better than trying to remember everything in your head! Awesome and simple interface.
One of the best apps for task and project management. Getting things done! Thank you,  Todoist team.
This app helps me with daily tasks, unlike others that are cumbersome.
Todoist allows for enhanced productivity by cramming a host of features including natural language prediction into an interface that removes itself from distraction.
Love how simple this app is. Daily tasks and email reminders. You won't miss your tasks next time.
Super efficient, user friendly and helpful utilities in one app. Now it just needs to add a pomodoro timer and I'd never need another app!
A very convenient option. Do Try it !   -1 rating because I dont like my mail being spammed with my TODO.

Often these types of apps are full of useless bells and whistles that just get in the way. Todoist has a very clean interface, yet with the intelligence that is built into the app it's still very powerful.
Really helps me to stay on top of the various activities I have in my life. It's worth taking the time to organise it properly to get the most out of it though!

App now hangs whenever I open it; won't load any data unless I search for something that's already in one of my lists.  Seems to be ever since the annoying addition of that forced "reschedule" feature - which is also making me hate the app these days.

This feature has been consistently asked for over the last two years and is probably the easiest requested feature to implement, yet we're still waiting for it. Still waiting as of 10/2014. It's now 6/2015 and still no dark theme. 11/2016, still no dark theme. This review will remain 1 star until it is added.   In the meantime, Any.do has already "considered" and added this feature.
The app os great. I like that it informs me the amount of days my task is overdue
In general it's a good app but, as I see it, on home page all tasks and projects should be displayed
Only gave it a 4 because there were a few things i came across that I wish it would do in the free version. Other wise it's great!!

I've tried at least 6 to-do list apps over the years.  I've liked others, but I LOVE Todoist! It is what I have been looking for- a project based app with sub projects that is simple, intuitive and effective. I've been using Todoist since early 2013 and it gets better all the time. I went from a Galaxy S3 to S5, and now to a Moto Z Play. Works great on all of them.
I've tried a few task managers but ToDoist just works better than all of them across all devices.

The best "to do list" app or planner I have ever used physical or otherwise. The key to the apps usefulness are found in its fluidity and intuitive nature. Editing large amounts of to do items can be done in minutes. Smaller amounts? In seconds. Here's hoping todoist keeps its simplicity and stays relevant with updates for years to come.
Easy to use and highly functional.  It helps me keep track of everything I'm trying to remember (to do lists, shopping lists, and projects) all in one place.

Come on - Upgrade to Calendar View! I have been using this app for 4 years, paid, and i can't keep scheduling in and doubling up on meetings! You seriously need to incorporate a calendar view for this app! You can only look at a list....come on guys i don't want to leave but i will if i have to keep guessing what i have on a certain date!
Name it and you can connect Todoist to it. Premium adds enough extra features to make it worth it. Being able to quickly add things via Alexa at home and OK Google in the car is a killer feature
I've been searching for and using several different task management apps. For my process, Todoist Premium beats Any.do, Wunderlist, RTM, and Outlook. Couldn't be happier.
I started to use Todoist and it has immediately  improved my productivity. I would only wish to work with other productivity tools as an accelerator such as Trello

What is this? It looks so promising and great application, BUT you need to pay premium to activate the Reminders alarms. So this app is incomplete. How can we test if the reminders work with the sound at the exact time if it is not free?
You can't even add a reminder to tasks without upgrading to full product.. deleted as soon as realised that. Such bs!
Crashes when first launched every single time on google pixel please fix
Something recently happened... I have to load the app, then back out and close it... And then re-open in order to see any tasks.  It no longer displays anything upon initial opening.
Great to use for reminders, easy to add to the list and even easier to check items off.
I dont know what I would do without this app!!!
Loved this app, but today is second time my tasks disappeared or were marked as done. I have so many work and personal projects, that it made a problem.
Very happy with this app. It also has a chrome plugin which makes it easy to sync across devices.
Just starting to figure it out.  Upgraded immediately to Premium.
Fantastic tool but you must take the time to learn how to use all of the features before it really will benefit you! Highly recommended this app!
Find this app very useful. Also cross platform so I can use it on browser.
This app has a widget that allows me to put the to do list on my home page, very useful!
Great Tool! Be great if you can sync with a Calendaring service like Google Calendar
Best to-do app only downside is its not a magic fairy that does everything on the list
I had an idea and thought that it would be useful to be able to select two events and then have a sort of function to swap the timings between them.
Relieved all my stress, no adds, love it
Does what it says. Not too fancy, a good core task manager.
Love the app helps me out an awful lot
Beautiful app, love the integration into other apps. Keep up the great work

Great app.  Probably the best to-do list manager out there.  Very intuitive and I like that you can add a due date simply by typing it (no need to open an extra window).  I use the free version which is more than sufficient for my needs, but some of the bad reviews come from those who need the features from the Pro version but don't want to pay.

I've liked a lot of applications initially but gradually lost interest in them. Not so with Todoist, which remains my go-to task manager three years in. Like other superb applications, Todoist does a few key things well and provides the flexibility to use the application the way you want without forfeiting simplicity. I can't overstate the value of Todoist and if you don't think the premium subscription is worth it, you don't need a task manager.

I like the flexibility and I am only using the free features on my phone, the Chrome extension and the Web app. Just what I needed and with no issues. No limits on number of tasks or projects and great ways to add repeating tasks using normal language.

I've been using todoist for almost 2 years. To have it on my phone, on my desktop, and in my Gmail makes it really convenient and easier to rein in the demands on my time--not to mention less ruled by my inbox.

Was good, but recently removed the ability to schedule tasks in the past, which is needed for recurring tasks that you forget to tick off on the day and don't want the schedule messed up. Looks like I'll be searching for a replacement.
Easy to use. I like that you can create your own project labels to keep track of individual project priorities.
Program works well, still some features I'd like to see at it though like location controls and things like that
Keeps me organized at home and on the go. I can share my tasks between my mobile and my PC. Love that I can share lists with others too.
But I can't find a way to disable receiving emails abot taskt. I only want to be notified on my phone.
It keep on remainding us via email.so we will not forget our work and finish it on time line
This is my first time using this kind of thing and its simple, but exactly what I need. My productivity has multiplied 10 fold!

I used it as a mobile endpoint for the desktop app (web) but now it is my main interaction point with todoist. Great app, well performing, comes with a great quick access widget and is intuitive and fast to use. 👍
Works well, but it takes some time to figure out all the features. Very useful app though, and great for separating your to do list into work, personal and other categories.
Excellent app. Keeps me from forgetting the millions of tasks I have to do each day.  It syncs seamlessly between my Android phone & my iPad. Gotta love that!
I'm a writer and researcher and this amazing app is now very much an important tool in my work - love it.
Very user friendly with reminder options.  My is synced to my email which then sycns to my computer and tablet so set up was very quick.
The app is good, but it's the Outlook integration that has really helped me stay on top of all the To Do's that flow into my daily work load.

Works great for managing multi-faceted admin work. Excellent way to create mini reminders for oneself or colleagues on the fly - equivalent to scheduling future post it notes. The filtering tool is indispensable. Wish there were more options in Premium for reviewing, sorting/filtering, and downloading completed tasks - would be useful as work reports.
And it really helps. Number of things getting done is increasing

The extensive capability of Outlook means that it is still a potent tool, and it's desktop capabilities are still very necessary for many of us. Create a Todoist desktop app that displaces my Outlook task manager and let's me create tasks, offline, for delayed sync, including my Outlook mailboxes, and you'll have a bases-loaded grand slam home run. (Amended response) Hi Doist, I have Todoist on my desktop with Outlook, yes but it's not an integrated experience. Does not work in an integrated manner with my calendar, and I cannot use my mail commands (flag and date) to ping to Todoist. I would love to know that I'm wrong as I want to go pro with you. IFTTT does not solve the problem. I have only been able to create 2 useful recipes and with Outlook for Android at that, plus they are cumbersome.

I have been using Todoist for the past 6 months as my sole task manager within my "modified" GTD system. Very streamlined and intuitive interface; yet with the capability of tracking sub tasks, recurring tasks, due dates and text reminders.
No more lost paper notes are wandering memos on the phone. And assigning tasks allows for a bit of collaboration.
Excellent cross-platform  usability - has become indispensable! Still using it after 3 years.
Why? This app was amazing until the last update. Why do my overdue tasks always have to be at the top now even when I click to see only the "today" or "next 7 days" tasks?
