I love Todoist, but what it needs and what is really important to me is that finished task should not disapear, the should be marked as finished and go to a seperate box of finished task asigned to the date. At the end of the day or a week, when doing my work report I cannot check what I have done, I have to write on a peace of paper the task before I thick it off. Only this way I can prove to myself looking at the done task at the end of the day how productive I and contemplate at the specific done task.

I use this in conjunction with planner for all those little things that I tend to forget but don't find important enough to write in my planner. I help run a few Facebook groups so in order to keep up with everything I would need two or three planners. I love this app for this purpose. I can label and group each item, time stamp or just keep it in my to do box. It also has an option to send an email but that's just a convenience. I seriously am in love with this app. I have so much more to write but it's :)

Ignore older reviews - this is one of the very best to-do apps - and largely because they keep making it better and better. The ability to type inline commands in the task title is superb and makes it so easy to create a task for what you want, when you want, with the formatting and labels that you want in a flash.  Agree with other comments that Karma points are arbitrary. Hey-Ho :-)

I am highly dependent on lists for productivity. I've used task software from free to enterprise-level, but still needed my daily paper post-its to stay on task...until now. Todoist has exactly the look and ease of my paper lists, with the added bonus of recurring items. Intuitive and syncs beautifully.

clean, simple to use, helpful, great widget. my only real complaint is that there is no way to make the sorting options permanent so that they automatically apply to new entries. I want to be able to add new tasks from the widget and have it sorted by priority without having to open the app.

Great tool to keep my ToDo.  Very fast and fluid interface.  Only concern I have is seeing a list of finished tasks and requiring a paid version to see that seems unreasonable.  My workaround to create a Finished list and manually move them.  Other than that very happy with the app.

Todoist is so easy to use.  No need to enter the task then chose a date from a pull down menu and then chose a time from another pull down menu  - time consuming and error prone. With this app you just enter a task such as: Take dog to the groomer Fri 3pm and the task is entered for Friday at 3pm.  Recurring tasks, alerts, ability to prioritize tasks and to organize by folder and sub-folders are all there in Todoist.  I truly have nothing negative to say about this super convenient and good looking app.

I've tried lots of different to-do apps, but I tend took come back to this one for its simplicity and ease of use. It takes me half the time to enter an item in todoist. It helps me stay organized. I only wish the pro accounts cost a bit less.

I have always used lists to keep track of my responsibilities and other items which need to remembered. It started with paper and pen and progressed to various apps on my smartphone. To-doist does everything I need and I have transferred all my lists into it. Thank you for creating such a useful app

I had been searching for perfect to-do app for me and this is it. There is one little bug at least on my Nexus 6p. When I try to add a task with a date following it first and then a label, sometimes the text got wrapped wrongly between the date and the label. I am unable to replicate this bug as of today. But yesterday I came across it. Anyway, love the app.

Time Reminders should really be free features though. Paying 40 dls a year for that feature is crazy considering I'm not a power user. Not having those available for free made me switch away after using it for a long time.

I use this for everything now instead of trying to keep track of paper lists for school, work, home, etc. It's FANTASTIC. I love how easy it is to organize and adjust items. I've only come across maybe one or two things it isn't able to do. I love that I can prioritize and color code everything. :)

So far so good, it is everything I needed it to be and then some. Excellent tech support as well, very timely response and helpful with an access issue I caused when I first signed up.  The add-in with Outlook is great.  You can easily turn emails into tasks.  Very flexible labeling, filters and easy search capabilities to find tasks.  I've set mine up to follow GTD (getting things done) philosophy.  Thanks for the great app!

All to do software and methods are a little make worky and clunky.  Thus one is simple and has ability to use tags,  projects etc.  Getting others to adopt was not easier than Asana,  Wunderlist or any of the others.  Overall very intuitive,  works well for me!

I very rarely purchase apps, and even less often do I sign up for subscriptions. I did however buy into this app as it helped me make big changes in my life, boosted my productivity through the roof. I love the quick commands, the seamless integration, and the feedback metrics.

Setting up your preferences is straight forward enough and initially I tended to think I wouldn't really benefit from a to-do list. I think I was of the opinion it was for office types who will always tell you there aren't enough hours in the day etc. I found over time however, it's extremely useful in terms of ensuring you take care of day to day things, no matter how simple or complicated. It sync's beautifully across all devices and I have upgraded to utilise all the features available. I have tried other highly recommended to-do app's but would say this is best of them for me. I love too, the sync with Google Calendar.
Has all the features required for the getting things done approach and the user interface is intuitive and fast. 100% recommended.

Still missing start date... after almost a year now. AI may be fine, but this less complicated thing would mean so much more to me: an uncluttered view, and seeing only what I need to see when I need to see it.
Really easy to use, keeps me organized and on top of things. Would love Google Calendar Integration
This sits in my Outlook email window so I just add emails for follow up to todoist where I can manage them better. It keeps my life in order.

Ok, this is the fourth edit. I tried to like it, but can't. This app won't tell you when a task is due without the 40 dollars a year fee!!  It is worthless to most if it won't remind you that you need to address something. In other words, no alarm when you wish to be reminded. The developers stripped one of the most important functions out. Oh well, it is pretty but see ya....
Best to do app on the market hands down. Truly helps me stay organized with my business tasks as well as my personal. One of those few things that really make life more manageable.
I use todoist for all of my personal and work related lists. I especially like being able to share them so easily.
Easy to add items on the fly. And helps remeber things you tend to forget after meetings or teleconference.

the interface is clean, but not compact. Subtasks are present, but a bit uncomfortable to work with (e. g.  duplicate in lists under some conditions), no simple inventory checklists for tasks such as shopping etc, no custom sort and grouping in smart lists. In general, good but not perfect.
Todoist is by far the best way I manage all my tasks, whereas I use Evernote as a reference system. A perfect combo for Getting Things Done.... Todoist Premium... Worth the money
I am enjoying using Todoist on Android. The interface makes lots of use of standard Android functionality and I can concentrate on my work.

I love this app, it motivates me to accomplish things and is a great way to keep track of tasks that need to be done in a simple but pretty format. I just wish I could tweet off of the app instead of just the website. Maybe I just haven't figured it how to yet.
Enjoyable to use and works pretty well, but while I will miss attaching files or commenting on tasks I'm not gonna pay for premium.
This app is complex and complicated in areas where that's completely unneeded (gimmicks),  while at the same time being underwhelming and uncustomizable in areas where you want depth.
Does everything I need. Superb integration with all devices. Good UI. Have tried others, some very expensive, but still prefer the ease of use of Todoist.
I previously used another app which stopped working. Force me to find a new app . Luckily I found this app and have been using ever since. Works great across all my platforms ..always in sync.

Solid app with a lot of useful features for collaboration. Wish there were smart features, like entering a phone number and having it queue up, but overall, love how it is available everywhere and easy to use
I used to use a diary, now everything is on my phone. Quick to add and edit.
Apart from many other good features, one good feature it has, which is not found in any other TODO Apps is, we can have any number of levels of tasks. Most other Apps ate limited to 2 or 3 levels
I have been needing this app for a decade now. Haven't even explored all features yet. Sharing lists with others makes it really relevant.
Great for categorising lists and reminding me of what I still need to do even if the scheduled day has passed. Wish it was easier to schedule task on specific day though.

It was just fine, why would you need to update it and make it worse?? Now I cannot set the date for the task from the widget. I have to add a task then go the app itself to set the date! Twice as mane actions than before! One more update like this and the app will be too much pain to handle!
Tried a bunch of these, this has some bells and whistles, but still easy to use
I had notifications turned off and still got a text at 4 a.m. that woke me up.  No thanks.
I enjoy using this app, it makes me feel like I'm actually doing things lol. The only reason it's not five stars is because of the lack of subtasks, but otherwise it is a superb app

No thank you, I just want an app to make shopping lists, to do lists and perhaps a reminder now and then. I don't need an app that wants access to accounts and I have to set up an account and log in to use.
For a guy who had constant trouble organizing minor chores, this has been extremely helpful. I'm simply way more organized with it. Thanks!
The app is very easy to use and easy to see all of the things you need to take care of.
I really needed to do list. This works great and can be accessed on my phone or at my computer. Easy to use.
Love the app, but can't find it in my budget to pay for it. Free version doesn't allow me to see finished tasks (activity log) so I'm gonna be on the lookout for a different app.

Hi Todoist, I like app but there is 1 MAJOR problem from a USEABILITY perspective. The App Notifications says 'you have 2 dues tasks today' - WHO CARES!! (this is irrelevant to me and doesn't create the urgency and focus I may need on the task I have created, I want to know WHAT TASKS!  ...i want to see 'Get Milk' 'Pick Up Cat from Vet' etc GIVE ME THE NAME OF MY TASKS!  otherwise I simply swipe the 'you have tasks' notification away and don't use the app. $44/yr for Reminders in a To-Do App?? Come on guys!

A great app with easy to use interface. Two features that i would really like the developers to introduce is having the start date of tasks with due dates and ability to put recurring tasks with back due date. Thanks
Sure 5star app. But i would like to have reverse list sorting.  New tasks to be added on top of the list not in the bottom.
It sends reminder next day through notification & also through mail,if u have not marked any pending task as done. This is d best part of it.
I've tried this and a couple other list management apps, and thus far, this one fits my style best.
I've tried a few others but always came back.
Syncs with pc and has good features. I had to reset my phone but recovered the list when I logged in to Todoist
Simple and beautiful interface. Not too irritating but gets the job done.

I'm a list loving SAHM and this app is great for it! I love the reminders, urgency levels and the price for pro. I don't use any of the sharing with others, but I'm sure it would be great for working a job!
My wife's already using wunderlist and inbox so I need to find how integrate with these two apps.
The UI is intuitive and the reminder system is very useful. This app helps me to be much more productive, I love it.
Useful for basic planning, too bad there is no calendar integration, no premium = not many features, slightly gameified which is cool but can also be counterproductive
Wasn't going to spend the money, until I realized I was going to spend this much on Task book in the store. This is great because it's always with me!

I have had premium and the free and I think the free is still fine but the premium just fine-tune it. I would like my projects to be always open though as that would make it quicker for me to add stuff as I'm going along.
To do list helps me to write down everything so that I don't have to worry about it anymore and organize it in projects or prioritize it, it's been awesome!

I've always been used to managing my workload. So when I retired this great little app helped me plan my daily activities and remind when essential jobs around the house needed my attention. It's easy to use and a great aid memoir.
Such a great way to manage my daily tasks. I can even assign individual tasks to my better half! Brilliant interface and syncs extremely well between all other devices.
So useful. You can have different lists for all your projects and schedule them. I tried a few list/organizer apps first and this is my favourite by far.
The entire suite of Todoist apps are brilliant. They work well on the platforms they are designed for and the features are just awesome.
Integration with the browser app plus features for sorting,  scheduling and categorizing tasks makes my life so much better
I like that Alexa can tell me what I have in my list for the day. Very helpful.

This is super useful for sorting out my rota shifts and house chores. I love that I can customise the repeat space between tasks and it's not set to default options only. Super useful app and never use a problem with it. I can sync it to my PC and phone so my partner can see it too.
I've tried many many productivity services over the years and this is the first time I can stick to one, because it's simple and does just what matters, rather than focus on fancy useless features
Extremely effective, great way to turn ideas and tasks into action plans, and out from my head so that I can conserve mental energy. Love Todoist!
Such a useful app. I download all my tasks here from my brain as soon as I think of them or am given them. Declutters my brain and makes me more productive and consistent.

I have tried several different task scheduling apps for Android, and Todoist is clearly the best. It has great flexibility in creating categories, and is easy and quick to use, even across my phone and tablet. Recommended!

The filtering, tagging, & priority flags make this a great tool for not only getting things done, but deciding what's truly important to devote energy to, depending on the time available (only 24 hours in a day, after all). Plus a great design & UI. Definitely worth the yearly subscription.
Very easy to use. I'm a stay at home dad and suffer with memory loss due to a moderate concussion. This app is a tremendous help in tracking my daily chores and tasks.
Great for many approaches to productivity inclusing GTD. Mobile app is fast, easy to use and syncs with desktop-generated data.

I really enjoy how the app is integrated between Google chrome and a native app, its interface is easy to use, but very powerful. I use this app for everything from grocery lists to homework assignments to extensive project checklists to goalsetting
Keeps me current on all my tasks. No more forgotten appointments and missed episodes of my favorite shows. Don't know what I'd do without it!
Now I don't have to have lots of lists written on numerous pads and can organise my work each day, achieving more of my deadlines.
Been using it for two years now. Helps me massively to organise my life. Thanks for the app, Todoist team!
This app has changed my 10 year old life, it has helped me remember things. Get this app

This app helps me get through business as well as everyday life. I love the color coding and the fact it reminds you every morning to check your list every morining. Its easy to use and os very helpful. I tried many to do apps, but this my favorite by far. Thumbs up🖒

nuf said. Over the years, I've used one app or another with projects, priority, contexts and so on, and it's real easy to navigate, add and generally maintain an accurate task list. I'm looking forward to going pro and also integrating with Toggl. Google now integration a big plus!
The best task app, well integrated into gmail as well.   Works smoothly, offers many options how to customize and manage your work, syncs through everything.
I'm learning the GTD method and have been using Todoist to implement my projects. So far it's working great!

Old design already needs so many taps to enter all into (at least two taps to change anything). Adding or editing a task with the new design is even bigger hassle, can't grasp all information about a task at a quick glance, then two or more taps is needed. Really consider switching if this is not being improved within the next week or two.

There is a significant battery drain in the latest version on Android 7 (16% of Nexus 6P battery in two hours in background). Seems to be related to another issue when the app can't reconnect to ToDoist servers if I start editing in a no-coverage zone. If I forget to force quit ToDoist, I have a completely drained battery by midday.

The basic version is quite good but they definitely hold back 80% of the functionality for the paid version. I am sorry but $40 Canadian per year is crazy for an app that literally just stores a database. I know they have to pay for servers and such but maybe at $5 per year I could justify it. Who knows, maybe the paid version is worth it but man that price is just too steep.

This app follows the age old advice that everything should be a simple as it can be but no simpler.  The stand out features are the most flexible recurring date types you can imagine and highly customizable widget to make one stop shopping for your task management.  This is the one To-do maker to rule them all.

There's a lot of things that sit unused if you don't buy the premium version. The Add Task option is nice but you could just as easily get that from Google Keep. I do really appreciate the Karma points to motivate me though. This is my first try of a to do list app so I don't have a lot to compare it to.

Sometimes after using it on the Google Chrome plugin plugin, I open it on the Android app to find the order of the tasks all completely randomised including sub tasks randomly assigned to other parents. It takes 10 to 30 minutes of my day to reorganize everything back into the correct order. It's so bad that I am now considering moving to another app.

I love the project design abilities in this app, and the language capabilities to plan your task due dates is very clean; however, selling reminders as a premium feature needs to change. It's too necessary of a to-do list ability, that there are plenty of work-arounds using other apps. The is definitely not a one-stop to-do list.

This is my first one of these sorts of programs, and it's been really good for me. It helps me organize and bring structure to my life. Great interface, easy to use, works well, no complaints. If I used other similar things maybe I could have more criticisms, but in the first place I'm a fan of only needing one app like this, and there's nothing more I need than this. So I give 5 star/ would recommend.

It's a highly polished to-do app: implements Material Design, supports Android Wear and notifications, syncs to the cloud, and has clients for a surprising number of platforms. The company responds promptly when I report issues. I even consider it a plus that their pricing model appears sustainable: they charge a reasonable annual amount for labels and filters, which serious users will want. That said, there are some rough edges, and Todoist just gives you building blocks. If you're here to do GTD, you may find it challenging to define projects, labels, and filters that make sense for you.

This app is very well built and would very easily suit all of my purposes if i were just looking to use my phone. What this application needs is the ability to not just set reminders on your android wear but also view them and mark them as complete. If im at work and i dont have my phone on me i still want to be able to knoe what i need to do next.

I've installed numerous to-do apps and this one is by far the best one. It is very customizable when setting dates for reoccurring events. The only drawback is when you have a certain task that needs to be completed multiple times during the day. For instance, if you want to add "brush teeth" for twice a day, you would need to add TWO tasks as opposed to adding ONE task that needs to be checked twice during the day.

I've tried many of the other to-do list apps for the sake of productivity. The feature that always steered me away from the (free version of) Todoist is that it doesn't allow for push notifications... But those never helped me, the fact that I can have the Todoist app on my phone, as well as both of my computer's is what makes me enjoy it so much more. I'm glad I'm using it now

I loved Things on IOS and Mac. But Apple has overcharged me too many times and I've moved to more open and robust technologies. Todoist has features that triumph over Things for GTD. But I want to control when my tasks appear and their due dates separately. If I have something due long from today,  but I want to see it in case I have time to do it,  I either set a fake due date,  which is dangerous,  or review a query far into the future. Part of GTD is not processing more than once, and this makes it many.

My girlfriend recommended ToDoist because I've struggled with organization and time management for years. I've found that it's simple to use and it has improved my productivity significantly. I like the Gmail extension so I can easily create tasks from emails, and the Chrome extension that allows me to create tasks from web pages. It's pretty amazing.

Just making small goals for every day has made me so much more productive. The feeling of checking everything off at the end of the day is great! This app is easy to use and gives you just enough reminders to make sure you get things done without being really annoying about it. Highly recommended

Felt so much in love with the free version that i could not stop talking about it all the time. Fortunately, my dearest friend gifted to me the premium version. It is totally worth it! Now I can see my completed items. Love the Gamification technique, karma. Download todoist today and, "karma kiye jaa phal ki ichcha mat kar"!

Makes it easy to break down and organize your tasks,  stay on top of them, and become more productive.  Seamlessly syncs across multiple platforms, and is integrated into all the devices and applications you use most.  Great app.

I highly recommend this task management app. Have already asked my two overseas clients to start using it. The only problem is there is no active way of keeping track of your completed tasks. This feature must be incorporated for those who want it.

This is a new review -  Recently, I've become a convert of David Allen's Getting Things Done. However, Allen himself does not go to great lengths as to which digital system to to use. That's where Todoist comes in and it handles beautifully. In the past, I used todoist just like any other to do app and it was awesome. Crisp, clean, and simple. Guess what? It packs a hell of a lot more making it the best out there. You can make it your own and own your day! Just get it.

This app is unable to run stand alone on my phone without a login. There is no reason a to do list should have mandatory login. Give me the to do list. Then have an OPTION to log in and sync across platforms. That way you are providing the app that you advertise and letting the users select the OPTION to use your features, or not.

Does what it states simply put. They have apps for pretty much every platform along with a web application. The integrations are a huge bonus too. All together though it's the perfect app for someone who lives an agile lifestyle with lots of tasks that need to be done just in time. It's also wonderful for group and team projects as you can collaborate on lists as well. I've used it with everything from school/work projects, to managing a distributed grocery and chore list for my household.

Each task takes too much real estate on the screen; too many notifications - both app popups and also emails and I can't find out if that is customizable to reduce or say stop emails. Little info on website for users; no simple comparison chart to see if premium addresses any of these issues. Lovely looking but these small things end up being very annoying. Would pay for a better customization set.

A really nice and fun application to organize your stuff but the problem is that its very poor before upgrade, you can barely try some options. Finally, would like it to be updated and open more than one account at the same time.

I have tried a lot of productivity apps out there. I keep on coming back to todoist any time I try something new. The design is clean, keyboard shortcuts make it super easy to add and change tasks and collaboration is simple. The only thing todoist lacks is a dark theme.
I particularly enjoy being able to sort things into projects, tasks and sub-tasks, it's really helpful if you're busy with more than one thing at a time.

After having tried many to-do apps (none of which I was able to use in my routine), I found Todoist to be ny go-to to-do app. I upgraded to premium from day 1! The projects, labels and filters are just what I need.  The only thing I'd like to see added is the ability to add attachments from the mobile app as well.

I tried almost every task-related app on play store. I have been using other apps until recently, I just started using this app again and I was really impressed with what they have achieved, it seems this was created for Ocd people like me who must have everything written down completely organised. Loved it !!

I use the app as an aide-memoire, being a bit forgetful. Nice layout and easy to navigate. One small point: it doesn't seem to sort items in date order automatically - unless I've missed something somewhere.

stuff like labels and all would be awesome but that comes with premium; which is wayy too expensive. I've never seen an app demand that amount from a customer before (something like 28$) but other than that, this is so good for managing things and I definitely recommend downloading it !
I find it hard to believe that such a basic function like getting notifications isn't on the free version
Few things I would improve on but overall a great app.  Its cross platform integration is brilliant.  It works smoothly and brings focus.

I'm not going to pay them $2.50 a month FOREVER just to have "premium" features which are basic necessities for a to-do list. If it were one reasonable price I would definitely buy this product to unlock all it's features, but I'm not subscribing to it. There are too many suitable free options out there.

Fantastic app, it's my todo app for many things in life. From groceries, to small private projects, places to visit, organize my daily tasks, or my work.   And the features that it has here and there, add up to a great tool that improves my day and keeps reminding me not to procrastinate.

This is slicker than similar apps I have tried and I feel I have been rewarded for sticking with it. Could use a calendar and that would really round it off. However, its narrow focus is a plus because it is excellent at task organisation.

I like this app overall but am really annoyed with the lack of space-economy in the big widget. In Todoist i can see only one or two items whereas with Wunderlist I see 5 items in the same widget size. Overall, the app is well thought-out and a boon to my organizational efficiency.

This application has helped me get organized,  I used it for everything from reminders for recurring household activities, to groceries, to work related to-do, never missed anything ever since I started using Todoist. Give it a try, you won't regret it!!
Tries way too hard to push premium onto new users. I want to try it out first

I use it all day to help get things done.  Group all of your life's categories, prioritize your "Must Dos!" Go over your "never dos".  Great app for "doers" who get stuff done. Only annoying thing is for me it tries to put dates on tasks.  Not really into that whole date thing but maybe some live and die by it.
I've tried to-do apps across all platforms and with a whole load of approaches to organisation of tasks, but Todoist has been the one that's really stuck with me the easiest.

I have used to do lists in the past but for some reason never found them as helpful as this. I can check my lists wherever I am and it's really easy to use. I got more done in my first week of using todoist than I had all year!
helps me stay on top of tasks plus it synchs perfectly across multiple devices and online.. would def recomend to anyone
I like that I can make a backlog of to do items sorted by project. Once a week I triage my backlog and schedule items to be done during the week. Would love Google assistant integration.

Pretty much all the good stuff requires payment.  That's understandable, I just wish there was a way to disable those options.  I got this app because I have memory problems, and having to exit out of the buying options of a feature I forgot wasn't free gets quite annoying after the 300th time.

This is the only to-do app that I've stuck with for any length of time. There's enough functionality in the free version to make me want to pay the upgrade just out of sheer appreciation. The ability to use the html version when at my desktop makes it seemless. I just wish the upgrade was a bit cheaper.

I love this app. It's really simple to use and coordinate with my family. I'm only giving 3 Stars though because if I want more options I would have to pay for a renewing membership. If it was just a 1 time fee to unlock all the additional options I would pay it but I can't justify paying every year. Also there is no option to make a task renew everyday. Ex: unload dishwasher. I have to manually input it everyday into my family's chores list.

I like it. Interface, usefulness, etc. But... I believe you should be able to view your own history of tasks. After all, this is not an added value by the app. It's just the list of tasks you did. Other things I'm ok with being behind a pay wall, but not this one. Would probably rate 5 stars if such "features" would be available to everyone.

I tried a lot of todo list. Watodo!, mylifeorganized, ultimate todo, 2do. Although I need to pay yearly for this productivity is such a big thing that I took a one year experiment. Todoist can be so flexible for gtd folks, and you can practically take notes on this. The filters allow you to tag place, people, duration context well and custom filters enables u to create magic. Edit: they actually listen to good ideas.i suggested that the comment section can be expanded and they did it

Thought there was something better out there so deleted this app and tried numerous other ones-BIG mistake! Easy to use, very user friendly and above all... Very motivating. I especially like the little messages I get once all my tasks for the day are finished lol.  Love this app and I'm here to stay :-) Thank you app team for helping me keep my life on track 🤗

The synchronization across different platforms is the best I've ever seen. Very powerful hidden features. The thing I would like to see most is to be able to quickly set location reminders with natural language processing like you can with dates.

I digress). This app rocks with multiple STABLE widgets on different screens for different projects and SUBTASKS multiple hierarchical levels! Great customer service too! Todoist combined with an online calendar is the perfect combination for me; if a professor sets a deadline at a specific time, I can enter that in Todoist and have it remind me, and I can type notes for tasks and attach things to them. Synchronization, even offline, just works. They have an app for just about every platform. They have automation capability with IFTTT. Worth every penny of the $30 subscription for pro.

Love this app especially the smart reading of typed text that sets dates, project names, etc. When using the widget to enter a new task although it seemingly recognizes the smart text entered it does not carry over to the actual app. Once this is fixed, 5 stars and will probably subscribe to premium.  Nice work todoist team.

The app works like I feel like it should. For example, you can create a project and assign tasks to it, and those tasks will show up on your "to do" list along with tasks that have no particular project. Basic stuff like that seems to be lacking in so many other products!
App just keeps getting better. A year ago there were a few things this app didn't do well, but most minor irritations have now been addressed. I don't buy may apps but this one is worth paying for.

My life lives in todoist and I'm a massive fan but it appears with android 6.0 there are some battery issues. This swallows a quarter of my battery each day currently.. Please fix this soon so I can carry on enjoying it!

As a person with many voluntary roles, a full time college student and have many other commitments (orchestra rehearsals, work etc.) this is exactly what I needed to help me keep track of things I need to get done. Thanks to this app, I will never forget to attend another training session, another assignment I need to complete or even what I need to get from the shops. Love it!!

This is the one! I've pretty much tried every task manager that's been out there but this is by far the best thing out there. Here are the highlights: APP SUPPORT:  Todoist supports EVERYTHING. I have a Mac, a PC, an android phone and an iPad and there are apps for all of them. And in the end up mostly using the web app because it's so good.  EASE OF ADDING TODOS:  You can add todos from anywhere, hotkey from any app in mac, the notifications screen in android, typing q in the web app, forwarding an email.  NATURAL LANGUAGE DATES/PROJECTS:  Todoist is even better than RTM. You can type, "Send weekly update every week on Friday #Work @office" and it will create a todo recurring every Friday in your Work list tagged with "office". Other apps force you to go to menus, drag things to the list you want and all sorts of horribleness. (I'm looking at you Wunderlist)  ADVANCED FEATURES: Too many to name. My faves: Set a time on a todo and it texts you a reminder, Space for project notes, unlimited comments on todos, photos added to todos, custom filters (Like todos for all my work projects due today).  Stop looking. Just get this.
Tasks are easy to create and I never have worry about something getting missed. I started using this for school and now it is the only task program I use for everything.

I'm a hyper organized person. I've tried MANY list apps and this is by far my favorite, I've been using it daily for over 6 months. It's key lists can be color coded, and can be promoted or demoted.  all tasks can be prioritized on a scale of four (High medium low none) so I can use the Eisenhower decision matrix ( Google it. Life changing ). And I love that you can type in the commands along with the task name and it's coded in - for which list, what priority, when it's due, and any tags. Just the best!
I have been using Android since it came out, and this is the first application I have reviewed.  It's that good.
My #1 organizer app. I use it for everything. Nothing else helps me keep track of my life quite like it.
Easy to use once you get the Todoist mind set. There are some more useful functions on the Premium version but i am not well enough into it yet to commit.

Paid features are always show in UI  not able to hide. Projects without description. If UI would be simplier as Google keep would be better. Fonts/ratio big, no compact view, widget no resizeble to two columns

I use Todoist daily to keep track of what I need to do, and what I've already accomplished. Karma is a fun way to help motivate...I don't actively work toward higher levels, but I do get a little thrill when the advancement notifications show up.

User interface is not ideal but very complicated. There are too many steps involved with every task you wish to add. I wasted so much time trying to enter in tasks that it took away from the time I could actually accomplish them in.
Interface is easy to use, pretty customizable, and free of clutter. Also, can be used across devices, which has been super useful so far.

I use Google Calendar. This app only syncs to Caleder once a day. Major problem as you can imagine. . Other than that it is a great program. No other issues. I have recommended this to my friends and family.
Todoist works well for me for reminders, shopping lists and to-do lists.  I love the integration with IFTTT.  I get pretty busy and the todoist widget on my phone helps me keep organized.

I have enjoyed using todoist for work, i find myself getting more done in a day, unfortunately the location based notifications are not working for me but hopefully that will be fixed soon        but overall i think its a great program and I'd recommend it
Its great. I got the paid version and if you stick to it then it will help you alot. Features are good, cross platform support is awesone.

I am someone who genuinely forgets things. Todolist is like a true companion who keeps gently reminding. I really find the tool useful to keep me on track. I feel so much better when I finish the task and by swiping it off the to do list.
I like that this app can make tasks as simple or as complicated as you want it to be. Simple to do list or multilevel projects are possible.
I am obessed with this app. I'm a huge list maker but this let's me organize them and set priorities and reminders. Best app for the scheduling challenged
Simple to use and as complex as it needs to be... Not to mention I love that it notifies me each morning that I have stuff to do on my list

This is the best to do app I've tried. It's very user friendly, efficient and intuitive and actually helps me get stuff done!

Very solid app and online  program. It helps me to get the cluttered thoughts and events from my brain to an organized and easily-accessible system that is user-friendly. I'm still learning the best ways to use it.

Literally used to be so disorganized but this app as well as the chrome extension for it have really helped me change. It relieves a lot of stress to be able to look in one place for all things school and work. Also, premium is seriously worth it.
I find it very useful and helpful for school and else. The only thing i wish the app allowed me to do is to edit the project title. I have to do that off my desktop.
Synch well across all platforms. Easy to use. Great productivity tool. A bit pricey.
I'm trying to use this great app more to save my time and prevent to waste paper ad much as possible
I can keep all of my to-do lists in one place, including shopping lists. Simple, useful, rarely crashes. I couldn't ask for more.
I like seeing the simple display of tasks i need to do in different categories such as Work or Shopping. So when i go to work i know all the tasks i need to finish there. Overall pretty helpful app.
I do enjoy having it, but there's definitely room for another app with an easier UI to be developed, but for now I can manage.

Seems to be really good. Losses one start since prohibitively expensive recurring annual subscription to get the features I need, especially if I'll get it for my whole team. Losses a second point for placing the paid options all over the app in a way that distracts productivity. Other apps to which I upgraded and have most of the features I need have a free version that is functional without distraction so I could use it and put it in my normal workflow before I upgrade, had an option for a non recurring one time price with a negligible annual fee for online sync which is understandable, and their one time price is less expensive than a one year subscription here. I understand these are different marketing strategies. I'll stick with the ones I use for the moment.

Já tinha tentado várias opçōes. Como o Todoist é muito simples e minimalista, nele só permanencem as funções realmente importantes e isso é fantástico. Depois de passar por mais de 10 apps pra me ajudar com a produtividade, acho que eu finalmente encontrei.

It syncs very well between multiple devices, is doddle to use and has a very clean interface. The premium version isn't the cheapest, but is worth the cost in my view and I especially like the ability to attach files to tasks. I would love to be able to attach notes from Evernote, there are workarounds but that feature would be the icing on the cake.

I was so happy to find this app.  Since I gave up my Franklin Planner for electronic media years ago, I have really struggled to find a system that was as integrated and holistic as the FP.  I like Todoist because it syncs across both Windows 10 and Android.  That is important.  There is an Outlook extension that becomes an integral part of my desktop Outlook app.  That is super important.  Even the Web app is great.  It all just works. Beautifully.

It helps me stay up-to date with all my things to do. Love the easy user friendly UI and also the reminders.  I can easily divide stuff into various projects and keep track of them.  Would highly recommend it for anyone who wants to stay on top of their daily activities

I can never seem to get my thoughts together and I always forget what I need to do. To-doist takes care of that for me. Unlike other to-do apps I've tried, To-doist also makes the initiative of providing orginizariom of my thoughts and tasks as well as writing them down. Even if I don't have premium service, it still works rather efficiently

I was very keen to try this service now that it has arrived on android. And while the app is very well designed, a premium subscription is essentially needed for full functionality, and this does not come cheap. This, combined with the lack of any widget or cross- app sharing, makes this product nothing but a decent starting point.

Clean design, easy to use, convenient across platforms (web, Android, Mac, Windows, etc).  I love the prioritization feature and the non complicated design.  I also enjoy literally swiping items off my list rather than clicking a box that checks them off. It's a rewarding feeling when the item is completed. Great job.

Tested the free Todoist a few times before, but never found it intuitive, nor did I like the design, plus it's expensive. Now I tested the premium version to see if things are better there. Notifications for the newly created tasks stopped after a day. I realised that I couldn't remember whether the date I set was the due date or the reminder date. To test it, I tried to create a task without a due date, but with daily notifications. I couldn't and it wasn't clear either whether the task was created at all.

There are a number of things that I love about this app; natural language input, colour coding projects, nested projects, nested tasks, repeating tasks, comments on projects and tasks, beautifully clean interface that's as colourful or dull as you like, cross-platform support. The only thing lacking is the Wear app. Still, worth the sub if you want to go pro.

App is very helpful in a time crushed world. The lists and reminders have helped keep the daily  schedule on track and ensures that tasks are actions consistently. The other curious result is that I have put away all the diaries and calenders and work lists that I have usually carried with me as the app allows her to cover all those tools.

I tried this out just because I could link it to my Amazon Echo todo list via IFTTT.  It has very quickly become my primary todo list for work and home. Easy to use interface, works on every device, plus I can easily share projects and tasks with my wife to keep household activities flowing smoothly. Only negative is the price is a little steep for the premium version considering all the other free apps out there.

I am by no means a power user if this tool yet but so far it has been very effective without fail. I wish it would integrate with Google calendar. Also would like the ability for other co workers to login or create administrative rolls for my executive administrator. So far I like this app and will be using it as a go to tool. Give it a try you can't go wrong.

It would be great to be able to click a task that was added from an email in Gmail and have it open the email in the Gmail app, or at least open up correctly via Chrome. Instead it tries to open in Chrome but says, "Temporary Error (404) We’re sorry, but your Gmail account is temporarily unavailable." Everything else is great though.

I've been using todoist for 1 year+. I am in nursing school and have two jobs. My wife lives 100 miles away. Busy is the word. Todoist is great because relying on short term memory is a bad decision. It helps me kill procrastination. It is easy to use. It sends me an email every morning and it's usually the first thing I look at. Thanks, todoist.

It's quick, easy and intuitive to use, it really works and it has Android Wear support. Everything I want and need in one package but $44.99 per year is just too expensive for the features I need (I only really need one or two or the premium features). Please Todoist folks, consider an in between paid plan for personal users - say AU$20 per year.

Seriously, I love checklists, cause I'm really good at forgetting things, but having this portable to do list has been a life saver. I'm one of those people with a super busy schedule and no mind to remember, this app helps me organize everything. I have not been late to any events or forgotten anything at the grocery store etc. since I downloaded it, 10/10 would use again! (or in this case 5/5)

Such a brilliant tool when it comes to daily productivity. I now get things done and I don't forget anything with the nice notifications. Its simple and clear to use with a great user interface. The ability to set your daily, weekly or even project tasks or lists is great. Its certainly changed how I live on a daily basis and now I wonder how someone can live without it. It makes a grand difference to jotting down on paper, notepad or worse keeping it all on your mind.

Tried it for over a year but the lack of a calendar view makes it very hard to manage tasks. Devs refuse to consider adding it, even after multiple customers ask for it in their forums. Using Ticktick now which has pretty much all Todoist features + calendar view and its cheaper.

Really great app, love the karma and statistics; the sharing and setting number of goals per day/week. -- most functions however require a premium which I think is a little high for this sort of software. A one off price would be better, or lower the subscription fee. -- I do like the absence of adds in the free version :)  definitely an app I'll keep using for my weekly tasks.

Todoist is everything you need from a to do application. The natural language parsing means you don't need to learn how to schedule things, etc. and allows you to add tasks very quickly. This combined with a stunning, intuitive interface and cross-platform availability and you have everything you could ever want from a productivity app

It meets all I wanted from Any.Do and Keep combined! (Specifically the ability to collect all tasks and quickly draft out today's plan in chronological order) Not to say better than those that I gave up like Wunderlist. Cannot replace Google calendar yet as it does not support start time + end time. Don't assist long-term planning also.

This is very helpful for assigning tasks in a small group like a family or small business. Entry is a little time consuming and it isn't as intuitive as I hoped but it's good. I've found most every feature I looked for so far and i would definitely recommend this app.

The software does what it promises to do, nothing more, nothing less (it is a welcome change from some of the over-promised apps I have downloaded) ... It performs smoothly, does not get in the way, does not seem to consume phone resource and syncs nicely with the free Chrome add on... Enjoying it.

I love this app!  It is so great for keeping all the things I need to do organized and easily visible on my phone.  It has a great widget for my home screen, and I can pick how big it is.  It's so easy to add my own projects and different tasks within.  My only complaint so far is that if I accidentally mark something as complete, I can't undo it.  Fix this, and it would be 5 stars!

I love this app! I keep track of work tasks and personal tasks. Everything I need to remember is easily jotted down to free my mind for other things. I even be keep my grocery list and songs to download here. I can view completed tasks to help with monthly and annual  performance reviews. Easy to categorize and prioritize.

Can't complain, like how easy it understands due dates. Would like to created linked items this then that, then that.. So I can create a sequence of tasks that only show up 'today' once the previous task is complete

Works across platforms so you can access it easily from your phone,  tablet, home or work PC. I find the options to label and group tasks really useful, like a cut down MS Project. If you like lists and getting things done,  this app is for you.

If it weren't for the limitations of the free version, this would have been my primary to-do app. In short, this app has managed to keep UI and functionality balanced without compromising on either - something the  Wunderlist app has not managed to do in my opinion.   NOTE (to Devs): The already available options for start page are quite good. I felt that one more option to display all projects could have been added.

All my excuses for being unorganized or forgetting things have been totally blown away by this very handy application. What really blows me away is being able to link in other people into a shared project. Business and personal activities can be controlled all in one place and easily separated.

I do tomatoes, follow GTD and keep inbox zero and totally digital calendars. For a long time teux deux did the trick for me--no frills, simple daily lists. But my husband and I wanted to share grocery lists, and lists of fun things to do. Google docs and evernotr felt like overkill for such a simple task. I noticed todoist was integrated with IFTTT so I tried it out, and we've both been hooked for a year. Win!
Now I can be sure that I don't drop balls. This program is easy to use and integrates seamlessly across platforms.

When compared to others, Todoist is the easiest to use. It is straight forward, you don't need tutorials or watch videos to learn how to use it. My favorite feature is the ability to set up Reminders for each task.

I downloaded this app with high hopes. I decided to try it out like you do with any new app. I went into "shopping" and I added "buy milk". So it added "buy milk" to the list. I then tapped the reminder icon and was immediately asked to upgrade to premium for $28.99 for 1 year. Seriously? I can't even do simple reminders without paying? Why is this listed under free? It's really not. Needless to say it will be deleted.
Pretty good app. Problems withsync. On PC all dates are good but on Android they show as +1 day. Every today task on PC appears as task for tomorrow on Android.
Sometimes we need too fix a time for things to get done, so ready entering of date and time is a plus for me.

Great app I have been using for less than a week and it's changing my life. I am getting so much done! It's just a shame so much functionality is lost behind a pay wall, I just don't have that kind of money as a student.

The UI to choose a date for a task does not seem to allow choosing a month different from the current one. Also, I can't seem to find a way to submit feedback from within the app. So I had to do it here.

Just wanted something simple to keep on top of things and this fulfills that need. Only suggestion is that instead of just check marks to show a task is complete, I would like to see something to indicate that a task, though not complete, is in the process.
Very good app and happy with it. I wish the scheduling of different day and time was more intuitive, but it is fine once you get the hang of it.

Very useful if you want a simple task organizer. Love the ability to throw it on a screen as a widget. Have to pay to unlock many features, but for what I get out of the free version it is plenty for me.
Spams you with emails and doesn't let you set a to-do with no specific date. EDIT: Can be changed in settings it turns out, thanks devs

The app will not make you more productive, only you can do that, but todoist is great for organizing yourself and keeping track of your pending items as well as keeping them up to date across platforms.
Very good app, lots of devices, missing sorting options for tasks and home page (sort by date then by priority for example). Would consider premium by a bit expensive

My work load has been ever increasing and having to manage and follow up delegated tasks had started to become quite messy. I tried the free version and upgraded in less than 24hrs. It's been a great way to keep on top of different projects and stopping things slip through the cracks. Definitely recommend it, good bang for your buck.
It allows you to build lists and projects with no fluff but it's not boring. It also rewards you for completing tasks. Which is cool.
A must have app for managing your day..easy to use and loaded with functionality and available on many platforms.
I never review apps but this one deserves it. The design really is distraction free and it is easy to form a habit of using it. Amazing.
Great app. Very simple UI. The date recognition in the tasks is perfect. The windows and browser based apps are just as good, if not better. Now I just need to get my company to pay for premium...
I liked this app but suddenly, I can't log in with Google. It keeps saying "there's an error occurred please try again later." And it's been 3 days from now.
Great app and would highly recommend upgrading. Takes getting things done with to do lists to a whole new level
This app works really well. It allows tasks to be grouped and organized in various ways, but is also easy to use.

I like the program and I think it is helping me to stop procrastinating and get things done!   The karma could be a little better if the points were based on how many tasks were added and completed undated of just a number for tasks being completed or added during the time between checks. I would also like to see a timer within the program and the addition of karma points for close estimates on the time to actually complete the task versus the estimated time. The sync across platforms works wonderfully!
Most of it is OK but the Android home screen widget is butt ugly and wastes screen real estate. Only two (2) items are visible in a 2x3 widget! I have pixels, I want to use them!

I'm still a relative Newbie but the program works better every day. Most of the issues I encounter are probably Operator Error. There could, perhaps, be better integration with other programs BUT they seem to be working on that constantly!

They send me emails several times a day. If any of my to-do items reference a day or date it comes back as a text message to me which I guess is okay for some people but I'd really like to be able to turn that off. I just want a to-do list that synchronizes over all of my devices which this app does without all the spam. I would like them to add the ability to dumb to the app down.  I get the feeling that they would like their users to be a group of people collaborating on some project.
I have been looking for a complimentary online task manager for a while. This one is closest to my ideal so far.
Im really enjoying the app, its easy to use, straight to the point and it helps me to remember all those small but big things.

Runs well, I especially like the multiple subtask option. The widget could use a way to open the application for editing "parents", though. I get the no notifications unless you pay, too, but it still kinda sucks a little.
I'm a very unorganized person, but it helps me see everything I need to get done and do it
I've adopted ToDoist to help me manage actions across all of my stores. This is a great communication tool.
Great app reminds me all the time. My problem is my own discipline.

Adding new task window objects are huge! and it's not easy to interact on Nexus 6. Requires more UX for new task window; make fields and titles more minimized in two column. AND ALSO PLEASE have a look to Android N, Widget is not stable.
This is my go-to place for every task, both business and personal. I have used Wunderlist and Asana extensively previously and this seems to be the best tool for my situation.
This is the best Todo list and planner I have ever seen. Clean, usable interface, coordination through all devices.
Todoist is an integral part of my life.  Use it every day, couldn't get by without it. Helps keep me focused and motivated.
When I first started with todoist I wasn't getting the most out of it. I watched a series of YouTube videos and learned a lot. Now I know how, I am so much more organized.
Liking it more and more as I get used to using it. As I make it a habit to use.
App asks for upgrading it but according to me, you should provide more features in free version such as reminder. Thanks
Functional and minimalist UI, ease of access on multiple devices. Auto converts your time/date text input to one that the the system recognises and remembers it.
I love this app, it is good for work and home. I can add to the list so easily in the middle of the night when I think of something. Everyone should use this.
This app,  and it's numericaly conceptualized productivity 'Karma,' has helped me quantify what I have accomplished. It leaves me seeking new things to do!
At first it was a novelty, now it's essential that I put all my stuff to do in Todoist or it don't get done.
I plan on buying the full version. So far it is great for tasks. Though I would like to see calendar ability for 'repeat' tasks.

Nothing is intuitive about this app. I still can't figure out how to add more than one task to a day. Not to mention you have to type out the day you want to add the task to. Not user friendly at all.
Just don't put every little thing on your todo list or you'll start ignoring the notifications!
I'm using this one to keep track of all the little things and it's doing a great job.

Some other apps I've tried either don't have a desktop option that syncs to my phone, or is too complicated to add the projects and labels that I really want. This app makes it easy for me to categorize my info while still having quick access to it all. ☺
When you dont want to keep everything just in your mind or write lot of drafts on papers that can be easily lost...its a great opportunity...just a pity that notes and reminders are only premium :)

I've tried a lot of productivity methods and apps but this is the one. Todoist premium is intuitive, easy to use and so effective in its simplicity. I love it. I felt like I was drowning before being so overextended and now I'm still overextended but I feel much more in control.
This is an excellent app for saving time, organizing, and not missing any appointments or important calls. A definite benefit to productivity!
This app is super easy to manage and navigate through, I'm super busy so I needed something like this to keep me in order
my only complaint with this is having to specify the parent of a task every time, which makes it annoying to make long lists
Cant set recurring event start time, really not convenient to type recurrings, Id better pick some
I use this all the time for reminders and lists - it's like a replacement memory.
The app doesn't let me forget about things that I enter. It holds me accountable for the things I say I need to do
This app changed the way I organise my life and has made me far more productive. I have never paid for an app before but I thought todoist was well worth it. Truly fantastic.

I've tried pretty much every to do app there is and this one really is the best. Very flexible and functional, with great support too.

I find this app particularly helpful as a tool to remember what I wanted to get done. In my fast-paced life what is important to do can get lost in all the pressures of every day tasks. This app helps by providing an easy way to record a task you want to remember and reminders of the tasks you set a specific date for.

I tried other to do list apps, I even went old school with paper and pen but nothing helped.  Todoist came along and blew me away.  I love the simple user face and I love that there's so much more behind that interface to help me get through my day.

I hardly there ever review apps. But this has literally changed the way I work and live. There are so many features, but my favorite is emailing to add a task. The integration between devices is seamless. If you've been looking for a way to better manage work and to do lists this is your answer. The premium version is totally worth the annual fee.

Amazing app, looks a lot better than the last to do list widget I was using. The only thing I think could be improved is that lack of customization. Several of my other widgets are transparent or partially transparent. So this sort of ruins the the theme of my pages (However, features like this aren't necessary, just icing on the cake). Additionally, bring able to change the text to different colors and/to to send degree of transparency separately from the background would be cool too.

My needs are simple, so this app does just what I need. It syncs up with my work computer to keep me on top of the many projects I have going at once and I take it everywhere with me (on my phone) so when I think of something I need to get done i just jot it down on the app. This is especially useful for someone whose time is as divided as mine (and whose mind might be getting a little to old to keep up with it all without the app).

Though I have retired, I have many things to accomplish. Todoist frees me from the daily grind of updating status at the desk, and helps me capture ideas on the run. Would like two features added : Some tasks are for a specific time, like a meeting. Would be nice to be able to set time duration.  And when I complete a task, there is often a follow up task that emerges. Would be nice to press follow up button to 'string -on' the follow on task.

The best free task management tool you can ever lay your hands on.. make your mornings worry free with this.. add dates and days to tasks by just typing it into the tasks.. every morning right before you start for office get the list of things to do. Make personal and office works very efficiently...

Having tried all the options, Todoist is imperfect like the rest, but about as good as it gets! Good for making hierarchical structured tasks, and breaking them up to accomplish them. A few more options for customisation and granular control would go a long way, but the advantage is that everything feels very quick and natural compared to other apps.

The app is more restricted than I remember. I can't add any comments to a task, I can only add text to the task itself. It would be nice if there was a free version of the app, without all the features we can't use. I'm debating if I should continue to use it or try another app that works across Android and Windows.

I'm just starting to get the hang of this app, so far it's wonderful. I'm trying to use it to organize my life and so far it's been helpful; but I've noticed there's no way to organize tasks in ascending order so that the newest tasks are at the top. It would be awesome to be able to use the widget  that way, so my latest highest priority tasks came in that order. Maybe I'm missing something? Either way I hope your app helps me make a difference in my life.
Quite simply I can't remember my life before todoist and yet I've only been using it for a few weeks. Perfect hassle free way to get stuff done. Brilliant. Pair it with IFTTT for power power power

Simplistic design helps me focus on what's important - the task. Adding new tasks is easy, especially with conversational inputs. Categorization tools allow me to maintain balance between work and life since I can assign to Projects and only see the tasks I want at any given time. Smitten.

This has improved my productivity quite a bit. When I originally wrote this there wasn't a no due date button in the app, and now there is, so I've changed my rating. One feature I would like is being able to import / export project templates as .CSV files in the app. Other than that this app is great!

Wow! I didn't expect a simple application with a very easy user interface can help me manage my time so well to the point where I get many things done daily on my summer holiday! The fact that I can easily manage time is enough to give a 5 star rating. And if there was a sixth star , I would have given it! Like seriously the developers deserve a well earned *pat on the back*  😊

I use this at work and at home and it makes remembering all the things i have to do so much easier. The thing that sets it above other apps for me is the repeat options. I can type 'every thurs' or 'next fri' or even 'fortnightly starting tue' and it understands me. So simple
The scary part is how work I have outstanding.  Simple to use and helps me stay focused on the important stuff

I once thought that I had experienced all of the highs & lows that this life had to offer, that is until the day fate led me to this App. Once download I felt I had reached the kind of organisational enlightenment most only dream of achieving in this modern world.. I find that I am now more at peace with myself knowing that this little App will not only retain in it's memory but also remind of the tasks I must perform that my own mind had long since forgotten.. Thank you Devs for making my life so complete.

Been using all day for several years & will continue to unless something obviously better comes along. Getting better - last major update was a big step. Still far from perfect for me but with work arounds it gets the job done.

This is the best to do list I have used. It just reminds you daily what you've given yourself to do, or missed and isn't full of alerts every hour. It perfectly reminds you, without being overtly intrusive.
Dont think too much. just note it on Todoist  to forgot  and to ensure keep  tracking it till completion. Don't waste paper too.
Favourite to do app I've used so far. Powerful but easy to use. I like the way it rewards you for getting things done too.

Use this app not only to manage my own and my team but aslo my whole life, its integrations are just perfect, syncronization work great. Interface is very simple but still, very powerful. Service is responsive, updates regular.... my last and only wish is an integration to OneNote, rest is just perfect !
I love todoist, it has lots of easy to use features. I recommended some more features and wish they will implement them soon.
This app is a life saver. I quickly write what I want to and and later could deal with it without having to fight to remember. I sends reminders on time.

I use this app every day, it just works with my habits & I love setting due dates that remind me to do things. The only complaint that I have is the upgrade is expensive and for an entire year. Id like to pay less for a month long trial.
I was too impulsive to buy the paid version ;) and have not fully explored the possibilities of the paid version, but for now, it is a great app.
Been going strong with Todoist for months now and have been trying to utilize the GTD method, it's easy enough to add and manage items effortlessly enough that it hasn't become burdensome.
Really simple swiping interface   makes it very easy to keep track of everything. I use it for school work and personal errands and I never forget to do anything anymore.
The accomplished goal just goes away after you complete it. I like seeing my accomplished goals, it can be a source of motivation.
Mostly good for basic use but would like to be able to drag and drop things to do within the widget. Otherwise very pleased.
This is an best task manager I've found so far.. But cost is really too high.. No monthly payment options or EMI had to switch to other task manager for more accessibility for features..
I love how easy it is to set the due date. It sends an email with reminders for the day. I've used other list apps and this is the easiest to use.

I'm still finding out more on this product. I'd like it to integrate with my Outlook calendar and Gmail calendar but I haven't got that to work yet. Once I have time to investigate further it should be more helpful to me.
I live on this app, its beautiful easy to use and syncs everywhere. At one point they had voice suppory through google now. That was a huge dissapointment when it went away

Still a novice but I'm impressed with this app thus far and look forward to maximizing its use in the future. Frequent use of the tutorials  and forums  are key to learning  and utilizing the many aspects of this tool.
todoist enable me to create my   complex schedule which no other to do list could that I had try. And I'm not using premium.

I am an plan it out, organize it, kind of person so of course in the past I have downloaded tons of todolist apps but none where ever exactly what I was looking for. This particular one is just awesome. It functions well and is just Great all around Love it!!!!
Todoist has allowed for me to get all of my task in front of my face in a simple and beautiful format, which causes me to get more done I n a timely manner.

Todist has helped me remember regular occurring things and the things that pop up during the day/week.  I like that it's web based and I can use it on my mobile devices.  The only thing that confuses me is that my phone doesn't sync well and doesn't remove completed tasks.

This is what I'm using right now, because it helps me visualize my workflow so well. Three quivels - 1) not much there there to the Google Now "integration" (it will ask you if you want to use with Todoist & that's about it); 2) natural language could be more natural (I get a lot of "we don't understand that date" - Remember The Milk's is far better) 3) there is no way to bulk edit for non-date fields (label, priority - again, RTM does this); also date changes are unpredictable with recurring tasks.
A bit hard to use at first as it doesn't give instruction on how to use, but it's fantastic once you get the hang of it. I get everything done and more efficiently.

I have so many active projects going on inside and outside of work.  Todoist helps me to keep track of all the things I need to do! I used to use a pen and paper planner but I've shifted to using this app because of its convenience.
Light, seamless tool that helps me stay on top of my ToDos easily with minimal touch
I love this app and service.  The phone, tablet and web version are all great. I've got our whole organisation using it to manage our projects.
After I figured out how to use the app   I can't believe how awesome it is. Really organizes my day.
I can create simple todo lists without hassel. Takes 2 seconds to add to the list, and makes it easy to manage.
Talked to them on Twitter, got a very fast response. Kudos! Options to recur Tasks hourly, daily, you name it.  Reminders as paid sucks but using IF and Google Now makes up for it.
After trying all the tools, this is the one that worked across my ecosystem of tools the best, and had an affordable pro level.
There are a couple of issues which take the edge off it. Drag to reorder sometimes doesn't work, the card just pops back to its last position. Sub tasks show up twice in the today view.
It was good, now it is great. Fast and extremely usable. In the arms race of productivity apps, Todoist again takes the lead.
I am on the free trial, but I doubt I will upgrade for SUBSCRIPTION!
I'm in a long distance relationship and having the ability to create a shared project and use it as a shared to do list that we can both add to is great, very helpful 😊
Great app for keeping up with all my To-Do's and lists.  I've tried many and this is the one that works best for me.
Super easy to use to do list, and great features. Highly recommend it for anyone needing a quick place to put and manage tasks.
simple tool that will help you get things done. break big goals into smaller tasks, enter them in todoist and get them done one by one
This is one of the easiest to use and maintain apps. Lacks features like sub tasks which is available on Wunderlist. I have moved to managing my tasks online from notebook and sticky notes.
Love the ability to connect it to so many services.  Can integrate both work and home
Free version has most of what I need including offline access on phone so I can add and view tasks when I'm out of range. Tags would be great but not available for free.
Excellent.... However paid version is expensive than required and free version has important features missing.
Good app overall, easy to use and look great. Only feedback would be to improve further on the versatility of task-setting, by adding more advanced options asf
Using the free version ATM. It is simple to use. Has a good widget. The application has a few themes with free version and more with the paid version.
I particularly like the projects/sub projects that you can create multiple lists with. Wish we didn't have to upgrade for the calendar sync though.
Simple, quick, but still all a round type of to-do program. 5/5 after some try outs with calendar and memo based programs..This alarm like app is great!

But there is an problem while building task hierarchy. The problem is always present when I try to modify the hierarchy of tasks and then kill the app. After running application the hierarchy is a little different
I've been a paid user for nearly two years and really enjoy Todoist. It's the best task and project management app for any mobile device.

The best todo app out there, in my opinion.  Certainly the most flexible.  Beautiful layout, easy to use.  I highly recommend it.

Great layout app for list of task you need to perform. Isn't amazing that we can share or designated a task.
The only app I found that integrates well with my outlook calender! Love the reminders and being able to task emails.

While I like the robust features like creating subtasks, I also wish it were simpler to create subtasks--delineating the levels. At the very least, please make the indents further apart so that visually I can tell what is sub to what at a quick glance.

Have been using Todoist for a few days only but I'm really enjoying its simplicity. The daily and weekly views are a productivity boost. Maybe, just maybe, this may replace my physical Bullet Journal.

Like it, buy i cannot find a way to see a history of the completed tasks.

Awesome widget - definitely worth trying out. Switch between different types of todos, mark them as done, add them... Very compact and powerful
Very useful. One problem maybe is: too less possibilities to group tasks.
One thing don’t like about this app is that if I set a task to Roxy reoccur everyday and by chance forgot to check it on to Todoist and check it next day it will also check right today’s one.
The constant reminder of overdued tasks may seem irritating but it keeps you in line with your goals and prevents further procrastination.
Seriously good application. Like the link with Gmail to notify you of tasks forgotten (or overdue....) seriously effective.
Not with much complex featutes this is a nice one to try.
Solid to do app. I like the ability to use it on multiple platforms, and the ability to add projects with subtasks. However, all the notifications and emails are a bit excessive and obnoxious.
This has been my favorite to-do app for years, and I've used a few of them. Clear user interface, supported across multiple platforms and devices, and IFTTT integration.
I wish a little more premium features could be added to the free version of the app.. Or at least the reminders. Other than that it's a good app. 👍

Helps me stay organized no matter which device I'm closest to.  Make entries as they occur to me via cell.  Review or act on them later while working on lap top.  PERFECT!
Really easy to use. Can import projects via .CSV - use autohotkey to generate the file etc. Keeps me more organised than I have ever been :D

I like that this app allows you to organize your to-do lists into multiple colour-coded categories. Perfect for everything from my daily to do lists to my grocery list and even a books to read list. Fantastic.

Todoist is now my every day app. One day cannot pass without me referring to it. So far the best productivity app in the market.

Beautifully developed application that really drives you to be productive just for the satisfaction of clicking that checkbox. One area of improvement though would be to have more multicoloured themes for premium and business  users
