Todoist

I really like this app for the simplicity and ease of adding a task.  I would have given 5* if the task display is a bit more intuitive.  Currently overdue tasks take most of the screen space and its hard to look at today's tasks.  Does it really matter if one overdue task is 45 days ago and another one is 44 days ago?  It will be much cleaner if there is an option to group them as 1 day ago, 1 week ago, 1 month ago and Sometime in the past.   I can reclaim a lot of screen space.
Minimalism and simplicity of interface, support of subtasks (tree), superfast adding of tasks and smooth desktop-smartphone data exchange is the main features I love in Todoist!
The best :)
Lots of features make this usable not only for personal lists but project management as well. Worth the yearly subscription!

I tried many other apps, paid and unpaid, including Anydo, but they all seemed inferior to what I could do myself on a piece of paper or in Excel. This one is the only app that has its own programming and query language, which could be used to sort and prioritize tasks. If you know what you want, you should be able to achieve it with this app. Simple and extremely effective.

I tested a few other top rated to do list apps. This is by far my favorite. Simple interface with a lot of powerful features that you can choose to use or can easily ignore. This really helps organise my day / life for home and work. Tasks, jobs, things to purchase or need reminding about etc etc.

This app made managing my tasks and planning my day very easy. I find the daily summary in the morning very useful. I now use the app everyday. I love the Quick Add feature, especially since it now allows you to specify the project with the '#' symbol.

I'm using a one month trial of the pro app now, after 2 weeks of just the basic free version. I loved the basic but would have liked to have the comment ability included in it. As it is, the subscription fee ain't that much for my peace of mind so I'll probably continue once the trial is up.

One of the best to do list apps that there is, while not as feature rich as informant, it serves nicely on the essential features for those who don't want bells and whistle and just want a great cloud based to do list. It also has a unique karma system that rates you for completing tasks giving that extra motivation to complete your tasks.

So I had way too much going on and I needed to organize the tasks I had floating around in my mind and I didn't want to use the Google calendar. This app was exactly what I needed. I add a task and assign a day and boom, I had a much less troubled mind. I'd give it 5 stars if I could see a calendar. I would like to be able to see more than a week in advance without having to look through all my tasks.

Does the job smoothly, but I was incredibly annoyed by the app's habit of translating anything that looks like a day, date, or time and moving it to the due date "for me". I deal with a lot of events, and the info I put in is for me to distinguish among items, not for the due date. I haven't figured out how to turn this "feature" off. But there is no way this app is worth a yearly fee, especially not at the cost they are currently asking. A one-time fee, sure, but not repeated hits.

I use this as a planner and task manager since I forget to do a lot of things. It's satisfying to cross it off and know that I'm on track. I also use this to manage my club board (who can also access this Todoist) and it helps us all visualize what we have done and what is still left do. I really enjoy this app!

Todoist is a great productivity application. I really like the option to add in a specific time of the day. Todoist automatically puts the list in order with this feature. This app is totally worth it!     Side note: apps are great and I <3 making list' but I constantly need to remind myself why I am trying to get things done. Sometimes I wish there was an app to remind me why I want to be productive.

Useless "To Do List" App, because you cannot even attach photos or other files to your tasks. I like to create lists of things to do around the house and that usually requires a reference photo for when I go to Home Depot or something. This functionality does not seem to exist and it seems you cannot even assign\share tasks with other users, which is standard with other apps, such as Wunderlist. I gave it a shot, but have to uninstall...

Features are easy to use with minimal bugs, only feature that doesn't make sense to me is that sub-tasks are not reset upon parent task completion/repeat... eg, I make a repeating task with 6 steps, but when it repeats, it still shows the 6 steps from last week already completed rather than needing to be done again this week.

Like it and better than other organising apps ive tried and love the projects and sub tasks, etc. I've upgraded to paid for version I liked it enough. Just find setting time and date alerts difficult. Or could be me but find myself tapping back and forth until I get there and I get the magic combo of date, time and notification type, whatever. For those who like lists and like that done it feeling, this delivers. But alerts and notifications and reminders could be easier to set and can be frustrating.

As a forgetful person Todoist really has helped me in my job as well as my personal life. In my opinion your really can't get any better than Todoist as far as GTD apps go. Beautiful interface, easy task creation, and a killer date engine. My only suggestion is to provide a way to return to the start page after you navigate away from it, as I have customized my start page heavily and need to use it a lot.

The sharability and ease of use is great. My main issue is the widget is not adjustable (at least for lg v10 marshmallow). The to do list is a big part of the app but having my agenda display (widget) from the home screen  conform to my screen size needs is a must. Right now there is only a 1x1 icon or a 4x3 agenda view, please add adjustability or other options like 5x2

I've been trying out several productivity apps and this one has definitely been the best combination of design and practicality I've found. I did have a bit of an issue trying to add subtasks. I had to spend a bit more time figuring that out. It was the first time I tried to enter subtasks so probably is get used to the process here.

The best app ever. I am especially fond of the two ways to set up recurring tasks (after, every). Categorizing in projects, tagging, sharing projects with another person are all great features. And it's available in pretty much the same format across different platforms - Windows, chrome, android etc.

I love todoist and their team. I've tried many productivity apps but none of them worked with my flexible way of working except todoist. I love the freedom within the app and the strong multi platform features as well as the teams regular social media advice of techniques to maximize the app. Love todoist

I love this app, I was looking for a to do app that would allow me to organize my tasks in projects, assign them to certain days and give them a priority degree and this app does that. The design is very nice and I like that all tasks are saved to am account so you don't have to organize them all again when you buy a new phone or have to re-download the app for whatever reason.                                      I highly recommend this app if you're into organizing and efficiency like I am!

I have been using this app for the last fortnight and have stuck after trialling 3-4 popular alteratives. It's easy to use, intuitive and well integrated with Android. Save your self the time and start here

Tried this several months ago,  but it just didn't work properly.  Read again  about all the wonderful features, so I was eager to give it another try.  Got an error message when I tried to sign up which said that I should try again in a few moments.   I waited a few minutes and then tried again.   And again.   And again.   And again.  Waited a few more hours and tried several times again.  Then a few days.  Then just gave up.

One of the most well thought out to-do list managers I've seen. Sure there are some features I would like to see like task duration and better predecessor handling,  but it's simplicity and superb UI keeps me using it more than the alternatives that do have all these advanced features.

This app helps me plan my day my, month and to some extent my life. Wonderful app by the developers. I have used the mobile as well as the desktop version, both are very very convenient to use. I haven't used any other application of this genre and never felt the need to try others. It is undoubtedly the leader. One suggestion include some tutorials as i am still discovering many new and very useful features of the app.

I'm way more organized, there a small learning curve but todist instructions are very easy to learn. The premium features are well worth the money and plus its does not cost that much. there are deals now and than.

For those that made the switch from Microsoft to Apple, it took some getting used to - This app is no different.  This app is great but it has its own way of doing things that takes getting used to.  Things like:  Recurring dates, rather than copy and paste, or typing the time rather than clicking via the calendar etc.  I would have offered 5 stars had the app incorporated some of the other methods of working.

Not very motivated to purchase only one year of a task/goal list. Since it is an app if I am to pay $30 that should be mine to keep. I understand the people that put effort into this should get their money's worth and I would be more willing to pay if it was not yearly or kept any of my info.

Edited to add:  Reinstalled, which fixed sync but lost all my new entries and completed entries. I still don't know if I reconstructed my work completely and correctly, and I won't know until I run into a real world problem caused by the data loss.   And yes, I contacted support, which offered the same suggestion (after I'd already given up and reinstalled). The point is that I did not want to lose my work, and I knew that a reinstall would do exactly that.   Not happy, Todoist.  Original comment:  One star until you fix sync.

Works really well. Has good subtasks feature which a lot of to do apps dont have. Also love the gmail plugin. Another thing i LOVE is forwarding my emails to Todoist. And the super customizable recurring and due dates feature is great. Most apps dont let you do schedules like every Monday and Thursday at noon. Todoist does.  I would like to be able to make filters that can exclude projects. For example i have a project i call personal and use two Todoist widgets on my tablet. I'd like see one widget with ju

Managing to-do 's quickly is an art, it cannot be boring but it needs structure. Almost by contradiction it needs to be 'light' to use but have a certain depth of functionality. This balance is just the hardest to achieve but TD have pulled that off and across multiple devices.

the second i think of something i need to do i can quickly enter in the task and then review later what needs to be done. its very satisfying when i complete a task and get to check it off. i wish it kept a history of what i completed just to have a record but thats my only complaint.

Couldn't be happier.  Been using a number of Todo list apps on IOS, Android and PC for years and struggled to get one I was happy with; easy to use, seamless syncing across all my devices, nice interface and allowing me to group and arrange tasks as I wish.    Todoist has ticked the boxes.  It allows easy sorting, scheduling and grouping of tasks and basically does what it says on the tin very well.  Most importantly however it does so with a very slick interface that gets the trade-off between functionality and form just right.   The web interface is classy, as is the IOS interface.  The Android app (at least on my phone as opposed to my iPad)  is a bit more constrained but I suspect this is due to screen size limitations.  Finally, Todoist is well supported - there are maintenance updates to the web version occurring almost daily and a constant stream of new features.  So highly recommended.

Great organizational app! I love the use of natural language. Many features are accessible without a premium subscription, which is also a great bonus! You do not get SMS or email reminders about each task without premium, but it does send a reminder in the morning of how many tasks you have for the day, including any overdue tasks from previous days. I really enjoy the addition of Karma when you complete tasks. Integrates between my MacBook and Galaxy wonderfully, too!

Can we please have a filter query to detect having no child tasks, or is there some way we can currently do this? That way I can view all tasks with a certain label that aren't blocked by other sub tasks with different labels. Also, multiple parents would be useful for situations when several tasks are blocked by one task. 5 stars if that's possible.

I use Todoist only as a shopping list manager, even though it's loaded with features. You can completely ignore the things you're not interested in, the app doesn't care. It's sync reliability is better than Google Keep, which is why I switched to it. After having used it for a while, I find the mechanics of everyday use to be quite intuitive and delightful. Sharing a list with my family, it helps us mark/unmark items as completed with simple swipes. The widget is great too, comes in handy when shopping.

It has a lot of features for free and is pretty simple to use. I was able to find a way for it to do everything I needed. However, instead of giving you directions upfront ie. for setting repeating tasks & making headers, I had to find "hacks" that weren't really hacks because it's a real feature in a todoist blog. A link to this in app would be useful. It syncs btwn devices easily, but the Windows10 app is glitchy. The email notifications of undone tasks are a nice free feature. I recommended it often.

This is a really nice app to use and maks planning your tasks a breeze. The yearly $50 to unlock all features is to expensive compared to other apps. Would happily pay the $50 once off to unlock all features but not yearly. Would be 5 stars if you change pricing.

Better than Any.do, Wunderlist, Google Tasks or Keep, and other planning tools I've tried. Feature request: I want to schedule things for "Morning", "Afternoon", and "Evening", without having to specify the hour. Otherwise, some priority-one 10pm chores are listed above priority-two daytime tasks, making my list order all dysfunctional. I made a complex workaround, but assigning broad time chunks would be nice.

It would be great if the notification feature was part of the free version, but beggars can't be choosers. Otherwise, it is a nice little app to help keep track of things coming up across platforms. Just have to remember to check it in the morning.

Love the cross-platform integration (Android and Mac for me!), UI, and the fact that the free option is all I need. I used to use Remember the Milk and was a Pro user but the outdated design and lack of a Mac app was a deal breaker. This is perfect.

I like the simplicity of the UI and its availability on all devices. Most of all, it is the only todo list that works for me. Thank you for developing this app! I just wish the free version have access to more premium functions like reminders. It is annoying seeing great functions but not using it.

I'm the type of guy that does one thing at a time. I focus on one task and that usually means I forget a lot of other things that I need to do. This application tells me when one of my tasks are late and it helps to build habits and routines by allowing the creation of daily tasks. It also allows you to create recurring task ie: 'every Wednesday at 6' do this task. The app records and schedules these tasks automatically so you know you won't miss a deadline. This app helped me organize my life! Great app!

I am a total nut about organization and planning and planners in general. I have jumped around and tried so many different methods, processes, and products (mostly because I really like testing out new stuff to organize my life). Todoist is the only thing that has lasted throughout my crazy try-out periods. It is the single best app I have and I would be lost with out it. Take it from someone who likes to plan out EVERYTHING: todoist makes it so easy to rearrange when plans change. It's the best!!!!!!!

The free version of the app works great! The interface is amazing, it works with it a glitch,  and fills a perfect utility void. I would upgrade, but the subscription price is kind of high,  and not being an out right purchase is pretty annoying.  Also,  if there was calander interface or widget presentation, it would probably be worth it.

I have alot to do these days- homeschooling 3 kids, housework, working, keeping track of medications, appts. This is a great organizer  because I can make multiple lists with different due dates and  reminders. Then I can also bring up everything due today from different lists. I can name my lists and give them different colors and that's all for free! It's awesome! I'm going to see what cool stuff comes with their pro version! Great job!

The widget is one of the best bits meaning this tool is constantly at my fingertips which makes it easy to utilise and committ too. As an advocate of David Allen's GTD methodology i love this app for a lot of reasons and highly recommend it to everyone.

Tried several and keep coming back to this one. Can't find anything any better. Easy to enter info, like the postpone button and the over-due function does not create hundreds of entries that I gave to go back, delete, and clean up.

This app gives you just what you need, a tool that keeps track on the things you have to do everyday and also has a rating that you progress as you finish tasks. That system makes normal tasks feel like quests that you have to complete in order level up which is just so fun ☺️

Been using this app for years.  I only use the free version now, however.  While I have had the premium version in the past, I disnt fr I used enough of the premium features to warrant the cost.  It would be nice if there was an in between free and premium as I don't need many of the collaboration options.

Great system and seamlessly links to all formats - iOS, Android, laptop. Only shame is that you can't add notes unless you subscribe, unless you add a ghost task to contain those notes. You give all the functionality but could I suggest not making notes a priced extra or price it a bit lower? Great app though!!

I've been a GTDer for 7 years and recently switched over from Toodledo. Which I've been using the past 5 years. I've tried what must be dozens of productivity and to-do list apps over the past 7 years and Todoist has been my most enjoyable experience to date. To-do lists don't have to be boring or visually unappealing. But many are. Todoist has bridged that gap between high level functionality and elegant design.  The only fly in the ointment is the reminder and label input functions which seem buggy.

I would recommend a possibility setting a certain date so the event would start that day  and then it would go every day, for example, i want to learn german and french in holidays but i cant set the date on ,,everyday,, bcs i dont have time for it now, thus i want to start in upcoming month. Thank you

I tried so many to-do apps that never really helped me but this one is really awesome ; the way you view the upcoming days means you never miss something coming ; creating a task is intuitive on a whole new level with emoji supported labels and priorities. karma is nice because points 💯. It changed the way I plan stuff to do now I actually have fun doing it. Totally worth the subscription, high quality app 👊
I still can't get the app to notify me from the sounds I pick on my Samsung Note 5, how do I solve this problem

Couple of things though for better functionality.  When moving something to a different folder a window comes up to where u want to move it to but with that said there should be create a new folder button on the popular just like how Google Drive has and if u want to place it under the main title.

I work a lot from my calendar and like to see appointments and todos in the same place. Loved the way it worked with Sunrise Calendar before Sunrise was taken over by Microsoft. Interaction with Google Calendar (or other calendars that work through Google Calendar) is not so slick. Tasks completed in Todoist do not show up as complete in these calendars. Incomplete tasks do not get carried forward. Synchronization seems to work only in one direction - from Todoist to Google.  I understand these issues have to do with the Google API (or lack of API), but the usefulness of the app for me has been diminished.

I'm a developer and an entrepreneur. I own and read a book on productivity called Lifehackers Guide to working faster and smarter. This is the ONLY task app (and I've tried everything form Gmail Hacks to google wave and slack and this is it)

Worth every dollar of the yearly  subscription. Cannot recommend highly enough. Meets every need I have, with a well designed and thoughtful material design update. Option to switch to old input option would be nice as typing is not always convenient or practical. I love the theme options and animations, so much attention and love not just a dumb port. Worth the wait. Third party integrations and api support, combined with so many platforms makes my life perfect!

I really like how clean it is and the best part is adding "at 5 pm" and the scheduler auto adds the time. Another thing is the todoist app is everywhere! One of my fav is the Firefox extension with full functionality of the app not just a list, where i can quickly add or tick off from list when i need to. Double Thumbs up!!!
I had the pro version then didn't renew because it was too tedious to manage from my phone. Now that there's a Web option, I'm happy to come back.

I use todoist everyday and it works quite well. I really like all the shortcuts available and the fact that the dev actually listena to users when deciding where to go next. Todoist is just enough of everything, but not too much of anything to works extremely well for me.

Synch with 15+ platforms? Can't even see what platforms it synchs with. App description gives a few examples. Thought I'd download it to see what else. Nowhere in app does it say so. Just says upgrade to Synch with 15+ platforms. Great! So you want me to pay close to $50 just to see if you will Synch with a specific platform? No thanks. Uninstalled. *UPDATE* 1. So you expect me to go to website for info on a mobile app? 2. Hard to find. And then only 13 platforms. 3. It is $44.99 per year. Still BS.

I've used so many to do apps. Todoist rates among the best and it syncing with Google calendar, ifffit, and Evernote simplifies things for me. I just have to figure out how to use "projects" without all of them showing up every day. Great app.

I've been using Todoist for a while now and think it's great! However, I keep running into walls when wanting to use certain key (to do app) features, like setting reminders. There are too many features that are only available for premium subscription holders. There are certainly more feature-rich apps for cheaper and so I'll be switching soon.   I would've continued to use Todoist if I only had to pay a one time price for access to all the features; freemium is such a tease!
The basic version does not allow you to set dates for your items, so there is no way to see what tasks are coming up. So it's pretty much just a way to make lists of items.

I am not a very organised person but ToDoist definitely made me one. It's so much easier to remember things because it's easy to use and a reminder will pop up and tell you what to do for the day. The only thing is that you have to pay 28.99 for a year, but it's better than it sounds because I did the math you only have to pay a bit over 2 dollars a month. The only way to get reminders is paying but it's totally worth it and it's not just reminders there are lots of other features. This app is for everyone.

I love how this app works compared to other to-do list apps. It really helps me stay on track! The best thing about it, is its shareability. Because you can share your lists, this is a very good family shopping list app, if you're looking for one.

I like how this app has the ability to synchronized between multiple users. I've used this with building grocery list between my wife and I. Still haven't figured it out completely, but I'm looking forward to learning. Thank you so much guys!

This app works. It's not going to help you plan your entire life goals, but it WILL help you organise yourself before a flight, make sure you don't forget any shopping, or get everything ready for a birthday party. I think the app is very good for those sort of things. And I find it really annoying to see things go overdue. It encourages me to want to complete it!
I've only had this app for a few hours, but can attest, it is top notch. Does so much more than I expected. Combines several different features I thought I would have to utilize via multiple apps.

It's really just a list if you can't add labels. You can add labels & comments if you pay $30 per year membership. So for me this is a bad app. At least let me try it with full features. I have tried Remember the Milk and they have all features for $30 but let me try for free.

Often i used to forget my tasks which i was supposed to do during the day or which i'd be supposed to do in future, but this app solves that problem. 1 star less because they are providing very limited features in the free version of the app.

I'm curious on how to integrate this more into my life, but am not always able to (so 4 stars). For university it was excellent. I'm curious if there could be a trial of pro before purchasing to make a sure decision! Thanks!

Sure it will allow you to make lists but charging €13.99 to set an actual alarm/reminder, that's gouging... such a basic function deprived by a pay wall. Shame! Sure go ahead and charge for the multiple users accessing the same list... that would make sense but locking us out of functionality is a good way to get people to drop your app like a hot potato for being utterly useless....
Easy to use, helps me keep track of things I want/ need to get done and it's fun.

Like any application you need to be clear with yourself on how you are going to use it and be prepared to adapt. Took me a few months to get the hang of it for my work follow. Can not imagine work without it now.

Liking the app so far. ( 2 weeks in) But for some reason I'm having difficulty setting up the reminders via phonethe phone. They are very easy to program, but simply dont show up. The only time I got one was in a test scenario where  I set it up for 2 minutes after... Any clues ?
Todoist is amazingly well done to-do list app. Helps me keep track of little (like when a TV show season starts) and big things (some work notes), as well as all the things in between.

And makes me do what I said I would do! Only gripe is it doesn't seem to want to tell me what I have achieved by way of tasks completed today. Only tasks completed in individual projects. Real kama is how you feel when satisfied with a day well spent, not what an algorithm tells you you should feel.

Seems like everything I tried to do in the app required a yearly subscription, even setting deadlines for things, ridiculous. Not only that, it sends about 4 emails a day about your to-do list, in my case all these emails for the one test entry I made before uninstalling, totally excessive. There's better actually free apps out there. If your willing to pay a yearly fee it's probably a good app, but I have enough paid subscriptions as it is!

This app helps me stay organized in so many ways. I especially like the plug in in Microsoft Outlook that allows a person to create a Todo by right clicking on the message. The way I do this allows me to operate with a "zero inbox."
Everything's neat and straightforward. I like how it's set up easily. Not much else to say on it really, I recommend it
Calendars were never my thing. Todoist is exactly what I have been missing for so many years.
I'm on the go a lot, physically and mentally. Todoist keeps me on track. Just wish I could remember to open it everyday.
This has been the best digital app for managing my projects and tasks. Keeps my head clear from worries about forgetting stuff. Easy to use and simple to navigate.
I like this app because it's simple and to the point. It gives me a friendly reminder to start my day off and then I get things done. This app definitely delivered what it promise.
I have use this Tool for a while. So, far it's does what I need. I have found a problem once in awhile. It may be due to my error. It has all the must do list.
I love this app so much. It has helped me get through school and with any other task that I needed to be reminded about. Highly recommend it if you have a bad memory like me, haha

I have this app on my desktop, phone and tablet and it has helped me so much! My time management has improved so much since I've started using this app. It's a must have for people with time management issues .
I have only used this app for a few days, but it seems to be very good and thorough especially with the attachment to email.
Seems to be what I was looking for, just a straight forward reminder list. It does a lot more than I need it to, but you are able to turn things on and off as you like. No problems.

Only extra thing I'd like to see is list templates. This would be a template where you can add a bunch of pre defined tasks to a date such as a "packing for holiday"  checklist or "backup procedure"  checklist etc.
It takes a little bit getting used to but once you learn how to navigate, pretty easy :)

I just downloaded and am now going to uninstall. It seems like a good app, until you want to set an alarm for a task, or enter comments, and discover that's only available for the PREMIUM version -- which costs you $29. And not just to buy it... that's the cost PER YEAR! Screw that, no checklist app is worth that

Sends my reminders, I definitely get more things done.... I like that  I can still see my list of things to accomplish,  and if I couldn't get to it,  it still reminds me...definitely better than old school carrying around a tab of paper
I really enjoy all the free features. I don't know if I want to buy it though because I can't try all the features.  I wish I could try all the features before buying.
Works perfectly. I wish I had a check box on mobile like I do on the site for checking things off, but otherwise Todosit nailed it.
Used to use OI shopping list for quick lists, but this is obviously better due to cloud syncing and more robut options.

Good to-do app, but the widget is frustrating and wastes a lot of click able area. Very very annoyed that the widget cannot be compressed to a width of 2. Uninstalled, but I would reinstall and pay $5-10 for a better UI.

I really love this thing. I used to have little notes to myself all over the place. I installed this on my phone and my Win7 PC. They are automatically hooked together so any changes made anywhere show up everywhere! One of the most clever features is the auto detection of priority and due date in context of the entered task.  Not to mention the daily email reminder of what you've scheduled for yourself that day.

I really like this particularly the integration with zapier that send it to idonethis so I can keep track for monthly reporting.  The only improvement would be to be able to set you default project as I have to move them all.
Sometimes moving list can be tricky from one day to next.  It will jump two days but only once in a while
Works really well. I'm now so much better at tracking all my to do's
Once you get used to the interface, the app is intuitive, and certainly helps organize your day. It runs on all devices too. Very happy ☺ with it.
Great for repetitive & nonrepetative tasks.  Very easy to have multi level projects & group by priority.  Synchronizes among PC, tablet, & mobile phone.
Now I can manage all my task efficiently. Nice material design.  Would like to suggest for the widget to have an option to change color to transparent.

Todoist is one app I rely upon daily to keep me on track with long-term and short-term projects, as well as specific and repeating tasks.  I love the ease of scheduling recurring tasks.  Syncing to all my devices is essential, and is handled beautifully.

It's a keeper, tho I would like to see more options for items/due dates etc. I.E. I was trying to make a weekly notice for taking my trash cans out to the curb but on Wednesday and it was Thursday...everytime I tried to make it weekly it changed it to Thursdays. This means I have to wait till next Wednesday to actually change it to a weekly chore. So, does that mean if I make a monthly errand I have to also create it on the day of the month I want it to repeat (or at least wait till that day to edit it)?

I deleted the app and reinstalled the latest version. In the few hours I have used it since, I haven't experiences any crashes like I experienced with the previous versions. I'll keep looking out for any other issues as well. Thanks.

やりたいこととやらなきゃいけないことがハッキリするから時間を上手く使えるようになるし良い。システマチックなんだけど割りとちゃんと可愛くて予定立てるのが楽しいです。〆切管理とかも出来る。カレンダー系のアプリよりも良いと思えたTodoリスト系はこのアプリだけだと思います重宝してます。

Nyco

It does everything you want it to but sometimes you have to guess things like shortcuts (drag right to mark a task done, left to reschedule) or the fact that you can schedule repeating tasks. A tutorial would go a long way but the interface is so user friendly that if you have experience with these kinds of apps you can intuit a few things.

Great app. Love integration with IFTTT. I have it tied to my Amazon Alexa, so when I add a to-do item verbally it shows up in my Todoist list! Still on free version, but might consider paying for it if it becomes my go-to app for list maintenance.

It's the weekend and I can finally take my wife to the movies, only we forget that movie that we saw in the coming attractions ast the last movie we went to that we HAD to go see. Or I finish reading War and Peace and I'm ready to start the NY Times new best selling political history book, only I forget the title. Well never again! With Todoist I keep track of movies I want to see, books I want to read, projects my wife wants me to do, restaurants I want to try, funny quotes from my breakfast club.

This app and the desktop version are essential to my daily life.  While there are a few additional features I wish were available on the desktop and web versions, the Android app is perfection.  One wish for Android: an option for a dark theme. Thanks Todoist!    UPDATE:  I need start dates on non-recurring tasks. While I still love Todoist, I switched to Remember the Milk just because I must have start dates.  Implement start dates on non-recurring tasks and I'll come back, Todoist!

Due to years of pushing myself to sleep too little, I have a terrible memory.  I am new to this app but finding it awesome so far.  Karma makes it a game and the score makes it competitive.  I installed the app on my android, the chrome extension and the add-in to my work outlook at work as well as the windows 10 links at home and at work.  ONENOTE FOR WORK AND EVERNOTE FOR PERSONAL for files makes this supercharge my brains potential to get things done...

U can keep it in sync using phone and Chrome browser. Just disable some nagging notifications and u are set.    Annoyance: you write something like May 6 or 8Pm (any date/time) and it wants to tag or make it in a sort of due date.time.. Stop that please ?   Otherwise, recommended.

Extremely well done. Been using it for a few years. Makes creating systems very easy. Could have a couple more features but they already have a ton so I'm not really gonna hold them accountable for that.

I was looking for a a good all-in-one calendar and to do app. I did research before selecting this over the other Google recommended one. After playing with it for 20 min I'm not impressed. None of these apps have any way to plan beyond a week. If they do, the interface isn't user friendly. I have little difficulty remembering my week. It's beyond that where I need help. Delete.

I have executive functioning issues and Todoist has been by far the best app for me. I use it to organize all my varying projects and use labels to create a hierarchy for individual tasks to keep me focused and on schedule. The widget's customization makes sure I can't forget my task list and again, is great for helping me stay on topic. It has exactly what I need but is lightweight enough to be immediate and super easy to work with. Works perfectly on both my Android devices and my Macbook. Literally the best app I could have. Thank you, Doist!

I paid for full after a day or so playing with it, and am well happy. Also, impressive support with replyable email contact. Finally, my system is perfect(ish)! Update - lived with it for a good while now and it just gets better - tbh I forget it's even there, it's just how I gtd without having to over think it! xo

This is a good app. It makes my life a little easier by remembering things I could forget easily. I think it's a little over priced at $28 a year, but probably at the end of this 1st year I'll have changed my mind.

I really enjoy the ease of use of this application. It's very user-friendly and has made prioritizing my tasks much easier. As far as keeping you on track it's also an awesome tool to use. I love that it sends you reminders when you submitted a project to be done at a certain time and you haven't completed or put in that you've completed it so it reminds you to either get started or 2 mark it as completed. LOL overall great app!
Still has some bugs with respect to the web app. Particularly we're unable to select "no due date" for certain things i.e. books to read
So far, I am keeping up with my tasks; my bouts of organization usually last a week, but the cross-platform client is giving me more staying power.
I have tried so many to do apps. I have to say this one is the best its simple yet it has all the functions I need.
I wish I could rate this app higher. It couldn't be better and has helped me loads

... but I cannot for the life of me get the reminders or notifications to work in this app. And yes, I've turned notifications on within the app and given permission in settings but they still don't work. I turned off my third-party lock screen too, but nothing works.  Very disappointed. Not much point in a to-do list that can't notify me of anything. I'd like my money back please.
I'm so disorganized and this helps me so much to keep track I of stuff to be done in an easy access app. Love it.

Great app. Have installed Todoist for Windows now. Only thing it doesn't recognize dates properly. The 7th of April will be the 4th of July. I would like to see this bug fixed for Todoist for Windows.
Find that this app has helped me be more organised and is quite easy to use. Like that I can reorder tasks through dragging.
Easy to navigate and do exactly what I've been searching for a to-do list app to do. Haven't gotten into the premium features or sharing, but the basic functions and layout are nice.

Great simple app that is easily accessible and user friendly across all platforms. I haven't figured out how to receive text reminders yet, despite trying several times, maybe this could process be improved
This is by far the best To-do list application I have ever used. The user interface is simple and intuitive to use.

It is a really simple and great to do list app, with great features like intuitive date and time setting. I wish I would be able to assign one task to multiple people. Otherwise even the free version is plenty good for everyday life.
I have compared several task apps and found it's the best of the kind. Versatile functionality, elegant layout and easy to use.
The Definitive Productivity Tool  I have been using the premium for about a month now and believe me when i say this . Todoist + Google Calendar can work magic for you :)
It's simple, free, and I use it. Well done for not irritating me with adds to make me buy it. I may even pay for the full version.
uninstalling. .. for free one they could have provided few features other than adding and deleting the task. Even for adding simple comments it's required to upgrade.  Never install such apps
The app has a excellent design, but the usability can be better. Some actions require too many clicks and there is some bugs in labels using the website
Very simple to use, but has all the needed items. I had tried many to do app before, never satisfied like this
Todoist does all what I expect it to and then some. And it integrates well with my fav calendar app Sunrise. Finally, finally a to-do app that does not leave me disappointed.
I use todoiat for daily cleaning tasks, personal reminders and business todos. It syncs flawlessly across all my devices and has every option ive looked for yet.

Definitely love this app.  It makes it so easy to manage simple tasks, or just needing to add an item in a rush so I won't forget later on.   It's definitely saved me more than once with work and my wife!
I love having all lists in one place and checking things off.
I'm pretty bad at managing my time, this app is great. The way it works across different devices and formats is a real win. Well worth subscribing to get the premium version.
I tried a number of apps and Todoist is the best for many reasons. Try it fir a month or a single project and you won't regret it
All around intelligent and efficient to do list app. Available on any platform, truly can work for anyone anywhere.

I needed something that would allow me to track tasks on multiple devices and platforms, and to share tasks with others. Todoist has been great for that. I'm still learning features and how to use them, but so far Todoist has been a great help with getting organized and improving productivity.
This app offers so much to help organize life. Makes it easier with the paid version but you can still use it all the time with the free version.
This app is great, very easy to use and has helped me stream line my task management at home and work.
I used to manage my daily goals here quite simply. This is very helpful app.

You'll get my 5th star when you combine location and time based reminders. As it stands now, I either forego location reminders or get them even when the due date is days away. Overall though looks like a fine product with great potential.
The notifications are not too much like other apps. Very easy to use and gave a sense of accomplishment when completing tasks with their level system.
Integration with email app cloud magic works very well. Nice and simple way to hold all your to do list at one place.
Its nice to compile daily lists with and voice recognition of event dates and times is just what i needed.
Top notch tool for organizing tasks. Google calendar integration is good and will be great when synchronization happens faster.
Great integration with other devices / platforms. Powerful task manager, great logic engine for recurring tasks and for scheduling. Great app.
As a chronic procrastinator, this app has helped boost my productivity considerably !
I use it daily to keep myself organized and avoid procrastination. Easy to use and convenient. Love it.

Easy to use, neat, nifty and pretty feature packed with all the right bits and pieces. Love the natural language recognition. One of the best task managers for both Android and iOS. But I wished they packed more for free. Even basic functionality requires a premium upgrade.
The best taks app have ever owned! And I have had many. The damn thing works like I want it to, across all the devices I use!

Pretty neat app, buuuuuut the USEFUL features are restricted to premium, which is worth mentioning that it is almost $30 a year! Way too much for what it offers. That may sound cheap but it's not worth it. Uninstalled.
My whole life ison todoist. Work and personal. The only big feature I'd like would be the ability to put in task durations.

It us a good way of keeping track of your to do's and it is satisfying to tick them off but why oh why does it not recognise Priority mode of Android? If the app is not set to be a priority app it should not make noises when the phone is in priority mode!

It's just a list without upgrading to premium. I didn't see in an easy way to repeat items.

I think by coincidence Todoist 9 was released on the same day I received a reminder to renew Premium. Of course I was already planning to renew, but seeing the new features definitely reinforced that wise decision. Somehow they have made the app more powerful while also making it faster. One of my favorites, by far. Happy to have it and use it everyday.
In my opinion it's one of the To-do apps with the best free version.  Also it easily works cross platform so that no matter what device I'm using I've always my to do list up to date.

The last two updates (so called material design) have disrupted the data entry process and the auto correct disallows you from use day/week/month descriptive text in your tasks.....very very frustrating.  And there is no override (like the check mark in most texting applications) This program used to be a 5 star application but it now takes me twice as long to enter and correct my entries.  Please address these issues and ask your user base what they want.  I am considering not renuing my premium subscripti

Great productivity suite. If you are comfortable with Outlook they this should be familiar. Organizing my tasks took a while to think of but the app helped me get it all out. The following day, what could have been very stressful ended up a breeze. Thanks Todoist! (I want to spread the word that your premium service was well worth it! ..and I don't usually write when I rate.:)

Hands down the best task app out there.   Intuitive, and easy to use with good integration into other apps that I use.  Latest update had pretty much everything else that I had wanted from this app like projects in the quick add function.   Nice work!
You pay for basic functions. Free app is VERY basic. 1y subscription is twice the fee of Toodledo. Very limited features of free app compared to other apps.

I love how simple it is to add and manage tasks in Todoist. It's also easy to postpone tasks to the next day. And I like the positive reinforcement of karma and calculation of daily streaks in completing tasks.

Although there have been times that I haven't liked some of the app's aesthetics, I haven't been able to deny the functional beauty of this app. It has always been a simple, clean app, whether on iPhone, Samsung Tab, Google Chrome or the website proper.
I love this app. It's simple to use and has improved my work flow as well as the amount of what I can accomplish in a day
Nice design, fairly limited unpaid functionality. I'd change the 'send' icon to a tick on the event creation. Is a bit confusing
basically moat of the features are locked and require premium upgrade. basic setting such as alarm/reminder should be free

My Note 4 was able to update this app just fine but on my Note 8.0, I press update, hit the accept button and absolutely nothing happens. It's been that way for days meanwhile I updated over a dozen other apps on the Note 8.0 with no issues. And I have a paid subscription.
No reminders unless you pay. I understand holding back on reoccurring reminders, but single time reminders is a little overboard.

So far I love it. I'm still learning how to use it. I like it's simplicity and functionality. As soon as I downloaded the app, my productivity visibly increased. I was accountable to the things I need to get done and I can teach how well I've kept up with those things.
The app is clean and simple yet full of features and the ability to edit projects and change hierarchy is great. The premium plan was a great purchase.

Regular issues with syncing and errors with dates/time zones.  Solution provided is to clear cache... Hardly ideal when dealing with multiple users and platforms.   Minimal android updates (still cannot sort tasks by date due in android and no ability to search in a project.). On a wider scale, the removal of the todoist votebox has minimized user engagement.  Mac apps are nice but when will a chrome app with local notifications that I can actually use at work be developed?
I've only had this app for a week or so, but it's worked pretty well so far. The ability to nest tasks within folders within folders is great, as well as the ability to customize folders.
Très pratique. Je recommande. Une petite suggestion cependant : pouvoir régler l'heure de la notification quotidienne serait parfait.
I love this app. I use it in conjunction with the outlook add on. It keeps me super organized and accountable without wasting a bunch of time setting it up.
Preparation required, Dependencies, Actual date completed and Reasons columns would make Todoist complete and great. Hope you guys release an update soon incorporating these suggestions. Thank you.
Very impressed with the new features, this is definetly one of the best apps on android.
There are apps that can do many of the same things FOR FREE.  A good presentation might have made me willing to spend a few dollars.  not 3p bucks for a year.  Disgusted with this greed here.
I found it so overcomplicated to begin with but now I'm learning how to use it properly I'm starting to like it a lot.
I really like the free version for a basic to do list app, and it meets my expectations.
When trying to open Completed Tasks in Karma. Premium account.
Does everything I need it to. Lacks a few of the more useful items on the "free version" because they are stuck behind the "full version".
I love this app. It really keeps me on top of things and let's me rest easy. I can put in new tasks whenever I want, so I never forget to do something on my to-do list! :)

As someone who requires a surrogate executive function, and who has tried many different to do/scheduling apps, I am finding this app to be one of the most helpful for me. I particularly like the ability to add sub-tasks to a larger task.
I'm not the biggest fan of to-do lists, as they tend to accumulate junk over time, but this app makes them easy to manage and I do seem to get more done.

Seems great for putting down tasks necessarily associated w a specific date/time, etc.,   but what if i need to write down just a simple note/idea/thought/memo that cannot be assigned to one particular day only ?  Wasn't able to this simple task within the app...

This app is simply the best, most useful, most beautiful task manager available. One of my favorite aspects of it is its cross-platform ability. Todoist is available on almost any OS/platform. I love Todoist and use it all the time. It's an easy recommendation to anyone.         Todoist is the only task manager I've used that makes me get stuff done.
Using IFTT its a great service I love it it's soooo cool well done guys
Tried a lot over the years, this one is by and far the best out there. Very good as a free version, fantastic if you pay to get the advanced features.
And I tried them all... It has all the features one would expect, the premium plan is definitely affordable and the extra features are worth it. No complains for now.

While the free version of Todoist is more limited than the free version of Any.do, Todoist is much faster on my phone and the actions are more intuitive. The Todoist application in browser is also better optimized and more practical. If I end up buying either one, it will be Todoist.
I like this application because it continues to remind you until u complete the tasks.
Bonita e simples interface. Minimalista mas completo! Meu único incômodo foi com o fato dos lembretes serem um recurso Premium.
The best productivity app available with great Outlook integration and access on every device.
My wife loves it. She can put my honey do list on and prioritize them too. Personally, I'm not fond of it, (I don't like list ) but it makes her happy.
It was missing some key functionality like sorting by dates but developers listened. Trust me, Todoist is worth the price!
Wish I had discovered this 2 years ago! Makes things easy to organize and keep track of things long term.
Unless you pay the substantial yearly fee for premium some very basic features are missing.
Plays well with a number of my other apps, especially Sunrise calendar and Amazon Echo.

Used it to keep up with my activities so I know what I need to complete. Perfect for keeping myself accountable. I do wish it could notify me on the times that I set a note for (call Adam @ 5pm; Todoist alarms at 5pm). Thank you developers of Todoist.
Can't really think of any other feature that needs to be added. Does a comprehensive Task Manager job for me.

Very smoothly designed application. Letting me know discreetly without me forgetting about what I need to do throughout the day. Very busy and use my phone for everything ?  This is the app perfect for the stock Android look and feel.
This is one of my most used apps on Android. Great app, thoughtful design, excellent functionality.
I like karma points. They provide motivation. Wish i could see done tasks for free
"Text Joseph at 8am tmrw"  And it knew what to do. Perfect app.

What works is great. But as others have said, basic functionality missing from free app (no reminders?) and $38 a year is a lot to pay for something that other apps offer for much less.
It keeps me focused and on track!
Brilliant app that is so simple to use but with all the features i require
A personalized blog post on the todoist blog about seasons and getting started upped my productivity just when I needed it so rather than  just four stars this app rates five stars from me.
Love this app and the latest update. Good speedy support if needed as well.

One of the best task managers around.  Good looking and efficient.  Plus it's on every platform and syncs perfectly. Awesome Web and email clippers. My one wish is for faster priority editing on mobile.  It's easier on a desktop but on mobile it's 5 taps.

I love being able to assign tasks from a to do list, communicate with the assigned person to answer questions or notate the work finished with my work colleagues. The ease of making a family project to keep track of lists besides groceries and gifts lists, but big pirchase goals. Some of my favorite features is the Karama points, which makes completing tasks even more satisfying. The email alerts, suggestions and daily digest is an awesome reminder without being too pushy. Love this app. A mist have!
I love this app and readily upgraded to premium within three days of downloading it to enjoy it fully.
