But unfortunately I share OmniFocus in apple's family plan... So I have to give it up. But I do love Todoist. But it sometimes makes me crazy with all those tasks coming after you. In OmniFocus you can defer or simply hide something not available now.

This app gets it. Has everything you need to be organized, and access to everything everywhere you need it. I use it specifically with the gmail plugin and chrome app on OSX, and Android app on a Nexus 5X. Never an issue with keeping everything in sync. Being a project manager that deals with a lot of software that manages projects and tasks, and has been exposed to a number of task managers, ToDoist is still the app I continue to use because it just works. It's perfect for what I do.

I have tryed several different to-do programs and was about to give up. Then on a last try I download this program and was simply amazed. This does everything I was looking for. And much more. The fact that you can input a task on one android device and it will update all your other devices, is too good to be true. I have finally found a simple easy to use application. I would urge everyone to give this a try, you will be amazed.

I am able to easily add new tasks and view my tasks.  Works consistently between the web site and the app.  The overdue and postpone features are handy.  It would be nice to have configurable lead in time based upon project or priority.  I.e. high priority starts to show up 4 days in advance.

A very functional app with very sleek and responsive interface. Absolutely loved premium features, shame it costs a lot now in Russia. Widget offers great functionality giving you ability to instantly add or manage tasks. 8 of 10 friends and colleagues on facebook use it too, so I would totally recommend it to anyone.

It's super convenient and efficient, but there's always a reoccuring bug that puts a negative on its productivity/efficiency. I use it as a widget and when I try to complete a task by tapping it, sometimes, the options do not come up on the bar. I have to open the app then complete it when I usually can just tap it done on the widget screen. Even when I go to the app to clear the task, the widget still shows the task. When I add a task, it doesn't appear. I've already tried removing and readding the widget.

I just started using ToDoist a few weeks ago, and now it's a huge part of my workflow. The organization structure of the app is fantastic and overall it's super useful. I wasn't terribly thrilled about having to pay money for a couple of the crucial features, but it is worth every penny. The way filters get created also sortof threw me off, but once you get used to the way their queries work, it's super easy.

Great app, could use a repeating dates feature I.e. Set a notification up for every Wednesday in a month other than that no issues p.s I think some of the issues raised in other comments have been adressed, so if they put you off check to make sure

I love the idea of todoist and the functionality provided, but sometimes I experience bugs where one part of the screen will get covered up by something else or pushed off the screen.  I've reported it once and was told it was told to use a work-around.  I'm not sure it has totally been resolved in all cases, but I appreciate the personalized response from support.

Works well across all my devices and sync is absolutely flawless. Better handling of subtasks would be helpful. The auto date feature is more of a hindrance than a help. Great to be able to look back at completed tasks and the notes facility for a task is well implemented.

I like the system. Very intuitive. You can have a full page on your phone...or not.  They have sort of karma point system...which i dont care about，but if you like giving purself motivational points then maybe it will be useful for you. The one thing i find missing is a recurrence option... I.e. if i know that i need to do something every 3 weeks... I have to separately put that in.

This one may seem better than most, but you still have to subscribe for basic to do list-esque things like reminders. I'm not paying 20 bucks a year so I can be reminded to do the things I need to do. I'll pay a one time fee for something like this (which feels like DLC), but I still won't like it.

I have used any.do before and while that is a good app, this app / service simply blows that away. I am much more productive using Todoist and simply cannot live without it. Paid for the premium service and never looked back, will definitely be renewing again and again. Keep it up guys!

I have been using it for almost two weeks and I notice I'm starting to get more things done. Start small, set dates and times, and don't worry if you can't make it all. If you want something done split it in small task and schedule it. Excellent tool.

Todoist has been helping me to be more productive by easily showing me what I need to get done in a day. It is easy to quickly postpone tasks in order to keep your list for the day manageable. Very slick interface and natural language parsing for task due dates. You can even do weird recurring events (every Tuesday, Thursday, sunday).

Using the premium version for a week now. Was previously using free version. I think it's a fantastic app, but only the premium version. Has lots of integrations (like with the CloudMagic email app, and a chrome desktop add-in). Very intuitive and seamless. Use Evernote for keeping reference material and a digitital file cabinet and use todoist to manage projects and tasks. Was previously using Asana, which is good for teams but a little clunky for individual users compared to todoist.

I've used this app for a while. I'm generally satisfied, but there is one thing that is really bugging me. Once I've completed a task, it disappears. I really want to be able to see tasks completed as well as tasks to do. I use the free version, but I can't see that paying for the pro version would make any difference. It's got the the point that I'm now looking for an alternative. And that's why I've downgraded my mark from 5 stars to 3.

This is one of the best list apps.  The screens are clearly laid out.  The interface is fast and intuitive.  I really like being able to prioritise my tasks and have priority flagged by colour.  The only changes I would suggest is that on entering new tasks, it would be better if it took you straight to the edit screen.  Also, being able to refer to dates in the subject line without automatically setting the task to that date.  But really, this is a great app, well worth a look.

Well designed, cross-platform app that is helping me gain a small sense of control over the things I have to do. This app stands apart from others in its ability to easily show what has been done (a critical element when used for business related activities).

This is the first to do list app that makes sense for my organizational style. Dig the recurring reminder (weird others don't offer this), plus the ability to integrate the app with other people is outstanding. I now have my boss trying it out for our company. Thanks for the Outlook add-in too. Keep the improvements coming!

It took a bit of time to get used to but now I love it. Learn the gestures for completing a task and how to move task to a different day and then the app is golden. Type in the day you want to put the task and p1, p2 etc to give it a priority on your list (out of 4). The karma rating in the emails are also kind of cool for tracking how productive you are at completing your tasks.

It has been a life saver for getting organized, especially at work. I love being able to create reoccurring tasks and not to have to rely on paper lists that get lost. And because it syncs across devices I don't have duplicate lists anymore either. Excellent app!

After trying a bunch of apps like this (including any.do, wunderlist, swipes), I chose this one for two simple reasons: it's good for teams, so you can assign tasks, and very good at scheduling, with the right level of obtrusion to make you more productive. IFTTT integration is also a remarkable plus for. If you need a little more features, you can try Producteev.

As ridiculous as it may sound for this app to be "life changing", it really has been lol. I have tried out a number of different programs to try and sync my calenders, tasks, etc. so that I would remember everything and be more organized between work and my personal life and nothing in my opinion has been so convenient. The ability to do what works best for you, combined with the simplicity of the app is why I love it. I could rant about it all day. Take a little time to really learn its capability,worth it

Don't listen to the bad reviews, give it a go, its simple, intuitive and really lifts the load of huge task backlogs. With various other apps to view your todoist tasks and Gmail integration even on the free version, it's the best task manager I've tried. Great for shared projects, and personal tasks, and and surprisingly good for shopping lists!

I've never been good at keeping lists, but this app helps me not only because it helps divide tasks into particular projects and gives prioritization ability, but also because it gives me points for completing things. I'm definitely more motivated when I can see my progress.

I'm a full time college student, and this app seriously has saved my life by helping me keep track of which assignments are due and what days/times they're due. I also love the cloud syncing of it, so that I can add tasks from my computer without having to worry about them not showing up on my phone. Two thumbs up!

Very easy to use app and extremely useful in keeping track of the different tasks I have during the day. One drawback which has to do with ToDo model in general is that tasks are perceived to be of interest on the day of use. However, often tasks require a considerable chunk of time to accomplish. Doing so requires looking ahead and although we can do this with ToDoist using reminders and the search bar, that methodology is not too user friendly. Better would be to have a countdown for specified tasks.

App has helped me a ton in staying organized and getting things done on time. Highly recommended. My only complaints are that scheduling a task for a specific date seems like it takes one or two steps too many, and the in-line parsing uses too common characters like hyphens. Features I'd like to see are pinned tasks for big tasks a few weeks in the future that I'd like to keep in the back of my mind, and the ability to apply a set of notifications to a label, instead of individually.

Haven't used the full paid app but not impressed at all with the "demo" of the free app. It doesn't even do the most basic things without asking you to pay.  I'd rather know what I'm paying for first thanks.

I had comments but Google play deleted my long responses, unprompted, twice. It boils down to reminders, $29 every stinking year just to unlock my much needed reminders, I don't need the other junk! Give me a $5 option for reminders only or something please! Otherwise. Great app in a very competitive market

I like the priority numbers we can assign to tasks. It wasn't easy for me to figure out right away, but within the day I got it. This new update is also very good. It is more straightforward now. I just would like it to be more straightforward to add subtasks while editing projects.

A bit more advanced and intuitive then Wunderlist! Pro version pricing is a bit steep however - even now more so! Maybe a middle pricing tier should be looked at, I don't use a lot of the pro features but just enough to make me purchase it. However $47 seems a lot of money for a years subscription (AUD)

I can get by with just the free version, but it's so awesome that I can't wait to see how well premium works for me. It's great to finally have a to do list with sub-tasks. I love the color coding options. I saw a previous review that said the app was "life-changing." I thought it was an obvious overstatement, but I completely get where this person was coming from now.  Having so many options to organize my thoughts has reduced my stress a lot over the last few days... And I'm still on the free version☺

This app has gotten so much better since the material design update, which led me to buy the full version. The only improvement for me is if the organisation of sub tasks could be made easier. Other than that, this is the best To Do app out there!

I love this app. It syncs to all my devices and I can share tasks or make notes on them. The trouble I had was getting the app to work on Windows. It wouldn't open and still won't. I have to use the website on my PC. Works fine on all my other devices.

I've been working a GTD workflow for a year with this app and have found it useful and reliable. It isn't bloated with features, but the main things are solid: multi-platform, sync, versatile reminders. The home screen widget is a critical feature for me. I also appreciate that Doist values my data as much as their own: the nightly backups are well worth the premium subscription. Any Sync/DB issues seem to be resolved. The UI is clean and easy to use — the material design update really improved that.

I've been a long time customer and the app has improved significantly over the years I've been with Todoist. It's clean, fast and has all the features I need. I look at other apps but always come back to this one

This app is well designed and great for keeping track of things you need to do. The only improvement I would make is to add a way to create recurring tasks that repeat daily, weekly, etc. That would make it 5 star.

There is just so much missing in the basic free version that i don't think, its an app i'd invest in long term.  Some must have features of task management are only available if you pay for it. Reminders, labels, etc are options that mandatory for a to do list. Then there are bugs. New Sub tasks cannot be added to tasks to first tasks if there are other tasks in the web app. So I add tasks and sub tasks on web app... Then go to app on phone and then move the tasks. I don't think ill use this much longer.

Have a filter for sub tasks. You've been asked this for a very long time and have had to take down the feedback forum owing to the volume of complaints. We know the official line very well - sub tasks may get missed; let us, the customers decide if that's a risk worth trading for a nested and neet filter view. JUST GET IT DONE TODOIST!!!!

I literally use and rely upon this app every day and overall it is very good. Recent months have brought increased stability and sync reliability among many bug fixes. I do wish they had not closed the support forum where users could interact and learn from and help each other--I quite miss that and my engagement with the app has tapered some. But I continue to use it as it is the best option out there for me and it's really quite good. Try it!

I had it at 5 stars, but after my free trial expired it wouldn't let me use comments anymore. That's fair, but it also blocks me from looking at my really important note comments I had written.   Edit: They replied and said that I can access them via the web so I've remade the 5 star rating!

Great interface, powerful features for organizing lists of to do's. Easy to use, syncs with their cloud service so it's accessible on all your devices. Lots of apps or add ons for various operating systems and programs. I like the quick entry of tasks with recognition of time/date. E.g. "Buy milk after work tomorrow" ends up on your tomorrow list. "Put out recycling every other Monday" ends up recurring every other from the Monday within the current week. Adjusting due date is simple if needed. Liking it!

The app is beautiful and is extremely user friendly, more so that the competition like wunderlust, gtasks, and others in that same category. However, even though this app is stunning, it's flawed. To unlock the most basic features you will have to pay $28.00 sub fee per year... Why would I do a sub when other apps can offer me the reminder function for free? Try again and maybe if you allow users for a one time payment it'll take off.

It helps me a lot in getting organised.  I have a terrible memory, so I just write any errands, books, shipping, anything really, that comes to my mind.  This way I never miss a detail. I recommend it for busy people who have to keep  lot of small errands in mind.

I think it could use more step-by-step instructions.  It is assuming that I know more than I do.  Maybe younger people with more tech savvy sail through this learning curve, but I am having trouble finding documentation on how to upload the program.

To me it's still the best to do list management app out there. Simple, clean and efficient. This coming from a geek with his finger on the pulse of tech and apps. Always looking if for the next best evolution. To me, not other app can compete on Todoists ability to quickly input a list of tasks. It's essential for be to insert quickly and have the task categorised and scheduled. Also, Doist should really write a book on how to properly sync data to the cloud. It's second go non.

I have always had difficulty keeping track of everything I needed to do. I have tried other solutions before and it took too much effort that I stopped using it. This system is great and I have it loaded on all my devices. I recommend this to anyone looking for help remembering all the tasks of the day.

Good app to get myself organised. Not sure if the karma points are necessary though. You can categorise your tasks and design your own categories too. Haven't tried the premium version or adding other people into my tasks.

All the features so far are very satisfying. I must bring to the light the fact that Todoist allows completed tasks to be displayed upon search  queries; something Wunderlist doesn't (and probably never will)! However I am hoping the Todoist customer support team to be much, much more active in responding. Feature request: Please allow indexing within the completed tasks and subtasks so that subtasks do not lose their index level upon completion. 5 stars rating awaits you. Thank you!

I chose this to do list because it can be very detailed, and I find that very useful. The only improvements I would think it needs is setting defaults for tasks, like what inbox it goes to, and who it's assigned to, it gets annoying having to choose all the settings every task I make. But this is still my favorite to do list!

Love the ability to sort your lists with priority and also with different labels which are available with the premium edition.  The repeating task functionality is great, although it helps having programming experience to use it.  Best To Do app I've used so far out of Trello, Any.do, To Do Reminder and Google Keep and is way better than paper or using a doc :)  Although I do still like to use Any.do for things I need pop up reminders for.  Also I like how much u can see at once with Google Keep.

Works as it should on all platforms. I have two missing features: 1) batch operations on many tasks is clunky because one needs to shift-click on every desired task - can't select a bunch at once; 2) I'd like easier access, review, and management of completed tasks. Otherwise, an excellent app.

I've reviewed a lot of to do list makers, but this one takes the cake. I can even use it as an add on to chrome which I love. The only thing I'd change is that uncompleted tasks become "overdue". But that's a personal preference :) great app

I have been using this app for a few years now and love how intuitive it is to use and how beautifully it can clearly present information in a small area. Some things I'd like to see are perhaps a workflow/pipeline mode where you can switch your tasks between the current "classic" view (I.e. listed top to bottom) to a left to right "progress view" where you can define progress stages in columns and drag your tasks to the appropriate stage you've taken them to (a bit like what you can do in trello).

So fast the best task manager I came across. Simple and easy to use. The only thing that disappoints it it's a little too money oriented. The free plan is very limited compared to options and features offered by other similar apps.

I have had so many to do apps and I never seem to be able to actually get anything done because I would never open the app up. But not anymore with this app is check it daily and actually can set goals for how many tasks I want to complete each day. Then I have the chance to reach different levels by consistently hitting my daily goal of completed tasks. So not only am I finally getting things done but I get to challenge myself at the same time. This app and my Erin Condren planner are LIFE SAVERS.

Hate the super sized fonts and not keen on the changes to the layout. The fact that new tasks have pretend text in them is really distracting. I use to like it's simplicity and functionality, this version is step backwards. Sad that the developers don't seem to care about users views.
The best to do app I had so far. It can be very simple for not high demanding users and also can be used by hard users like me (keyboard shortcuts, creating many sub-projects and sub-tasks).

Pros: Best to do productivity app I've found. Quick entry, easy to organize.  Recommend company's blog for information on organization and tips. Installed on mobile, desktop and chrome plug in. Syncs nicely between platforms. User interface is clean and intuitive, well designed. Cons: Few problems with reoccurring projects dissapearing after marking off. Sub-lists seperating into new projects/projects being duplicated after altering sublists (user error?). Doesn't play nice w/Zapier & IFTTT recipies.

The app is a good complement to the desktop extension for Chrome.  UI is simple and intuitive.  Most of what I want on a smartphone. It integrates perfectly with my laptop, the laptop UI enables to link emails to the tasks.  A good buy, as premium is recommended. Something missing is the ability to link a contact to a task, as currently this is limited to emails and websites

Was always hesitant to try a monthly subscription for a tasks app - got 6 months free thru a third party and so far am thinking might renew. Solid task manager, and integration with other apps is quite good (and seems to be getting better.) Sometimes maybe you do get what you pay for?

Great app exactly what I wanted....I just wish it had alarms to remind me of the tasks I have set that have a time ...notifications become lost with all of them and do not continually remind you until you complete your task.
I just wish that some of the tabs that the premiums have were free. But I still love the app so far, today's my third day using it so I'm kind of pretty hyped-up about it. 😁👍💯

I've had a Todoist account for over a year now. I used it 3-4 times originally. I was recently beginning to get overwhelmed with law school and I was tired of adding simple tasks (reading for a particular class, a particular assignment, place to be, etc) to my full calendar since it was very time consuming. I relaunched Todoist and I am able to keep everything so organized and on track. It has been extremely helpful because it works across Android, iOS, and Windows. Thank you. I highly recommend it!

Love the shortcuts, labels, and prioritization tags. I've added my own time tags so I can easily see if I have more tasks than time on a day. It'd be nice to be able to hide tasks that are recurring or scheduled into the future when looking at a "project". The list gets long. Not a deal breaker for me. Great app and great web interface! Migrated from Simpleology which was very effective but ugly.
I am enjoying this app so far. Quick, simple and very clean processes without any extra raff and the perfect tool for getting things done it's improved my productivity by quite a bit :)

A "to do" list with no reminders? Free apps like Wunderlist, Google Keep, and Evernote are cross-platform and allow reminders and recurring tasks. Todoist looks beautiful, integrates with Outlook, Gmail, etc and the pro version looks really inviting. However I don't see enough separation to justify the relatively high price.

Having bounced between a few alternative to-do list applications, I've comfortably settled down with Todoist. No other app I've seen thus far has all the features I would consider mandatory: list sub-items, sync between devices, and an Android widget. I'd have happily paid for these features, and you're telling me they're so basic that they're FREE on Todoist? Dang, son. You crazy kids must be some kinda new-age philanthropists.

Use it everyday.  Very practical and so easy-to-use.  Very little learning curve.  Good reminders.  Lets you group tasks by project,  comment, and share.  The project organization works well because you can have subprojects.  Not a complicated project manager but more powerful than just a to-do list.  Only drawbacks are that you can't assign tasks and there are only two choices - completed and pending.  It would be useful to have "in progress," "canceled," etc.

Much faster. I can set recurring events really easily; I typed in "mow my lawn every other Thursday starting tomorrow" and it totally worked. However, I have one big suggestion that will make the difference between me using this app for everything and using this app in addition to others. I think time periods need to be integrated in. The app is fantastic now, but if I could type in "work tomorrow, 1pm-10pm" and then it goes up as a time period rather than a single task, this could replace my calendar.

Fast and simple. That's enough of a reason to use it. No clutter and overload on features. Just add swipe add swipe. It's Great. Though I'd like it if there was an easier way to adjust the priority of tasks without having to enter the full edit window.

Been using prem vsn for years.  As a possessed list-maker, I love the seamless usage between tablet, laptop, smartphone, iPad.  Does everything.  But recent "improvements" are not so great - wierd colors on priorities, changing text into due dates, search function change.  Still, cant do without it.  Thank you!

This is by far the most user friendly to do app that I've used, and I've used plenty. My favorite thing is how easy it is to enter tasks and due dates. I can just type in 'due tomorrow' and it'll set it for that day, instead of going through the hassle of flipping through a calendar for each task. It saves so much time when entering a lot of tasks. I paid for premium, and I think it's worth it. I love being able to sort things by label and filter. There are so many combos of filters that you can create, it lets me customize my lists for my own needs. Your app is great. Keep making awesome things!

Been a subscriber for a year to the premium. Really love the design. One problem I have is the inability to enter projects when a new task is created. I use projects heavily and if I create a task in the inbox I need to go back into the task and assign it to a project. Kinda annoying. Other than that it is good. Not sure I will renew subscription yet.

Nice and friendly, and I appreciate the little shots of dopamine this app encourages, it makes completing the mundane a little more interesting. As a result I'm way more organised. Oh and the karma levels make me feel like the Buddha, that's always good too.

This is a great task manager that works nicely with other platforms and apps. I was searching for a task manager that works great with Evernote and Toggl so it streamlines my GTD process. It also integrates with Outlook and Gmail so I can quickly create tasks based on emails and attach them  without having to leave the email client! I took out 1 star because I had to buy the premium subscription to be able to use some of the features that I believe should be in the free version.
I understand that to do list keeps you organized, but you can get all the paid features in free apps. True it takes some digging around, but its not worth 1800 for a year. Uninstalling now
Lack of elementar features. Bad designed. Hard to make any simple action. No date selector. Unavailable add subtasks. Unavailable see more than 7 days ahead.

These jerksoff spam your email!!....edit: i did not op-in! What the heck type of attitude is that? Dont spam me man! Got it? You sent me multiple unsolicited junk mails to me within hours!! That is the definition of spam. So.. stop! I deleted your app. Me downloading was not an invitation to spam my mailbox. If i could give negative 500 rating i would for this terrible attitude. Thats like thinking its ok to steal a car because the owner didnt say you couldn't..  stop being spammers. Thank you.

(Subscriber) super satisfied. The most functional way to manage tasks with plenty of ways to organize your tasks plus time based and location based reminders and psychological points system to keep you motivated.  Difficulty of Use: Medium

Need to spend a bit more time sorting out the notifications, great to be able to set location specific reminders in the paid version, but don't seem to actually remind me when I get there! Very useful in general and is proving a valuable part of my daily work flow. To be able to link Evernote notes on reminders would be great, could add the Evernote email address every time but a bit long winded process.

For what it does it's a pretty good app, but the reminder functionality (one reminder for all tasks daily) is next to useless for me. Give me per task reminders that can be customized or snoozed and I'll be thrilled!
Either the desktop/web version is too amazing or the app is not so great cause I really don't like using it. I wish it was more intuitive, everything is too many taps away and there's no drag & drop.

This app is BEYOND what I expected. I am sitting here in disbelief. I was doing homework, and it popped up. This the best app for keeping your life together!  Go ahead and download this NOW, I promise you, it will not upset you. The app is PERFECT FOR ME.This whole App is perfect from the name of the app, to the way it is set up to use, EVERYTHING! It is like an ideal to-do list that I would make if it were me. I will be thinking about purchasing the premium!!!! Thank you Todoist!

Beautiful UI. The UX could be better... for e.g.. two clicks to enter a custom date/time for tasks. What is annoying is that some really basic features like finding completed tasks are either hidden somewhere I can't find it requires a premium upgrade.

Very easy to use app. Started using it at the recommendation of Tim Challies in his book Do More Better. However, I miss the feature from TeuxDeux that automatically rolls an uncompleted task over to the next day. I would love to see this option added.
It actually took more effort to ignore my task than to do them. Fantastic tool. It's the only todo list app i now use

Too many spaces to ad your to do list. I felt confused on which area to keep my lists. Could just be me. I hope others who currently use this app understand it and those who are just beginning to us this app have better luck then me.

I just loved this app. Free 1 month premium trial. However paying 30$ per year just for an app is little expensive to me.                                    Had it offered premium for like earlier WhatsApp rate I would have straight away bought it for 5 years.

Coming from someone with ADD this has changed my life in terms of time management and productivity further then any other app I have tried. Simple to use but keep digging and you will find tones of features to use.
My favorite task management app. It's efficient and easy to use with alot of features that make it a prime chose for daily use.
Best of all the apps that I've tried. Simple to use and segregate work/home/shopping so it's easy to keep on top of things without getting unnessary information. Highly recommend.
I can't survive without it. Not always intuitive, but once you've used it for a week it will be indispensable. They are always improving the interface and it is way better than 6 months ago.

Couldn't ask for a more lightweight capture system. I mainly use Todoist quickly capture tasks and information throughout the day with ease and speed. It works wonderfully offline as well which is the biggest thing for me.
Natural language input for dates and labels,  all my devices,  seamless sync and powerful filters
It is great to be able to just type and add to do items, and then tick them off once completed, on any of my devices.
Although it is super simple, it's nice to be able to make a list of things to do effectively, and even with the reminders of overdue tasks, it pushes you to do them; which is great
So I had a little bug and rated it 2 stars... within 24 hours I got an email from todoist on how to solve it step by step. I love the app and also it's awesome creators 😉👌

Great app, i really enjoy it, but, i do not like create new task interface. It is not convenient to slide up and down with changing text size in order to find reminders option or due date option. Therefore, i give 4
Notifications could be better. Anydo has much better integration with Android. Plus I can't schedule nothing for repeat
I've used a lot of todo list apps and have settled on Todoist for its simplicity. It has just the right blend of flexibility and function.
I appreciate the easy to use interface and the satisfying swipe to complete tasks. Would like the ability to skin the widget to match my calendar.

I'm uninstalling this disgusting App, which don't have any good feature for free. Every basic features need you to upgrade the app, it's sucking too much battery as 🔋 consumption is 9-11%. And also this App expands to bloody 65.5 Mb & consuming 200mb of RAM …!!

Only thing I would add would be that when you select a Level 0 project, it shows you how many tasks you have in sub-levels / total number of tasks, WITHOUT having to use the labelling system, which just takes extra steps.

Still getting used to the scheduling keywords... but since they have an article explaining it, thats cool. I have used it all week and love mostly the ability to create repeating tasks, and to sort all of your tasks by day... or by project.
The best for actually doing things. Karma system motivates you. Adding notes and being able to set as done activities in the past would be great.

I can finally see all my mental to-dos on one place, and when I see how overwhelming they are, I can easily spread things out over a week or month. I'm actually getting stuff done rather than being paralyzed by always having too much to do.

There are only a few premium features I have to have. The rest are all extras that clutter things up for me. Because of that, the price is uncomfortably high. Would love to see ala carte premium features.
Has allowed me to track actions of multiple deliverables and keep track of progress. Helps keep me from letting things fall through the cracks.
it does exactly what it should without making you walk the extra mile to do it... the notifications based on location are awesome
I use it everyday. Nice for organizing multiple events. The free version of this is perfect. No need to buy the paid version unless you are extremely busy.
This helps extend the infrastructure of Todoist to perhaps its most useful platform. Bug free so far and intuitive ux.
Todoist has basically replaced my short-term memory. It can be used in so many different ways. Find a workflow that works for you and you'll never turn back.
This is most likely the easiest app of this class to use. The interface is intuitive and the multiple platform support is awesome.

Exactly what I wanted. For a free organizer it really gives a lot. The karma feature is a nice motivation. I would like an option with a status icon that permanently shows the progress of the day, with this the reminders would be unnecessary.
I've used premium for a few years now. It is an excellent product. I am not a power user, but I understand all of it's features. It is available on many platforms. It is powerfully simple.

This is a fantastic, simple, clean task list app. I like that it syncs between the app and computer desktop, browser, etc. Nice intuitive features include recurring tasks, delaying a task until tomorrow or next week with the click of an icon, and many more. Great app!
This app is among the best productivity apps I have used. Be sure to read the manual to figure all the neat little tricks.

Really amazing app. Increases personal productivity and never lets you 
forget about important things. I started off with the basic version and 
have recently upgraded to the premium one and I have to say it's been 
surprisingly good so far.
I love this app but I really wish we could change the spacing between tasks. There is way too much and it doesn't feel minimal when it could be.

I've tried several time management systems and tools, but none seemed to work for me, until I found this one. I love that I can access my task list from all the devices I use, whereever I go, that I can group tasks by project, and assign priority levels.
Does exactly what it says. The free tier is a little nerfed IMHO, but the IFTTT integration makes this a no-brainer.

Multiple platform use is seamless, layout is so easy to use. Entering an item to do in advance is difficult. So if I want to get item for Wed and item for Tues done on Mon my list  items are auto corrected away.
It's great on all my devices and my computer. It also works for me better than the Apple To Do List
I really need a to do list manager because I'm involved in multiple activities that are time intensive. This app handles them all with ease. Well worth the price.
When I first installed this app last year, it was bothersome. They have found the balance with reminders.

So useful, and intuitive. I constantly use it, all day. The widget is one of the best I've ever seen. It's pretty unfortunate that the paid version is monthly though. One solid payment would be more attractive, I think.

The interface is simple, so it works just fine. I like using it but tempted to look elsewhere because the upgrade to a 30€ per year is just exaggerated! Upgrade for what anyway? HOW CAN I STOP app from sending emails to my account?
I like this app. I still have to figure some things out but either way it's a good app.

The website is good - lots of functionality. Unfortunately the app is awful. Most of the useful features are missing. I have no clue which functions work or don't. I just tried to drag a task to be a subtask of another in the app - somehow it ended up deleting the other 5 subtasks instead. This is the last thing you need - there's certainly no way to retrieve them on the app, fingers crossed I can find them on the website. Other obvious missing features are a way to sort tasks (again I had to sort on web)

Cannot view tasks that were checked off... I accidentally checked some off and couldn't add them back, or reflect on the day and what was accomplished. Won't use this app mainly because of that.  I was using the free version

The application really is helpful simple to use and helps alot, wish there was less menus like today this week and stuff like that just cause with the projects folders it starts to look messy and over complicates things but other than that really worth it.
Great app. It was easy to get started and has plenty of features for power users. Support were nice, quick and helpful.
Everything awesome. Moto e. My phone never been so useful before. Even with virtual assistants.
The best to do app out there. keeps you going with some innovative features.  Premium gives you a lot more features for a very reasonable price.

I used omnifocus on my mac for a long time but had a Nexus 6p. I realized that I needed something that was multiplatform. So todoist was perfect for that. It's simpler than omnifocus but has all the power. Great app 10/10 would r8 again.

There are things that I love about this app, like the karma bit. However, the subtasks are not as easy to follow on the app as the desktop or Web version. I wish it were easier to see the hierarchy on the app.
The projects feature lets me be even more organized but dividing my tasks how I want. I struggled to find this option in other similar apps.
I've tried a bunch of todo apps before,  but none stuck. Thanks to the amazing widget,  I'm still using this one weeks later.
Even the free version has no annoying nags or adverts.  Very good.  Thanks.
This has really helped manage tasks between my manager and me. The only thing I'd like to see is more automation to set tasks based on email content.
Very intuitive and easy to understand interface, and syncs well across all devices. A can't live without app.
It needs an option for deadlines and add things to do in events in Google Calendar. Give alerts too.
I am still a new user; but i like that it reminds you you with an email with a daily listing of uncompleted tasks. Will download onto my tablet and hope the cell and tablet sync.
While it has a few quirks, I find the free version pretty good. I just moved all my tasks out of WorkFlowy and left info and far future projects there. I like the 7 day view.
I honestly couldn't function without this thing, I remember so much more and achieve so much more thanks to todoist!

Best task list app. Just a suggestion. Maybe make different priorities or projects more obvious such as changing the colour of the whole task instead of just a small dot or the thin colour bar on the side.
Helps me schedule future items I need to complete. I like earning karma points. I wish it Would let me categorize different areas of my life.

After trying Trello and Any.do (and a couple of "lesser" apps), and trying them seriously, for months, with dozens of tasks I find Todoist the best one for high volume, fast processing of tasks in demanding environments where prioritisation is unpredictable and highly changeable.
Overall good, but when clicking on the back button of my phone the app closes. It is really annoying. Please fix!
All the different views, lists, by date, projects, etc. No wonder I could not stay organized before. This app keeps this unorganized person very organized and on schedule!
I have been waiting a long time for a to-do list program like this. It is really well thought out and works seamlessly between platforms. Well done!
If only better RTL languages support  (like Hebrew), would have given a 5 star ranking
It's really helping me track my days. I am much more organized than i was before this . I am getting a lot done.

Some apps better than this. According to your reply, you want to know the features... Firstly, while scheduling, I need to touch screen 7-8 times. Second It's showing that you are done for today but what's next? For that i need to go for next 7 days by 3 touches!
Excellent, intuitive and effective. I love this app. Simply amazing for organizing. Especially bc you can upload documents and tag emails
The premium is definitely worth it. If you're into GTD, this is a great app that syncs seamlessly between platforms, is useful, and very intuitive.
Prefect. Just bring your price down ALOT for the premium service

Excellent ecosystem of apps. They have the simplest UI, and do exactly what you want them to do. The natural language processing involved is sophisticated and smart. Excellent app - I kinda feel handicapped without it.
Best todo app. I use the Web version for work and the Android app at home. The karma points makes it even more interesting to use.. :)
All the features you could ever need - at a price. I use this app all the time as a student, it would be great if you could offer an educational discount.

I like it, but the free version is lacking some of the most basic components...like Google calendar synchronization. A notification reminder that I have to pay for? Puh-leeze!  The premium version is almost $30 PER YEAR???  Nah...definitely not worth it. Just to get some color options and a notification? Nope. If anything, should be a flat cost to upgrade. Better options out there.
I think subscritption for a year is pricey. Id prefer to try it for a shorter period.

Works well.  Had some difficulty getting it to do what I wanted it to do at first but then I figured out how to use filters.  Also had to ask support for help with something and they got right back to me.
The project feature helps to organize your personal tasks. Also I love the priority feature, it reminds you the most important things to do first.
Just starting using it and I love that it's cross platform. From my desktop to my tablet and phone, all synced up. Awesome.
Started using for not only simple tasks to do but family projects and reminders as well. Handy lists synchronised on all our devices. Thanks.
Couldn't go from day to day without this app to organise my life. Just needs an easier way to move todos into projects while creating them and it's perfect.
you can make a task but cannot set up reminder for this task unless I upgrade to pro which makes it useless.
I have been using it for over a year now.  I am so grateful o he team for the awesome work. Todoist is helping me reaching my goals everyday. I love it.
Has easily categorised groups and shortcuts. You can have things on repeat in unique patterns and it totally gets it!
After some time of usage I would say that balance of free/paid features is a bit unfair and I missing reminders in free version.
Overall a good app to help u organize and remind important tasks. However couldn't find a feature to set recurring tasks which is needed sometimes.
Just an app to keep myself organized. The aesthetics aren't bad but nothing about this app makes me want to shout it from the rooftops.
Just works and its free. If you want more advanced features you have to pay....but the free version is plenty capable.
Easy to use while keeping several projects going at the same time, from groceries lists to work projects to errands. Quick to note  something when you think of it and reordered it at a later time.
It allows you to personalize the way you want to, has a great widget and the notifications doesn't interrupt whatever you're doing.

Great app to keep everything organized. I love that it integrates into Microsoft outlook in windows and works across all platforms. Also easy to share lists with others using the app so you can have a family shopping list for example. I wish some of the premium features were available for free but the developers gotta eat I guess.
The app is good but it's a little inconvenient. I have to add the task on today's date and then manually change it in details.
Wish the reminder (alarm) feature is available in the free mode. Other calendar apps have similar memo + reminder features.
Lack some features like start date, task/project description, but works well enough.
App is useful for keeping track of tasks. But daily emails are a bit nagging. Not sure I've familiarised myself with all the features yet so may be a better app than I think.
Can't repeat routine tasks automatically without paying, but this gets the jobs done.  Can set up to 4 priorities.

Nice and decently versatile interface. I really like the multi-level task tracking and the different notification systems. I would suggest allowing for military time when putting in due dates and reminders though.
I should give this 5 stars, but selfishly, I'm still waiting for the Evernote integration that was in dev a while back. Still...ALMOST perfect!
Great simple lists and can be scaled up for larger projects using gtd methodologies. Been using this for over 2 years now and can't go back.
It's great and I love how it syncs between my phone and my laptop. The encouraging notes when I tick off tasks are my favorite feature!
Love that it is pretty much cross platform making my to-do list accessible everywhere.
I'd pay for pro but feel the price is a bit steep. I'd much prefer a monthly payment option
The free version doesn't even have basic features such as setting reminders.

This is the first to do list that has actually assisted in my productivity. I never thought I would give up my paper lists, but I think ToDoist has done it for me.   It would be awesome to see some different views available, like a tile view of the projects to quickly see a few at the same time. Also, a quick notes area could be nice.
Great to-do app but some features like notes and tags that feel fundamental require sub.
Need to move items from one list to another. However, I haven't figured out how to do that yet. If it were more intuitive, assuming it can be done, I would give the program a 5 star rating.
Finding it very helpful in keeping me organized and having it on my Windows desktop, Android phone and my Chromebook makes it perfect!
Perfect for the procrastinator type.. Add a due date, or not, how you handle your to dos is your business! Lots of options in the free version. Definitely gonna buy the full version soon!
I wasnt able to keep up with anything. Ive tried sticky notes, notepads, calanders. Nothings works as good as this app!
If you are like me that need a little nudge to get things done then this is for you. Also it work as a place where I stores my quick thoughts and ideas that I could work on later.

Amazingly design, but basic features intentionally crippled in favor of the premium app.  Reminders are an incredibly important feature to any app, especially one where notifications are hit or miss.  I have yet to get a notification when any task was coming due.
I've been using this app for over an year. This is one of those apps that has become an habit of mine. This is revolutionary. Not the idea, the implementation
This app helps me remember, order and check off what I've done. Recurring tasks are really helpful too
It the best app to remind and keep things on track. Very very strongly recommending for reminding day to day task with option to share it with other concern people related to it.
This app is really great and helps me coordinate with my boyfriends better. Easy 5 stars. Would recommend to anyone

After trying dozens of todo apps, Todoist ended up as the absolute winner for me. It has all the features that is needed for managing tasks, works on every platform with a slick UI and comes with a very reasonable price tag.
No qualms about the app so far except for the steep price for premium. I definitely would buy the premium version if it wasn't  $20/year
The app seem simple but I have had hard time and still couldn't find a way to delete a project. This should be easy
Just helps me get stuff done, because I love checking things off
Why can't we carry out tasks in batch. Change priority levels in batch, assign to projects in batch? These should be what you should focus on first
Love that it gives me feed back, I can make list with sub lists, color code and label. It gives me reminders each day..great app

The usability is very good.  The email style to do handling is new to me but turns out quite effective.  If have to blame I wish there's more feature open for free version.  But without them it is still the best to do app I've used.

Tried many task app and I've found to doing to be the best. Synced online gives me the same updated copy anywhere. It has the 2 different recurring date feature "every" and "after". Postponing recurring task works as you think it should which is a constant pain point in other to do app. Tried the premium version for  year but the free version I found was sufficient for me.

So far I like it. Suggestions: I don't like the way the indent feature works on android and I would like an improved interface for scheduling recurring tasks instead of having to type out the whole keywords "every" and day of week. Right now the ios interface is better than android although I am on my android more often.

I've been using this app for almost a year and having the premium version, made me love it more. However, since I got my new phone(samsung galaxy note 5), the notification alerts stopped popping up unless the phone is being actively used. Reminders are very important in a to-do list app, if it doesn't get fixed soon, I don't think I'll be renewing my premium  account.

Overall i like the app a lot. Todoist is the only solution I've found that syncs with both my phone and my macbook, and also with Google calendar.  However the Android widget needs some work.  It wastes a lot of empty space and there's no way to show upcoming tasks without dividers (date, task type) between each.

Have used various cloud solutions for syncing task lists across different devices, all of my devices use different operating systems which has proved to be an issue with other cloud based todo lists. None even come close to offering the same features and simplicity that todoist has

This is one of the best "to do" apps I have found. The free version works just fine for my needs and there's no way I'd sign up for a subscription for this. That's crazy & too expensive. Really nice interface though, except the scheduling part. Its too complicated to have type in each day I want it to repeat. Just give me plain old checkboxes with each day of the week. Also a pull down that I can assign the task weekly, every 2 weeks, monthly, etc. And a scroller for the time. That would make it a 5 star.

Simple user interface but gets more in depth if needed.  The desktop/mobile combination is incredible, and one of the reasons I switched to Todoist. $30/year is a lot of money, but for right now, I'm willing to pay since it has made organizing for big events much easier. It would be nice if it had a little more flair, but I'm glad they got the app right instead of focusing on the look first then leaving the app a little weak like Wunderlist. Also, I love how I can add tasks right from my watch, huge plus!
Still working to learn the system to make entering subprojects, tasks,  and subtasks efficient. Not as simple or intuitive as I'd have hoped, but a solid app with great functionality otherwise.

So far I'm loving it. I was looking for a to do list app with a simple yet usuful widget that shows my to do list simply and so far this seems to be it. Great. Probably the best to do list app out there right now.

There are still few annoyances.           1. For example a label can not be changed/edited once you add a label.     to a task.                                                   2. Location based reminders do not work every time.                                     3. No category wise view available
Well designed, simple apps that have power user options integrated should you needed it. Best of the lot so far, and I've tried alot
I rely on this app to track my tasks at work on outlook, on my personal Gmail account and on my android. Works seamlessly across all platforms.
For me the simplicity of this to-do list app is a real time saver allowing me to manage all aspects of my busy life.
Would love a place to request features however. Like a monthly/weekly calendar display of events for project planning.

I just started using it last week but it's extremely efficient to have a to do list where each item can be updated individually.   Started reading Getting Things Done and this is the perfect companion app so far.
I've used a few applications of this kind.  I like Todoist because of all the features I get with the free version - especially the reocurring tasks.

The app is easy to use I like how I can work with others on projects with this app.  It seems stable and looks nice.  It is all I want in a todo list.  I am not really a fan of subscriptions and would like to be able to just purchase it but that's OK for me.
Love Todoist. I've tried tons of others but I always want to come back to this one. Well done.
Helps me keep track of every the.  Despite a hectic schedule planned the task list always looks neat and is easy to read. Gentle learning curve. Very user friendly. Great job!
I've been using the app for a couple days now, not user friendly, have to fumble through to figure out how it works.  Wish it would automatically sync to watch.

The free app is great. Doesn't complete your tasks for you, but it's the next best thing. Wish the premium was a one time purchase or that there were levels of purchase. Not sure if it would be worth it for me.
I've used a lot of todo applications, abd this is by far the best. I even paid for the premium account, and I rarely spend money on apps :)
I download this before. But i deleted cause i think i can't. But now, it's time to change myself. I believe that i can do this. Thank you ToDoList.

One thing its missing 4 me. Googlekeep lets you paste a paragraph and convert each break line to a new todo. Is great when wife messages you a large grocery list and dont have to input one at a time. Other than that I like the app. :)
I love to try different apps and saas and I have very high standards, but this one is really one of my favorites.

A very useful app that helps me to accomplish and not to miss my goals. Together with the web access provides a clear and effective view of my tasks. I love the Today view - the other apps miss that basic but absolutely important presentation of the todos. I bought the premium and now I have a complete life changing software.
I like how easy I can add projects and change its order, hierarchy and keep up with everything. I love to sync with browser version. Clear visualization helps task assimilation. Well done.
Good app, and my only current complaint is that if I don't pick a default reminder time it takes a while to set that. Otherwise a great app.
I live the simple to use interface and the ability to scheduled my tasks. The email reminders are a nice added touch.
I really want to like this app. The widget is good. But I really don't like how difficult it is to view completed tasks. Maybe paid version is better, but will try others first.
Overall very useful app. My only suggestion for improvement would be to reduce the steps it takes to add reminders etc.

Not the most intuitive, it's a bit if an acquired taste :)
I looked at many other apps, which are confusing and take awhile to get used to . This app is very easy to use. Love it!
I love the simple, but powerful interface. The cross-platform support is also very nice. I switch between an Android phone and Outlook PC throughout the day pretty seamlessly.
Great app for highly effective people! I wonder if this app can connect to google calendar so the tasks will also appear in calendar. Or maybe the the calendar display :)

I like this app for the most part. The areas that need improvement is when adding a task there should ask for what day. The home screen would be more useful if it showed the upcoming week and finally not receiving emails every day!
