Have been using app for a few days now. I like it so far but have not used all of its features. I love being able to sync with other devices.  Update: it has been nearly a year now that I have been using the app. I have upgraded to premium version mainly in appreciation to the developer.  I now find I use the app more than my calendar.  I receive reminders which are not annoying and it is easy to add items quickly.

Absolutely love how flexible this app is for to dos. You can keep things really basic and simple or get as complex as you like with adding tags etc. Would love to be able to change the priority, project, etc. of multiple selected to dos at the same time. Changing these properties on each individual task at a time can get tedious.

As many others, I like simple surface and it feels like the app can make me get my things done better than other methods I have tried. I am on trial for the premium version and think I might go for it when the free month is over, mostly for I do not want to have any limitations, and also because I think that paying for it will make me use it, and that might pay off quickly. Some things can be improved, though.

Still not perfect, but the best solution overall for my daily doing and it's constantly improving. Shortcuts and autocomplete are real time savers and sync across devices is flawless. Subtasks are still not handled well, though, as these are sometimes not directly connected to their parent tasks, which may lead to separation when changing due dates.

I was looking forward to using this app and exploring it's potential. Unfortunately, premium functions are unavailable to even test.  Instead of trying them, liking them, and deciding to upgrade... I feel as though I've been forced to go with a different app simply because I don't know how this one would help me. This approach really doesn't serve them well at all.

Talk about organization and productivity. I love this app! So accessible and it can load on my google chrome and anywhere else I need it. (Ex. Just in case my phone is occupied by my daughter watching movies I can still see and complete my tasks.) My to do list can never get lost on a scrap of paper i used to write a quick note. The more I use it the more I'll know about all the features it offers to increase my productivity.

I think that is the thing I like about Todoist the most: it's a perfect tool for capturing items on the fly GTD style, but scalable enough to take on major projects. It has a wide range of applications: I use it on my android, inside my chrome browser, and even on my Windows desktop. Sleek, fast, and very easy to use.

Amazing app. Easy on the eyes design and the ease of navigating through the UI is what makes the app the best. It's just the best To-Do app that I've mange to find. There are a few problems that I personally have such as making tasks that have no date nor time appear somewhere I can remember. I'm sure that the premium version has a solution for these kind of tasks. Other than that small issue, the app never fails at making my day as productive as possible.

I've tried other ways to keep track of the myriad tasks I need to get done each day. This is the best, by far. It's easy to jot a note when I notice an issue I must address or an action item I have to do. Then, it shows up where I need it on the device - MacBook, Windows desktop, Android phone, or iPad - I'm using at the moment. It's interface is intuitive. Even better, the tracking features make it easy for me to get and stay motivated.

The biggest benefit to the app is its simple, light weight but comprehensive enough to meet the average Joe's needs.   I use it daily, love the quick add pull down. The plain English date setting feature is also a plus. Only thing I want is more evernote integration.

Works seamlessly across Mac and Android devices, updating within seconds. Nice scheduling shortcuts to speed up setting deadlines. Adding sub-tasks can be a bit clunky and awkward in the Mac app - no direct way of adding except new task, then indenting (much better in Android app). Overall pretty good.

I've been a Toodledo user on iPhone for years, but recently switched to Android and found the Toodledo Android app to be completely unreliable. I'm actually glad, because Todoist is far superior to Toodledo for task management. I've not only replaced Toodledo for personal tasks, but also Asana for collaborating and Outlook tasks at work. Todoist does it all, and it does it beautifully. Totally worth the annual fee.

I was using Google Keep to stay on top of tasks at work, but using this is a bit better in a few ways (in particular, the Windows program isn't just an embedded Chrome application, meaning my desktop arranging software knows how to open it correctly). Great alternative. Does all I need it to at this point in time. Being multiplatform is also a huge plus.

I haven't used it more than a week so far but it seems to be doing what I wwnt - reminding me of my to do list. It is pretty simple but I almost wish there was a tutorial because some things like 'karma' don't make sense. Otherwise it's nice!

Works flawlessly. Because it syncs so quickly accross my three devices (android tab, iphone, pc)  I use it not only for tasks, but also for reference data (using "Notes")  that i might need quickly on one or another device . Very easy to customize and use. "Labels", Filters" and Search cababilities are especially useful.

I love using this app! However I'm currently using a OnePlus X and every time I try to add a task it tells me that projects can't have more than 200 tasks. I've never end encountered this issue before on other Android or ios devices. Not sure if it's an phone specific bug or not.

Great job on bells and whistles, but comes up short on fundamentals:  all tasks must be assigned to the inbox or a project (special purpose lists must be projects); no bulk edits; data cannot be exported.  This is just a front end to the web app.  The free version is useless; you will have to pay the annual fee.

So far this app has helpedme keep track of the myriad of day to dayy tasks I have to do. Not really into the karma points system but I suppose it can be a motivator... I'll upgrade shortly and see how the full package works

This is a great to do app. It has all the functionality with time or location based reminders, reoccurring tasks, projects, lists and possibly best of all, if you do get stuck, find a problem or just need a hand with the app, the support you get is first class. I'm on my second year of premium subscription now which probably speaks more than me banging on about features.

I hardly ever take the time to rate an app, cause let's face it, who wants to take the time? I had to rate Todoist because it really is that good. I've used a lot of to do type apps over the years and never keep using. It's been a couple of years, so thought I'd try again, with one major requirement, it had to work across my iPad, Android phone, and Win desktop computer. I paid for Todoist to get at all the features and wow! So quick to enter a task. You can just type "sign contract tom at 5" and its done!

Clean, powerful, cross-platform and actively maintained. The android app (one of the many platforms, and they all sync seamlessly) makes full use of your device abilities. You may attach photos to the tasks, use location-based notifications, or display a widget with a certain view of tasks.  I used to rate it 5 stars, but now I think I would look for an alternative if I was to start over again. The company in recent months introduced features that break the functionality (like the input control in web interface that have problem with long descriptions or heuristic metadata recognition that works poorly and can't be turned off). Also, they seem to ignore the voice of many customers on the support forum. The product is still nicely engineered, but I'm not sure if I continue my premium subscription with this approach.

Started using TODOist a week ago after six months with Evernote Premium.  So far I find it easier and more intuitive than Evernote. I haven't abandoned Evernote yet, but TODOist is definitely on par if not better. Will rate TODOist again after 1 month trial.

Superb app, backed up with web access and chrome extension. Have been trailing for a week or so. Evernote compatibility is great and flows well. Will keep investigating but will probably upgrade for the extra tweaks in due course.

I like the app but when 9am comes around and it chimes every morning and I can't get it to stop. I sleep during the day and I hate when it wakes me up. I could turn off the phone but then I wouldn't hear my work calling me. Kinda stuck with what you got. If I could mute it then I'd give you 5 stars

Had trouble keeping track of tasks and organizing them. This really helps a lot. Love the multiplatform application of it as well so it's always with you. :) great job guys. If we can see a history of tasks completed though, that'd be cool! Other wise great stuff!

I have tried lots of todo  lists,  but like Goldilocks,I think they are either too simple or too difficult. Todoist strikes the perfect balance: all the features I want, and very quick and easy to use. And it's available on everything that I might want to use it on.

Looked like a good To Do list app at first but is wrought with shortcomings. 1) Any feature that matters is a premium feature which requires an expensive subscription. 2) YOU CAN NOT EXPORT YOUR DATA!!! Its another "PREMIUM FEATURE".  3) Dont try using the Mac desktop version of the app from the countryside. The desktop version of the app is nothing but a container for the browser-based web app. Thus, when you try to see your list from , say, a ski house, you will not see anything at all unless you have an internet connection.   4) The Android version of the app does not use screen space in an efficient manner. If you have a dozen items in your list, you wont be able to see whats coming up without scrolling.   5) Every time you press the wrong button, you get a pop-up window telling you that it is a premium feature button. The premium buttons are  annoyingly located next to the  buttons you actually need! 6) You can't type in a date due to the apps mandated "intelligence." Make a note to buy a christmas gift tomorrow and it pushes out the due date to December 25th! There is no user option to turn this off. They tried to be smart and became stupid!

Great app! Very easy to use and I love the fact you get that Chrome extension for desktops too :) My favourite to do list app. It's simple enough, yet not lacking in features. I found Google Keep too much of a note-taking app rather than a to do type app.  The recurring reminders here are very easy to set up! Just type "every weekday" or "every sat" or something along those lines!

I started using it for work but then added my personal errands and then Girl Scouts projects, etc. This app can help organize your entire life and minimize that chaotic "running list in your head" experience. You do have to use it religiously, adding *every* to-do item to it& adding a date, a parent task, &/or a priority. But once you're in the habit it works like a charm.

I've tried a lot of to-do apps but keep coming back to this one. Just enough features to be useful, not too many to over complicate things. Latest version of the Android app has a great interface.  Only con, the inline parsing in the web version is finicky and annoying.

It's a good idea, but it's an idea already done. You can achieve the same purpose this app does by using Google now or Google keep, quite simply and seamlessly as well. I'm lost at how this app sets itself apart from the rest of the market.

It started out great and I used it constantly. But about six weeks ago I tried to put in a new item and it wouldn't let me. I thought it needed an update so I made sure it was up to date. Same problem. I uninstalled and reinstalled. Same problem. I had if.tt connected, it is no longer connected. I'm disappointed that it won't work.

I've been a long time proponent of Outlook tasks, and hadn't tried anything else for years. Graduating to Todoist is like going from a tricycle to a spaceship. Mobile support, date processing, task assignment and sharing, etc. are all much better on Todoist.

This App looks good. But I think the below problem need to be fixed. I created some task and assigned to some one else (collaborate). Though I have created and assigned the task, it shows up only in another person's device in the next 7 days list but not showing on my device, I too have equal responsibility and want to see what is planned for next 7 days

It doesn't tell u before u download that u have to pay 30 for a year of the extras. My paper note pad will do much better. Rediclouse! !!            Reply to reply..... look at the tick tick app or gtask. Or other apps. Can get it cheaper and alot of other apps have ur paid features  for free.

One of my have-to-have apps. I love the reminder by location feature. It makes it much easier to remember to do something when I arrive at home or to work, compared to traditional time controlled reminders which tends to be dismissed if delays. Keep it up!

I have ADHD, and I've always wanted a tool exactly like this. I thought I would have to create a to-do list tool myself because nothing else ever worked for me, but this is beyond what I could have designed specifically for myself. I can finally think with a clear conscious again. Thank you!

Although still finding my way around this app it is helping me remember important things. Havent been able to effectively plan ahead. If this doesnt exist it needs to added cos i cant find it. Otherwise great app.
I used Remember the Milk for several months before this, but kept having buggy things happen with my repeating tasks. No issues so far after a week with Todoist! I'm loving the interface. Keep it up!
Don't know these apps are getting high rating. Google must do something about this

Really like this app and how easy it is to use. The videos are easy to follow when setting up. I've used both basic and pro versions. My favorite list app I've ever used... and this is probably my 5th or 6th one.

I started using this app 5 days ago, and can already feel that the app and I are going to have a long term relationship! I have a forgettable short term memory (pun intended!) and todoist has helped me plan and follow up more effectively, and really, get things done.

Todoist has the best combo of features and simplicity. Flexible enough to allow for customization, but simple enough to keep you focused on the tasks. It also has a great accessibility from any device. I have tried quite a few task systems and I always come back to Todoist.
Greatly polished experience. Sometimes a bit resistant towards my preferred mode of work. Delete date action hidden behind three taps? Omg, dislike, uninstall. JK, excellent work guys.

I use it everyday. School work, work work, shopping lists, projects, and checklists. The interface is minimalist yet functional and is the best task manager I have used after a very long time searching for something that works this well. GTD compatible.
Its ability to sync across multiple platforms is awesome (e.g. web browser chrome extension)
Todoist is by far one of the most intuitive to do list applications I've ever worked with.
The desktop version is miles better but at least it syncs up. The mobile version has all the same features but it's awkward to use

I am an organization freak and this has solved so many problems for me. The outlook integration is a life changer. And the quick add tool makes it seamless to add tasks. So user friendly and intuitive.
This is a very good way to do it. The more I use it the more productive I am.

Easy to get started but seems like most of the really useful stuff is behind the paywall. Still does what I need it to do. I also like the "karma" gameification element. Makes it a bit more fun to run my errands and get stuff done at work. If only there were perks at the different levels?

Love this app.  What would make it perfect is being able to EASILY turn my emails into tasks.  If I use the share menu, it puts the whole email in as the task title.  IMHO, it should put the email subject as the task name, and the email content as the comment.  Any chance this can be fixed?

Todoist app (unlike Web version) somehow lack of an important feature (sort options), quite surprise why this hasn't been implemented after so long. Otherwise, 5 stars in future when this is implemented.

What good is a to do app if when you have more than a few items but there is no way to sort anything by date or by priority.   Widget just displays items in the order you entered them.  Not very useful.  Disapointed.

I love the app. The karma feature is a neat incentivisation for coming back to the app which differentiates it nicely. However the app crashes more frequently than I would like, particularity when accessing the aforementioned karma feature. (Samsung Galaxy S6).
Has truly become a lifeline for getting things done, particularly with calendar syncing and outlook extension. Just brilliant!
Wish the reminders and more themes were available in the free of charge version,  despite being very limited, it's still satisfying
I'm forgetful. This helps me forget less. Or re-evaluate the time scale of my work.

This is worth a download. Easy to learn and the email reminders are helpful. The only downside so far is that the interface for making sub tasks is a bit awkward but you can easily make sub projects instead.
Relatively easy to use, nice interface too.  I can't tell the difference between the free and the paid version
I always downloaded multiple to do list and never keep up with it.  This one is easy and smarter than all the rest.
Sure they have some features missing, but the things they have are powerful. They are on every platform. This is the only task manager system in the game that has all the features it has.
Love this app, it's so easy to use and has been invaluable to me. As 8 have THE worst memory ever.
By far the best todo app. Available on many platforms and has a lot of features. I only wish they can add pomodorro support with a timer.

Great app.  Love it's ease of use and colour coding. Looking forward to the free month's upgrade to premium. Some personal niggles with reminders behaviour but it's early days for me wit this app and my new phone.
App was a little bit difficult to use at first. Once you figure out the process it is very handy
The only to-do list that has ever helped me to do what has needed to be done,  so perfect.
Have begun to use this app as a start to get my life on track. The journey has been good as of now . Please incorporate option of viewing completed tasks.
Great app for tracking tasks, improving productivity and getting things done. Cross platform support is excellent for managing tasks and productivity at any time and on the go, at home, or at work.
Overall, I love the app. The home screen widget seems to have issues updating from day to day, but it's not a deal breaker.
What a waste of my time.  Could just use a paper list.  This app just wants you to buy premium where all the good stuff is at.  Incorrect description in app profile.
Great app, very useful! I only wish that the widget allowed for more tasks to be seen at once. The blank space around the text for each task is excessive.
Good. It got me going.  But i want my widget to display all tasks, regardless of what category they are in.

It's a todo list i like the most but you should add scheduled tasks(task that repeat each week for example) and the option to assign a task to multiple collaborators inside a project. This would really distance you from your biggest competitor any.do to do list
After using multiple task lists (Google, outlook, Yahoo), I always come back to Todoist because it's the one that works best for me.

Love it, but wish it was more aware of me completing tasks on other devices, the Android app is often out of sync. And gutted that Thunderbird is no longer supported on PC. Is a good reminder of my day, right on my phone.

Before using a planner I struggled to keep up with the workload I have in a day. But while using todist I was able to know what I was supposed to be doing and exactly when I was supposed to be doing it.
I used to be  Remember the Milk & Wunderlist user before I tried Todoist.    Not only is Todoist available for anything I use, all the apps look great!
Only issue I have rt now is the widget stops working. Have to keep reloading it.
It is complicated. Major options available only if upgraded. Need internet connection to function properly. All in all the last thing i need to further complicate my life
This has all of the things i have been looking for since my out of milk app went belly up with an update last year. .

Very useful, use this all the time. Only complaint is more of a personal preference: the premium-only features are still visible on the free version, and are somewhat distracting. Not a big problem though.
Todoist has the easiest interface and the most intuitive mobile and desktop personal project management that I have found.

It's a great idea, and task manager app, but it would be great if the widget wouldn't take up all of my screen and had more content, or at least I could resize it. Having only 3 tasks listed wastes my screen real estate.
Just like the description, super easy to get in and out of which for me makes it relevant for daily to do's.
I'm not paying $40 PER year just for an app that works a bit better than the free one that comes with my phone.
Very handy to set recurring reminders at set intervals. Also super simple to split between work and home so I don't have to worry about the two groups mixing together.
Seriously. I can organize by project, set deadlines, and also rearrange tasks super easily. So awesome!

This app has everything you'd ever want. It manages and keeps track of everything perfectly. The coding is really well done too and it basically keeps track of your data over the website too. This is really cool.

I used Todoist a while ago, and found it clunky and not convenient.  I had the opportunity to get a free premium subscription through AppSumo, so I tried it again.   Wow, I am glad I did!  Todoist has greatly improved for my usage, and I now love it, using it every day.  Fantastic app!
Every platform supported which is great. I have it on my phone, windows, gmail and chrome. All fully functional so there are no compromises.
A good app that helps you set tasks, priorities, and achieve them. Could wish for better connection with google chrome and gmail apps.
Love this app. Works the way I do on projects and allows quick entry of  tasks. Integrates with Outlook and has a Chrome extension so I can add jobs easily from other websites.

In the week that I've had this I really like the Outlook setup since that is where I spend a lot of time. It makes adding and managing really easy. I also like the location feature where it can remind me when I leave work or arrive some place that I have something to do. To get full use you need the premium option.
When there will be more friendly option to create subtasks implemented, for example using drag and drop to subtask the added task.
Its great so far (I really like the choose when its due feature) but I would like to see it available in more sizes as a widget. A 2x2 or 2x3 is ideal for me and the existing size is very large.
This app really assists me in keeping myself organized. It is an awesome addition to my phone and I use the widget with it often to add tasks to my to do list.
The best one so far. I'm planning to upgrade to premium account just to support you :)
I found this app while looking for a compatible  to do list that would sync with my Galaxy note 5 and Google. Thanks for a great and useful  application.
Does everything I want it to as a free app. Set tasks, reminders appear as notifications the day something is due. Very easy to set reminders and check off items that have been completed.

This is the simple app that keeps me on track every day. With the widget on my Android, the Chrome plugin at work and the Mac app at home my projects are always at my fingertips.  In full honesty I only use the free version but this is something that I would have no problem paying for.

Would love there to be a simple way to schedule activities for different days of the calendar. It would be easier for me to be able to pick a day and then jot down all activities for that day, instead of writing the tasks and having to schedule them one by one.

Simple but robust. Karma feature is icing on the cake. I like gamafication. Just try it. I've used them all. I purchased the full version after using the app for one day. Why? Because the designers know what's important, and the app makes that apparent.

Good

This is the best to-do list app out there, comfortable, efficient and simple. Only complaint I have is that I could not see the instructions for how to write the correct dates. Also, it would be appreciated if you would make it possible to make a task that is due multiple times a day, like "brush teeth three times a day".

I like the app and would totally go pro but I really dislike this trend of monthly/yearly subscriptions. With these types of apps it should be a one and done situation. I don't like thinking if I cancel my subscription I lose a perfectly good app and all my hard work. Better luck next time.

I spent a lot of time trying out every ToDo app I could get my hands on.  I did have to upgrade to the premium version to get all the features I needed but it has been worth every penny.  I work in IT and am constantly needing to add things quickly to my lists as needs arise.  Todoist makes adding, prioritizing, and managing work and personal lists quick and easy.

Swipe functions, projects, sub tasks, sharing, smart scheduling input, let's me get really into goal breakdowns, which I like. The karma is also a fun gameful feature but my favorite part of the data analysis is the "last 7 days" bar chart that's color coded so you can see what project you've been focused on.

They claim to have subtasks... After  trying 6 different platforms I only found one way to create a "sub task" using android platform. This so called subtask was just a new task that was indented and was not at all a sub task of another task. There are pleanty of other to do list apps that allow you to use sub tasks correctly. I would not waste my time with this one if that is what you are looking for.

Really good app, with lots of integrations that help me stay organized even in my worst days. I'm not giving 5 stars because of the unstable releases some times (there are versions that stay unstable for a week or even more), and not having a native Linux version. Support is adequate but answers lack some technicalities that would great to have.

Its competitors set the bar pretty high. Syncing labels integration are not premium features that's par !! Selling an active development team directly seems much smarter. Apple and google take forever to iron out small details. Lower the fee sell it on its active dev team that is premium

I'm a chronic list maker and hoarder of information and Todoist is the best app for me. I use the desktop quick add tab ALL THE TIME when I am surfing the net and I like being able to have the same info available to me when I'm mobile. I don't have a premium account but I wouldn't mind trying it. Worth a try if you've been looking for the right fit for lists.

This is just what I needed. There are two things on my wish list that would make it 5 star: (1) the mobile app makes everything Inbox instead of asking what label I want, and (2) I'd like for it to tell me what % of my time goes to each segment I've created.

Very useful app when all features are unlocked. There's a lot to learn in order to achieve maximum utilisation but it's a matter of time.  I would love to experience more active gamification to keep me focused in a fun and obsessive way. This would be an amazing app if it integrated with The Pomodoro Challenge app. Eg. Projects in Todoist could link with Projects in Pomodoro Challenge to keep track of tasks. I can see synergy between both apps.

This ap help me keep my very scattered non-profit work schedule up to date and very classy. I enjoy the system for keeping track of done tasks as well as all of the tiny little things that make this app. I have no problem paying money for something that will save me time effort and possibly funds in the future. Thank you so much for creating this it has made my work life possible.

I've been a To Do-list task junkie since the Palm Pilot days, and I usually switch every few months, but I've been using Todoist now for over two years, and it just keeps getting better and better. I love the new interface design changes, and it functions wonderfully on the Mac, iOS, and of course Android!

I have been using AnyDo since it's inception and you guys have managed to drag me (kicking and screaming) over to your app. Love the UI and the features. Now, for the "be careful" disclaimer above. If you don't plan on purchasing the premium features of this app, than don't click on the tab for premium. It doesn't take you to an option screen for monthly or how to pay, it just automatically charges you for a full year. So, be careful.

You're willing to pay $25 a year to use it, it may satisfy some people, but I need notifications, and paying $25 a year for that is kinda disappointing, if it was free or if you could separately purchase notifications for like $2 a year then I would keep it, unfortunately, I am going to have to look for a different app.

I've had the app for a few months but have not taken the proper time to learn it all. From what I have used it's fantastic, I can almost entirely replace my existing calendar with todoist. I like very much that I can sit down and plan a day, which I can do on the side of a box with a pen... what makes todoist special is the reminders, and the flexibility of these. Now I just need ironically an app to motivate me to use it :D

Easy to use, largely-intuitive interface, rich functionality but let's me do simple things like quick capture of tasks on the run. I can easily separate out and manage the few tasks I prioritize for today from.the many I throw onto my list, separate out by personal and work (or any category I choose) , and I get a good working interface on all my devices with syncing across all of them. Exactly what I wanted.

Both in terms of UX as well as UI this application nails it. Works in perfect sync with the web version and hides away many trivial issues. One slight issue, and i am being really finicky here is the lack of a good drag mechanism while dragging tasks between different dates.

I'm using the free version. Meets most of my needs (cross platform synchronisation, intelligent UI when setting dates and times etc). Minor gripe is the relatively expensive monthly subscription - if it is cheaper, I wouldn't mind paying the premium to enjoy the full suite of services. As of now, will stick to the free version.

I like how the app is set up. The only thing I don't like so much is that there is no option for a monthly subscription to premium. I'd much rather pay that a month at a time. Or if you could use labels in the free version would be even better.

My phone was recently updated and now will not do any Widget actions. I am able to quick add but I cannot select items to be labeled as completed or reschedule anymore. Please rehash another update to fix this bug.

Better alternatives out there.  Astrid clone has all premium features like custom repeating intervals for reoccurring tasks.  I've been using this for over a year and nothing comes close, or if it does it will cost you yearly.  "Tasks: Astrid To do list clone"

Well, just got it 2 days back. Mulitplatform support is amazing. This is an amazing App if you are willing to spend little time on it. For productivity this the tool I was looking for. $30 bucks seems like a lot.l,but hey if this software is enhancing me then money is very well spent, lot of us spent 30 bucks on much more stupid things . Love the innovative way to enter deadlines. My thanks to todoist for amazing product. The self improvement enhancements it does Is well justified the cost.

I knew it would not have notifications or comments in the free version, but did not realise that the collaboration, syncing and subs would also be crippled. Wasted 15 minutes, then uninstalled. Much better options out there

The app was great even before the update and now it's even more awesome! Only gripe stealing its one star is that the sharing project  feature is somewhat broken since not all tasks are displayed to the users.   Request: enable adding more than one user on a  single task and optionally displaying to the user only the tasks that have been assigned to him (or option to select who can see a task, even when not assigned to them) UPDATE: No gripes with the app, it's great

I have been looking for a to do app that not only has excellent functionality and collaboration but also has a really good design. With their selection of apps from web, tablet, chrome, windows and more this is truly the ultimate to do app. Well done. I have just finished transferring all of my any.do list over!!!

I've used a multitude of other task managers but finally landed on Todoist for the past couple of years. It's huge amount of cross-platform support is really the big selling feature as well as ease of use, a good amount of features and an easy-to-use interface.   That said, in order to get the best experience (and notifications), you'll need to pay for a premium account. I don't mind paying for it because its so cheap but I know a lot of people are allergic to paying for soft

I have ADD and procrastination issues. I've tried dozens of different apps/websites/calendars, and this is by far the best I've ever used. I even pay for Premium, which is not something I usually do! Totally worth it!!! The Todoist staff is also exceptional - great customer service for paying and nonpaying customers alike, and constantly developing great new features.

Looks nice and operates fine but this it. What I dislike most is that all todos are bound to dates. And out of the box they all become "overdue" unless you take time to set and revise the dates all the time. For this kind of stuff, Google Calendar works much better.

The syntax for creating tasks is incredibly flexible and easy to pick up.  The included widget also looks very nice.  I pretty much never pay for subscription apps but I am certainly considering going premium with this one after only using it for a week.

I've been using Todoist for over a year. Very impressed and satisfied with the pace of updates and regular improvements. They've added batch editing functions previously lacking.  Picking date/time UI is still a bit clunky, but they're getting there. Definitely recommended.

I am an avid planner! Love my paper planners and decorating them. But I also love to complete what I plan. And Todoist is fantastic! I have the free version which meets all my needs. I haven't found a need to update to premium as yet but have not ruled it out. I like how I can type in exactly what I am thinking and the app 'knows' what I mean and puts my entry's in the appropriate date!! This is great! Todoist is now part of my evening planning routine! Love it!

The free version in my opinion deserves 2 stars. The paid version I would love to have and feel that would be worth 5 stars, however; this app does something all its competitors don't... They force you to pay the entire year upfront! 2 bucks a month I won't notice added to my cell phone bill,  but 30 dollars up front out of pocket I will. Looks like Any.do is the winner by decision.
I plan on using it everyday. I haven't figured out how to schedule an appointment or event months down the road however I have another program for that.

(Reply to Todoist: I see the appeal, but computers are terrible at auto-interpreting what people want. Explicit controls are often far less frustrating.) Looking forward to an option to toggle off the feature that parses due dates. e.g. "Call tires now company" gets changed to "Call tires company". Edits get automatically parsed and unexpectedly change the due date. The good: The hierarchy is neat- breaking projects down into chunks, and nesting those chunks makes them a lot easier to complete.

I used to be a Franklin Covey paper planner. That is from my generation. I had tried switching to electronic planning before but nothing worked for me until now. I love Todoist! It fits my busy and mobile lifestyle.
This app wont blow your mind, but combined with the website on my PC I have total control over my tasks, which is good. It is also becoming more and more intuitive over time.

Really enjoying the usefulness in this app. Although there are some paid features that I would love to have, this has been a great free alternative for Outlook tasks, which I needed since my employer switched to google hosted email this year. The chrome extension works well also, and integrated pretty seamlessly with my web based email. It was important to be able to make emails into tasks to save time. The only way I would replace this app is if Google got off it's duff and made their tasks even remotely useful!

The app is nice and useful but simple features like notification , deadline and etc don't really need yearly subscription. This features could be unlocked with a one time purchase and cloud features remain in subscription plan for those who really needs cloud features...

PROS: Simple and clean, syncs across platforms, so I actually use it. I also use the Chrome plugin on my pc, which can also link to my Gmail to add tasks that are connected with an email. CONS: When you go to enter a new task, it gives a fake example (eg. Schedule meeting with Bob) that can be distracting and make me forget what I was going to add! Seriously, I know how to enter a task guys, please remove the prompts or offer a way to turn then off!
I keep track of everything with this. I wish they'd offer a student discount for pro, otherwise I can't justify the expense

First app I have used as a to do list that works like I do. Great UI. Easily worth the $ for annual subscription. If  you want something for nothing, write your own app and host your own services on your own servers

Been using this app for a little over a year now and honestly it's the best Todo list app out. The standard version is nice for starters but I strongly recommend getting the pro. It makes like so much easier and getting things done faster!! Great app 😍🙌
We use it at work and track alot of tasks on todoist. It works for me. I'd rate it 5 stars if the pro version was a bit more inexpensive but all in all, great app to have.
On my laptop a task is shown to be due on Monday but on mobile it says it's Tuesday and all the other tasks are delayed a day. Not exactly sure what's going on.

Great tool, HORRIBLE app! How complex can creating a to-do item with reminders be? I can only create items due "today'. Any other properties need to be added afterwards (or maybe worse: after two months I still couldn't figure it out...). Adn why can't I just create a reminder using a calendar-time selection? Non-Americans aren't accustomed with the American date-time format, so literally typing it is extremely inconvenient. Although I paid for it (hoping the extra features would resolve my issues) I'm looking for something else.
Will not pay pln 100 per year to have task reminders unlocked.
So far the experience has been great on Android, especially compared to IOS.  One key feature missing is the lack of importing txt or CSV from other apps.
Todoist helped me tremendously by keeping me organized and on top of all of the things I have to do each and every day. It's a great app and keeps getting better all the time.
Great way to keep track of upcoming tasks and events. A couple of quirks in the free version around recurring tasks. Assume this is not an issue in the paid version. Like it.
I really love todist. The karma points actually provides some motivation, but the simple design is really why I love this app.

Good to have this app. Most of the stuff resembles 'Asana'. I have been using every day and free version. Going good and I am able to be more productive. Removing tasks is been hectic. I was expecting that to be under finger swipe.
I could not live without this app now.  I record all my todos and projects using Todoist.  I have also linked it to my google calendar so that it automatically create appointments.
Works great, and syncs across my devices. Helpful keeping organized, completing tasks, can make quick notes on Android and not lose a thought.
The developer is super responsive. It does lack some proactive features, but it's fairly complete.
This is a great to-do list manager.  I really like that it understands plain English for due dates and recurrence. It would be even better with a Gantt Chart view and easier note viewing.
I used todoist web for months around 4 years ago then became a mess and left it... I closed my account and I regret it deeply.
I like the design and the options that it gives me to set calendar dates and times. It is quite expensive to get notifications but I have worked my way around that.
I love having it on my browser and as a  app on my phone so the list is always nearby.  Simple , almost too simple, an dj wish it had a few more options but it does the job.
Flexible and easy to use.  Great integration across platforms.  Projects, labels and comments make this a great app for personal and work.
Excellent app. Integrates with desktop and tablets well. Only downsides - things can only be assigned to 1 category and Can't change categories of to-do items easily.

The free version is decent, but would prefer the full version. However it is extremely overpriced! You would be very silly to pay that much when so many other apps offer comparible features, at a fraction of the cost.
I use todoist on my phone, tablet and at work. Best to do list app I've found, with good, clean looks as well.
Just love this app. It manages all the chaos in my life in a good way.

There should be a link of completed tasks with folders on left links panel... Secondly there should also an option of time management tracker, if I want to track the hours/days spent on specific tasks for future reference or for billing to client. There should also be  an input field for hours/days spent on specific to task on changing the status to completed.

boo hiss to those hating on its pricing. Being organized is incredibly important, and having the functionality of todoist over both an app platform and Google chrome extension is incredibly handy! good design and development.

It's an excellent app. However, others (such as Wunderlist) provide significantly more features before you hit the paywall.... Whereas with Todoist you can't even use notifications in the free version? Not sure how these calls are being made, but at its base it's a great app and an excellent task-tracking system.
This helps in keeping track of everything and motivating myself. I have only used the free version, and it's continued to be useful and helpful both during and post college.
It is so well organized and useful i love it. Id like the mobile version to look a little more like the pc one but whatever todoist is so cool.
great syncing between web and app and great categorization feature. Newest version of app doesn't display correct tile on Android
Great app to keep yourself accountable. If you think you keep forgetting those important things, use Todoist to be the Superperson who's always on track!
This app + the outlook plug in works great for me. Only qualm is the widget doesn't refresh.
Integration on various platforms, browsers and application (e.g. outlook) has revolutionised my todo lists. Great free, better with subscription.
Clean interface with the features I want in a to-do list. Handles recurring tasks extremely well.
I use Todoist every single day to manage tasks and projects. The Android version is very visually appealing by following the material design principles.
Able to categorize all my to dos and view it either by date or by list/category. I can easily push a task to the next day or to a future date love it
Update not working. Even I update tasks in web app, the mobile app is update nothing.
We use this app as a quick daily reminder of tasks for a 20 person team. It is extremely easy to use and keeps my guys on track all day.

Coming back from a serious illness I have so many things that need attention it is almost overwhelming. I need a means of helping me break down the tasks into manageable bites. Todoist does it for me!

Great app for getting organized.  There is some room for improvement in the ability to easily and smoothly nest tasks together under one overarching task, and I wish selecting projects was a little smoother, but I am very happy with the app for the most part.

I am using this app together with desktop application and Outlook add-in. For me it is a good todo list and small project management solution comparing it to more than 7 different products I have used. I believe there are better products but they cost much more. It is a good price for offered functionality, considering also that you can share tasks with your team.

I think renovated should be something that should be added. One of the reasons you want a program like this is to remind you to do things. Sorry uninstalling, for what this program do I can use Google keep.
I have a lot to balance (school, modeling, photography, and YouTube) and ToDoisy helps keep me on track & let's me prioritize my lists

Muy buena app para gestionar tareas, simple y útil para lo que se debe usar.

Great app, but widget is too bulky and not receiving notifications without premium is a joke. I was actually excited about this app at first, but when I found that out, I knew it just wasn't for me. If you just need to make To-Do lists, not a reminder app, this might be for you

This is best to do application of all time. I've been using free app for over a year and now I am a premium user and it's totally wort it. All you ever need from to do application is here. Development team is great and app works on all major platforms seamlessly.
This is a very good app for anyone with bad memory and a lot to do
I use this app on my phone, tablet, desktop, and my wife's phone.  We can easily coordinate shopping lists and other to do lists.
Help me remember things I need to do and get it done.
The app has been a part if my everyday since the beginning of the year. It helps me keep track of tasks and goals and the recurring reminders make sure nothing is forgotten.

Excellent app with fantastic customization options. Lets you use it how it suits you best. Great as a free app and worth it for the annual membership if you're looking g for a total productivity solution

I loved it, it's user-friendly fast and beautiful. Thanks a lot

Love this app. It's great for homework assignments. I wish premium features were available for a one time purchase of a premium version of the app. Way too much money to pay a yearly membership fee to get premium features.

A clean, consistent and cross platform interface takes Todoist far, and the latest release adds long overdue smarts to task parsing. Sadly, the widget is still oversized to the point of near-uselessness. Pros: sub-tasks and sub-projects, priority levels, tags/contexts, multiple reminders based on time or location, flexible due dates. Cons: No weighted lists, lame syntax for search, filtering and markup, mediocre batch editing and task moving.

Great app for many reasons, but it is extremely annoying that I can't easily create new list items by just pushing enter, or some other button. When making things like a grocery list, one needs to be able to quickly add new items one after the other without having to do more than one step. That seems like it should be the most basic feature of an app like this. Would like to be able to do the same with voice commands as well.

I agree with the others with having event modifiers just below the listed task and not at the bottom, or maybe just a ticker at the left side for a quick checking of completed tasks. Batch transfer of tasks between projects would also be helpful. Still a great app though

I've used just about every task management app you can think of, from asana to wunderlist. After trying to many of them out, I came back to Todoist and I'm very happy with the product, so much that I signed up for premium within the first week of using it again. UPDATE: 10/14/15 still love the app, I use it everyday and it's become and essential tool of mine to get things done.

Come on, guys. Setting a time reminder for a task is a basic feature, not a premium one. The free version is ridiculous. I don't care how good it looks, it's not worth it. And paying for the premium version would be silly, since Google Keep offers the same features for free. I can do without tagging my tasks, integrating to Google calendar (although I'd very much like to), but not reminders - a basic feature of any note taking app.

UI is gorgeous and it displays tasks from different projects on your today page effortlessly. It also syncs flawlessly to desktop. Only complaint of the free version is the lack of a feature like any.do's Plan Your Day or any sort of a reminders feature. Would also appreciate categorizing by due dates (like the priority of a task should increase automatically as it approaches a firm due date). I don't like how idea of due dates is combined with items that aren't necessarily due but you want to do today.

Todoist offers full-blown task manager (labels, projects, priorities) with nice (customizable) UI. Date typing and powerfull reminders make app the best productivity tool I use.  There is also Karma - app's feedback which gives you points for working with task. Great way to motivate if that's your kind of thing.  For non-premium users there is a big drawback - Reminders are Premium only.  Premium pricrtag seemed high at first, but it's equal to two beers in Czech republic per month which is great ratio :)

Been using Todoist for a while now.  Many rave reviews; it made a believer out of me.  No more notebooks and papers and sticky notes everywhere, disorganized and scattershot.  Clean, configurable, complete control over projects and tasks plus integration with Gmail.

I have tried just about every to do list app out there, and this is the closest to perfect that I have found. I have been a paid user for about 9 months now, and for the most part the app has been great. The location based reminders still are not as good as Google Keep though.  The last couple of updates gave me fits when the shorthand for due dates and reminders stopped working properly though.  All in all the app is great, but please fix the bugs!

The activity onces completed its difficult to figure out what it was. At one place they should mention all the activities that r completed. Also it shall allow to amend whats is written in the task earlier.

I love the service as a whole and the Android app in particular. Gorgeous material design, powerful features such as location-based- and recurring reminders. I'd recommend the app and the premium service any day of the week - and thanks to Todoist, I'll be sure to remember to do so.

I've tried several to-do list apps (Keep, Wunderlist, Any.do, my own spreadsheets...) and this is by far my favorite. I love the flexibility of recurring dates: every Friday, every other Friday, 5 days after the latest completion, every other month on the 14th at 2:00pm starting in February... I also love the way the app syncs with the web version I access from my laptop. Haven't tried the sharing capabilities yet, but I'm looking forward to it working as well as everything else.

The new material update is great, but as others have mentioned the widget is actually the easiest way to add new tasks now, since the main app is a bit challenging and not very intuitive. Otherwise it's a highly recommended app from me!

I rarely take the time to rate an app, but this is critical information to the developers. In the last update, the quick add feature disappeared from the pull-down menu on Android. I'm highly disappointed. Was considering moving from the free version to the paid version before this happened, but I can see that even those that have paid for the app have lost this feature. TODOIST, it's IMPORTANT! Otherwise, I really love this application...if only it could do the work for me, then I'd really be overjoyed. ;-)

Love this for the most part! Very useful and keeps me organized. I use Sunrise calendar. I would like to use Google Calendar but unsure if this app will  sync and put my tasks on the CALENDAR. ********** 10/16/2015 Very impressed!  The Google Play Developer Console Team responded to my concerns with instructions on how to add ical url to Google calendar.  Works like a dream.  Will highly recommend to everyone I know!  Whoever the Google Play Developer Console Team is ..."You Rock!"

The newly updated app's notification does not function properly. Someone invited to share project is not notified within the app, but though email.  Upon confirmation of joining the shared project, app notifies shared project is not to be found. Please help make upgrade on this app accordingly. Also, the new interface is great. The way how it manages projects is clumsy.

I use this app on several different platforms and devices and it doesn't seem to sync correctly.  There'll be tasks marked as completed that some sync, some don't. I love this app but the syncing problem makes it much less useful. I will have to switch to do apps if this doesn't get fixed. Thank you for the app ! It has not always had these problems! ***Update 10/19/15: works great! No syncing problems! Syncs immediately.

Just enough complexity to organize my projects and subprojects. Interaction with gmail is awesome!!! The free version is fantastic - the only thing missing is reminders, which are a premium feature. I'm too disorganized to remember to do things at a certain time otherwise. I have been using it for a few weeks and already rely on it so much that I am happily going to upgrade to premium. I'm in med school and always busy and I feel like it's a bargain for organizing my hectic life!

So intuitive: you can type any date/time terms in words and they will be assimilated, drag & drop tasks and folders, color things, enter search terms. Interface purposefully similar to many email platforms. It can be as simple or as complicated as you make it. Only extra thing I'd personally like that it can't yet do is to be able to search for partial label names, but really that's small fry

I am sure the App is Great I was using it for a couple days but then I went to add a comment and saw the premium. I said well I don't really need the comments so whatever, then tried to add a reminder and got the premium popup ... -_- Fine I like the app... let's upgrade... ...28.99 for one year... No.. no no no I am not paying that much for a app that I just needed for reminders ... I would have payed up to 2 99 for it to unlock the reminders, comments and labels ... I wouldn't be using the uploading.
Many of us use this now internally, proven to be a great app for managing todos and keeping up with others.

I like the UI and I see that it has some really useful features for those who pay. However, it's shocking how I need to be a premium member for reminders - it's one of the simplest features and it's petty how we aren't given it for free.
This app has completely revolutionized the way I organise my life. It's easy to use and intelligently designed.
My complaint is mostly about the Web version. Some things can be done on the mobile app but not on the Web version.  It's confusing
I use the paid version with my co worker.  It is wonderful for what we do.  Having it on all my devices is great too.  Love the comment feature.
I don't have much specific needs arrangeing my affairs so for me it's perfect. I don't even utilize all the options given.
Really good app a loved for long time in new cool design. Only thing I can say is that for me is premium useless.
This is one of the best apps to help keep me productive. Keep up the great work!
Works exactly as advertised. Simple to use. I love that the people whp made this have made a free edition which doesn't scunge you, and the paid edition is so affordable!

I use this on both my android and Windows phones.  I like the syncing capabilities across devices.  On Windows phones the tags are available on the free account.  I just wish that it can be free also on Android devices.
This app has helped my focus.   Instead of hunting down my many paper to do lists I can easily pull this up on my phone.   I only wish more features were available on the free version.
I am looking forward to using this in the long term. I won't be parting with this tool anytime soon.
Clean interface and useful function. But the reminder function was reserved for a premium feature, I think it did not make sense.
I needed something to handle repeating reminders without cluttering up my calendar. This is perfect! And love that it syncs between my desktop and phone.
Use it to store even my notes, lists n manuals. Jus wish it has a calendar like google calendar n that i can see all my appmts n things to do, then it wud b perfect!
Simple integration to Gmail and all my mobile devices. I manage a team of six in Australia from Europe, this has worked brilliantly for me. Highly recommended
I tried out quite a few to-do list apps before this. None of them can touch it. Good stuff.
Helped to merge my business and private mail boxes into one to-do list. The app in a phone makes the lust ever present and effective.
Excellent app that does the job of a couple of apps I had prior. Very easy to use and chock full of handy features.

A to do app on mobile without mobile reminders is preety useless. Also start selling features unit wise and not all in a monthly bundled pricing as for Indians its a pretty steep premium price for an year i.e. Almost 2000
At least from Google tasks, where I have many many lists. Also needs more direct integration with Evernote. I'm still comparing with Trello and IQTell.
Update version looks ok but still need to pay for reminders.  The demo said it was free in the new update.   Please correct this.  Meanwhile im sticking with Google keep.  Its reminders are free
It would be nice if inbox can be arranged in different ways, such as ascending and descending according to dates, and in alphabetical order.
If the premium is a one time purchase then it makes sence. But I don't think the premium options are worth a monthly subscription....
Just wish I could have more than one list to separate school, work and personal things.
Intuitive, simple, and works well. Integration with my desktop is helpful. Favorite feature is being able to type due dates and times, that's what made me choose this task app
The mobile app is maybe a little bit more solid than the Outlook plugin, but is a terrific application in general

To implement GTD I needed an @in folder for anything that didn't have a context (which I do with labels) or a project, I managed to do that with a filter: "no label & p:inbox". After that my setup was complete!

Best features are paid. -3 Stars. All the features I was looking for come in the paid only version only. -2 Stars (If I could) Try any.do or the Google todolist for a better experience. Not to mention free.
What's the use of a to-do app without alarm functionality. Why pay to get such a basic feature.
This app keeps track of my todos and notifies me when items are due and tracks how many days.over due. Very user friendly

I really like this app. Works well with gmail. Allows me to be reminded of tasks via email. I would only suggest adding an option to sync to calendar than it being automatic if i write a task with the words fRIDAY or something like tha. I look forward to other additions and tweaks
I moved all my tasks from another to do app and I don't regret it. Excellent task manager,recommend.
The app is great. The widget sucks, IMHO. The smallest setting is too wide, it could be more compact.
Also would like to use for grocery shopping but don't see an easy way to create a list. Keep has the look I like. Todoist has the reminders I like.

This app doesn't let you do what most other "to do" apps allow you to do for free. Need a premium account for most features. Daily emails that require you to enter your password when unsubscribing. Not for me....

Use this everyday. Make a to do list to get done throughout the week and it reminds me daily of what needs to doing. Great for project management. I would like to make a list on the app and be able to mark off single items such as a shopping list. But overall it's great.
Using Todoist has greatly improved my efficiency and turnaround time with my personal and professional life. It's quick, easy and fun to use!
This is exactly what I have been looking for. Simple powerful encompassing my personal and business to do lists. I am getting so organised!!! Love it.
I have this on my phone, laptop and pc in the office and it all syncs up really well and the email reminder keeps me straight. I liked Trello too but I like how we can put a date on these tasks.

Todoist does everything I need, but has such a clean interface that it feels like a very simple app. It keeps getting better with each new version!

Excelente aplicación para mantenerte al día en tu trabajo y/o proyectos. Por lo menos la opción de compartir fotos debería estar disponible en la versión free, con un límite de espacio para las mismas, y luego de culminar la tarea estas se eliminen, que sólo se conserven si eres premium.

Todoist instantly became my task manager after checking it out when I read about the rebranding. I noticed it was offered on pretty much any device you would need. The app itself is easy to use and navigation is smart. The one thing I think could be improved is using the back button on Android phone to go back to the last screen you were on.

Since July, updates have made entering tasks with dates, numbers, and projects harder. It is terrible enough that we've been allowed, eventually, to turn off this "intelligent quick add" filth on the website, but this app still does the thing even if you turn off the feature.  As such, the app is basically unusably broken. I have gone back to paper and I'm now uninstalling.

I'm a big fan of the GTD methodology, and I've tried many apps to support it. For the way I use GTD, this app fits me like a glove. Everything I need is there, I don't feel like I have to shoe horn things to make them work, and it's not overly complicated. It fits a wide range of devices and synchronizes between them quickly and effectively. I especially like the email client plug ins. Powerful stuff.

I organize my days around all my tasks and appointments -  even reminding me I have to play a little every day. I've tried Outlook task manager and others but found nothing that gives me the flexibility and features provided by ToDoist. I'd like to see a few enhancements to make projects easier to manage - like task dependencies and better completion review. I'm hoping we'll see those in future releases.

But, there's some difficulties creating sub tasks, and it would be nice if the remember option wasn't premium, because I think it's needed some kind of alarm. Also, when you edit a task, maybe it's better to do A/B testing and simplify some options, like setting the time or/and day, it has more than 3 different ways of doing it, so, less options for a same task it's better.

So loving todoist, so simple yet not short of great functionality! As an ex omni focus (task list king, Mac & Apple only) user I have felt no real loss since joining the todoist ranks & feel totally pumped as I punch through my tasks & receive my reward points.

Smart, simple, intuitive. The worst part about other task management tools I've tried in the past is they really seem to go out of their way to overcomplicate an otherwise simple need. This one doesn't. Love the UI and the service. I went pro a week or two after trying Todoist for the first time and see many happy and productive years ahead.

It works really well, it is very Google like with material design. Smooth and intuitive (although lacking tutorial) It's pretty limited without a subscription but still usable. It would be nice to have reminders in the free version. It syncs with the chrome app, so you can check your list anywhere - very nice.

When I finish a repeating task (which this app does) and "check it off" it does not show back up on my list of things today until the day it needs to be done. What a wonderful feeling to see a list  get smaller instead of  staying the same size. Even over due repeating tasks leave when checked off and are not created as yet another overdue task. This is how my paper planning works and it is wonderful  to find an app that works like it. I also love having it on all my devices.

Very inefficient in screen space and it requires more taps to get things done. I've been using it for a while now and haven't gotten to like it. I'd pay money, more than the current premium fee [which I do now] to have the old interface from you or your competitors.

I have been using this on my phone, no other interface so I haven't had any issues in that regard, but it's a good little app for helping me manage my huge list of "things that must get done" from all my craft WIP to family appointments and just general everyday things, I can use one app for shopping lists and project lists and house lists, it's nice. I am still getting used to everything being in one place and having to go and check things off, but so far it is helping me get much better organized.

My only complaint is in regards to the comment function for tasks. It seems sort of silly that the second someone begins to type a note, they're no longer able to add attachments to that comment. It's also somewhat of a bummer that the extent at which someone can modify a comment is solely limited to changing the text, or deleting the comment all together. I was surprised that it's apparently impossible  right now to reposition a comment up/down the list. I can envision moreorganizationalfeaturesinthefuture

I have only updated the app because I have been forced to do so since the widget did not sync with the browser. I find that this was completely unnecessary and so far my experience with the app is much worse, which leads me to start considering other apps despite being having a premium todoist account.

I love the uncluttered design of todoist.  First when I started using it couple of years back, I couldn't adapt the idea of minimalist design which todoist brought. I was using wunderlist that time. But slowly when I got used to todoist. I didn't look back. Even the free version provides me so much productivity that It really tempts me to go for the premium version. What holds me back is the reporting functionality. Have I not looked it up properly or todoist still don't offer extended reporting?
You'll like this app if you love minimalist design. With premium, organizing and filtering tasks become even more easy. This tool has been an essential part of my daily routine. Highly recommended!

This app is just a waste of money and time. You cannot view filtered task on ios platform, when you assign a task the person assigned cannot view the task on android platform. Just complete rubish. Do not sign up for this app. Unless you want to waste valueable time trying to figure out how to carry out a simple task.

Great to do list app! Out of all of them I've stayed with this one the longest whcih is saying something for me! I love the clean and minimal design. There's a million hidden shortcuts and features and the whole app is rock solid! Sometimes I wish there was a way to add reminders a little easier(less taps), and I would love a day planning view but this app fits my needs and wants!

It is TOO smart sometimes and when I type for example "do home work one hour per day" it convers "one hour" to 1pm reminder. Also due date and reminder are confusing, looks like it doesn't show tasks with today reminder in the widget (it shows today due dates).

Beside that, all of the interesting and helpful features like getting notifications, adding labels... only available on the premium version. So if u're looking for the basic and free to-do list app, it's not worth downloading.

Only rated it 4 out of 5 as I'm still using & pushing the capabilities of the  free version But both the ease of use & multi-platform availability is leaning me towards unleashing the full potential of the paid premium model... Will amend when & if I commit.

This app won't even let you add notes to a task or view completed tasks.  That's basic functionality and should not be considered a premium feature. This app is a free trial, not a full app.            Adding a subtask is a nightmare of confusion, poor formatting, and extra steps. That's as far as I got; if they can't get the fundamentals right, I'm not going to invest time to discover what else they got wrong. And the spam emails? I'm trying to get more organized, not add extra clutter I need to deal with.

I've been happily using this app for almost a year -- best to-do system I've ever tried. At the point where if I don't put it in todoist, it probably won't get done. Especially great for scheduling recurring chores and location-based reminders.

Just want to try this application. But when you ask me register to continue, then I uninstall this application. Sad to know that this application didn't have demo version that not require user registration. ======== You still didn't hear me at all. I don't want register just to see what is this application can do even if registration process is so quick. If I would like your application then I can register and give you access to my email etc. AnyDo application can work without registration, and if user want more features like sync he can register at any time. You can do the same things: give to users guest mode and save the ability to register for using more features. This is simple and compromise way.

I'm sorry but since when was it ever acceptable to charge on a monthly basis for a blooming organisation app? I'm not buying that "ah you spend so much on a coffee" nonsense - there are app developers that have worked much harder than you and don't charge like this. This app is basically unuseable unless you get into a contract with the owners wherein you fritter your money away for a very basic tool.

I like all the added animation, but first things first, it now takes much more efforts to edit a task. There is just too much useless space and too little information in one page. Please make things compact again

I have tried many such applications before sticking to "todoist". The "Karma" points keeps you stick to your work and push your productivity to next level. In my case i am finishing many works same day, which were generally postponed. Would highly recommend.

The flow process to do so involves way too many steps on phone and web interface. Thanks guys!

Poor, poor interface.  Extremely difficult to move tasks around and create sub tasks, both on the desktop and Android app.  When you complete a task with sub tasks the relationship is lost.  Un-completing these tasks and sub tasks creates them all as top level tasks.  Uninstalling.

I would be happy to purchase premium because I think this platform is awesome but I don't like having to pay for a whole year up front. Nevertheless 4 stars because this is by far the best cross-platform task manager available and trust me, I have tried them all extensively.

Great app, easy to use. The paid option is worth it. My only suggestion for a future feature is the option to have a repeating task be repeated on a set schedule or from the date when the task was last completed. That way, if I'm a few days late in completing a biweekly task, the schedule adjusts automatically so the next due date is two weeks from when I actually completed the task.

I paid for premium mostly because of this functionality - location based reminders. And it is very basic, lack of simple features and almost unusable. Not able to pin location manually, no option to rename it, search gives other results comparing to Google maps and irrelevant, no integration with Google places. Very disappointing.

As I've become more busy, with  more things to do, Todoist has made managing my life incredibly simple.   I didn't use this program much at first, but especially after suffering several mild concussions, I've found Todoist to be absolutely amazing, especially because my memory is temporarily worse than ever.   I could write more about this application, but I believe I've made my point clear.  Thank you to the developers of Todoist. I highly recommend this application to everyone and anyone.

I've been using Todoist for about 3 weeks now and it has changed the way I get work done. I'm more productive which means I have more time to do what I enjoy doing. The only problem is that some potentially useful features are locked behind a paywall.

This app keeps me organized in all the different aspects of my life, from freelance projects, to my full-time job, to life with four little kids. I work across multiple devices and operating systems, often from the web. Todoist handles it all, looks great everywhere, works from the web, and is super fast.  Without this app I would be lost.  P.S. I really like the Android widget for quickly getting tasks into my inbox.

Smooth, flawless interface, easy to be organized through devices, and the fun thing is when the task done (or adding task) we earn more points; double fun indeed. The free version is even incredible, couldn't imagine how great the paid version is.

This app is AMAZING. I've tried MANY 'to do list' type of apps in the past and I mean a lot. But, honestly, I gave up since I never found an app that was good enough but todoist is great. I found this app on my computer the other day and it's great that I can use it of many places. It's just been 1 day that I've been using this but everything has come to place for me! Super satisfied.

I was a long-time user of Any.Do, but I hated that I couldn't see specific due dates for tasks more than a day in the future. I tried this app and feel in love. I do miss Any.Do's reminders (you have to pay for that feature with this app), but I'm still glad I switched because of the dates thing.

Paying for premium for a couple years. Was a 5 star app now it is too tedious to create a new task and set a reminder. Was a couple of clicks but now I find reminders are not saved because I have to click the arrow twice... The old version was more efficient. Looking at any.do as alternative.

Closest I have come to a smart task manager. Encourages you to simplify the way you view things without sacrificing too much flexibility. That's stupid and reflects poorly on the company. It's not trivial to move projects from Google Tasks (or anything else) to Todoist: No import or related documentation is provided, so the only easy way is to pay an outside service. That means, to _actually_ try this app, you have to subscribe to upgrade and pay to import. Makes me wonder where else they'll be short-sighted or stingy. Support? Security? You couldn't offer a 2-week free trial? Dumb.

ToDoIst falls short of the GTD mantra in one key way: the focus is on setting labels, reminders, and projects at the time of task creation, and not IN BULK. With GTD you are supposed to dump all of your ideas into an inbox, then move each idea/task into smaller chunks with labels, reminders, projects IN BULK. This is to decrease the TIME and ENERGY it takes to create a workflow. With ToDoIst you have to INDIVIDUALLY edit each task's label, reminder, and project. This is a huge waste of time when you have 20 things in your inbox that need to be quickly sorted. It's, ironically, almost the complete opposite of the GTD mantra. All in all I think TDI is fantastic, but there really needs to be a "bulk" edit option to really take it to the next level. I understand that you can do this with due dates, but that's pretty much it. This needs to be applied to labels, reminders, and projects as well. If I need to quickly label 5 tasks as "y" and 8 tasks with reminders, I should not have to edit 13 different tasks independently.

To do apps tend to either be way to feature rich and complex while others are a small step above notepad. Synced across all my devices I'm good to go.  I was a little skeptical about the yearly subscription but after getting a month to try it out I'm strongly considering adding it.

I adore this app, but since the last update it's extremely glitchy. Please fix this.. I miss my well working amazing app.  I re-installed the app and it's still freezing. When I open the app and move a task from let's say Wednesday to Monday it freezes and I have to shut down the app. This didn't ever happen before I updated it.

Reply: I could also specify the due date and the project in the older version when adding a task, but cannot in this version. That's why I mean it's slow.                   The older UI is way faster to add a task. The new interface wants to show that it is smart, but actually the lack of usefulness makes it look stupid. I am a premium member and I pay for saving time, not good looking only.

It sounds like a job title or a role. Are there places for improvement, yes.  Would love to see tighter integration with Google Now reminder cards and calendar.  But it has replaced any.do as my GTD tool.

I especially love that fact that saying something like "Note to self buy paper towels tomorrow" to Google Now will result in Todoist creating a reminder tomorrow, just like typing it into the app. Just wish the buttons on notifications didn't cut off text.

I like the new look however adding a task isn't as quick and easy as before the new design. Please let us use the old version. I am a subscriber but do not want to renew if it's going to be more than one step to add a category or labels. UPDATED: While I appreciate the reply, I am not sold. I  have to type a lot more- or remember the abbreviations- to add to different projects and labels. I am not renewing my subscription at this  point. It's too bad, I used the old version on a daily basis.

To use anything but the most basic features you have to subscribe to the premium version for a $30 yearly fee. I don't use it for work though so I don't need subtasks and projects but I would like to have reminders and multiple themes, even if they were purchased a la carte. Can we get a more productive design instead of a prettier one next time?
