After 2 years of premium, I think I have to find a new to do app :-(

And I never looked back. There are a few things that I miss, but for the most part, this service is superior. The best features in my opinion are the frequent and thoughtful updates as well as the fact that this service is more or less on any platform you could want. Keep it up!

Hate the new task entry.  I do not want to type a quasi-instruction sequence.  I want the easy selection process in the quick add version.  And you keep changing the name Tom to the date tomorrow.  Ridiculous!  What is more ridiculous, upon further review, is that the dialogue for adding tasks is still there- but you didn't provide any info to tell us that!  A long press on the + sign shows the dialogue in an improved design over previous iterations.  But why do you force us to be lucky and discover it like we were playing a video game?  C'mon, man!  Trumpet the fact that you provided a smooth option.

I had some problem in start but apps its great now. Just one thing: its to white. Need black version of apps and widget. On widger also is to much space between weeks or task. So if you eliminate this space will be better. And support is great.

Todoist is not the most aesthetically attractive of the various task list apps out there, but for the most part, it is very functional. It's easy enough to quickly add tasks in the app, but I personally prefer adding things online or through the web app because it's much faster to type than it is to keep tapping keys on my phone.  What I like most about the app is that it is easily customizable. The app doesn't have any default categories to start you with; you are free to create "projects" viewable in the side bar as you wish, or none if that's more your style. This is the case for pretty much all of the other functions: they work, but if you don't feel like using them you don't have to.   If you like keeping a task list, at the end of the day it doesn't really matter which tools (digital or non-digital) you use to do it as long as you are effectively getting things done. Todoist is a great choice, but if you don't like the layout there are plenty of other options.

The update sucks.  Give me the option to downgrade please. If I wanted this much aggravation I'd write my task list on toilet paper updated: they gave me the APK to go back to the old design. all is well with the world.

They make it seem totally awesome and useful. But you have to buy the full version for like, I think it was $30 a year... for this to be even close to useful. But it's like, I DONT want to pay that, just to get a notification for the things on my to do list, or to change the theme color of the app. The amount of things the app doesn't allow you to do, unless your willing to $$, is making this free version so disappointing for me and unbelievably useless. Just being honest.

I'm a PM and I never forget about any details (immediate or long-term) because I just set due dates out, even months away. It syncs with my phone, browser, and has a desktop app. Notebooks can't compare. I love that I can break things out by project and create sub-tasks, filter, prioritize, reorder.. It's such a clean and user-friendly interface.

I have been an avid and daily user of Todoist for a long time.  It was 5 stars for me before the update.   Now it is cumbersome and difficult to navigate.  I have tried to embrace it but just can't get there.  Sorry but I will be looking for a new App.  I am so disappointed as I loved it before!
Not too simple, but not overly complex, either. Two small items I would like to see improved: more streamlined notes (entering & exiting) and ability to add tags when tasks are created.

Loved it before.  I agree with others about the upgrade.  From my standard 7 day view, I have to create a task, then go back in to edit it in order to place it in proper project.  Makes adding a task a bulky process when it used to be so streamlined.  Is there something I am missing?  Also, try typing "game night" as a task.  The new auto time recognition thing messes it up every time. Hanging on to this app on the hopes that you'll come to your senses and give us back the prior functionality we loved.

For so expensive service I'd expect, among 24/7 online availability (which is there, luckily), also a perfect UI that simplifies tasks mgmt. Unfortunately, it's not the case, also after the redesign for 'material' approach. I ended up many times when I believed I created a task with reminders etc., whereas due to unfortunate action (pressing back because there was no 'Done'/'Finish'  button) I just lost my entry. Apart from that, the feature list doesn't really justify the price.

Having tried a number of todo apps, and having been let down by one of the original pay-for providers, this is a refreshing change. Seems to work well, is clean and stable. My only complaint would be that it's reminders just aren't naggy enough. Bit too easy to dismiss.

The updated UI makes it very tedious to enter new tasks, or reschedule existing tasks. The effects make it slower, and the way the look & feel changes (such as just to pick when task is due) is jarring, causing an additional mental context switch. I'll give it a couple weeks to see if any options to return to a usable UI become available, otherwise I plan to switch back to my 'Remember the Milk' premium subscription instead.
I love this app and that it syncs on my phone and computer so its always up to date.  The only thing that would make it perfect is if the premium features were also free.

This update is supposed to be streamlined, but I find it more difficult to add tasks. Tasks are also not listed in order of priority. Most annoying of all is that while trying to place overdue tasks for a new date, it keeps scrolling back to the top, making me constantly look for old tasks.

Tried almost everything else out there, but kept coming back to Todoist. Now I've settled on it and have been using it for a year. The free version is good enough for keeping track of day to day tasks. If you haven't tried it - Highly recommend you do so now.  For the todoist team: The new update automatically recognises days of the week if you type it as a task, and schedules it accordingly. This is a problem because quite often, I only mean it as a task description, and it's annoying when todoist automatically schedules it. A confirmation would be nice, so I can dismiss it if required.  The material design update rocks BTW.

This app used to be great, but now it is frustrating to use. Please keep it simple not clever. Takes too long now to add a task and go back and edit it the way you want it. And how frustrating to change the default time of a task!

the premium service is not cheap too. The free app is ok for simply listing daily/weekly tasks.  2 functions it lacks: a) view completed tasks - this is quite important. if i accidentally tick off a task and i need it back on the to-do list later on, i have to retype it and i am unable keep a log of the tasks i have completed previously b) commenting on tasks is disabled on the free app - this is a problem as i cannot plan and add details, which cripples the organizing function of the app and limits the free version to a list  of course, all of the above is fair, given that the app is free. For me, it's just a pity that the premium functions which make the app great are simply way too expensive

Thus is your basic running to do list. Not many bells and whistles, it's simple and effective for what it needs. I love the week view.  If I could make a suggestion, make a way at the end of the day to push all unfinished tasks to tomorrow at one time.

It's like this was made for me. Since I downloaded it, it helps me stay focused and on task. As reminds me daily on things I need to complete. Tip: schedule things to do before the due date and not on the day of.

Flexible, but requires to many taps/keystrokes to get things done (both web and mobile version). Examples for mobile version: adding task with due time or reminder is a pain: it requires a lot of typing, switching to numeric keyboard, to symbolic keyboard and back and forth. Why not just add a slideable "timer" UI control like in many alarm apps?  Also, is it possible at all to batch move few tasks to another project in mobile version? Looks like features were cut in order to  oversimplify design.  Also, is dark UI theme going to be available?

Down from 4 stars. The Material Design update looks nice, but it's functionality is clumsy & cumbersome. The old version was better. I dislike the overzealous parser. It interprets words like "tomorrow" or "Tuesday" to be due dates; so "confirm meeting for Tuesday" makes the due date next Tuesday, when you've either missed the meeting or are too early! This happens even if you overrode the parser's due date then go back to edit the task later! For 2 years as a paid, premium member, I've seen a zillion bugs.

I used to really like this app, but the recent updates to the interface have been terrible. It now takes much longer to enter in a task if you want to enter in any information beyond the name of the task itself. Hopefully they fix it. In the interim I need to find a new app.

I've been using the app for a couple of months now and it does work for my needs.   The more I use the app it the more fluid it becomes which makes me more efficient.  I would recommend it for the person who is going to use it as a tool, not just a to do list.  The only issue I have had is that I have to re-boot it on a regular basis, which is a bit inconvenient.  I'm not sure if that is an app issue or Windows??   Thanks for the app.
I've tried quite a few and this one if the best by far. Love how you can easily share tasks  and keep track of things to remember.

Look, I love change. I really do. But this latest update is awful. Everything looks good (sorta...) but it's a functional tool, not a social media app. I don't care about it's looks, I care about it's functionality. Before this update, adding a task from the widget was simple and you didn't have to type out all this nonsensical jargon. Either change the widget to be the way it used to be or undo the entire update. Whatever you do, please prioritize functionality and efficiency over looks. Looks are useless.

Task creation is now a frustration, I always put references to dates/times/hours in my task names, but they disappear because Todoist decides I'm being stupid and want to make that a date or time.  At least make it an option to turn off the date suggestion.  I love Todoist on the Web and use it daily as a premium member...but this new input feature is just painful.  Also, fix the advanced project filtering please!
I haven't used this app much yet,but I am excited to have it and all of its potential. Glad I download it. Happy so far.
Really like it, only thing keeping me from giving 5 stars is the pay model, too much is stripped from the free version.
Due date no longer working correctly after update. E.g. ev 2 weeks starting 14 July will only use the ev 2 drops the starting.

This update was very unfortunate. The app looks better but it is much harder to create tasks. That part is really an unfortunate failure. It takes way too long to add a task now. Looks like Im going to have to go back to Wunderlist which is truly a shame. I really like the outlook plugin for todoist but this update is annoyingly unfriendly. Remembering abbreviations? In the age of advance GUIs? This was a really misdirected update. I unfortunately will not be renewing. Dont defend this mistake. Fix it quick
New July '15 version nice and a bit easier. It still needs a simple way to finish a repeating task is over, like a school or job project.
Seems like a decent app, a little clunky about the entry of to do items, but good for managing them.  The fact you can't add notes unless you upgrade...a little bit too miserly if you ask me.

I have no real gripes about it. My only complaint would be the price of premium. I wish it wasn't a subscription but an outright purchase. Way more robust than Wunderlist and Any.Do, just too pricey for the sub.

I opened my mind to the new design and focused myself on the "why" behind the changes. With patience I started to understand the reason for the new design and used the app the way I thought it was intended. I actually like how the updated app works for me more than earlier versions. That was not my initial reaction to the new version.
Enjoying using the mobile app but can't get the desktop app to work in Windows.
Very confusing on how to setup a subtasks in latest Android version. Have yet to be able to do it.... deal breaker for me.
I didn't think it would ever happen but I gave my Daytimer and colored pens. Keep improving it but it is a great product already.

After the latest update, the new Material Design has just took over my heart! The way things show up, and the color scheme used is just plain awesomeness. Would vote it 5, but sometimes the app tends to respond slowly! I'm pretty sure it is just a temporary bug and will be fixed! Hats off to this amazing application!
but the last update made the input form less practical. Otherwise it would have been 5 stars
One bug I've noticed is when you have to many projects your not able to scroll down.
It has a simple interface and is ready to use. Sync across the app and web interface is quite good. Quite easy to manage tasks and projects.
All good.  And hreat fpr team work.  Only downside didn't work great with my macbook.    I'm sure they fix that soon.
You expect me to pay $30 usd up front for a year (no monthly payment options) for features you didn't even give me the opportunity to test drive? No thanks, I'll give my money to Any.Do
Particularly the widgets and repeated tasks. It says you can use straight English,  but really only in a prescribed sentence format. So a GUI would be preferable.
No ad even if you stick to the free version. Clearly the best To-do app I've tried so far. Still don't know if the extra features are worth paying for (relatively cheap).
needs a lil bit too much effort to manage tasks (clicks, taps, drags etc.) but perfect on the rest. love the karma system though.
This design sucks. Use to be best designed app for todo list now they have made it most complicated app in todo list.
Good app to help me keep up with my tasks throughout the day. Will probably upgrade to the premium version in the near future.
The old version had better functionality, and easier to use.   This app is still a lifesaver, but not as pleasant to use.
Simple, effective. Includes "gamification" (your karma score) if that's your thing, but doesn't ram it down your throat if such things arent a motivator for you. Premium is a bit expensive IMHO.
Easy to use and works well with smart watch, dont need to by any upgrades because this suits my needs, thanks.

If there's a better to-do app I haven't found it. I use this for critical work goals and for personal use. It is elegant, simple, and performs flawlessly. It's a model of how every productivity app should work.

Todist fit so seamlessly into what I needed to help me with time management, that I immediately began to wonder how I had gotten along without it. It's so simple and so effective. Todoist hits that sweet spot.
Love using the app and integrating with outlook. Very handy and easy to use. No technical issues thus far after using about 2 months

I Have used and implement this tool for my business and personal life over a year. I like the GTD methodology.  I Have had a few tech glitches but they were fixed shortly.  The Web and Android platforms are primarily used.
I'm so efficient when I use it. The Wear integration needs additional options, 5.1 opened up many possibilities for the app that they haven't taken advantage of.... yet
easy to add items. setting up repeat tasks a bit clunky. wish tasks would automatically sort by due date

Has really helped me improve my organization. I use it in conjunction with a field notes notebook 📓 which I take notes in first, I then transfer items I don't complete immediately into todoist. Works great!
I am using ToDoIst for 2 years. I can not imagin a work week without this app. Simple and done. I do not need premium but I pay for it because i want to support ToDoIst team.
Using Todoist for 2 months. It is simply the best and smartest life organizing tool I have. It needs improvement in making sublists.

I paid £18 for an annual premium sub and then  the sync stopped working on my Nexus 9.   Also, it will not work on my ubiquitous iPhone 4. None of these caveats are in the sales docs.  This product is not market ready. I would like a refund!!
I discovered the full power of Todoist after reading a book by Daniel LeFebvre "Getting Things Done With Todoist".
This to do list app is simply perfect. I can quickly add reminders and tasks. I have tried many other apps that fall short.
Lots of useful features, especially like the natural language input and that it syncs between devices. So good I might go nuts and pay for premium.
What I like about this all app is that if you want a simple To do list, this does it. If you're hyper organized it allows you to do all sorts of customization. It's great.
Todoist has become my primary task app. The integration with so many different apps has made this indispensable for my workflow.
ToDoist has been my go to for breaking down mountains of tasks into manageable daily agendas.
Like the connectivity with all my devices including my 2 Windows 10 OC's app works great
It does everything I want.  It is light, flexible and available anywhere.  It takes a few too many taps to do things for my liking but its on par with Wunderlist.  Logo could use updating.
Am also a big fan of Doit, but this is so streamlined and intuitive, as well as beautiful. Best around.
This app has made everyday task & Event seamless for me. l work from any device and my bf has been very easy .

Loved this app before the upgrade! 2 PROBLEMS: lt's virtually IMPOSSIBLE to MOVE a task by holding down on a task, as the screen moves at the speed of LIGHT! My screen scrolls CONSTANTLY!!! I click on ONE thing & the screen takes off to Tomorrow or somewhere!!! STOP THE WORLD! I JUST WANT TO READ IT! Also, if I forget to swipe a completed recurring DAILY task until the next day, it jumps OVER the current day to "Tomorrow!" PLEASE FIX!!!
Truly enables a productivity style that works with people of all shapes, sizes, and lifestyles. Love it.

Material design looks great, intelligent quick add is a disaster. This app used to be a five for me, now I'm looking for other options. I hope the developers listen to their many premium users who hate this feature and provide the option to turn it off.

The postponement of tasks still removes the repeat variations after multiple postponements. This is an annoying feature and I'm considering moving because I'm continuously having to reset the repeat on all my tasks that lose the value.
Hate that it wouldn't stop asking me to rate it every time I opened the damned thing, though.

Dragging items constantly causes the app to crash, adding new tasks is slower, the design increases font size and adds garish colors without improving usability. It was a great app, now it's just ok. The replies from the staff appear to be deaf to the resounding feedback from users, instead trying to convince us that we're wrong and that it's better. It's not! I know it's a lot of work to make an app and it's hard hearing negative feedback, but you already were doing a great job... Get back on that track.
Keeps my to do lists organized. I am sure it could be tweeked to streamline it more but it has been really helpful for me.
would get a five, but due to need for upgrade purchase,I have it a 4.
Found some bugs, hope they will be fixed soon. But in general very useful to-do list.
Just started using the Todoist app and so far so good. Does everything I need a reminder app to do and links all my tech so I can get to all the things I need to do within a touch or click.
Need I say more. A productivity app that doesn't get in the way of being productive

Been using for 6 months and love it. Little by little I'm using more of its features. It has really gotten me into a productive habit. I think it can even help you figure out your priorities over time.
Great app for busy people with a lot of stuff to keep track of. Yearly subscription a bit too pricey so I'm sticking with free version for now
The website functionality that needed to be captured here is fairly well done. Can't replace the website for "throughput"but is a good second choice for ubiquitous capture

The best thing about this app is the ability to add a new task from the notification bar without opening the app.  The worst thing is the widget, it's not very good looking, too much white space between each item.   When widget is improved would give 5 stars.
Simple interface. Easy to make posts, due dates, and the feel-good of clearing them with a swipe.

I've been using it a few days so far and I like it. Helps keep me to task and I needed that. Would have given it 5 stars if in the free version you could set alerts. Alerts come with your free calendar so I would have thought it would have been a free add on.

This app replaced my 5 year old routine of tracking my to do's using a day timer. Very happy with this app, easy to add new tasks on the fly.  It would be nice to see a more full featured Windows client for when I'm at my desk
For some reason my offer from Huawei of a free year of premium has not been activated, and would like to hear back on this. Have also emailed about this
Cross-platform support is the best part of this app. The ability to add & update entries on multiple devices is a huge advantage.
Wheb adding a task, it automatically goes to the bottom of the list and you don't have the option in the settings to change that. Premium account/app is too expensive.
Nice to do app, I'd remove the default emails sent to the user, user can activate them if needed but by default is kind on annoying
It will be very good if I can see the list of tasks that I completed. Its premium version. Please make it free. Thanks.
I like the new look.  One thing that I would find handy is the abilty to set the project for a task when inputting the text in the same way as you can add @tags and p:priorities.
It has everything I need in a "to do" app, and so little extra that it remains simple and there's almost no wasted time or screen space

Easily the best to do list app I've encountered. Wunderlist was good, but this is better! Using it in synchronization with Sunrise Calendar and Evernote complete the trifecta of productivity and organization!
This has become a critical part of my effort to stay organized. So much so that it was easily with it to purchase the Premium option.
I am a premium subscriber.  Sync has completely failed across platforms. Desperately trying to save task data. And support could be do much more helpful.
I've been looking for a decent app for organizing tasks for a while now and I think I finally found the one we did it kids.

Used the free version. Can easily sort task based on projects and easily sync between computer and mobile. Reminder option is good along with daily task email in your inbox. Great productivity tool. Highly recommended.
Had trouble installing update, but it finally went. I like that I  send a section of tasks to wearable.
Switched from Don't Forget The Milk.  Find Todoist easier to use and therefore more effective.  Of course like all organizers, you have to commit to making the time to use it.

I absolutely love this app except for one major flaw. Paying for the premium version 4x just so 4 people can get reminders...not cool. I would gladly pay $30 a year for my group to collaborate on projects but not per person. Regretfully uninstalling.
You've improved this perfectly decent application to the point where it is perfectly unstable and unusable. Losing a 2 year user.
I'm still only using the free version and it has come in handy at work and in life. I'm thinking of doing that upgrade and letting this app be my go-to for keeping me organized.
Better than other ones I've used like wunderlist. I would give it 5 if better reminder features were included.
Best I've used for basic to-do list. Only used a few months but already seen some nice user improvements as well.
Just waiting for the location reminders to be fixed. But I like that I can just write the info straight into the box including start and end dates and priority and labels.

The minimal design here is key this makes the experience superb. Material design through and through and you've got yourself a winner. Love the way that I can manage different projects (lists) and each can be give their own unique color. Pairs very well with the web counterpart.

It's one of those apps that you wonder how you lived without it. It's as useful as you want it to be. With evernote app there to remember everything, todoist gets my tasks under control and actionable, plus it can feel like a game with their karma points.
The old Todoist was good but the new version is even better. I don't need to revert to the web version as often as I used to as it's easy to use, even on a small screen.
Great app, easy to add and manage tasks. Please add a "Due this week" feature, so that a task can be quickly added to be done by the end of the week.
This is the first app where after a week I've still been able to do everything I've wanted. Free version is fine but this is good enough to pay for. The fact that this works with IFTTT is a plus.
My only complaint would be that even after paying for a sub the app has a popup asking for a review.
I like the way it integrates with other services. A little clunky to add tasks on mobile, and it isn't quite as pretty as wunderlist, but it is more functional for me.

Free version has great features for users. Interface is very fast on my phone, tablet, and computer. No bugs no laging. Users can create their own projects. Goals can be sorted via project and organized underneath another goal, like a sub-goal. Very pleased with this app. Might go for the unlimited paid version.

Especially the add task feature, I can understand why you think you upgraded it, but seeing other people's comments also, it's not as user friendly as before. Why change what was so good already? :(  also, there is no flexibility anymore with writing dates and numbers!!!
It would to totally perfect of you have a standalone app for Linux system.        Bug: Sync issues with Firefox on Linux, getting multiple deletions..
I appreciate the simplicity of  Todoist. An App that links tasks to email & contacts would be ideal, a 5 star.
Switched from Wunderlist and couldn't be happier after three weeks of use.
Like the reminders.visually is not very appealing hut quite basic but does the job
Unsure if it's a premium only thing but I'll be darned if I could find how to make a task repeat. For me that's a core requirement and so I think I'll be passing.
Why would you make adding tasks more complex! Please go back to old format.  I just reduced you from a 5 star to 3. Disappointed!

I use it for everything. I have a free subscription and it is all I need. The team at doist is great, and very responsive. If you want to start being productive, download it and follow the ivy method. If you need more complexity, you can always move to a  paid subscription.
I have many projects and they always have more dependent tasks I had not found any application where I could do that until now.
I like the calendar/reminder function. However the subtasks don't always show up when using an android phone.
This has been a really great tool to keep me on task and to stay organized. I'd recommend it to all
That being said, there are minor things lacking ie. .. inserting a check list. ..if I want to create a list,  this thing takes forever.
Reminders seem to be more reliable now. Bit of a clunky task input and no way to disable Wear support, so it leaves a background Wear process running if you use it or not.
Great interface,  some features are not intuitive
Nice and simple....fun to look at karma trend as an interesting way to stay committed to time management. I've incorporated as my main tool for life management. Todism!

This little app is exactly what I wanted. You can add tasks to your to do list that can be color coded. You can also adjust importance and add sub tasks for an item or built projects. I've been using this constantly since I installed it. Love it!
I installed this app a few days ago after trying others. It was with an article that I read that compared it to other apps that helped make my decision to pay for the upgrade. So far so good....
Recommended for people with memory issues or problems remembering times and dates.
I've had some issues with other platforms, but the Android app is solid. Combined with the availability of apps and plugins elsewhere, thus is becoming an indispensible tool for me.

I am somewhat of a productivity geek and have used a number of tools from Asana to Trello, Wunderlist to Toodledo. But I must say I have taken a liking to Todoist. It's a smart app that works really well. Simple yet Elegant, works great on all platforms.

After an exhaustive  search, I am happy to say I've finally settled on Todoist to manage my day-to-day tasks. Attractive interface, useful features, and a motivating system involving a level hierarchy and "karma" points gained by completing tasks. Give it a shot!
I like the material design makeover. My only gripe is the way it automatically fills in dates when you type any number into a task. Very annoying.
I really do not like new interface. Old was perfect now it is difficult to use.
Become myy default app for to-do list, after trying all major apps available. Pricing for premium version is competitive but can be little cheaper.
Tried them all. This has all the features I need and looks good. Evernote and calendar sync really help organise my life.

I've tried a lot of different task management tools, and Todoist nails it for me. Integrated with Gmail, available on any platform, GTD support, powerful filters, and a great UI. I've only been using it for a month and am looking forward to exploring even more advanced features.
Good, responsive support  team makes it more than just another to do application. I loved it. Features are added often and evolving continuously.
Great app. My husband and I love that we can since our to-do lists, it's much easier than making a calendar invite or sending an email!
I use a desktop, ipad, and Galaxy s6. Todoist has seamless coverage fir these devices and I enjoy using it. I would like to see finger print list encryption and more security.
I haven't used it enough to really understand all the features but it looks promising
Very well made todo list app. Specially with the premium features together with all the various places of integration I feel like I have found a perfect tool for organising my daily life.

Basic necessary functions are available in free mode, but you have to subscribe to get alarms (though can set due date/time nonetheless) and task notes & attachments (otherwise can only use task name to describe your task).
Now when I type a number it automatically gets converted to a date. So if I add 9 carrots to my shopping list, I can't. This is ridiculous. Uninstalling.
If want to add task to say book appointment for hairdresser on 8th August it adds task puts in that date -help!

This is by far the best app I've tried.  It let's me apply the Franklin Covey methodology (I use projects as roles). I ended up upgrading as I think it's totally worth it especially considering it's multiplatform.

Best task manager available. When coupled with a desktop email client this is extremely powerful. The UI experience is pretty top notch too. I still have to figure out how to batch move tasks I didn't complete to the next day but I'm sure I'll figure it out. Great job.
Fantastic, not only will this app help you organise your daily tasks but the multi platform ability helps you enter tasks no matter where you are
Keeps me organized and on task. Can be customized very easily. I like that there is granular notification control. Sync between devices is flawless.

It is one of the best to do list apps out there. Easy to use with clean design and useful widget. I gave 4 stars because I wish it had a field for effort estimate and actual effort so I could track my time.
This app has allowed me to organise my life better through my phone and laptop. Great all round app

I've tried a lot of different To Do apps and this is definitely the most feature packed, flexible and usable. Great for work tasks and personal use, while the shared projects makes it easy to use with the family. The free version is very limited, you do need to pay (use the free trial) to see the full benefits.
A no-bs app which gets my work done. Have been using it for a while now.
Seriously. I hate the new quick add ui.
I use it at the office, share lists with my coworkers, girlfriend, clients. It's great - keeps me in sync with what needs done.
Amazing app. Seriously. I love the whole karma thing :)
Possibly the best, the only problem i have is with syncing. FAQ isn't that much of a help either.
The best task and project management tool I've tried. Very minimalistic by design and very functional. Love the location-based reminders.
Old design was much better then the new one, I hope you'll bring it back. Overall, usefull app.
One list across Android and Mac, phone, tablet and desktop. Nice visuals and straightforward design. Integrates well with OS X notification center.
I've tried a lot of different apps to organize my To-dos, but this is by far the best one and it continues to get better.  I am looking forward to new integrations courtesy of the new PowerApp API.
I love the functionality in this! It helps my forgetfulness and is easy to use.

As a developer I'm excited that Todoist offer a web API for their app, which makes it possible to write your own scripts and applications that plugin to Todoist. I'm looking forward to see what updates the Doist team have in store :) hint: maybe a vim plugin :P

Дизайн конечно обновили, все очень здорово, но фишки с автоматическим преобразованием текста в параметры при вводе очень странные - хочу ввести слово, а оно автоматически меняет его на какой-то параметр и сохраняет не известно куда.
