I really want to move over from wunderlist and thought the redesign might win me over.   I'm held back by the needles clicks to edit and change priority for example. I would love to see someone use pinch to zoom to expand and collapse folders to make navigation faster too.

It was so simple and perfect...now every task with a number requires another step to not automatically treat it as a date, project list collapses, suggested tasks are a distraction....will start looking for replacement without an option to revert or turn off some of these "features".

I've been using it for a while now and I really like it. I like the features and really like the new UI. I would like to see an easier way to set up recurring tasks and alarms and the ability to choose a specific time to snooze a task reminder.
Love it! Feels weird when each number thinks I'm entering a date, but I'm sure the dev team is working on this.
Very useful and sleek, and I love the fact that this has plugins on Gmail and Firefox. Love it! 😊
After the last update, the app is once again, the best one out!
Can anyone else get this to work properly? I cannot edit Todoist tasks in GCal, including their dates. And, they are syncing to my phone days behind the GCal entries I make on my laptop.
This is hands down the best productivity app that I have ever used.

TODOIST, love the update EXCEPT for the changes to adding tasks. It takes longer to add tasks now. This is a huge pain point. The old interface focused on speed and use, the new one focuses on it being pretty. Everything is way to spread out when your adding a task. If you don't decide to change it back, then give the option to switch between material and old style.

I don't mind the distracting colors, though I think the simpler color scheme from before was more befitting a productivity app.  What has killed it is the 4 straight force closes I've had since the update.  EDIT TO ADD: Force close happened after sweeping right on tasks to check them off.

I feel like I need a new tutorial after the update which was not fun to find out on the fly when I don't have time to figure it out all over again!   I love that it integrates on all my devices and sends email reminders. I really wish there were widget options though. 4x3 is huge. 4x2 would be fine or other smaller options that would fit on my phone pages better. If it had that, it would get 5 stars.

I downloaded this app today after reading an article and I was not disappointed at all! Great design and it uses material design SO well. The only thing is that I think the price for a year subscription is a bit too much. If it was maybe like a one payment thing  I would totally buy this. Anyways still 5 stars. Keep up the awesome work!

I'm ridiculously picky about to do apps and I've tried scores over the years. I want it all: GTD-capable, flexible, fast, easy to use, but with plenty of customization, granular control and a wicked smooth workflow. Todoist delivers. The premium version shines and is one of the few out there actually worth the price.The latest update raises the bar by making task entry lightning fast with RTM-style quick syntax. No fiddling with a half dozen fields, just type as many task properties as you like.

The latest update moved all of my task forward a day and will not let me add new task to Today or change existing task to Today.  NEW PROBLEM: Release 8.0.1 fixed the problem with Task having been moved forward a day but now nearly all of my Projects are not listed on the Android app. They're still on the web, Chrome and Outlook, but not on my phone. Again, BAD UPDATE!!. This is not what I expected for $29. per year. Everything worked just fine before this update.

A few weeks ago I would have given this app 5 plus stars, but I hate the changes they made to the way you add tasks. I'll keep using it hoping they fix this mistake, at least until I find something that is as good and as easy as this used to be.

Update: love the redesign. It has some bugs, but it's efficient, well designed, and still an integral part of my war to get things done. This is the first ToDo style system I've been willing to spend money on. It has Google Calendar integration, projects, tagging, reminders, and more. It was well worth $2.50 month to support the creators.

Samsung Galaxy S4: Your ADD TASK on the LOCK SCREEN covers up my PERSONAL MESSAGE (which has no option but to appear at the top of the screen). I have always set my PM to display my contact info, if my phone's lost. I see no way to remove ADD TASK from LOCK SCREEN. It's unnecessary there for me anyway; ADD TASK is quickly available from the pull down NOTIFICATIONS BAR. At a minimum, please create a setting to relocate it's placement. Please advise. (Great little app. Annual fee is too expensive for me.)

Like some aspects of the new design but too much wasted space I want to see as many tasks as possible without scrolling the old layout was superior in that regard. The website interface suffers from the same affliction. When managing large number of tasks a birds eye view is needed.

The best todo app I've had, way better than Wunderlist (more features, less expensive, better interface, more logical, etc.). Also, WL is missing some key features around flexible repeating events and reminds which Todoist does perfectly. Support is pretty spectacular - I've gotten replies within half an hour on weekends. Can't go wrong!

One of the best things about this app was the widget. But it functions worse after this new update. Especially bothersome is the huge padding. I want to be able to fit more than a couple of tasks in my widget without having to look at all this empty space.

Going the way of Wunderlist! - trying to win design awards rather than actually providing a functional app.  I want to be able to add tasks easily. Not learn a DSL to add times and dates...  I used to be able to set reminders and dates from the add task button - now I have to enter stuff like "Task name at 9pm" - which will create a task (no reminder) for the next 9pm occurrence. There's probably some command i can type in to get it to do what I want, but seriously... this is a step backwards.  If i have a task, with subtasks, since the update, these don't expand.  If it aint broke, don't fix it. I sincerely wish I hadn't updated!
There is no other app that is as truly cross platform as Todoist. It's well designed and miles better than the competition.

It is a great tool to get things done especially because it is available for pretty much anything. The Material-version is very pretty. Why only 4 stars? For one it has themes but no real dark theme. In each theme most visible fields are still white. And it still doesn't have real start dates, so that tasks can be hidden until a certain date. When I can do something starting Saturday, I do not need to see it before.

But the update changed it to the standard Google/Android app look, with bright colors and big fonts. I really liked the simple look, especially the quick add widget/shortcut which I used often. That took up a very minimalist portion of the screen. Now, the whole screen is used up when doing the exact same thing. The purpose?
As a manager for a large company I use this program religiously for my time management. Unfortunately there seems to be some issues with sub-tasks loading very slow. Besides this I like the update.
The only thing i noticed was that material design hasn't fully met the widgets. Other than that everything works fine now.

The web Browser Version works great, unfortunately In the app creating proper nesting is near impossible and  nothing stays nested correctly. Simply checking that you completed something will unnest tasks if done in the wrong order. In addition the app is very bad at pulling dates out of titles, so much so that the function should not be included in the app. For instance typing something like "sit ups 50 reps x 2"  will result in the app trying to pull 50 or 2 into the due date over and over again.
I really do love this application. But after the material design update I cannot display my sub-lists. It also isn't syncing correctly.  Website works great though.

New method is not more efficient. No reminders without upgrade? Really? People won't upgrade if there isn't something in the free version to get us hooked. And ur preset labels...did u intentionally make most of them so awkward to force us to upgrade? Used you since beginning. Looking elsewhere. Maybe after I've found a simple to-do w reminders and sync I'll come come learn ur version of efficiency. Didn't have time for surprise today.
Really good looking update to material design. Not quite as user friendly as before but I can get used to it.
Crashes after update to MD on zenfone 5 (4.4 kitkat) device. Bad testing before deploying new releases.

Not that easy to add tasks as before redesign. Using text input is not that convenient on the go. Number of taps and waiting for animations for add/edit task dialogs increased. UI elements on those screens are far from each other what makes your finger travel a lot around screen. Downgraded to 7.1.4.
Got irritated that the premium tabs cannot be removed. Hate clicking on labels accidentally and getting the premium notice.
I use it daily in Personal and Work life. Helps me in keep Office schedules and Priorities always on track. Never been easier and smooth. Keep up the Awesome Job. Cheers.
I chose to use the old Todoist because of its simplicity. The new UI makes me take longer to create tasks and looks far less clean. I'll be looking for a replacement.

Update was okay cosmetically, but the entry change is terrible. You may think it is easier than ever but in reality you have ruined this app by fixing what wasn't broken. Please, for the love of humanity let us get the old version of entry back.

The new design looks great and I would probably use it but the fact that you have to pay to have basic functions such as a reminder is pretty dumb. I'm not sure that many people  will use it because of that.

I didn't like new version , I was comfortable with old version.. In new version you can add tasks easily for today. But it takes to much time to add tasks on specific date .. Provide us old version.  So it will be easy to access.
I've only had it installed for a short time, but Todoist has proven to be the most effective and efficient way to keep track of every. little. thing. that comes my way.

Keep the look,  but the old way of adding tasks.  I don't like the 2 steps to picking a time and date, let's just make that go directly into the yellow page with options.  In other words, if I slide left, go straight to the yellow page
Lowering my review for the new version. I loved the old version for how clean and simple it was. All that has been thrown out the window in the update. Too bad, Todoist used to be my favorite app.

The new material interface is pretty, I'll give you that. It's also pretty useless.  Why would anyone want to type "tomorrow" instead of just clicking an icon? And if you want to provide that option, why delete the icon too? And the new UI makes it difficult to set project category--I can't figure out how to do that while creating the to-do, even after watching the ridiculous video on their website (so much WOW!). Apparently you have to do that after first creating the task.  UPDATE: reading a response from Todoist to another disappointed reviewer, I learn that you're supposed to type out the name of the project too. So much typing. How innovative and convenient! So now I need to type something like "Check Kathy's binder due today, a "ASU misc" label"? What a pain in the butt!
Tried several To-do app, but this seems to best so far. Updated to 5 star after new update.

I'd give it a 5 stars if it lets users set their own default reminders instead of a "30 minutes before" reminder every time. Edit: after the last update I can now do that. The developers did listen to the users and implemented what they want. I am very pleased.
Like sub project or sub task listing is taking an awful lot of time (5 to 10 seconds). Never experienced this before.
Great new design and very easy to use across all platforms. I'm obsessed with my Karma.
It's more complex than ticktick but once you get over that slight hurdle it is a little better for power users and feels more solid as an app and a company.
The original update today had a glitch but the developers responded quickly as normal and now we have an excellent update. Rock On with the best To Do App on the market!

... And lightening quick sync across all my PCs and devices. Latest update is good, not sure why other reviewers are finding it difficult to add a task, i have no issues with it, but it was pretty good before the update

Using this more and more. Started using it for own tasks at work. Now using it for personal reminders, organising teamwork and keeping tabs on projects. Love the integration with Outlook too. Sync between various devices is seamless. This is a keeper.

Just an opinion, I think it would be great to have at least some trial period to experience the premium. I find the app crippled when there's no reminder feature. At least allow a number of Todo items to have the reminder option.
The material design interface is stunning! The no bells and whistles design makes it great for anyone who is just keen on getting stuff done.

I like the way you can send to do lists and get others involved. It is basic unless you pay  for e one with whistles on. I would like to see either one of price or cheaper yearly fee. Then I would buy the more comprehensive version. In all the basic one is good
Had a little difficulty making the reminders work the way I wanted but hopefullu I have it figured out now :) Great features.
I love it!! Love the different categories you can color and helps keep track of everything that I need to get done.
Great todo management app. Some learning curve but not too bad. Would like to see easier input of sub tasks. Maybe I just need to work with the new interface a bit more. Looks great. Works great.
Dependencies were requested by users a long time ago. Still missing. What a pity.

It appears this was redesigned for speech control input with no regard for how this affects normal input. It looks like an update done by the geeks without input from users. I am looking for a different app.
I love this app, but the newest update makes it so much harder to add tasks. I'm going to be spending more time typing things in than actually accomplishing anything. Completely counterintuitive.
With the new interface I can't see how you add sub tasks to the same main task easily? Otherwise great app. I don't have a problem with the new way to add tasks.
Todoist is great with the preamium features. But 30 dollars a year is far too expensive.

ToDoist is a great cross-platform todo list service (syncing is fast and flawless between my Mac, iPad and Android device).   With this release, the Android client becomes the pick of the Todoist bunch. Interactions are well designed, everything is a tap or two away. It's also very pretty, which doesn't hurt.   Highly recommended.

Update had a bug problem. I post a review explaining my disappointment. 15 minutes later the developer responds to my review. A couple hours after that a new update and no more problem. What's not to like! Awesome job you guys!!!! Thank you:)

This new version is total CRAP! Not only does it look dog poo, it no longer allows adding new items. At least not by pasting from the clipboard. How do I go back to the excellent app you used to have???  DON'T DL THIS VESION OR YOU'RE SCREWED !!!
Download it now. It's easy and not annoying!
Minor complaint is that there is too much space wastage with the widget. Even when it is 4x4. Please make it more compact. I think this problem got worse with the material update.
Great app, well layed out UI, works on every platform, once you have plan the structure no going back you will love it! The next day I purchased the premium version.
Switching between projects is a nightmare.

everything is very nice. but i think push notifications should be made available for free. Else what is the point of having a to-do list manager which cannot notify.               Update2: The new material design theme is very nice and pleasing. It was always a wonderful app to use and is the same even today. I use the todoist on my phone, chrome browser,  outlook messenger seamlessly without missing out on anything important.
FAB button in material design release has stopped the crashes in android m preview.
The updated design certainly looks better, however the old menu for adding tasks was far better. Typing out everything is far more work than simply tapping a date. So please add that back in.
Reminders disappear from notification bar instantly without me interacting with them. I miss all of my reminders
Love the new look! And the small bug I had at first has already been fixed. Impressive work, Todoist team!
Great app for managing your day to day tasks. Wud love to have sub task feature in Free edition.
Appreciate the support, updates and all the love coming from Todoist! Please continue to bring premier customer support to this top tier app
A bit confusing. I still sort of like it... Can someone explain how to add my tasks to a project quickly? It defaults to the inbox and doesn't seem to go to my project when I type the project name.
Took a minute to learn,  some seemed awkward at first,  love it now...
Does not synchronize with Google Calendar. This is Android, so most people use Google Calendar. Missed opportunity, great design!
Godd design, easy and organized. A good fit!
Looks terrible with the orange juice backdrop! Scrolling through tasks and editing tasks is awkward and inefficient. Bring back the old version or loose me to GT tasks

Update. The new design... a bit confusing. And what's with the sugestions like Pick Andy at 5. Please downgrade. Or please let us choose between versions. This time 3 stars. --------------------------------------- Best todo app! Integrates with email and notifies you in time, even place. Love the function of setting emails as tasks. I use Postpox in my computer as email client and CloudMagic on my phone. They both work as charm with Todoist.
Material Design simply made me redownload this app and give it a second try.  Material widget would be awesome.
task surching not work proprly.
I love the new interface, and it makes using this app so much easier!
LAST UPDATE BREAKS THE APP
I would love to have the remainder on the free version.
Easy to use and an excellent tool for life and work.

You used to be able to add a task right into the project you wanted it to go in now you have to add task and then edit it or select the project first....just seems like an extra step now....really annoying
Is this communist China? Can we please change the colors in the header? Looks utterly horrible. -3 stars for that :(
Just recently started using it. So far so good.
Would be good if you could alter the transparency of the widget.
Yes even better than wunderlist.
Works well. Pleasant to use. Any number of subtask level.
Simple to use, does everything I need.
So far, it's covers all my needs
Useless for keeping simple lists.
Love it. Easy to use, does what it says
Works smooth and great for shared collaboration
It took two years but I can now organise tasks much more flexibly
A widget update - smaller font - would be nice.
Support and bug fixes are super fast!
UI is great!
Love to use this App, and it's easy.
Very good solution to Improve my business.
Have to buy premium to do anything
Great app, very smooth, clean and fast.
Great app  especially gmail integration
Love the update. 10/10, will update again!
I'm more organized thanks to this!!
Trying for ages to get something that works and fits with Thunderbird and my mobile, chromebook, and laptop.
Reminder does not work!
Really useful app
Works across all platforms, amazing!!!!
Helps me stay organized!!!
Great app love it!
Really improved productivity.
Very intuitive UI design....
It's awesome
I don't want to set a date but every number I put turns into the date. I miss the previous version. I may have to switch to something else
Nice app
Perfect
Clean UI

Absolutely love this app. Just wishes it worked with Google task.  06/23/15:  My Review of since Material Design Update: Okay. Just updated. It's already not passing the test.  All my to-do's have been pushed back 1 day. Everything on the desktop version still looks fine though.  The material design looks nice, but who cares if app is now broken

Material Design update: Looks pretty but all task dates are now off by a day. Please fix. A solid foundation and a generally good app. Needs more functionality in the repeatable tasks area, views of projects/tasks more than a few weeks out is confusing (where day of week is still main header), etc. But I'm a premium payer, hoping it will get better. I also know that Google Tasks is gonna get a revamp and will slay this whole market. Who, when push comes to shove, does it better than G.?

The material design update is nice, but I reaallly would love the ability to press and hold on a project in the list to get an option to edit the project (move it left or right, rename, delete) and also add project above/below/as child project.  "Manage projects" is slow and laborious when adding more than 1 project

Yet another app that hurts itself by "going Material" - except you can hardly call it that. It's just white - white everywhere, with missing borders, layers, and depth. Everything is suddenly half the size, yet taking up twice the space. And why are tasks pre-filled with useless placeholders? I don't HAVE a gym membership to renew. Why can I no longer add tasks in expanded view by default? Feels like this was largely an attempt to make the app "simpler," except the compromises made it worse for everyone.

A bit overboard on form over function. Hard to read fonts due to colors and too much wasted white space. Buttons on a menu bar without any labels to indicate what they do. Have to touch them just to find out.
Been using this for about 2 weeks now. Good for keeping track of little tasks I need to complete.

I use it on 3 platforms and it's great. Today I updated the Android version and all my tasks for today got bumped to tomorrow and I am unable to move them to today for some reason. Tried restarting my phone with no luck.
It does do what I need. It really is what I was looking for. The free version is great for testing. I'll purchase my license as soon as possible.
The problem i have with this app is new item will be on the bottom of list, i prefer top, can't sort them
Great little app. Came pre-installed and now use it all the time
The best wonderful tablet interface and a very clean phone interface. :)
And the karma concept is cool :)
Found exactly what I was looking for.many many thanks to developers.
It won't let me add a task to today. It defaults everything to tomorrow...
The best of the to do apps

This might be the best to-do app I've used. I've tried many. All of the features I found that I liked I different apps, are all in this one. Multiple levels of subtasks and subprojects, notifications, reminders, notes, attachments......it has it all.
Finally, I've got it MD. It's really cool!
perfect for the purpose.

The free version works reasonably well. It does some things better than other apps (e.g. deeply nested subprojects and subtasks) and others not as well (e.g. filtering). The premium version has a few more bells and whistles and boatloads of unfulfilled promises. Do NOT buy it unless you are happy with it exactly the way it is.

This is the only task management app that I have been able to stick with.   The interface is intuitive,  and it has the best repeating task functionality I've seen.   The only thing I really want to see added is better business account features, such as the ability to see tasks completed by others.   When that comes out I will move my whole team to todoist.

Trying the free month of premium. Very simple to use, but all my tasks and projects in one folder suddenly deleted. I do not know if I did it or it was a program bug. If I did it it should be harder to do. When I imported the last backup, it took a long time to format it correctly. Hopefully this doesn't happen again because otherwise the app is nice because of its simplicity.

This app has been absolutely amazing and I have already recommended it to many of my friends. The only reason that I didn't rate it five stars is because it doesn't work alongside a calendar. A calendar helps keep a visual picture of what's going on and I love an app that integrates a calendar and todo list into one.

Have been looking for a to do list app and this one was recommended by a friend. I wish you could put tasks in multiple categories. I created a category called "craft projects" and have all my crafts under it, but sometimes I need to buy things for my crafts and either have to put them under crafts or shopping. It'd be nice if I could put them under both categories :)

To do apps generally have a small feature set that eventually drives me back to pencil and paper. Todoist has a complete, but not overwhelming, feature set that works well on desktop or phone. The sync feature is indispensable as well. The only issue I have is that sometimes sync can be a little slow, so I'm not sure whether I haven't checked something off or if it's just synchronizing.

This is a superb program, both in Windows and on Android.  I had been using Wunderlist, and just switched to Todoist, which works far better, particularly in terms of being able to update due dates, which is very tedious to do in Wunderlist.  Todoist also has integration in Outlook, so you can turn emails into tasks without leaving Outlook.  You can also email tasks directly to individual projects.  They're also just rolling out integration with Evernote.

I've been wanting an app I can input all the stuff I need to do so I can remember and check things off, to keep myself organized. This app does it all. Though it's far from perfect, it's much closer than many other apps I have used or use on a daily basis. Definitely worth AT LEAST a download.

After using it for a week it's not disappointed me once - an unusual occurrence with apps! Especially love the flexible method for setting up recurring tasks; something strangely missing from many task managers.  And the presentation is immaculate. Great (and free unless you need the full feature set) app.

At first I was thoroughly in love with this app. Love the ability to create super specific recurring tasks and love the karma reward system. Here's the problem. I want to mark a task as not complete and take a karma hit without deleting it completely, especially if it's a recurring task. I've seen this requested in the support threads and the staff always talk it down but I really need this feature to fully utilize the karma system the way I want to. I would pay for premium if that feature were included.

I've tried all of them and nothing beats todoist. The ability to set due dates at a specific time and have them ordered that way is a must for me. The ability to have sub projects and sub tasks helps me organize my life and the ability to set due dates using real speak is amazing. The ability to add notes is also huge for adding important task related info. I used to use wunderlist but the lack of task order and multiple sub task levels was a deal breaker.

I've been using Todoist for a couple of years and always thought it excellent. The only thing missing for me was a good Android app and now we have one. It's been great to watch Todoist evolve and I'm sure they'll think up other ways to make this already excellent product even better.

I have slowly changed my review from 5 to 2 stars throughout the past few months because of todoists so called enhancements. I think the most troubling thing for me is the support sight that I am currently a part of (as a premium user) and see no real progress of customer care. (I'm tired of fighting to help Todoists become great again.) If I wasn't already integrated into it, I would more than likely jump ship.

Very useful for managing tasks on the move, though a couple of additional features would make a massive improvement. Firstly, a "send to history" option to deal with stuck sub-tasks. Secondly, it's way too easy to lose new notes by clicking the tick icon instead of the "note save" icon - the note should either be saved automatically, or the user warned.

I've been looking for a to-do list tool that handles recurring tasks and one-time tasks (and those weird recurring tasks that happen on the last Tuesday of the month or whatever). Todoist does exactly what I wanted and does it well. I wish the paid upgrade wasn't a recurring subscription.  I love the ability to see completed tasks because it's very motivating, but I don't have the budget to make it happen. Maybe someday.

So far I love the free version, I am just starting with premium so I can't rate that yet. However, I have searched for a long time for a digital task list this in depth and have used multiple other options with the exception of Evernote  (which I will try next if Todoist isn't as cool as I think now) so far I am extremely impressed. Thank you Todoist and I'm only sad I didn't find you sooner!

I can honestly say that this is by far the best task manager app, I'm trying to introduce it in the company I work as well. My only negative remark is about the v 10, there should be at least an ETA by now for the Android version. It's getting annoying a bit.

This app is very useful.  There are very few bells and whistles.  Its all business, which can be good or bad depending on what you're looking for in a to-do list.  If you're goal is to get work done and stay organized, this app will work for you.  Just be warned: some of the best features require you to subscribe for a year.

I run a small business and there are hundreds of things on my to do list. This app makes it so easy to organize and prioritize everything in my life for both work and my personal to do's. I also love the ranking system that allows me to strive for achievements in accomplishing my tasks! Highly recommended to anyone on any type of device.

I love that I can use this on my Android phone, a standalone Mac application and with good Chrome browser integration. I've been using the free version for a while now and have stuck with it in a way that hasn't worked with other apps I've tried. If it allowed me to sort tasks on the mobile application (as you can on Mac and Chrome) then that would be great!

New version is a downgrade. New materials design reduces information density, doesn't add any useful features, and destroys the add task from the widget.  Longstanding feature requests remain unaddressed-- e.g., the inability to view a project's subprojects at once. Continuing inability to tag multiple items. No dark theme.   Just went to TickTick, and it's a huge improvement.

Very intuitive and I like the format better than Gmail tasks (which is no longer free for my iPhone). I just use it to manage my own tasks, so I don't invite people or use the upgraded version.  But the free version is great. It syncs across my laptops, iPhone, and android phone seamlessly. I have my list wherever I am.

Todist has terrific task management features. The collaboration part is excellent. Moving tasks around is so easy. I love it. Except one thing. The filter disappoints me. It doesn't allow filtering on tasks assigned to specific team members.

tried all the other to do list apps...prefer todoist. really like its simple design and using its subtasks...the thing that i don'tj like is the way you add (sub)tasks - that is just clumsy...also having my projects as my main view would be nice...location reminders seems nice but i dont know if it really got the right location. adding tasks with photos would be nice...thanks

As soon as I think of something I  forgot to do, an hourly occurrence, I stick it on here. Even better though is the multiple project and repeating task function, which allows me to set daily and weekly goals for myself.

I prefer this hierarchical style for my lists. Todoist works well and keeps things simple. That said, now that I'm used to navigating this app, I'd like to see a few features that I could activate. An option to link to a"next task, " better management of recurring tasks, increased connectivity with other apps.... Some of these seem to be rolling out, which I applaud. Others seem to be overlooked. All in all, though, a great resource for me.

In a recent reply, Doist notes that Android *was* the first priority platform for development. The use of past tense there worries me. The potential of an Android device far surpasses that of an iOS device; but this potential isn't being reached as developers prioritize the iOS platform. I understand iOS still has a strong command of the targeted market, but developers (all - not intending to single out Todoist, I use the app everyday on 3 different platforms) need to give users a reason stick with Android.

Lovely easy to use app, and it's brilliant that all of your tasks sync across all of your devices. However, actual functionality differs between devices and while the Android app is mostly fine, it's not possible to filter within projects on Android (it is possible everywhere else). So sometimes it's difficult to get the information you actually need. If this was fixed though, and they've said that it's 'coming soon', then this will be basically a perfect app

I have tested and have been using all of the best to-dos apps and todoist v.7 is the best of the best. I like Wunderlist, it has for ex. free comments but non-flat subtask system. Todoist has. I like Asana but it hasn't offline cash which is important when you travel. Basically I use todoist for write down a new project when I travel because ver 7 has nice flat design even on small phone (better than 8 beta Material). Todoist works great with IFTTT and toggl. Cheers.

By far, the best task list out there for me. Simple and effective interface, quick data entry, and multiple options for organizing your tasks. Could use a little work on the user interface to reduce the number of clicks and time required to assign a due date, label, or project but the issue is not bad enough to take a star away.

When you quickly create a new task and don't set a due date, in the '7 day view' it disappears! I use this app to make sure I don't forget things but when that task disappears from the list I lose that reminder, and the app starts losing its value to me.

This app is wonderful!  It has helped me to manage projects better than any others I have tried.  The push notifications are 1 per day (as things are coming due) and couldn't work better.  And the syncing from computer to phone is seamless!  Highly recommended.

I use this for tasks I want to do at some point over the course of the day and things I want to do eventually. It's a great way to keep the stuff with no set start our end time and stuff I'd like to do eventually from cluttering my google calendar, where I keep appointments with a set date, start and end time.

If you're looking for a simple, digital to-do list that syncs across all of your devices, look no further. I use this for work tasks every day and couldnt be happier. I love that I can create a task on my phone and it syncs with my work PC and tablet. Love it

I've tried many different to do lists and this one beat the others. Many of them have the same features but Todoist just sits right with me. One small complaint is that the widget shows days that don't have tasks, which takes up unnecessary space. Highly recommended!

Notifications are so temperamental, recently that rarely work properly.  Your integration with IFTTT is great when it works. And recently your app is so horrendous. 'couldn't understand your due date' when I'm trying to add a reminder time, not even the right error. Poor.

I love this app and the service behind it! We use this in our household for reminders, shopping lists, daily, weekly and monthly tasks. The real-time synchronization and update makes it an excellent collaboration tool. The possibility of ordering, setting reminders, repeating tasks and sub-tasks means you can use this tool however you see fit yourself, without the app or service restricting you. Would give 10 stars if I could!

This has taken my lack of organization and revolutionized it. I have tried using calendars and todo apps before, but they always lack the organizational structures that my mind desires. Being able to create sublevel upon sublevel of task enables me to set up complicated systems that imitate the assignment lists for school. I can structure it in a way that makes it clear what needs to be done when and what is related to what.

The best part of the app is the minimalistic interface which has enough options to set tasks easy. I use the web version when not on the phone and have had no issues between the 2 syncing. It responds well on my older LG Mach and plan to stick with the app on a new phone.

This is a very well organized application. You can use it in very simple ways, but it scales up to much more complex use scenarios without becoming unmanageable. The ability to schedule repeated occurrence is of certain asked makes it invaluable for people who have daily checklist.

I wouldve given it 5 stars if it allowed either of the following  - Automatic Task Scheduling for Repetitive tasks that have many sub-tasks (like automatically have a reminder to check-in a day before the flight, send boarding pass after the flight, etc)  - Project management  Without either of them.. its not a complete solution.

The key to not getting overwhelmed is having a clear picture of what needs to be done. Breaking projects into bite sized tasks makes the work manageable. The software easily allows you to drag and rearrange tasks. Maybe something you planned for today can wait until Thursday. No problem.  Over time you learn to prioritize and accurately scope what can be done in a day. It's also a great tool for tracking longer term goals without fixed due dates. Record your idea now and assign it a time frame later on.

This is a great app, I've been using the premium version for more than a year and have been happy recommending it to many of my colleagues. 5 stars would be well-deserved, except for one unpleasant experience... after the last update, synchronization of the desktop app suddenly stopped working and I lost more than a week of entries. I hated that! Developers, make sure that your updates are bug-free!!! Thanks

It's a good app for project management and business task tracking. I felt it wasn't a good fit for me. I don't want to low ball it in stars for that one reason so 3 it is. Good just not for someone looking for a simple to do task organizer.

This comment is on previous version. I havent updated to this version yet.  I personally liked its very simple pleasant to eyes user interface and the date entry method..you just type however u want and it takes automatically in right format. Also as a Project manager i can easily divide my tasks into separate  projects and the pending task list view gives which project the task is from time and task name...key points as a PM i need to know. Havent tried the collaboration mode as i didnt needed it for  now.

I started using todoist when I wanted a todo list wherever I was, whatever device I was using. My job lives in outlook on my PC, and it's plugin has got me on top of what I need to do. It syncs with my android in a flash, and allows me to easily add something when someone stops me in the hall.  I also take advantage of the android wear and add tasks without even taking out my phone. Reminders, this thing has them, it can email you, SMS you, or send a notification to your mobile apps.  So good I ran out of r

I really appreciate that I can send items via "If this then that", I'm sending my Amazon Echo shopping list to Todoist. We sync a shared shopping list at our house ever since Palm Pilots. This is a proper todo app and starts and is usable within a second; unlike Amazon's Echo app which takes 30s every single time you  start it & makes me want to rage quit it (their Alexa Echo hardware is nice though). Some learning curve such as hold drag to rearrange the list but it does all I need, simply.

I have no prob working across all devices -Desktop, smartphone,tab and Gmail.I got it for the color-coding of projects and smart scheduling thru keywords. Giving only 4 stars bec I wished syncing is automatic across all devices.

Clean, simple interface and powerful feature set makes this a winner. I finally found the perfect combination between the power of ToodleDo and the clean simple GTD like interface of DoIt.IM task managers.  Six things Todoist has that make it a winner: 1 - great interface 2 - Customization / Flexibility 3 - "Karma" feedback 4 - Apps for all platforms 5 - Great support 6 - super responsive web site  I really believe this app and the corresponding web site give you all the tools to get things done and keep track of how well you are doing.

I've been using the app for a few days and it helps me remember all the small things I need to do. I wish I knew about a way to download my daily activity, to plan better for the future. I will recommend it to my friends and coworkers.
As an Astrid user, it took me a long time to find a proper replacement when it shut down. Have been using todoist for roughly a year now and I'm finally happy with my task manager.

I have tried pretty much EVERY task list app on the market but I like TD the best because I can set priorities, classify tasks and even share AND assign tasks (a feature that my husband in particular is not QUITE so fond of!  :-) ). I would say the one drawback is that there is mixed functionality across platforms - hence the downgrade to 4 stars but it is definitely my "go to" productivity app that I use at both work and home.

This is by far the best service I've ever used for my to do lists. It's seamless across all platforms and integrates well with Sunrise calendar (my calendar of choice). Only problem is one I never knew I had until Google released app specific cards for Google now. My other to do list app took advantage of it but Todoist hasn't yet. It would be the icing on the cake for a truly excellent app.

I've tried 'em all.  Sure,  some were of course really good,  but there was always something small missing - or just  plain annoying. This app nails it.  Clean,  quick, all I want and no overdone bells or whistles. The ONLY thing I would like is a way to customize it - I'm big on aesthetics,  and that's all that I notice lacking so far with this app. If you guys did something about that,  I sure wouldn't mind!

Todoist is a pretty powerful app that can go a step beyond a to-do list, and it's particularly good for people who tend to work solo -  a lot of the other popular task lists/managers are really geared toward teams, and while that's great, I don't often work as part of a regular coordinated team, so a lot of the features of those other applications really don't apply to me.  I'd say that Todoist's best feature is the clean user interface. It's easy to read, easy to add tasks to (and the Chrome extension is very good for this) and lays out what you need to do for the week very nicely.  There are some cons, though. It's not obvious how to create subtasks and there's an extra step involved that I don't think is necessary. There are a couple of snags relating to repeating tasks. If you have a repeating task with subtasks, the subtasks are not "uncompleted" when the task refreshes (only the parent task is). If you have a repeating task that is overdue and you mark it as done, the current deadline is skipped and the task refreshes for the next one, which can throw you off a bit if you still have to  do the task for the current period.  All in all, it's a worth a try.
very easy to add tasks as they arise. prioritization and categorization features are helpful. a very useful tool for keeping the things you need to do front and center.
Very powerful, but also has features for psychologically encouraging me to finish tasks, like karma and the ability to watch the number of remaining tasks decrease.

When i installed this i was pretty surprised how the app worked but when it asked me to upgrade to premium just to unlock few new things...  I immediately regret installing it... Guys... There are free apps who ask 0 royalties to pay for all the things you ask to pay... I will go back to Wunderlist...  Uninstalled
So many key features to remind you and to assist you in keeping track of your tasks. Can't love without it.

Was using a different product, but wasnt completey happy.  Tried ToDoIst and havent looked back!  Only gripe is that is requires premium for reminders, but I had no issue going Premium as ToDoIst really helps me maintain productivity.
I was a long time outlook windows user, thought nothing can be better till Todoist. It works in my PC, iMAC, Android phone, iPAD.
I only wish I could set reminders without requiring an upgrade, but the current features work for me.
It's the simplicity of it all.  If I have an idea I put it on here.  And it becomes reality.  I have a lot less oh crap I forgot something moments.
I can't find a manual anywhere so I don't know what I'm doing with this app. It's probably just me being a bit dumb. Thanks for reply, I knew it was me being dumb.

I'd also like to see the shortcut options available on PC, such as the ability to do !! To set a priority level. In addition, material design has been "coming soon" for about 3 months. It really needs that design overhaul.

After all the great reviews i gave this a try and its great for one person but the synchronization across multiple devices needs work and was very unreliable. We spent more time trying to make sure we all saw what was supose to be there than we did using it.  Upon sharing a project, 2 users couldn't see all the tasks under it, one user couldnt see any of them and the other could see less than half.  The user that couldn't see any on their phone could see them all on their pc. Too unreliable.
Really easy to use and share projects with colleagues. Great support from the todoist team as well
Very good app.  Only qualm I have is that you can't implement the michael linenbeger TWC system which I use. Which needs a start date field and a group by Priority option.

Ridiculous piece of junk app. I simply wanted to do a basic task of creating a list of apps I like and intended to add to it when necessary, yet this stupid app only guves you the option of setting reminders. The capacity for four nested collapsible levels in each project a key GTD-friendly feature. The due date and priority sorting features are very good as well. I went Premium after a couple of months for access to completed tasks and the notes feature. Undo feature only seems to show up briefly after completing a task; would be nice to have a menu item undo. Syncs well across web, Droid, PC. Pleasing interface. The "karma" point system and categories make the app stickier.

I did a lot of research on to do list apps and this one seemed to meet all my needs, it has enough features but not too many to be bloated, some minor tweaks on a few things would make it better but it's a great app

I have looked at a lot of to do apps. I haven't found one that works this well with both my phone and the computer. I really wish that it was better in terms of things like repeating tasks. For example I don't want to see my next week task that I have to take out the trash until next week. The interface is also a little clumsy in the way that it allows you to organize things. I would much prefer to be able  hopefully this app or some other app like it will make these changes and make me happier.

I've used Remember The Milk, Astrid, Google Tasks, Wunderlist, and Toodledo, but all pale in comparison. Todoist has managed to build an incredibly rich feature set into a very well-organized and elegant cross-platform app. My only request is if they'd support creating list items from Gmail messages like they do on the desktop, then this will be my holy grail todo app.

There will never be a perfect ToDo app,  we users are way to grumpy,  we want one single app to do everything and there's always this little thing that we would like the developers to add and then it's gonna be perfect.  No,  but really,  the only thing that I need in order go give Todoist 5 stars is a view pane for task notes as well as a task notes preview on mouseover.  That's all I ask, I moved to Todoist from OmniFocus and Asana,  I guess that's showing how much I like the Todoist.

wow. I hated any.do so long i managed to find todoist to find that its too great to beleive its true. Amazing. All the features i needed in native GUI on android even in chrome extension without stupid and slow animations. I will pay gladly for this.  Thanks!

There is no field for task description. There is only a subject line. Very inconvenient. Being able to add task description is a basic feature but in this app it's only made available with paid for premium service. Not useful to me.

Great solution that integrates with everything I need. Phone, tablet, Outlook, Chrome. Outlook add-in has great functionality. Does not use Outlook native tasks, but has its own panel. More power, manage projects,  and frees up Outlook tasks for email management. Love it!
Love that I can create all sorts of lists for home projects or tasks to do and have it accessible on my phone, tablet or computer.
Even the free version of this service is exceptionally useful, and the UI is intuitive. I've found it much easier to stay on top of all the little stuff in my life since I started using this app.

This is the easiest way to plan for ANYTHING.  After a few minutes fiddling with the program, I had set up my projects due for the next few weeks. Very straightforward and easy to use, from the get go.
this is the best task management application that I have seen till date. it has all the features I could ask for and the cross platform support is best.
I had the pro version for a while. As a list it works well and has nice features.  The karma thing put me off some, but mostly  I'm not a list person.

It's a pretty good to do list implementation. It's missing some important features like the ability to actually set whether you want a task to repay after 1 day or every day when finished. You also can't set when your day ends. However, the basic features work well, and it had good categorization features.

This is what I wanted for long long time.  If we can add feature to allocate tasks to others that will be icicng on cake. But even without  this feature it still is extremely great app for productivity management.

I use this every day and it has become a vital part of my kit. The ability to have location based to-do's and the karma are all fantastic ideas. The new material design adds to it too. Combine this with the fact it works everywhere on everything is the icing on the cake.
The Outlook add in is fantastic.  It allows you to set up thanks that you can take on any device or accessed via Internet.  You can also create a task from an email.
I love its simplicity, yet powerfulness and freedom in viewing tasks from different perspectives. The app is nice, fast, pleasure to work with and allows me to stay on top of my daily tasks.
Todoist is getting things done. There is nothing more.

I use this app in a simple way. When I know I need to remember to do something, I can click the td+ link from the notifications menu on my smartphone. Back at my office, I access the list from the chrome add on and click when the task is done. I am sure the app does a lot more than this, but if all you are looking for is really easy way to manage lists between devices, this will serve you well
