Todoist is a very functional to do app. It provides almost everything fans of to do apps have come to expect. This might be it's biggest problem : it offers the industry standard and little more. This is a disappointment as it has the canvas to offer so much more. Increasing collaborative features and the integration with productivity apps and storages will increase its performance. Todoist, like many of its counterparts, suffers from a bland design. It could improve on these and almost touch greatness :-)
ToDoist is the kind of app any person should have for organizing his life. The premium version works just perfectly and makes me ale to do lots of things otherwise I wouldn't even remember to do.

This is what I've been looking for. Todoist has the right blend of settings/features and minimalism. I love subordinately related tasks and projects,but the custom queries for your start page sold me. I can tweak my start page to show me what I need to do today.

i had to manually go through 250 tasks to identify unsynced items. but still I stayed with todoist as this is the only app that has manual rearangement of tasks AND has subtasks, tags, etc. another thing that is not perfect: manual rearrangement of task would be the most meaningful for priorities. especially, to pull the most urgent / important tasks to the very top of all tasks that have priority 1. but thats not possible...

I like this app as it allows me to tick things off when they are done and sends reminders to my inbox as well. Some functions not as intuitive or  user friendly but once u get used to it, the app is a great assistant!
Very helpful with centralizing tasks and working off of a list. The notifications of items due and productivity charts are helpful and provide incentives for staying on task.

I have tried most of the to do task apps and this one is the one I am sticking with since it does one thing and it does it really well. It is also very easy to quickly add tasks from the drop down bar

I started to use it for small tasks and it help me with my realibility a lot. I would appreciate integration with exchange (tasks and calendar). I am think about use in team and it would be really helpfull if I can send task ti other task management systems.
Only thing it lacks is the ability to collapse sub-lists in the widget as displaying everything expanded makes the list too long to scroll. No complaints though, beautiful, fast, and simple to use.
I have been looking for a simple task manager that can help me manage my day better. Todoist is a perfect solution for me so far.

Prior to this app, I tried: GTASK, Google Keep, Evernote, One Note and others. They just can't compete with this tool. It works across platforms (interacts perfectly with my iPad and MAC and my Motorola 360. Great email alerts and auto generated reports to keep me honest on my ability to complete tasks. Just an excellent tool!
The tool is well thought of and help in coordination and task assignments beyond tracking your tasks.
I can make it integrate with my GTD system by using labels. It is available on all the platforms that I use.

Subscription lapsed. Now I can't save new tasks. A menu constantly prompts me to upgrade when I try to save a new task. I click the "later" option,  but the task doesn't save. Had notes in premium and now can't access them. Absurd.

This app is great! It's very organized and easy to follow. You can also see up and coming projects for the week or for the day. The karma points also make you want to follow it and it feels rewarding to actually do the work and stay organized!  I would recommend this app!
I haven't tried any other agenda software, so I don't have a basis for comparison.
Everything this app does, is simply Awesome. Been using it since last 4 months.

Have been using ToDoist for over a year. Bought the premium subscription and for the most part has worked well. Just updated to 7.1.1 on my phone and now it is randomly adding 11:59pm to task that I have not assigned a time to. Even after editing, it is still adding 11:59pm but only for some tasks. I do not see why it is occurring for some and not others. Makes it impossible to order tasks as I want. Please fix!
Great to use as a brain dump and star doing things one by one
Keeps me very well organized.  The widget is very useful as well
I'm only just beginning to use this app,  but so far it's amazing.
Tried out several. This was the best.  Sub lists.  Priorities.  Synchs with desktop and phone.
Wonderful app, actually makes keeping organized less work.
My go to app for GTD. usable on all my devices.
Have helped me to organize my tasks. Thanks developer.
Support is quick.
Excellent clean app which does everything it needs to do.
I love this app!
Great way to plan your days ahead
Very good app to organise your life
all features need to pay for them to work
Наилучшее приложение из всех todo
Can't live without it.
Nice
Brilliant
Needs more options & features, for example such as persistent reminders, etc. Premium subscriber. P.S. Crashes on reminder date picker since the recent update.
So clean, and simple. Coupled with the desktop applications incredibly powerful and simple free app.

There are too many things I like about Todoist to say in this short review. The ease of use and minimalist approach is perhaps in the top of my list. The fact that they provide documentation of their API is perhaps the cherry on top. But it's not perfect, at least in my eyes. It needs a darker UI both in the app and the widget. And the fonts in the widget need to be smaller, or at least give the option to make it so.

IMPORTANT -- this will only make you as productive as you make it.  Their setup of using due dates as "planned dates" is highly frustrating IMO and can quickly get you unproductive and behind -- but if you sketch out a system before even picking up the app, their filters and Boolean logic combined with beautiful and easy to read formatting make this the killer application.

I have tried more to do list apps that I care to admit. This is the only one I have stuck with for more than a couple weeks. I am really enjoying and have convinced others to join. I think it could have some additional features that would be more helpful. Syncing with Outlook tasks would be very helpful. More reporting options to see past performance would be nice. The ability to see tasks on a calendar would be awesome.

Top notch interface on the app and on the web. This is, hands down, the best todo application for me. That lists are broken into projects and tasks can have subtasks really lets you set up task points for projects the way that real projects happen. Todoist plays a huge role in my days at work.

Love the app - simple, clean, intuitive and enough fully-featured even for quite complex GTD setups. More importantly it is truly ubiquitous with all its non-android counterparts. Would like to see some more advanced features like parent task being automatically completed once all the children task are ticked off for a 5 star rating.

It gets the job done.  Make a list, group tasks, schedule due dates, assess status, get reminders.  Its just not super sophisticated. I wish it had parent/child tasks or the ability to reuse previous tasks.  I wish I could have set up a Christmas list or a grocery list and tied it to my task for example. But again, for basic to dos, it works just fine.

Great flexibility with filters.  the fact that you can make sub lists. Could be improved if the project could be tabs for easy switching, and if you could add one more point of prioritization, such as a star to label easy tasks that are quick to do. Being able to sync from your device is fantastic. The only other feature I could want would be the ability to make a calendar that you could export to Google calendars with your tasks for the week.

Strikes a good balance between free and premium features, leaving a fully functional task tracking app at no cost.   Online integration works well, meaning a consistent experience across devices. Keeps things simple, which makes it very usable.   PC "app" is functional enough, but I personally dislike "standalone" chrome apps, so no major dramas there ☺

1. In android, Tasks should start with a check box for checking it to indicate the status "Completed"; a tick sign at the bottom ( to mark it  completed) is confusing. 2. Tasks may have a description field to elaborate it for easy understanding of others; to whom it is assigned. 3. Rich User Interface for a gorgeous look may make it elegant. 4. Some default Labels may be added to make the app more productive.

Sharing of tasks inside a project needs to be added. For example in one project there may be 10 tasks. But I need to share only 4 of them to one of my team members. Rest 6 are irrelevant to him. So share or collaborate option should be introduced at task level also.I expected this in premium version but not found. Please upgrade urgently.

I would really enjoy a simpler format to checking off the tasks. To explain further, I mean reformatting the check off system by making a box by the task and then when it's checked, the task is faded out, and then you can uncheck it if need be, and the task could stay until the due date pasts. This just seems easier for the user for consumers, and I believe that the coding for the feature wouldn't be too difficult. Thanks for your consideration, Allen Wells

I like it very much. Just like exactly I needed. Out of all task organizer,  this is surely one of the best. However, I am quite disturbed whenever I need to make a subtask. It's quite awful since I couldn't determine easily which task actually it roots from.  Whenever I made new substask, I couldn't directly link the subtask to any root task. The only good way is by adding subtask from the main task. However, it's quite frustrating when I need to write task fast. As verdict, I would recommend this app.

I've tried many apps to get organized and all came up short in some major way. Todoist is the only one I've found that really works for me. Making an email into a task saves me so much time. I would like to see a way to copy a task with subs to another project.  Also, I wish that project structure wouldn't flatten when filtering by label. But overall, a very useful and useable tool.

I never write reviews and this was not solicited. Its just so well done, I wanted to. Its THE list/notepad/organizer I've always hoped for. I've downloaded (many) prior apps; only to be disappointed by convoluted, limited, and/or unreliable performance. And although there is a pay version, the free version is generous about the amount of accessible features. Its fully functional. And I'm more prone to consider paying for the upgrade when the free version is so terrific. Other developers ought to learn that.

I really wanted a list that would allow me to make descriptive notes, like a shopping list. I can't seem to do that on here, so the best I can do is make a reminder to shop, then use paper or another app to remember what I was supposed to get. Kinda lame, but everything else is pretty good.

As a graduate student in a data analysis heavy field. As a happily married man whose wife works. As a father of three year old abd three month old. As member of the LDS church who spends 8 hours a week on volunteer work for my church. This app keeps me focused and on task. Love the app. Seriously, once I graduate I am going to make so much money because this app makes me so productive.

This is the most simple app of todolist apps out there. I've tried numerous and they're very slow, complicated and frustrating at some point. It has a desktop version too. Try it and see the way it changes your productivity.

See EDIT, reply is deceptive! Do NOT pay for this. They lie when they say it syncs with google calendar, they have been offered Google's api AND support, yet refuse to integrate as they wish to compete. Terrible!  EDIT: The reply from ToDoist is exactly what I'm talking about. There is no integration, updates from ToDoist to Google Calendar are done once daily, and are limited. Google literally offered their API when ToDoist was lying about Google preventing integration. VERY, deceptive!

I was initially skeptical of this app but checked it out because of the IFTTT integration. Must say this app has kept me on task. Really like the ease with which tasks can be grouped by project. Cross-platform support is an added benefit, but the Outlook plugin is essential and where I get the most benefit. This app will keep you tied in with everything you load through other platforms.

I used to use Google Keep (which is great), its just that Todoist is better.  One reason I picked Todoist is because of the videos on their website, and their extensive online help. I was going to pay the $29 for the app just cause its more than worth it. I dont really need the extra functionality, but the author did such a good job, he deserves the money.I use this app daily.

Love the app. I use it in the advertising industry and we have tons of deadlines always so this is great to keep track of my to do. The only thing I suggest is allowing for more colors when choosing the level of importance for items. (right now it's white, baby blue, blue, red)  maybe add some additional options in colors like purple and orange, etc.

Apparently I hadn't heard it enough.  Using outlook simply didn't work.  The website and the app are well organised and elegant easy to learn and works brilliantly.  The integration with so many other apps and tools was a no brainer for me opening up so many possibilities.  I'm enlightened now with the importance of writing things down.

I realize that probably sounds very dramatic, but something about this application and my new habit of prioritizing my day (as the first part of my day) is making changes in my life. I don't know if it's the Karma score that makes a game out of it, but I'm finding my life focused more and more. First to do app I've stuck too. Well designed and implemented exceptionally.

Won't let you write notes (an essential part of these types of apps) without paying for the premium version...which is very overpriced and based on a yearly sub ($28.99 per year). A sad case of a nice app that adheres to price gouging and subscription pricing.

Especially when Google keep is free and my phone I don't have to type everything in I just say ok Google remind me..and edit of course sometimes but when I arrive at the place or its due my phone reminds me. I had hoped this would integrate thru devices better and remind me as it was due but in the free version u can't even trial the features that may make it stand out upon keep and evernote. I don't care for the sample they care to share so I wont pay for a bigger piece of useless pie.

As much as I don't like having my whole life be on the internet, todoist is great because it really helps you stay on top of what you need to be doing (or keeps you from pretending everything is fine when you have been avoiding a task that was due months ago). Plus it's beautiful.

I was a Astrid lover and since yahoo killed that awesome product I have been lost in a pursuit for a replacement in the same level. Todoist made me feel confortable again. The natural way to enter the deadlines is the innovation that I liked most. I just didn't find enough reason to move to the paid version yet.

I've been using todoist for less than a week, and I'm already in love. The color coded priority levels, project breakdown, and access across many platforms sold me. Well, not really since I'm using the free version...But I might pay to get reminders. Anyway it's great for managing classes as a college student but also for things like grocery lists and new songs to check out. Highly recommend the Mac app as well as the chrome extension. Paired with the chrome Toggl extension, you can track your time per task

Suggestion. Maybe there could be like x button for things that havent been done today and it is too late to do them tomorrow. For example some things need to be done every day. If I don't do one today, tomorrow I can do it only once, not twice. Medication for instance. I can't take two because I forgot to take one yesterday. Now my only option is to check it like its done so todoist would remind me again. And it counts it like a comleted task which it isn't. But app is absolutely great. Keep up the goodwork

Its affordable (more than most) and has an incredible amount of options I am never without access. Sharing folders is quick and easy and a huge boon for sharing shopping lists for example. Todoist has transformed my productivity.

Over all, a good app. Would like to see more functionality for the Android Wear app. The Wear app can't  pull To Do lists from the phone app. Only items that a due today are sent automatically to the watch. The phone app can send all To Do items to the watch (if you tap a button) but, if an item is changed on the phone/tablet/computer, the change is not synced to the watch.

I love that its available on so many devices. Works well for me... however the sub tasks are really confusing..a sync to Google tasks would be really helpful... but most importantly reminders are very limited if there at all in free version! This is an awesome app but if you need custom reminders try something else...

The application is doing what it does really well. I still can't justify going premium  but the features might be worth it. I especially like the fact that it has an app for pretty much every platform out there.

I think the app and service are great. My only complaint is that some common actions like editing an existing task require too much time to begin. A long press followed by clicking an icon. But other than that knit picking thing I really like it.

In my search for the best implementation of the GTD methodology I stumbled upon this app.  It certainly is the best. What makes it so good is the extensive range of cross platform applications that you get with a  single subscription;a host of excellent APIs (try the outlook one, it's excellent );advanced filtering;and excellent customer support.  Oh also, it's the 'cleanest'  looking app out there, at least in my opinion.

I don't normally rate apps but love this one. I've tried other to do GTD apps before and while they helped they were often cumbersome to use. This time I downloaded 6 or 7 apps to try but feel in. Love With todoist. It is simple, elegant and effective.  I love how there is an easy widget for quickly entering things that come to mind. I feel so much more organized now  than ever before. I'm using it with  Sunrise app where my tasks, calendar, Facebook etc are all synced into the one interface.  Fabulous.
Well made app with a good work flow. Only gripe is that if you assign a task a project but not a due date, it can easily be forgotten since it will not show up in the two most common views.

I really love the gmail integration. I can finally empty my inbox and set reminders for emails through todoist. And the ctrl-shift-t is an awesome way to add anything as a todo. Edit:i continue to use it as a premium user of course

This application is way better than remember the milk I've been using this application from few months now and I can easily see the difference. I would recommend this application to anyone who wants to get the work done and is looking for up an all-in-one application to manage his stuff on a daily basis with multiple projects.

I've tried a few task manager apps, this seems to be the best one for my way of working. App syncs to website, to chrome extension...  Perfect. Notes being a premium feature is irritating but the free premium trial convinced me it was worth it.

It is a dealbreaker for me.  They don't even provide a decent built-in calendar. So if you rely on a calendar (especially Google Calendar) this app is not for you.  Yes they have some workaround that refreshes the Google calendar once a day or so. But to their customers they blame Google for not enabling two way sync. That is a 100% LIE and I do not like companies that LIE to their customers. Nozbe works perfectly with Google Calendar. Insightly too. Perhaps their software engineers can't figure it out and blame Google - and the  support staff buys their provably lame excuse.  or perhaps they are too busy working on Karma points - a really weak and pointless goal tracking system. Sorry ToDoist - I keep a schedule. I have appointments - I use a calendar. To me more important than gamification of my todo list.  It is really too bad because otherwise it is my favorite app. That's why I'm upset. They work hard on a great interface and then toss it in the toilet because they don't think people's calendars are more important than adding  games.  Priorities are seriously askew.  But hey maybe their market is not people with serious business to do.

Just switched to Android & had to find an alternative to Omnifocus. Todoist is beautiful & the free app is pretty useful, but if you want to view all tasks (not just 7 days) in order of date, you'll have to pay the yearly fee for the premium upgrade, then create a custom filter. I wish I didn't have to pay for this basic functionality, but I will for now.  UPDATE: The Premium app is totally worth the money, & the license works across multiple devices. Also, their support team is very responsive.

Just 1 thing missing. We can not set task frequency customised. In our company maintenance and production work we need to repeat task at random day. Say we have to do some task every after 17 days or 22 days,  but ur app allows to repeat after a wk or daily or monthly. Pl add this features to repeat task at customised days

I did my research. Todoist is the only one of its kind that boasts impressive, dynamic apps for both Android and Mac OS. I need an app that syncs between my devices, allows me to have many projects and sub projects and tasks, set due dates, times, and priorities, create tasks from my email inbox (by forwarding the email to the project), allows multiple assignees/users, and most importantly has an option to view all tasks due that day across my projects. I upgraded to the $3/mo plan, and couldn't be happier.

The website and app combination run my day, whether I'm using my computer in the office or on site, or doing volunteer/ametuer sports administration. The features allowing easy programming of repeating tasks are superb.

Most apps are great for tasks but not for projects or they're great for projects and too complex for simple to do lists. Or the app is amazing but only on one platform. Ugh! Todoist does everything! I use it for simple shopping lists to building proposals where there are many tasks and people under one project who can communicate through the app. Best of all I have it on my Mac and android. Sucks to pay for features but it's cheaper and more affective than most other paid project apps.

Downloaded free version of this to keep track of uni assignments and projects. Having separate categories helps keep everything clear in my mind. If it isn't written here; it doesn't exist! Liking the add on for Gmail but would appreciate being able to move emails to the to do list instead of having to retype everything. Can't justify paid upgrade at the moment and don't seem to really need it. Functionality is great. Daily email reminders also fantastic.

This program is available in so many platforms that you do not have an excuse for getting things done.   It has the concepts of GTD built in.  And I love the Karma email, it keeps me motivated.   Great job!   Great program!

Great program, quick and pretty deep. I am not quite sure why I am not giving it 5 stars, but there's something missing. Some of the ideas in this app, such as the productivity karma system are actually groundbreaking... but something is missing. Not sure what it is. I'll write in to the devs if I think of something.

I've used a lot of to do list wrangling tools, so far I've stuck with this one the longest. The app is better than the web tool, which has the odd surprising glitch but is by and large pretty robust, pretty usable and visually very appealing.

Todoist is the best task management software currently available on any platform. You'll find yourself incorporating more and more areas of your life into the program and feeling accomplished and energized you complete a task and boost your karma! Todoist still has plenty of bugs, which can be frustrating at times, but the customer support is friendly, helpful, and responds quickly. Accessing the full suite of features requires a yearly fee, but most users won't even need the extra features.

Am really liking this system so far, it makes getting organised fun. There are some interface issues though, it's not that easy to navigate intuitively. Sorting the tasks and finding them again does not come as easily as it should.

I agree with Aaron--the only thing lacking is the ability to add more hours to the day! This is an extremely flexible and useful productivity organizer. It's great for those with ADD and those who simply have tons of competing demands that they need to and prioritize (e.g. every parent!). I thought it would be a slightly useful gimmick, but I've found it to be incredibly useful and beneficial. I get more done with less stress. How great is that?

Really enjoying this so far, and love the ability to manage from both the phone app and web browser. Only issue I've had so far is the app frequently suggesting it sets the time zone, even though I keep saying 'Yes' to the suggestion - weird.

I like the offline capability it's very convenient for me. One thing that bugs me is that it has a server side timezone configured and if I use todoist both on my phone and computer and have different timezones it always prompts me to flip server configuration to current device configuration.

Really like this app, use it for hw and daily task but its widget could really use a new design! I think the app looks fine but personally I like minimalistic widget interfaces, that flow with whatever theme or background your using. More importantly, this application gets the job done!

In 3 days, I just got SO much more productive. I used to hate using digital formats for my tasks. All the other apps I tried were never intuitive or thoughtful enough and I'd get way too distracted using them. So I started writing tasks down on paper instead. Eventually I'd misplace the paper or lose track of items if they were postponed... Todoist is amazing. Get the premium version and sync it up with Sunrise calendar. And add the widgets for both to your home screen(s). Then you'll see what I mean.

Started using it at the recommendation of Dottotech.   Link it with Evernote and Sunrise Calendar.  Works well, and has become my daily base for scheduling and task management now.   Suggestion: Please have a page in Settings for Defaults eg. I would like to select a Default Project instead of Inbox, and a default time eg 0900 next day Suggestion for time settings: include 24hour clock military style without dividers eg 1700 or 17 = 5pm. rather than 17:00 Suggestion: offer world wide time based on UTC/GMT for international collaboration (may be already there, but I am only in one time zone, so I haven't searched for it yet) and a default time zone setting which may be different to computer TZ/Locale settings. John from Melbourne Victoria Australia

Gorgeous app that works like I do and flexible enough to handle changes as they arise (project deadlines, etc) Always settled for other apps and never really kept up with my demands.  So happy to say this one delivers form AND function! If ant beta testers are needed down the road county me in! KUDOS

Nice interface, amazing features, endless multiple platform, reminders are great,integrates with many apps, I'm just starting but sure the karma thing will give me a boost of motivation,  and premium is worth the money, definitely five stars. I suggest to include the end date option if left empty start date act's as due date, also a button next to the tasks to mark as "in progress". Thanks a lot guys :)

Unlike most task extensions, this one actually adds functionality to the browser. When working on schoolwork, I can add task on the fly without having to keep an extra tab or program open. Functionality is actually very high for an unpaid app, especially with the ability to have on nearly any device you can imagine. The manager itself is also very fast and intuitive, with many keyboard shortcuts to get around with little mouse usage. With separate "projects" I can actually integrate all my calendars and task managers into one place. Great way to remind yourself about bills, things at the store, etc. After trying 5-7 task managers and calendar apps, this one won the spot on my favorite icon bar of my phone.

Took me away from Wunderlist after using Todoist for only a few days. The free version was very impressive. After going pro, I cannot imagine working/living without Todoist! Seriously keep up the great work.  I have a few feature requests - one would be a Boolean operator that let's youf filter for all tasks with any label. Right now you can only search for specific labels or nor label...unless maybe I am missing something in my filter. Could be the case ha.
It doesn't has any notification Window, any sound o something that can warring you about task

I've only used ToDoist for a couple of weeks now so I still feel like I am learning how to best utilize it for my use cases.   One feature I would like is to have the ability to set a specific time for certain tasks and then be reminded at that time.

My boss recommended this app, and since I've really started using it  I've been much more focused and organized. She's a clever motivator!  I've tried several other GTD-inspired list managers, but todoist's multi-platform consistency and efficient UI have been the special ingredients I needed. The one (nitpicky) complaint I have is that creating a subtask takes 3 taps. Editing a task, for example, takes only 2, and I need to create new subtasks far more often than I edit existing entries.

Great app! Very useful and SIMPLE! Beats every other app I've tried so far. The only thing that's missing is the option to set tasks to repeat weekly but I'm assuming that's for the premium version? Wished it was a FREE feature :( Definitely would of given 5 stars if it was :)

The repeating tasks function is why I selected this program. I have lots to do each day and many are repeaters. This program makes it a breeze to keep up with all of them. It is also very flexible in which days and times can be set. It's a keeper!

Compare the premium features of this to free features of Wunderlist. If Wunderlist fits all your needs, then chose that, because it's an excellent choice. Otherwise go for this app and go with premium. There really is no in between, unless the interface is a deal breaker for you one way or the other.

I was a long-time user of Astrid until Yahoo killed it for no obvious reason. So, I tried other to do apps. Many are really good but none with broad ranging syncing capability and plug-ins that Todoist has. Along with the Samsung Galaxy Note 4, I have the Samsung Gear S which is based on the Tizen OS.  I'd like to see an Tizin based app like the Google Wear app. Since I am trying to adopt the GTD methodology,  I  request deeper alignment with GTD or more instructional information and videos on how to use Todoist with GTD. Also,  I changed my priority colors. My priority 2 filter didn't change on existing or new tasks. But I really dig this tool.

I would definitely like it to be integrated with my Google calendar. That's the only feature I am missing right now. Otherwise this app is awesome where you can add task via widget on the go and even schedule it.

Downloaded this app not too long ago and started using and my opinion is that this is one of the more complete n user friendly app. All data is saved in their cloud server so even if one need to change to a new phone or has to carry out factory reset your data will not be lost for this I gave 5 stars. Keep up the good work and add more functions n features for free users please.

This has become my go to way of staying organized. Love the ease of adding tasks via mobile, wear, desktop, anywhere. Project and due date systems are very helpful as well as reminders. I would love to see an integration with a pomodoro timer. I have to use this in conjunction with my timer app (pomotodo). Really wish you guys could make it happen. Keep up the great work!

Firstly, it has annoying bugs, like it asks me repeatedly if I want to change my time zone to where I live, even though I say yes every time. On top of that, it requires a premium upgrade to do even elementary tasks, like getting reminders, and that costs $29 per year. For a to-do app, that's ridiculous.

This is a good little app. It reminds me or Jira project managing software. You have have several to do lists. Each task can have as many subtasks as you like. They can also be set a priority level and can have date attached to them to be completed by. I would certainly recommend it.
Really like the everyday mails, the Gmail plugin is very handy.
Only thing I'm hating on this app for is the lack of setting reminders on the free version. It is a to do list app after all.

If I have a specific task that I want to do everyday, I have to check it as completed first before it shows on the next day. But what if I missed a day?! Of course I have to pretend that it is completed by checking it as done so I can see it again on the next day. I hope there is a way to avoid this "lie" so users can analyse their daily routine more accurately.

Simple interface. Intuitive. Syncing with other devices which are not on the Android platform is a breeze. Seriously one of the best apps out there. I have subscribed to the premium service while simultaneously unsubscribing from several other services that collectively  couldn't offer what Todoist can.
Great productivity app.  Like that it works across Google, Chrome,  and apple equipment.  Dissapointed that it won't work on iPad with is 7

Been using todoist for over 12 months from paper. The free version is awesome but the paid version is better. Multiplatform, fast, and good design... can't fault it and would recommend. Thanks todoist team

The minor goals (minimum tasks finished a day, etc) that you randomly hit and then the app gives you a little pop up - stupid, I know but it boosts my mood that little bit I need. Also, the convenience of having it on every platform I use (desktop, laptop, phone, internet) makes it ideal for me wherever I happen to plop down and work

Beautiful interface, great features (and I'm still discovering new ones!), intuitive programming. The Karma feature is actually working for me (thought it was a little lame at first, but it did some mind warp or something on me and I'm increasing productivity because of it!). I do find that when I go to move a task up in the list, it sometimes causes all things under it to get filed into it, but that's easily corrected.  Works great on my macbook and my android. Oh, and the customer service is super!

This app does it all. The widget works perfectly for me and the ability to add tasks from your notification bar is an absolute life saver. I have tried many to do list apps and calendar apps and this one by far had helped me the most.

We use Todoist for our business and love it. The online extension used with the app just makes the work day so much smoother. I can task my employees on my days off so they still have things to do. The reminders are great, too!

Simple UI is both user friendly and aesthetically pleasing. Offers a lot of customization options without making the app excessively clunky. However, right swipe accidentally deletes agenda way too easily, and the undo menu disappears too quickly.
I love it for its ability to work across all of my platforms. It seems need to refine the details. It requires to many button presses to accomplish things.
My only complaint is that it uses too much white space on the task list.   A more compact view would be nice.
I have tried them all and this is the most efficient, versatile and reliable calendar app around. And I say this after six months of intensive use on multiple platforms. Couldn't be more satisfied.
This app does not allow sorting a list alphabetically - an obvious and easy feature.  It is therefore useless to me. Uninstalled.

Bought Premium.  Waste of money.  First go work vanished.  Had to redo everything.  Start Page never opens first.  Random pages open when you click on icon.  So, have to take several extra steps to track down ongoing projects. Figured it out.  Idiots set it up where when you are in a project and select "Leave project" the program deletes project without a warning.  Morons.  Who would use that terminology? Should be "Close Out Project" with warning that all work will vanish!!!  Worthless
Really useful app for my terrible memory self. It would be awesome if we could have a dark widget in the next update or something. Great job with this app, btw. :)

Love the option to add a task from the notification area, dragging tasks between days, swipe to complete and the ease of rescheduling tasks. A dark theme, and batch options for tasks are missing aspects though... The best I've used, almost perfect for my needs.

I tried a lot of apps before settling on this one. I even waited months before writing this review. But the more I use this app, the more I love it. I have been seriously less stressed this semester in grad school, and I attribute a lot of that to this app. I love the karma system and I love how on top of things I am able to be.
Wish there was a way to pay monthly or bi yearly instead of the only option that is the whole year subscription for $30.  I love the app anyways.
I have tried to use Google calendar for years but it was cumbersome to set up a task and repeat breaks if you change 1 date in the series... I am addicted to todoist now!

I've used MLO (too complicated and expensive) and G tasks (too basic) and tested Wunderlist,  Todledo, Any do. I settled for Todoist for clarity, filters, widget with context view, design, impeccable  sync, price and letting me taste premium for free. I am very happy with Todoist :-)
Would love to see creation of sub task before check mark on mobile, I have to drag the sub task to the right project after it's created. Also need a notes area on free version.

I can only filter tasks by date via the website and not the app. No way to be able to filter by date on the app and the newest task added goes right to the bottom (out of date order) until I filter them by date on my computer. Very inconvenient.

I've used it since last August and haven't stopped. I have a block schedule at school so knowing what I need to do to prepare comes in handy. I like using the website more though when it comes to adding tasks.

I chose this app because I like the presentation,I can see the whole name of the task, I can add sub tasks and they are visible,  and critically that I can reorganise the task list so I can put the more urgent items at the top. I'm surprised that it doesn't have it's own calendar (although that seems to be typical of these apps) but downloading Sunrise Calendars (free) with it works a treat. Haven't had time to look at the more advanced features yet.  The only reason I drooped a star, pushes not so quick.
I use this app on my chromebook and all my other devices, as a college student, I haven't been this productive since middle school!
Fine for basic entry and reminder alerts. Not very intuitive as to how to check back on or view tasks already marked as completed.
It was really a good task organizer. I enjoy using it for a about a year. And it help me alot.  Before the mobile version I used the Web version, it is a real hand for me. I really recommend it
I have looked for a to-do app that works for me for quite awhile. I like how lightweight the app itself feels and how quickly I can make tasks.
No learning curve because it is so user intuitive. Runs across every device and program you need it to. Pay the 30.00 annual fee. You will have made the best investment for your productivity.
Those are must have features,  surprised that they are non existing here and deal breaker for me
I would give  this  a 5 if I could delete only one occurance of a repeating task.  Otherwise it has met all my expectations.

I'm struggling between todo, wunder  & ticktick. I really like todoist's clean design and sub-project feature that the other 2 do not have. However, there are several critical defects: 1) sub-projects stay @ a viewing lvl, not really functional.  2) android app too basic, to be the worst among 3 apps. 3) too many basic functions need to go premium that are usually free features of other apps. 4) you do not have a choice to take monthly subscription, you have to go for at least 1 year.
Todoist is great. Notes feature should be made free, attachments as a premium feature is fine.
And I've tried a lot of them! I had even switched back to paper with the Bullet Journal method... But this app has lured me back to digital. Beautiful interface and flawless functionality.
One thing. Update DashClock extension so that I could not only see how many tasks I have to do but also what are those tasks.

The new ios update and Android don't seem to talk to each other. You can see the timing in ios but not in Android. It's all screwed up in android version. It's also sad to see the removal of manually typing the timing for convenience.
It is a good task manager, but there are similar once for free. so I don't use this any more
Allows you to have a shared folder of tasks. Great way to set reminders and make sure everything gets done.

I used to just use gmail calendar, but I find this app is great for all the random things that I have to do and supplements my calendar of regular activities. Entries are easy to dismiss and create compared to one that I tried a while ago.

Though somewhat less streamlined than any.do it is the perfect all around to do app and has the kind of robust categorization, reminders, and sharing capabilities that I've always dreamed of. Amazing.
This is one of the best apps I've used to help keep productivity up. With the integration with mail it's on a whole new level. The only thing missing is meeting and phone call event links.
I'm beginning to manage my heavy workload and you can download extra apps to create a more persoalised system.

While I do have some gripes, mostly that there could be better and more instructions, this is one of the better task managers out there. It would be nice to have Evernote integration though.
Excellent free app. I live that it's across so many platforms. I use it on Firefox at work and it seems to be seamless between Firefox and Android.
Brain dumping into to do lists has increased my productivity and todoist is the best product out there (even just at the free level). "Karma" gamification was a good idea.
This fits great for personal task management workspace and after trying many apps, I would rate this one to be the best.

I use this app multiple times a day, and I have it installed on my phone and tablet. I use the widget on both devices, and though it usually works fine, sometimes it gets stuck on "loading" and won't show anything for days at a time. If they could fix that, it would add at least one more star to my review. (Also, it needs a "compact" view so each list entry isn't so huge.)
Unless you start using it you will not be able to understand how useful it is. Don't go by ui their team is improving it to material design

I really enjoy this app. It's really helpful being able to have projects to categorize the lists. Especially that you can choose the specific dates you want each item to pop up on. Makes my life much easier!
Really am impressed  with the interconnectivity with other apps like Evernote Gmail  Google Calendar etc. Keep up the great work and IFTTT receipes.
I've been searching for an application that was flexible enough to keep up with my needs for quite a while.  While not perfect (no application is), this is by far the best I've found.
I've tried many apps and this all comes down to this one being the best on the market. Only missing thing : liberty of colors towards priorities.
Easy to use, great customer support, and a solid app. Definitely worth downloading.
I love the clean way it works on my pc through mozilla thunderbird and on gmail and on my Android phone.  It helps me stay on the case.

If you need something that works across platforms, look no further! Todoist has been a life-saver for me. Only complaint is that I don't like to be constantly reminded of the benefits of the premium subscription.
Love constant reminders for personal and business tasks, running the free version, haven't looked at the paid version yet.
I've tried literally dozens of to do apps over the years, and while there are many good ones, Todoist beats them all.
This app is awesome. Better than other so-called `productivity` apps that paradoxically eat up time and focus. Clean, simple, easy to use UI. Highly recommended.

I haven't used the premium features yet but the ability to attach notes, files etc looks extremely useful

Very easy to use. Well organized and linked to most popular browsers, mobile operating systems, and even email providers. Thanks for this great app.

Great application but recurrent reminders are missing. The pro version have fair price.
Simple and super easy to work with.  It doesn't have too much complicated tools that only confuse things, but a right-to-the-point layout that makes a breeze going through my to-do list.  Love it!
I really like this app. It is working nice. If there is a way of reminding missed calls ,texts, emails it will be more usefull.

i'm a free user and this is working fine for me. hope to keep being pleased with this product.
