I have been using Todoist since 2013. My life have never been so organized. From the moment I discovered how to set recurring tasks and schedule events, everything went smoother. I am no longer using post its, and with ICal configuration I have replaced Google Calendar. Still needs a little bit of help on the sync-up between platforms, but is great to use.

This product is useful but on android you have to use sunrise for seeing the tasks sync on calendar and cloudmagic for enabling the association or conversion of an email to a task. On the desktop you must work with gmail and sunrise. These 2 combinations are very well suited for todoist. Check mark's confusing:decide what it means and stick to it .

There are some minor gripes like recurring tasks always being put to the next occurrence, e.g. completing a daily tasks at 00:01 will make it skip the rest of the day you marked it complete, not the day you might have done the task for. But in general it works pretty well, and they even have a public API as well as a fairly obvious financing concept, hinting at long term availability.

I would have given this 5 stars if I could view my completed tasks, and the website and application functioned more similarly. On the app, you can select multiple tasks at once, but the website functions differently. It's counter intuitive after using the app 99% of the time, and I find myself getting frustrated with the website and not able to undo mistakes as I can on the app.

A bit of a learning curve to setup projects and such. But after a couple of months I'm finding this app very efficient and useful. One critique is the check marks. There the Same check mark icon for complete task in one screen and done editing in another screen. A little confusing.

I've used a few to-do & general list apps and Todoist is the one I've settled on. Once you're used to the nesting structure and have things set up the way you want (you can adjust the "home" view etc) it's excellent. Syncing is immediate and as you would expect (I've found other apps lacking in this regard) and being able to share lists without subscribing to other features you might not need is also a real bonus. Try it!

I moved to Todoist from Remember the Milk, but was missing location-based reminders...until now! Better integration with Google Now would be the next killer feature. Even without that, this app is nearly perfect.
I can't even get the reminders out of the drop down menu if I wanted too...I've been better about getting things taken care of since downloading this program.
Very easy to maintain todo list. It made me lazy to remember things.
So much you can do with it. One thing in particular that I love is that you can customize repeat tasks. You'll never go back to other list like it.

You are limited to a title for your task, no description allowed - unless you fork over nearly $30 a year. Seriously? I can't even describe what my task is without paying? I understand charging for something reasonable, like group access to projects, or cloud storage. But this ridiculous limitation makes the ap useless for pretty much anyone outside of a corporate environment. NTY!
Just keeps getting better. Flawless app with a nice simple layout and does exact what it is supposed to do. Karma is a nice incentive to complete tasks. I love this app :)
I've tried a good number of cloud to do apps and this one ended up on the top of my list. If you like optimizing and figuring out a way to make a tool work for you, give this one a go.

I've used the premium services for a year now and I will be re-upping for another. Prior to this service I tried at least a dozen others. Each offers something unique and I'd suggest that each person tries to find their niche. This works well for me.

Since I installed this app, I used it pretty much everyday to track work and personal tasks. Very good tool to make you more efficient. Great interface and sync across all devices. Recommend to anyone.
I've tried them all and for simple to do list application this is great. Magnificent chrome extension and Web app as well. Highly recommend.... Continues to improve.. Job well done
I live in Brazil, premium costs around 75 Brazilian Reais a year, that's too much! I love the app by the way, it works wonders so it deserves it's five stars!
Quite good. I'd appreciate a quick-add feature, so I can add tasks with one click
Simple and functional. That's all one needs to get organized.
Widget is as powerful as app and web!
Assssom + simple worth using
Not overly complex, but with all the features you need
Cool app, but there should really be a 2x2 widget.
Clean and flawless UI. Love the widget also
Good app for tracking pending work
Seems like it should easily integrate with other calendar programs like Google or Yahoo
Looking for app that is not so nosy
Best to do app for Android.  Talks to Evernote,Sunrise Calendar. Great!
Easy to use and helps me remember stuff all the time
Does what it says on the tin.
Very helpful, I recommend it.
And the app works perfectly!
That makes this app useless for me. Seriously missing Astrid!
Simple, clean and to the point.
excellent todo manager. Easy to use. Minimal ui.
Wunderlist has reminders in free version. Why not Todoist then?
Awesome app for almost everything
Easy and not annoying with reminders
Realice varias pruebas cambiando una tarea y jamas recibi ninguna alerta en mi celular.  Eliminada la aplicación.
Can you make the notification pops up?
Great app love it
Great practical features

Started using the website to get a bit more organised and very impressed with it. The free version is more than enough for me and makes keeping track of the things I need doing much easier. The mobile app is very well made too and easy to use on the move, particularly for things like shopping lists!

Love this app. It was easy to get my team on board. I took literally a day to have everyone up and running. It helps that I can use tool like zapier with todist, and that the mobile app os so easy to use. My only complaint is that I cant get a time stamp for when a task is created, began, and completed. That would make the decision to buy that much easy. It the only thing missing fpr what we need.

Have been testing as a tool to assign, update and remind management members on projects and tasks involving team members from other sites... It's doing what we need. Only thing I would like to see would be an actual calendar view widget for PC and mobile devices...

Very few problems with this tool so far.  Would easily give it 5 stars if it had the ability to manage tasks with bulk actions.  It can become very cumbersome when you are managing multiple projects with similar requirements/tasks but can only manage said tasks one at a time/manually. However, overall it is the best value at $30/yr for a project management tool.

Have really benefited from having this because it syncs across my phone and laptop so I can edit and amend lists or tasks on the go and at work. Could be improved if it included reminder settings automatically and allowed you to add tasks one after another without having to keep clicking on the add task button (comparing with tasks on Google calendar).

Would give it a 4.5 rating.  I am a sucker for new, promising to do list/project manager apps.  I have tried a ton of them.  I have concluded that we all have our unique ways of working, and it is impossible for an app to perfectly suit everyone.  This one comes close for me, with it's great cross-platform syncing.  I use it via iPhone, Android tablet and Outlook.  I sacrifice recurring tasks and notes, the latter because I am not willing to pay $29 annually for that feature.

I'm a freshman in college ad honestly, I can't keep track of half of the things I have to do. With this app, I can quickly jot down errands and set up reminders to get back to work. And getting notifications of tasks I haven't completed is great. Also, I can sync my tasks to my calendar! And I can do all of this with the free version!   You do have to get used to the layout and how to input information in, but after that it's a breeze! I definitely recommend this.

I'm addicted to task manager apps.  It's the main reason I have a smartphone.  Todoist has a lot going for it: a nice clean interface, simple to use, and a great support site and blog to help keep you motivated.  I do think it's worth the subscription fee.

I got really annoyed with the focus on collaboration/sharing in so many todo list apps. It's a feature I will never use so I don't want it in my face all the time. Todoist has a refreshing approach with a separate product for teams - sharing is now available but it's out the way if you don't want it.**Edit - increased to 5 stars following addition of IFTTT integration.

I have always had lots of thoughts and ideas that come to me faster than I keep track of. I really needed a tool to help me remember them, organize them, prioritize them, remind them and keep track of them. I have used many other apps like this. However, even though I have started using Todoist recently and don't know everything about it yet, I find it to be superior to others, in terms of functionality and features. Thank you!

Ok, not as pretty, but repeating tasks can be made in so many ways, a feature only available in the paid app of any.do. Make your own categories, reschedule, etc. Easy to use. Wish list: send tasks to my husband, put the completed check box beside each task instead of at the bottom of the screen.

...a year or 2 later, Im still quite pleased!         I used Astrid until they were bought out, I tried Wunderlist for a while but was never really satisfied with either.  Finally I tried Todoist - wow what a superior product.  It's easy to organize and assign tasks, the interface is fairly easy to use.

The reason people use apps like these are not just to remember the things they have to do, but also to keep track of their progress, and inherently get a sense of reward when their tasks are finished. Of course, a completed task should be a reward in and of itself, but the ability to see your progress is very motivating. Unfortunately, ToDoist does not allow that - completed tasks disappear from their projects and the Today view, and are only visible with all the other historical completed tasks in a separate section of the app.  Users have been asking for this feature in a thread that's over a year old, and the company does not seem to think it is a priority.   I'm a premium user, and when my subscription ends I'll be moving on. In fact, if I find an app that does this and has the features of ToDoist, I'll leave, regardless of how much of my subscription I have used.

I've been going through app after app, and with a suggestion from a nephew,  I tried todoist. I heard of it, but never used it. Now that I have, I quickly ported all my lists into this app and paid the yearly backup fee. I deleted all other apps, and I am organized and very happy with this app. A very good find that brings piece of mind. Thanks.

I've tried a fair few todo list managers over the years and this one is the best. The user experience is awesome, everything I wanted to do could be done easily and I found it intuitive. Todoist strikes the right balance between usefulness and intrusiveness.

Todoist is seriously one of the most useful mobile/computer apps. I use it at work CONSTANTLY, and the ability to sync your Todoist account makes it super easy to add tasks no matter where you are or what work station you're near. The karma system is also a very nice little addition. It doesn't really do much, but that extra small bit of progress tracking can be really motivating. Fantastic and simple to use app, can't recommend it enough.

Have tried all the other major "todo" apps and this one supports a large variety of platforms and has great features. Only complaint is that you have to pay for notes and notifications which are key features, but overall this app is terrific.

I'm a consultant for a major Consulting firm. I love Todoist. It keeps me on task and allows me to organize my projects effectively. One thing I would add is a "someday" ability to catagorize tasks you don't want to give a date to.

I love this app.  It is simple in design and usabilty but extremely effective.   Everytime I think of something big or small I put it in here and categorize it.   My chances of forgetting things and not getting projects on time has been dramatically reduced thanks to Todoist.  I love that it syncs with my Outlook and how you can collaborate on projects and add comments to the feed or content stream and keep other people in the loop on your progress or lack thereof.  GREAT JOB TODOIST!!!

I  tried  several  applications  for  listing my tasks  and get organized. This is the best application  that I found. It works on all devices and integrates  nicely  in many email clients  and other  applications. You can use projects and filters and assign  tasks  to names. Also you can get  emails  with  the tasks  per day.

This app is the best implementation of a to-do list I've seen yet. Todoist collects all the functionality and features of other apps into a cleaner, more robust package. It's obvious by the design, and the features available free, that Todoist is thoughtfully made to give the customer the best experience possible, while giving the option to pay subscription for expanded functionality. I don't mind paying the subscription; it's commercial-grade functionality for a low monthly cost.

Simple free tracking in a central place I can get from all my devices.  Convenient and helpful for quick reference of both personal and work tasks.  Not at stage where I need to pay for reminders but can imagine they would be useful.  :)

It's simple and easy to use. The only problem is that the reminders is not a feature in the free version, which other similar apps have it in their free release. It would have been great if that feature was included rather than asking users to buy the pro version!
As a big fan of Allen's Getting Things Done, I've been looking for and finally found a great software tool to accompany GTD.  Thank you Todoist Team for an intuitive, simple and attractive tool.

Finding the right tool to track your TODOs turned to be a challenging task. After googling around for quite some time, I think, I found the one that shines the best. I was really impressed how powerful and cross-platform this productivity tool is, not to mention its sharp, elegant and good-looking user interface. Seamless task integration for Gmail as well as IFTTT recipes make Todoist even more attractive and intelligent. When it comes to drawbacks, ~30$/year Premium subscription seems to be quite a high price for such trivial extensions like notes, reminders, labels and filters, which many regular users would like to make use of from the beginning. Lots of similar applications on the market offer these features out-of-the-box just for free. Kind of a bummer… Paid membership must be definitely reviewed to more accurately differentiate between basic (free) and truly premium (paid) features.

Makes organizing tasks really easy. Even when you have tons and tons of them. Create projects with sub-projects; each having multiple tasks that can be easily tiered and given different priority  levels. Best thing though,  is the accessibility via any platform: android, windows pc,  browser based on a work computer, apple OS... so you can access your lists from anywhere anytime. Many more features in the premium version for like $30 a year, which is not bad. But free version will do you if you want no problem.
Waste of time. To add note details you have to upgrade which you have to pay for. Whats the point of putting it free if cant get basic functions.
I've enjoyed using this app so far and it has helped me become more productive.

Im a heavy google user, I use Keep and other note taking app, this is the best all-in one solution I found so far, the widget is great and very eye catching on my phone, make me aware of all coming tasks, I used Evernote before but its too complicated sometimes, I think this app + Keep fulfill all my needs, will spend more time and see! **After months on premium plan I can say it worth every penny!  I have basically use this to replace my google calendar, its a calendar+note pad+task list+planning app❣
I used to use any.do but they started to push a monthly subscription for basic features.  Todoist has it all

I don't write reviews usually. And I don't write this one to endorse Todoist. I write this to promote productivity. Something that this app does way better than other apps that I've used. It does all the right things and solves procrastination, at least for me.
I switched to this app recently and I'm so happy with it. I was looking for something that has categories and I can add tag and notes to items.

Really wanted to like this app as it's the closest thing I've found to Awesome Note which is exclusively on iOS. For me it sadly fails to impress for three main reasons: 1) Can't understand more complicated repeat intervals which I need (a lot!) 2) if you accidently tick something off by mistake, it's gone for good. Infuriating! 3) no option to permanently disable the cloud option. I really do just want things secure and local on my phone!
It would be nice to be able to set the time of day when tasks set for that day become over due. Right now, it does this in the morning, even though my real life deadline is at 7:00pm (for example)

It really is a great app to help keep you on schedule. If you add something without a deadline it ends up in a list that you have to go into to see. Not that bad but a few extra steps for things that might not be on your mind and have to look it up. I'm not sure yet of its good or bad but it also send an email of the days task as well as ones that you haven't finished. If you want to stay on track this is an app for you.
I like the ability to quickly look through tasks and swipe off when completed. Works great. Daily reminders of upcoming tasks due is cool too.
I love that it's synced between mobile and laptop. Could have a few minor usability changes...that's why 4 star and not 5 but otherwise AMAZING app if you want to get more organised.
It helps make keeping track of my to do lists easier. I can access it from my computer, iPad, and Android phone and all my changes are in real time.
I use it on an LG G3 on a desktop pc and share a lot of task with my girl's lenovo ideapad tablet.
With cloud support and available in 13 platforms, this app easily become my default to-do list for daily activities.
The free version is perfect for basic task management and is exactly what I was looking for.  I can access it anywhere and my whole family uses it.
This app has been amaziing at keeping all my projects organized and doe jotting down those great ideas as they hit. Even when I'm miles away from anywhere wallowing my dog
It's very very good, but the Pro ver is too expensive compared to other APPs, like Memability or Clipper. Best regards. Manuel Rizo-Patrón R.
I love that I can just dump everything I need to do on to Todoist. The user interface is clean & unfussy, and it is so useful to have seamless integration between my Android phone, my iPad & my Mac.
I wish I could add descriptions to my tasks, but that's a small gripe. Great app because of its simplicity, it has helped me organize my life better.
I love this. Integration on all my devices. Great user interface and a sense of organisation. This would be hard to improve on and the upgrade is reasonable and will be my next move. Thanks todoist x
This app is really well laid-out and has kept me on track better than anything I've used so far.
Only used it couple of times, but it achieved its goal perfectly, which is to keep the schedule and todolist. Great app.
everything look good but the widget is not good enough that why i give you only 4 stars.

Great and simple interface, good karma system, awesome schedule and timing choices (everyday, every specific days, on specific date and time, etc), and the reminder is not annoying. Very recommended for group project works using multiple devices!
Hassle free task organizer, wonderful app, would recommend try it once, u will fall in love with it
I have been a premium user of this service for awhile now and I love it. The app is great and with more and more integration being supported, it keeps getting better.
You know a productivity app is a good app when you suddenly want to be more productive because of a new app you installed. It works so well and it makes my life so much easier. Keep it up.
It works perfectly and is very adaptable. The Web app is also very convenient. I've been much more organised since I subscribed for premium.
I'm a premium user and I find its good for the most part. REALLY needs some basic functions though like copy/pasting your tasks
A better to do and talk list than other apps available. Easy to use and a very nice, clean display.

The widget isn't the prettiest thing to look at but it's functional. Also, it is confusing trying to figure out how to create tasks that reoccur a specific amount of time after the completion date. Once you figure out how to create those tasks, it works great.
Best to do list I've used. I prefer it to wunderlist & anydo. The free version is functional enough for remembering, ordering and prioritising tasks. Good.

Hands down my favorite task mgr service provider but can we please 1) have an option to control font size in the widget? (Way too bulky as is), and 2) have the persistent status bar notification a but more useful? Maybe have buttons to cycle through due tasks and a quick add button on the side to that?

Android experience and widgets are great. It would be better if events modifiers appeared just below event rather than at bottom of screen. Also some allowance for smaller fonts would let more items fit on the screen.

But the free version doesn't allow notes for tasks & the paid version is very expensive . There are others around cheaper or free & with similar functions. I also don't want to work with this type of layout. Wunderlist interface is more mine
Personal or professional projects get easier when not forgetting the due tasks. Especially the small details
Not nearly as intuitive as I would have liked . I found myself struggling to do things that should have been simple for example subprojects.
I am calling half cup is empty. Though half is full,  a full one would be 5 star.
If you want to make ANY notes on a task to do you are required to pay a whopping $30+ annual fee. Uninstalling the POS app, notifications EVERYDAY to tell me i have NO TASKS. GENIUS.
As with any task manager, you need to be disciplined and check it regularly.  But, this one is definitely the easiest one I have found to use.
Dont get me wrong keep is good for notes, but Todoist is better at reminding you and labeling certain things. Also the feature that reminds you of daily things and if you missed them.
Well thought out app that is ease to use and has all the functionality you need.  Suffers from sync problems occasionally.
The interface makes it easy to add new tasks on the fly. Also, the Karma system really makes me want to complete more and more tasks each day.
Although I thought that it connects to my sunrise calendar, but not. It could be if I write task into the Todoist and that appearances in calendar too...
While it does have its flaws, the benefits certainly outweigh them.

Time and task management is only as good as the system you employ,  but the right kind of tech helps. Todoist is a game changer for me and the best task management tool I've ever used. The app is gamified just enough to keep you wanting to complete your tasks.
Fantastic tool to help get things done. I love that there's a Todoist app for all the screens / platforms I work on (iOS, Android and Chrome browser.)
I have tried numerous task manager so far and I must say that Todoist is the one I am sticking too. It has the right mix of ease of use and sophistication. Good job!

If you like the free version, buy this app. It's constantly being improved and more integrations with other apps are being added as well. Great value for money. One star lost because integration with my Google calendar could be better.
Todoist's handling of recurring dates puts it above the many other todo apps I've tried. Former Astrid fans will find a home here.
The app is great. If you also add something where one can see one's completed tasks for a day or a project then it'll be amazing.

I looked hard for an app with recurring reminders. Finally found this one. Also like that it links to Google calendar so all deadlines are available at a glance. Best to do list I've come across so far.

Great tool for organizing your stuff. The points make it a little game and that gives some incentive to compete more chores. Could only wish for the recurrent feature to be a little more simple but that's minor. Give it a try!
This task manager really helps to focus on achieving goals. Clean design creates great user experience. Looking forward to see more apps from Todoist team.
Love the interface and its ability to integrate with different platforms. A must have to make everyday even more efficient.
While I think it's one of the best to-do list apps I've ever used so far, I believe that notifications and notes are essentials of any to-do list app and should be offered free.
Well, this app nags me if I don't get something done. That is good.

This is a great productivity app. It has helped me get more accomplished. Being apple to use this on Android, iOS and PC has made syncing all my tasks a breeze. I have only been using this app for a week and a half, I'm sold on a membership.
Great app for keeping track of day to day missions. I think there needs to be some kind of checklist function or maybe I haven't found it yet? Keep up the good work
I like the daily reminders and the integration with gmail. Really helps the beseiged keep up.
Used with Evernote, Sunrise, todist connected via Taskclone I'm always up to date and have all my resources available 24/7
I have really been looking for an app like this to get rid of paper lists...really easy and best part is sharing a 'project' with others.
Great app for staying organized. Not too basic or difficult to use. Would be better with color options for priority events.
I get frustrated with the dating aspect. Sometimes I just want to do something 3 days in a row but there's no easy way to do that without writing it out 3 times.
Absolutely love this app! Best one I have found for organization! Totally addicted to it. Has dramatically improved my life! So grateful!  Kuddos to the creators!

I tried multiple typea including google tasks and any.do but they coulndnt do what todoist does. Ive also used the api to generate a complete digest that includes unscheduled tasks. Five Star Awesomeness. Cheers guys
Super easy to use, super handy as well. I never buy apps, but i might have to because i really want those premium features
I will definitely pay for upgrading to premium if there's calendar mode. Also there's no "arrange by date" at mobile version, making user hard to find out wt to do on a certain date.
Wonderful! I just need to be able to move multiple tasks between lists at once. I'll go to 5 stars when this is fixed.
It really helps with the GTD (Getting Things Done) methodology. I would only suggest some color themes to personalize the app such as "black" or "low light" etc..
The app can get better but it is already very good. The service is marvellous!
Love it, I can get it on both Apple and Android, easy to use, attractive layout. Just started using it but seems very promising  :)
Other apps that offer task tracking etc are just too darn complicated. This is clean, simple and so far reliable! Droid maxx 4.4.4

I've been looking for a simple, effective multiplatform app for quite  a while. This one does it. I have installed and Uninstaller so many others. In half a day after testing, playing with the features, reading reviews, I upgraded to Premium. I can create, update, complete, edit tasks regarless of the platform I'm on - seamlessly. And instantly see the updates on another.
Easy to use and straight to the point. If you can't get stuff done with this app then there's no hope for you.

The app is reliable and well put-together, but the features that make it truly powerful or comprehensive are behind the pay wall. I would use the full version over Google Keep and Google Calendar, but not the free version.
Really love this app. I can put all my tasks here and have them enter themselves on my calendar. There are a lot of other things that I can also do with this app. Works really well with IFTTT.
Just too high price for people from some countries, who wants more features, but not any syncing.
As an IT project  manager  I replaced  my Franklin  planner (20 yr user) with  Todoist. I loved  it  so much  I upgraded. Having  fun using  labels  & creating  queries.
This game is the best for people who forget. Its even better with the android wear because it's always there and there is no way to forget.
Does a good job reminding me of things I need to do and upcoming things I need to do.
i am happy after one week of use , i am gonna pay for one year premium version, hope get even better,
Would prefer the premium version if available at a one time cost even if it's a little steep compared to a yearly subscription.

The only reason I upgraded to premium was for the Project Template feature it advertises. Come to find out there is no project template feature, it's done through a manual process of creating a template, then downloading, uploading, editing, etc every single time you want to use it. For the free version, I give it 5 stars.

Easy to use. To keep track of tasks. Can share with my husband or colleagues which make it useful beyond my own personal need. Still figuring out how to use it best and what its full functionality is.
Love how easy this app is to use. Especially the number of ways I can access it  (mobile, desktop, browser window). Keeps me in track and allows me to see what's coming up next. Love it.
Fantastic. I can't keep a pure GTD workflow, but the beautiful Web experience makes up for it.
The only app I've ever paid for, and it wasn't because the free version was hobbled. Superbly well made.
I've tried many to do apps. Some were too complicated and some were too simple. This has a nice interface and is easy to use.  This one is my favorite so far. Great job!
I mainly use the 7 day widget view on my home screen to keep track of assignments and other things for the next week. Convenient and simple.

I really like the number of platforms it supports. It can be integrated with Outlook, Chrome, Firefox, Android etc. which is really handy. Hope they provide some more features in free version like notes and sub tasks.
Basic features are enough for my daily life. Perhaps i'll purchase more features in the future
Multi platform is a must have today. User friendly, and still FREE for most basic Features.
It has been working well for me so far. I'm staying on track with my tasks.
Love this app!  I always forget the things I need to do or buy but now I have one place to jog my memory and keep me on track
The only thing I would like to see added is the ability to add emails directly to my todoist list as you can with the Gmail add-on
Flexible, well integrated with other services and available on all platforms that I use, both personally and professionally.
This could be one of the most helpful apps you can get. Really saved me from unorganized school work.
Great job. My favourite to do list app. Ability to customise the theme of the app widget would be good :)
Really keeping me on track with every thing I need to do.
This works very well for me and helps me make sure I complete my tasks and accomplish my goals.
This is more than I ecpected for to do list application, very recomended.
I've tried a few of these type apps and keep coming back to this one. It's simple and just works.
Have been using it for for years. Best app in its field and keeps getting better with time. Highly recommended.
Use it everyday to manage my tasks. Best I've seen so far.
Love it!  I remember all the little things I used to forget and kick myself about before
I've tried about every to do list/productivity app out there and Todoist tops them all. Not too many bells and whistles, (the way I like it),  and it gets the job done.
Wonderful app very useful,  only thing yearly subscription price is too much should be reduced.
Have tried a couple others, this one is very user friendly, has a good logical and intuitve flow to it. Like the email reminders too! Plan on upgrading soon.
I've used them all. ToDoIst keeps me on track better than any app I have ever used!
I really think it does everything i want it to do and then some. And it runs smooth as silk.
So much easier to use than Google tasks with reminders, projects, ability to postpone tasks as well.
Wish I started using todoist sooner.  I use it on both my phone and pc to manage web projects and tasks.  Essential!!
Downloaded this app about a week ago and I have already observed a jump in my productivity. Highly recommended.
I like it. It is a good time management app and the karma (game like) system is suited to motivate.
I'm still getting acquainted, but so far I love this tool. Thanks Tim Challies @challies for the recommendation.
Works great.  I love that Todoist has plugins for so many platforms.  So easy to stay organized.
Great app so far. Beautiful interface! Not thrilled about having to pay for reminders and notes for a to-do list though.
Easily integrates with gmail, has a way to organize tasks into various projects, and easy to create new tasks. Love the usability
Seriously... The best to-do app! Very clean , easy to use and the Outlook plugin is exactly what I needed. Also, having Karma is very motivating for me.
This has helped me organise my day to make sure I get everything done. It's brilliant, give it a go!!
Super useful and fun to use..as long as u update ur to do tasks dat is :p

Very intuitive design. Works smoothly and we'll thought out.

Excellent minimalist UI, very intuitive and quick.  Good for distraction-free task management.

Oh. Thanks god for that. UX is perfect and functions too.

Great. I can finally put my list into chronological order easily. Simple buttons. Simple design.

After a year of trial and error with almost all todo apps, I finally settled with this app. Primarily because of the availability  across multiple platforms and semeless sync. Outlook integration makes it easy for me to create task from emails. GTD elements are at its best. Still waiting for better location based reminders and ability to review tasks.

It's a great To-Do/Productivity app that motivates you to get things done.  It's not bland nor is it disorganized, you can set reoccurring tasks, earning points to achieve rank gives greater incentive to get things done, it has a blog, and I have enjoyed it so much that I have done away with other To-Do/Productivity apps.  It's that good.
It helps me plan and pace tasks in an unintrusive way. It is very useful to have my lists on all devices.
Great functionality, sync and widget. Easy and quick to add even the smallest task. Doubles as a reminder app and helps me not to forget anything. Karma is a nice incentive too.
Todoist let's me easily create, classify, check off, and generally organize and synchronize my tasks. I am very happy with it.
Great to do list app. The note takung function is really weak. Stick to the lite versipn as the additional functions on the paid version are not worth the price
I use this app all the time since I downloaded it. I love that I can work from my desk and add tasks via my Web browser and then check them and add more from my phone. Everything stays in sync.
I've tried several different to-do management apps and Todoist is the one that I have keep using.
The app is very slik and really helps get things done. However, it is heavily let down by the widget which comes in large or bigger, wasting a lot of space on a phone screen.
I want it to work perfectly but I'm not at the point where I've come to rely on it. We'll see. It's working for now.

The best task manager I've used. Can do simple lists, projects, notes...very useful because I customize it to fit how I work. Syncs beautifully across my laptop, phone and tablet. You will not be dissapointed.

I have been looking for a tool which I could combine with my outlook instead of having the application opened by itself. Todoist covers this need, very nice understandable user interface and many ways of accessing your tasks anywhere at anytime
This app works well with my phone and syncs well too, I also have it set to my Sunrise Calendar but Todoist doesn't notify me when my task needs to be done, or over do. What's up with that?
I love the usefulness of this app and its simplicity.  I use it everyday for both business and personal.
Powerful, simple, and connected. The only todo app you need!
Very good for making a list but absolutely nothing else, if you want to even just view compleleted items you need to pay for premium at a astonishing $29.99 a year... So yeah...
Todoist has all the features that I need on all the platforms that I use and it's simple to use.
Takes care of all tasks and works amazingly well with Moto360!
Have just gone with the pro version.  Liking it!
Notifications and calendar integration could be better
Best among all todo app
Expect a bit of a learning curve.
Easy to use, good features
The to do list for my phone that I am actually using!
Improve my productivity
Great app thanks

ToDoist easy to use and provided a comprehensive yet simple interface. Depending on how deep one wants to go, there is almost everything that one could ask a ToDo List app to do.  Certain features are locked out in the free edition, which is a pain. But I believe the subscription fee is not too much for the functionality this app provides on a whole.

I have been using it only for a few months now. I found it excellent. I had been using several other to do list apps in the past, this is the best I have come across so far. Have tried most of the features. Have used the calendar sync, gmail link and also recurring events scheduling. Today I am dependent on Todoist for my acivities

I don't like that this app doesn't allow the user to block out time periods. It lets you input start times but not end times. Voice recognition is also really buggy. Other than that, I love this app. Great mix of a user friendly interface with enough customization to fit anyone's scheduling demands.

After trying this out for a couple of days I was ready to put my whole list of to dos in it. I was worried because I was putting in the entire Sidetracked Home Executives in it and didn't want to be wasting my time if I decided against it. No waste. (I suggest if you do it then it is easiest to add it on the computer to start with.) Love having it and my other things on it. So. Simple to add things when they come to mind. Easy to switch things if I need to.

This is the best task app,  I have used.   I have never been able to find app that worked seamless between all my desktop and other devices.  Using app is easy and it gives you great daily information to keep your task in order (better than Outlook and Google).  Highly recommend.

Across all platform feature is  seamless. Ui is clean.I still do however prefer cal where you see dates and events.rather than just tasks. And tasks like call, message and email will be linked in within the app. I wish I didn't buy this despite it being a good app. Could be better.

This is the best to-do list app I have ever came across. I expect one more thing in the free version, ability to take notes. No need to upload files. But put some notes into to-dos is really helpful. So I hope you will understand. And I'm hoping to buy Todoist as soon as possible. :)

This app is far from perfect, but it is the best todo app available. I spent quite a time evaluating all available todo apps and basically this one is the only thing that comes close to being acceptable. The major benefits are the projects with sub-projects, the labelling and the priorities, but mostly the extremely good possibilities to get reminders for tasks that are due or near to become due. However what is needed is a better integration with Outlook mail and especially Outlook calendar.

I've tried, and tried, and tried to get a solid to do system up and running for years. So far this has been the easiest  tool yet. It feels like it gets out of my way. It's everywhere I need it to be for capturing items, gmail, chrome, phone and tablet. The IFTTT integration allows me to automate task creation and scheduling.  My only desire is to have Start Dates that I can filter on as well.  That would earn that 5th star in a hurry.  That and maybe theme support, a dark theme would save my eyes at 3am.

Todoist is an application which provides you functionality, not novelty, a brilliant yet simple design for the application makes it easy and smart to navigate, being as lite as it is it barely dents your storage space and really does make an impact on your day to day lives. Categorization of events, choosing dates and times, setting alerts are extremely simple yet useful touches to this brilliant application. Also, the reward system will push kids to finish all their tasks too, which is brilliant.

I have gone through every list app on the Play Store. This was one o the best. I have been looking for a list app to sort my Christmas lists, shopping list, wish list, birthday lists, and to-do list. The sub lists make it easy to do that! I love that you can put a due date and also a reminder in advance. I love how you can share lists with multiple accounts. An option to view all tasks with a due date in a calender is the only feature that could make this app better. Or maybe folders to put your lists into.

I love this app, I use it every day on all my random projects around the house, for my car modifications, and all my hobbies, including just random small projects that tend to pop up.  The only drawback is the monthly fee to use the app continuously. I wouldn't put a huge price tag on an app like this, but if it were $10-$20, I'd buy it. In the meantime, I'll have to enjoy all the free features as is.

Wanted an app to sync to my laptop and emails for business and personal. This is it. Looked at. and trialled many but this was the most versatile without having to waste lots if time inputting tasks. Now I don't have to fret about task priority, I do that the night before, I just do them. V happy

One of the best to do apps out there (and I've tried a lot). Great cross-platform support, great design. For some weird reason there's no way to specify a start  date for your tasks. Also you can only give your tasks one of 4 priorities. Despite these issues, I would still highly recommend Todoist.

I use this app to help me remember all my assignments. I like the option to create different sections, like different classes. I wish it connected to my calendar more easily so I could have a complete schedule, and I also wish it had the ability to add a time to an assignment. But overall it's a solid app. I haven't had it glitch at all, as other similar apps have for me.

The best thing for me about this app is the ability to download onto all of my devices. I have a desktop, iPad and android versions, so it doesn't matter which device I am using at the time. I can always post a to do and check my list throughout the day. It could be more involved as some posts have articulated, but if if you are searching for a simple app that can help keep you organized, this is perfect.

This is a great multiplatform To Do list management tool with lots of nice features. It sometimes fails to sync properly between platforms though. If I log out and back in again it seems to fix it. Apart from that, it's perfect! This is software I don't mind paying for!

Being that Google Calendar has become a mess, this is a great alternative. It edits Google Calendar, so it will still allow Google Now to function. Overall a decent app, but doesn't bring anything new or innovative. Could use an overhaul on design, but that's form not function.

Fantastic, comprehensive Organizational Tool to help me get from the beginning to an end of a Project (and all my honey-dos in between). If it could install in Google Calendar, that would push it over the top. Yes, premium costs $28 for the year. But I would lose that much in productivity if I didn't have it. Now if other people had it, the collaboration would be off the charts.

This app is amazing. I use the web and mobile versions to get the most out of the program. It's so streamlined and has more than doubled my daily productivity. Even without being able to set end dates on tasks this app deserves five stars.

Many of the tasks at my work are static in nature.  But with the friction of our growth, many more dynamic tasks or situations are surfacing.  We are not yet large enough to implement full automation.  Todoist allows me to bridge the gap of a historically manual minded workplace to an automated minded work place.  Hopefully some day we outgrow Todist, but for now this is exactly what we/I need!

Liked it very much. Actually this is the only app for which I submit review (I'm too lazy in such issues). Because it deserves that!  My only desire would be to see more visible separation line between the tasks. Otherwise they seem to be visually mixing with each other. But this does not stop me giving deserved 5 stars. Thank you. Well done!

Great app with strong widgets. No email add in free version unlike competitors. Biggest gripe is bad back button support. If I go from Inbox to a project and hit back I am often closed out of program. It should back to my list or the Inbox or AT LEAST ask if I want to exit instead of leaving out.

1.It is so hard to find the completed tasks and undo that to bring them back to today again. 2. It is not possible to create a task with a due date and recurring. You can only set a due date. and wait until the day comes to make it a recurring task. (AKA Start-End date feature is missing) 3.you can't see/check the sub tasks in the widget. 4. the Karma only gives you a general report on your performance. but if you want to know how you did in 1 project, you can't.5.not all query commands explained

Been looking for a way to organize my life.  Between this app and the website i think I've found a great way to do it.  I haven't been using it that long but so far it fits my needs exactly.  Personal, work, rental homes...it's helping me keep it all organized.

It's a very minimal approach, but it works great! You can set custom times for your tasks, get reminders, postpone or snooze where needed and even get email reminders and task tracking. It works well for letting me jot out what tasks I want to complete and doing them

It's the best task-list app I've used - doesn't have all the advanced features I would like, but is simple to use and has that reliable feel to it. A big negative is that there has been no words (that I know of) about android wear support, which I find very unpleasing for a paid service - wear support would hugely lower the discipline needed to work my task list on smaller tasks. I feel wear support should be a given for Todoist and unfortunately I will have to switch to something else if support is not added very soon :(

I find the app incredibly useful for someone who organizes and methodically steps through accomplishing things they feel responsible to complete.  Input is available from whichever platform I'm currently employing - notebook,  including Web browser or Microsoft Outlook or  Android phone.  I can set reminders on days and times of my choice.  I'd love to have more integration with Google calendar and the task and note applications accessible with the S pen on my Galaxy Note 3.

Todoist likes to pretend to be a free app, but to suggest that the free version is anything less than a trial is downright dishonest. Some pretty fundamental features, such as task reminders, are only available to premium users. What's worse, Todoist Free doesn't highlight which features are premium until you try to use them, meaning free users are constantly thwarted by popups asking them to spend money.  Rather than simply sell you the app, Todoist asks you to pay a sizable $29/year subscription fee, which in my view is a big downside compared to other similar apps.   All that griping set aside, I have to admit that it is a quality app. It's intuitive, simple, and highly customizable. I did a lot of shopping around an this is the only productivity app that does everything I want. I'm just hoping a cheaper alternative will emerge in the near future.

I was and still am a Google Keep user. Love the UI, but for my planning needs it was a bit too basic. That's where I found Todoist after trying a multitude of other apps.  What I love about todoist is how versatile it is for recurrent tasks. It offers far more features than other apps in it's free version and is fluid, clean, and syncs well across various platforms. Highly recommended!

Love the app in all its effectiveness and in all its simplicity but I wish there would be a smaller widget that doesn't need to occupy so much space in the home screen.  A 4x1 would be perfect. With this I would give it the remaining star.

I love the product and the app. Todoist is awesome. Only reason for four stars is that it's a bit slow, and I've had one or two tasks lost because I entered them in the middle of the sync. Otherwise it would be five! Go todoist. My favorite gtd app, both on android and the web.       Edit 2014/11/25: up to 5 stars (from four originally) for many updates and improvements. The app is smooth and quick. Todoist keeps improving as few other services do.

I have used many to-do apps, programs, and systems, but this one strikes the right balance between simplicity and features. It doesn't get in the was of what you are trying to accomplish - actual work. It can be used as a simple to-do list or a project manager. Some reviewers will concentrate on what it doesn't do, but it's strength is that it is as close to managing DA's GTD system (which is basically managing lists) as any I have come across. Thanks for great app at great price.

Great features, but without the $29/year subscription you can't even get basic things like reminders. I can't see not even being able to get reminders, so ill stick to the stock calendar/task list on my phone which has reminders.

I've used a lot of to do apps and this is the best one so far. The free version does everything most people will need but the premium is cheap, has a few genuinely useful features and let's you build up more complex workflows. Still developing, I had to ask about the p:[project] tag for filtering as it's not on their help page yet. When I signed up for premium I actually got an email from them asking if there was anything I wanted to know and the response was quick and accurate.

Love, love, love this app!  I can organize my days with repeating tasks and manually arrange my tasks in the order I want.  Has search so I can find tasks, too.  These first two must haves I've not found in any other app.  In heaven!  Thank you! :-)  All these features are without the paid features, to boot.  Highly support and recommend to everyone.  Nice touch is that it sends my agenda via email as a backup.  These guys nailed it.  Thank you, thank you.

Since todoist, my life has become a whole lot easier. I can fit a structure that suits me, or anyone for that matter, and can really get into the detail of the complexities of both my working and lesuire lifestyle. Phenomenal compatibility means everything electronic I need, has todoist available.

This is a great app that helps you to remember what you need to do! The only reason I am rating it a 4 instead of a 5, is that the date and time setting features are somewhat hard to use. If available, I would have rated it a 4.5. I'd like to see an easier way, but now that I've gotten use to it, it's great! The best part is that you not only get push notifications, but emails too. You are also encouraged to complete tasks so that you can get a higher rating.

Now everyone is going to want different things in a To-do List app, but after trying many, many, other apps, I've found ToDoist to be the best one for my needs. It works great, has useful features, and syncs with an one website so I can use it on my phone and computer. Love it.

I usually am juggling a gazillion projects and it is hard to keep track of them all - especially on paper - everything is constantly shifting and changing.  Todo keeps me on track, and allows me to re-schedule things easily.  I even upgraded because it was so helpful.  Would rather spend $30/year on upgrade than the same amount on a bound paper agenda that is difficult to update and doesn't come with all the productivity analysis tools, or the ability to share todo lists with colleagues or team-members.
I have been using it for a few weeks and of all the To Do list type apps, I like this the best so far. Too bad it's not really "free" since all the feature I need only comes with paid version.

The secret to a great To-do app is frequent use. Daily use. Todoist is quick, easy and uncomplicated enough to use without thinking. Sorting is as easy as drag-n-drop. Device syncing is bullet proof. This app is in my Top 3. Simply Priceless.

It's easy to enter stuff you want to do once, not as easy as I'd like for repeating appointments. (Their "natural" language input isn't always the way I talk. I'd like to see a GUI.) The reminders and day to day stuff work great. You've just got to learn to re-sort the list after checking off a recurring task in the web app, or you may end up checking of the next instance without noticing.    I switched from ToodleDo and find Todoist a step in the right direction.

Love it! Gmail app. Chrome app. Browser support. Android app. IPad app. Perfect way to integrate across devices. Would be great to have BlackBerry support though. Also Android interface is a bit cludgy for indenting. But this fits my needs best of all the options I've considered!

It's the best Task (or even project) Management app I've used till date. Believe me I've tried millions! But the only missing feature is admin rights. Anyone can change the deadline, anyone can assign a task to anyone else. I'll give it 5 stars only after you add this. And do this soon before I shift to another app. Still I'm grateful to the team for creating such a wonderful app. Thanks.
They hope you will try it then upg to premium. OK. But when I did an uninstall the account lived on, with regular reminders work is overdue.  Nuisance, be warned.

This has helped my family and I truly get things done.  I myself can finally relax.  I use it personally and professionally and will be buying it this month.  I would like to see a calendar layout and a team management capability in the future.
Ease of use should be THE top priority of any developer.  The designer achieves this with a style and feel that I find attractive.  Many could benefit from the example here.
Love this app. Literally makes me so organised, I've surprised myself. I love the ability to share task lists. Looking forward to android wear compatibility

I was little surprised when I  didnt find place to add time for my task. For ex I have task1 and I need to do it at 5 pm but default time for all tasks is 9 am. I don't know what is the thought process went behind while developing this app. Utter crap!

For a free app, this is the best list making tool I've used to date!  If you do want an app that has impressive list making capabilities (levels of importance, categories, labels, filters, recurring tasks, projects, assigning tasks to different people, etc.) and you want it to be clean and easy to use at the same time, you've found it! I have at least a free trial of the premium features and they do make a big difference, so maybe having to pay for those is the one downside.
After years of using text based lists and dabbling in to do apps this is the first I've stuck with and first I've paid premium for.

I have always been an extremely disorganized person, mostly because I forget about things until the deadline is right there. With todoist I'm finally on top of my life and it's sooo much less stressful!

Great for people who are constantly on the move and have a lot of todo's and ideas to organize. And the reports let you see how effective you've been at getting things done so you can set goals to improve.
A little restrictive in the free version. But if you like it, it's well worth buying for full features.
Love the sharing capabilities and multi-device support. Has kept me more organized and less forgetful. Highly recommend.
Using it more and more it's great. I used to write out my lists on paper now I can save the trees and still be orgnised

The app does its job, but it has its share of bugs. Using the same check mark icon for both saving and deleting items is a textbook UI sin. "Done" as "Save" and "Done" as "Delete task" are different actions! It's way too easy to "swipe away" a task when trying to scroll the list. It's good there is an undo message, if I notice what happened, but I had more than one accident when an item was lost and I didn't realize it. I had a big mess when I switched the phone and the timezone at once - first I had duplicates that I deleted, then some items disappeared. I'm staying with Todoist for now, but I'm actively looking for something better.
One of the best app I have come across. Awesome is just a meagre word to describe this app. Thank you team for your brilliant work. Really appreciate it.
Helps you keep focussed on doing the things that matter. Unlike some other to do apps, easy to use and doesn't become a distraction.
The tool is pretty good, bit one functionality I am missing is dependency. A task can only start if the task is finished.  Please add that to make thia a the best tool seen so far
This is a great app for planning and organising projects as well as making lists. Can also sync with other phones, computers and tablets. Very handy.

Really like this app. Only suggestion would be able to delete completed quotes. I like to keep completed tasks for a period of time and it would be nice to be able to delete them when needed.  Other than that,  this is the best tasks app I've used!
Great program for keeping on top of all aspects of work and home life.  Sharing lists makes coordination easy and the karma system implicitly encourages frequent utilization. This is a staple app.

This app is hands down one of the best I've used. It's so much more than a to do list. It also has an awesome web client to manage your tasks. I love the karma points, they really keep me motivated. Todoist is awesome!

I would probably use it if it could import my tasks from another task manager. It cannot, so I can't use it. In addition, it cannot login me using my Google account ("enter with Google" option on the main screen)

I've tried many apps and Todoist has fit the bill best for me. It performs well, and has all the functionality I need (subtasks, filtering, offline support), especially after paying the annual fee.  Recommended for OCD GTD folks - or anyone who wants to get things done, even if you're not OCD.

It is exactly what I was looking for in an app to become organized. Beware there is an opportunity to upgrade to premium but you don't have to; however, you have the opportunity to try it for one month free! You will be amazed at how a simple design can be so helpful. Don't take my word for it. Try it for yourself

This is truly my favorite app and is definitely the most frequently used on my phone. I'm an obsessive list-maker and this is perfect, there's nothing I'd change. I'm having a minor issue right now with scheduling tasks on and around daylight savings and my question was thoughtfully addressed in under 24hrs--what great customer service! Try it and you'll love it.

I've attempted multiple times to open this program, but each time it gets stuck at the sign-in screen, giving me a spinning wheel. Quite frustrating as I have this program on my desktop and wanted the easy portability; now, it looks like I have to find another app. LG Nexus 4.

As a Mac/Android user I couldn't find a viable replacement for OmniFocus until TODIST. Its great for teamwork, is multiplatform, works offline and after trying out several others it is the one I finally settled for. In fact I have opted for the paid version. The free version is also feature rich. Great app!

I've gone through dozens of to do apps and this one is my favorite, partly because of its ease of use. Only complaint I have though, is that you should be able to view the completed tasks.                                 Edit: I love the app, but ever since the update it seems to be giving me problems. Tasks don't seem to want to stay on the days I schedule them. I schedule something for a particular day, and it automatically moves to the next or previous day. Please fix this issue.

Awesome app. When I wanted to migrate of my old program into the cloud, I wasn't sure what to use, but after looking for a while and seeing what others found worked I am do glad I switched to todoist.

You guys could have more UX refinement. There are just too many functions occasionally up to a point when it isn't intuitive anymore. Perhaps you could focus more on frequently used functions using heat maps or other tools for UX. There are also times when some elements are sort of hard to press because of size or location. I just feel that it hinders me a little bit when using the app, unlike apps such as the Today Calendar which is beautifully designed with material elements. Also try motions and material

This is an awesome app, I am a subscribed to the premium option and I use it regularly for work.. I think it's good enough for professional use. The only things that I would like to see is an feature similar to the any.do app with their "moments", something that pops up in the morning that let's you plan the day. Also it will be nice to have a setting where I can have a default reminder, I like to have a pop up on my phone 15 mins before all my tasks are due. But having to do this for each task is tedious
Bugs come but are quickly squashed but they do come fairly often.   One thing to look out for - if you change date on a task sometimes it seems too easy to inadvertently put it a year out.

Its best feature is, it is available on plenty of devices and even browser add ons. Paid service seems costly for a year, but it is good if using it for multiple devices and multiple places. I was looking for something similar since long time and picked it up after few blogs of top ten to do list apps.

Still evaluating free version but very tempted to go premium.  So far so very good. The list is there on my phone, on my desktop, in my outlook exchange view and there on Thunderbird.  That is flexibility which is hard to beat

I have used different task lists through the years and have found none that compare with this application. The presentation of views is really nice; views are available by project, due today (including past due), due in the next 7 days (past due also), and more. Adding recurring entries is not perfect, but very well done. I just love the integration of email to tasks in multiple email applications. It's great to be able to see emails that I need to act on, mixed with other tasks I need to do.

With any GTD system, it's deeply satisfying to set yourself goals each morning and review what you have achieved with a sense of accomplishment each evening. Fear of forgetting a to-do doesn't keep me up at night. However Todoist's  Karma points encourage me to capture the smallest of tasks to raise my points higher. The more I accumulate, the more addictive it is. I find ever more creative ways to ensure I can achieve each and every task to get those few extra Karma points. Favourite tool.

Love the sub-folders, and recurring tasks option (when I finally found it on my free version!) Only one suggestion for a dream product: to record the date of completed tasks. Two things I use Todist for is keeping track of the books and chapters I read, and fitness milestones. Being able to review them at a later date would be perfect. Overall, Todoist is an great app I use daily.

Fit for my use. It was the app I was looking to sort my tasks.good UI. A suggestion. If you could bring down the cost per year,it will be a hit app. Long press on tasks should give basic options like delete or done

Love karma keeps me motivated.  Amazing interface. Only thing i would do is make the points system a competition. I understand i could do this on facebook but would love to see it in the app.  Secondly when i subtask routinely it put the task as a standalone task as well.  Please fix asap and you have a lifelong costumer!!
I love it. It's easy to use, easy to keep things organized, and the karma feature makes it kinda fun.

I don't need premium features, so this app works fine for me, replacing default task app on my smartphone. The labels make it easier to list project tasks and planning ahead, and the synch feature makes it the most useful.
I think it is a good app but i don't think that i will use because i don't think that they have a way to make tasks recurring.

Good as a basic to do list manager. However the free version is too basic and doesn't differentiate this app from the thousand other to do list apps. The karma feature is cute, but really just a shiny button feature that I forgot about pretty soon.
Could use some tweaking with the widget. Would be nice to see tasks on single lines rather than double tall lines.  Just can't see enough to make it useful.
Another good tool to #GTD -  great for integration and like all good plans should have a deadline -  this might bug you though.  More an actual list of to do than a creative space to log thoughts.
Very nice interface.  Simple and intuitive.  My only gripe is that you cannot create a hierarchy of project folders.

Love this app. It is great for to-do list and keeping life organized. The only things I would tweak are personal preference things, so they are not really a big deal. Get this app and get stuff done.

Todoist is the best to do list app out there. I started with OmniFocus on Mac but since switching to Android Todoist is the closest I've found to a full GTD app. I use it multiple times a day and it's always in sync between the desktop, browser and my phone.

its great ...helps you keep on track with your goals. synchronizes with email , to remind of work and even measures productivity!

Lots of free apps have some of the functionality that you have to pay for on this app. But this app is so much, much better than them - we're using it across PC, mac, Android and iPhone, working collaboratively, and I'm organising all my personal stuff with it as well, and all for a few pence per day. The people moaning about having to pay clearly don't need an app like this, but if you need something powerful, flexible and very well designed then this is for you.

Man I love this app. My only problem is that it is still missing the Karma feature. Then it would be PERFECT!  EDIT: NOW IT HAS KARMA AND IT IS THE PERFECT APP. LITERALLY. I HOPED FOR THIS DAY FOR SO LONG.

A simple but highly effective way to keep track of everything you need to do, get, and remember.
Great integration with Chrome, online and android.  I like the daily reminder emails too.

Been searching for a to do list app for a long time, and this finally wins!  I love the cross platform availability ...it is always right there whether I'm  working in Chrome, Outlook or on my phone or tablet remotely.

I've been waiting for an easy and concise application to manage tasks for ages. This hits the spot. Repeatable tasks, one time tasks, reminders; it's keeping me on track. Along with the desktop application I can always be productive. The best part is the widget. Its fully functional even if the app isn't open!
Update Oct 09,2014 : An awesome app just got even better with the Karma addition - congrats Todoist team! P. S. A sorting tasks feature like in web/pc apps would be quite handy too :-)

I still favor NOZBE if for one feature only and that's the ability to forward a task from any email. I use multiple emails and I need to sometimes set up a task based on an email I recieve. If I receive it using the email I set up the account with no problem but if the task I am setting up comes from another email then it won't do it. This is where NOZBE really takes the lead. I haven't used all the features yet and I am also wondering about connections to Evernote, Box etc..

NO.  Download it and get hit with charges at EVERY junction.  Want this feature PAY.  Want that feature PAY. I've tried various "to-do list" apps, and I haven't found one I really liked since Astrid was bought out. I've only been using this app for a few days (the free version), and I believe it's already helped to streamline my workflow and keep me appraised of what I need to do to reach my goals. The developer offers a trial for the paid version; I've taken advantage of this, and I may invest in it.

The app has mostly every thing you'll need and supports Multiple platforms and browser extensions so you can sync everything among your personal devices...The Homescreen widget proves to be very useful...Premium users have access to reminders and Notes...Todoist is highly recommendable to every one...Thanks for the great app...
Smallest is 4x3. I want to know what I need to do in my life not have my tasks be the main focus of my life.
I've been happy with it so far. The only problem is that when you want to delete recurring events after a certain date, it does not work.
...with the free version. Design is clean, tasks are easy to organize, and the app is very flexible itself. Recommended to anyone who loves simplicity and productivity all in one app.
This app is literally the best to-do list invention to be created! Absolutely love everything about it. It is missing nothing although an extra feature such as colour-schemes would be a bonus.
Simple, pretty quick, easy to set date & priority. Free version has no reminders except daily reminder/ email.
