The older I get the more help I need to remember what I supposed to do. I was never very good at staying focused on what I was supposed to do. Problem solved.  I keep finding more ways to use it almost daily. I linked it to my Outlook and use it instead of the Task feature. Does it have it's unique way of doing things sometimes, yes but so do most programs. I now have a to do list that is up to date all the time with on 5 devices

Best thing I like is that these guys hav a chrome and firefox addon. I add most of my tasks on laptop, and it automatically syncs to my phone. Pretty good options for ordering, categorizing and searching tasks.This app really helped me improve my efficiency at managing my tasks. Only two things I miss is the ability to add reminders and to view completed tasks. But I cant complain 'cause they have those in the paid version.

It is fairly easy to set up, there are nice looking premium features i have not tried yet, but the app seems very usable as is which I greatly appreciate. It also says it is usable across platforms which i will try soon, that is an important feature for me. Thank you for your work

I have tried the best out there. Any. DO, wunderlist you name it. But nothing provided me the simplicity ToDoist provided. You can get done a lot even in the free version. In fact, ToDoist people were kind enough to offer me a premium membership for free for a month.

Todist is a great app for me. I tend to have a lot of different projects going on and was forgetting to do a lot of things. This is great for keeping track of what needs to be done. I love the sub projects and tasks, the recurring scheduling, and the ability to share a list with others. And you get a lot of projects and list items for free. Nozbe limits you to only five.

This app is on all my devices and browsers.  Well designed and really useful feature set.  On mobile there's an integration with cloudmagic which comes in handy to add email tasks, but even with another email app you add tasks by emailing to specific projects.  I also use Sunrise so everyday i get a birds eye view of things I need to get done in addition to my meetings.

Had not found a good to do list since I left my Palm OS devices.  Todoist is so much better. I wish some of the date features were form based, checking off for every week for repeated events but perhaps I will end up seeing the advantages of this  new style.

I have only been using it a few weeks, but so far, I believe this is the task master I have been seeking. I almost didn't try it because of wasted time on other diappointing productivity apps. A colleague gave me a push and glad she did. I will soon be trying the additional available features. I am especially excited about the ability to assign tasks to my assistant within the app.

Love the widget and the "add another..." button for quickly adding a bunch of tasks. There is one bug with the widget... When you tap to switch lists and choose one from the pop-up, your most recently opened app quickly opens and closes again. It's really annoying in what would otherwise be a perfectly polished app.

Took me some time to decide between Todoist and one of the competitors.  The clean interface, the support of multiple platforms and the fact that the app is so easy to use, made me choose Todoist.  Will revisit for five star once I am able to explore to full potential.

Very intuitive and feature-rich app that benefits from Sunrise Calendar support, but hampered by its payment structure. A subscription model seems steep for a to do list app, where a traditional buy-to-use model would be more appropriate. If you're willing to pay the subscription then you get access to many very useful features indeed. Otherwise you're better off with Wunderlist.

subject says it all but overall a solid product. Am considering the £ version since the added functionaility of inc. attachments and notes would lend itself to easy project management. There are other software pieces that offer these features for free but this thing is slick and quick as hell to use.

An app that offers even essential features like reminders only in paid/premium version is a strict no-no. Besides this setting recurring meetings is a pain.  To answer the developer's question: Reminder is a basic feature that was available even in my basic phone of 90s and hence making that available only on paid/premium version is not justifiable. It's not about the price, but what you are paying for.

Very good overview, intuitive interface with collapsible projects, all makes sense. Misses the total task preview. On the website, I love being able to see how many tasks are already scheduled for a future day so I can avoid overscheduling when postponing tasks. STILL, for a free app and service I can't complain. So much better than Wunderlist!

Don't pay them any money, you will regret it. Sync across devices is out of order. Your projects and tags get deleted or changed without warning. Mobile app, Outlook plug in and Windows apps are horrendously out of sync... And the developers know it and still don't /can't fix it. I regret applying for a subscription, don't make the same mistake.

Good little app that's helping to make me more organised, hopefully. Have tried and failed with others but this one seems to have everything I need except maybe a calendar for longer term stuff. A minor detail though and loving it so far

While this app, may be comprehensive, it is very confusing to use. I upgraded to the annual plan and I'm having second thoughts on continuing to try to use it and figure it out. I've searched the program and the Internet for instructions as to how to use it, to no avail. All I can find are adds and videos talking about how darn good it is. They should spend some of that money they are raking in helping those who already paid them to figure out how to actually use the app and how to use it across platforms.

Originally I gave this a 1-star review because it kept showing completed tasks. I am happy to say that the problem has been fixed for quite a while. I use the widget and like how you can quickly reschedule a task to Tomorrow, Next Week, etc. I use this every day and am pretty sure that if I didn't use it I'd end up forgetting to do things I needed to do!

I am really bad with diaries resulting in scraps of paper with indefinable notes left everywhere.  Did not get on well with the diary apps on my phone either.  Until Todoist came along.  So quick and easy to use, reliable, and no long list of instructions.   Great for shopping lists too!

At first when I downloaded todoist I really didn't use it much. It had kinda weird system which I wasn't used to working with. But after a while I gave it a shot and found out the possibilities. I like the clean and easy to read UI. Widget for android is great as I use it all the time during the day. Project folders and tags are awesome for sorting. The only thing I really miss is some more visible highlighting of the folders instead of just a dot next to the name and custom colours too.

Closest match for my needs yet. Integration across multiple platforms, great calendar integration and flexibility of Todoist's UI (dragging tasks from project to project is a breeze) are among the best features. Affordability is reason enough to migrate yet again; lack of basic functionality such as notes and reminders are big blows to the free version. Though that isn't to discourage those who can from making the most of an otherwise fantastic app.

I come from an iOS environment. I used Omnifocus with my iPhone and Mac. It is one of the best GTDs out there. When I switched to Android, I looked for an alternative. I tried all the free ones. Wunderlist, the Squid thing, Google tasks, etc. Nothing was so fluent and fast as todoist. The design is great. I love adding tasks via the task bar or hitting a combination of my computers and add a task. Reminders are great and everything seems to work. What I miss, but are not really necessary would be location r

Easy to organize, schedule, set reminders, tag, break into sub-tasks, and share among people. WISHLIST: * Add support for Task/Comment revision history (in case of accidental overwrite) while keeping it simple. * Add support for richer markup (to support well-elaborated text) like Markdown while keeping it simple.

So far, Todoist has worked wonders for my agenda. I tried a few competitors, but Todoist does things none of them can, like inserting clickable links directly into task items or creating multiple levels of nested tasks with due dates, notes and attachments for any item. There isn't unnecessary ornamentation or animation to slow things down. Task creation and editing is very fluid. My only complaint is that the Chrome extension has been buggy so far. Still, it's well worth a paid subscription IMO.

I needed an app that would allow recurring tasks and cross multiple platforms: pc, mac, and android. This has certainly done that. I know I am under utilizing it, but I haven't taken the time to really explore. It's that easy to set up.

Applause for following the Android design guidelines so well. It's a beautiful looking app. The widget is the most functional of any app on existence. My only wish would be  making subtasks easier or more straightforward. Alternatively if you could just check off notes and assign them dates that could work too...

I love the 'real language' date entry format.  Super easy to be able to put "Every third Monday at 1300" and have it just do it. Only thing I could see as an improvement is to have the choice to add an on screen popup in addition to a Notification Tray reminder.

A good, basic to do app. But what drives me mad is setting a reminder: you are meant to write it as you would say it, so 'tomorrow 5pm'. But no matter what time I try and put it sets it to 10:00am. Aaargh!

This is a great app. It's a pitty it lacks tasks' time estimation feature, which is a crucial one, in my view. That is the reason I finally chose "Remember the milk", instead. Otherwise I would have surely chosen this one, as it is very usefull and comfortable.

Finally something I can use with minimal effort on my part that makes me more productive. The simple fact that it integrates with Outlook makes this phenomenal, add to the fact it works on nearly every device / platform and it becomes an actual functioning To Do app that allows you to be more productive and efficient without having to make more work to actually use it, if you know what I mean.   It's not perfect there are some tweaks, from an UI perspective, that could really enhance it's usability.   This is also the first productivity type app that I've ever spent money on. I purchased the premium services and have members of my team using it as well. I don't like the subscription model. I was also surprised since it was a subscription model that it was $30. I think that's overpriced from a consumer standpoint and is a deal breaker for a lot users. I know several of my team members wont' buy for that reason. I recommend you redo your roadmap and come done it the cost.   I can't recommend it enough.

I've been using the free version for less than a week, but am enjoying it greatly.  I've read several reviews and I'm not seeing any issues with notifications...I get a daily digest email; and a notification on my phone and kindle to open todoist to see my tasks.  I've had no issues with synching across devices or recurring tasks.  So far, so good.  And I have tried too many productivity apps, so still using one after a week is good for me...I know within the first day or two if I like it.

Todoist's snappy response time means you don't tire of using it, its sharing facilities mean you can cooperate easily, its nested project structure makes it easy to add both projects and tasks at any level of detail you want. Its interface for adding tasks could be a little smoother but it's my favorite task list app, after I've tried Avocado, Wunderlist, Evernote, Toodledo and IQTell.

For the most part this app is well done, so if you are just beginning with a tasking program go for it. But for the other 99.9% of the world who already use an existing tasking app and want to change over, the fact you can't import or export tasks without having to create a txt file and script puts this in the useless software pile.  The developers have been promising this feature for a couple of years now, but the road to hell is paved with good intentions.

This is an awesome app! i can put all the emails that I get into a very fast breakdown and put it according to the date I need to read it next.  The only thing I wish it would do is to be able to open up into a bigger screen so it would be easier to see all of my tasks in one place without scrolling

Great ToDo list manager.   Works across multiple platforms, has all the relevant capability.   Has proven to "just work".   I've tried many, but so far this is the best.   Just the right balance between streamlined interface, simple but yet enough functionality to even cover more robust needs.   There's always going to be a miss here and there - some of the ways to organize sub-tasks is a little awkward, for example - but for the most part this app gets it right.   Well done!

I've tried lots of To Do action lists, and I already use GTD (getting things done) on paper.  ToDoist puts the focus on getting things completed. The interface is clear and obvious, without being quirky. The professional version links my ToDo list with 13 platforms (I mostly use the web interface on my laptop but I could install the Windows software).  Sure there are things it could do in the future, and tech support is responsive and helpful

Previously used Any.Do and I thought that was great,  but ToDoIst  is just phenomenal. The level of detail that can be assigned to Tasks ranges from Simple to Complex and exceeds my expectations.  The Attach File works a treat (didn't work in Any.Do) and Support is unbelievably speedy and effective (Any.Do never answered my emails). There are so many features and the Integration with Outlook       includes Email and SMS reminders   and a host of other features. Highly recommended.

After Astrid went down, I have never been satisfied with any To Do app. I tried almost all services. Any.DO wasn't for power users. Todoist looked promising, but it doesn't provide notification feature to free users. So, I was using Wunderlist. Today, I decided to subscribe Todoist premium. It's great, but still I miss Astrid (that was really great gold standard).

No amount of minimalistic, fluid design will make up for the lack of FUNDAMENTAL features sorely missing from the free version of this app. Let me explain: Labels, Reminders, Notes, Custom Filters, Attachments ALL RESTRICTED unless you pay a $29 annual fee. I don't see how many could justify this purchase when there's other equally efficient apps that accomplish the exact same thing & more without the need to upgrade. I'm sorry, Todoist, I like you but adjusted pricing or added features are needed here :(

I really, really love this app in terms of the UI, usability, easy to learn, etc, but I refuse to pay $29 for such basic features as reminders and notifications. I would willingly pay a one time fee to purchase a full version of the app, but not $29. And that's an annual fee, not a lifetime one. Super duper lame.

Really great productivity / task management app. Would love some more features around editing all aspects of multiple items in one go (assigning priorities, contexts etc), and viewing (e.g. ordering tasks by priority, due date, label, etc., within any view). Would also like the experience to be a bit more consistent across platforms. . Certainly my favourite task app that I've used (at the moment...) Unlike other short sighted users, I'm happy to pay a subscription for an ongoing service to ensure the providers of the service stay in business and keep me productive. $30 is right at the top end of what I'd pay. By comparison Evernote is about $50 and Office 365 (which includes Word, Excel, PowerPoint etc, and 1TB of storage) is about $100.

After checking the app was great on all platforms I use (it is!), subscribing to premium was a no brainer. A great balance between powerful features and simplicity. Recurring tasks is the only feature I feel is missing.

I was hesitant to pay for a task app and held off for a while, but once I purchased an iPad I needed something to sync across platforms. After reading reviews it was apparent Todoist was my best choice, and after using it for a couple weeks I agree. Really well done!

This app has helped me more than any other "todo" app I've tried... and that includes dozens of others. I love the emails to tell me the days tasks and the graphs that help me monitor my progress and increase my productivity.

This app has dramatically changed my workflow for the better. I find it easier to hold myself and others accountable because nothing gets missed. Much easier to manage tasks here than through outlook. The ability to share projects is a bonus, and something my team is finding useful.

Added a few month later.  My appreciation continues grow for Todoist.  Different ways to use "labels" and nesting project (notebooks).  I also like the clear color coding. The recurring dates work but are the chief area I'd like improved.——Older review follows   Unlike Wunderlist: Todoist's search feature is present and works on my Android Tablet. Todoist has much more sophisticated, useful reoccurring tasks functions.  Like Wunderlist it features: I like have a button to call it up in my browser (Chrome) I works on my IMac. Caveat, Todoist has only been on my devices for a few days.  So far so excellent. I am using the premium service.  Added -- I'd like Todoist to have a reoccurring task control of "next" as in "next monday, wednesday" also be good to have an end function for reoccurring tasks.  The note function works but first you have to save the task then find it on the task list and note there—clunky  Added: Bottom Line Try Todoist, Wunderlist, and Trello  — Todoist is still my choice for day to day list making,.even with the newest release of Wunderlist.

One of the many way to keep a to do list. This one is best for personal projects and to-do. I love how it's organized and how well it integrates with Sunrise calendar which is by far one of the best calendar UI right now. Improvements would be to integrate more voice functions and prompts when inputting which will make its mobile function easier. Also social integration, something like Facebook, with a social thread should be considered with a news feed to motivate us in completing a shared project or plan.
I just found out that there really is no in-app notification feature for this app. What then is the point of this.
Can't provide fifth star until desperately needed Google calendar integration finally arrives. Using Sunrise cal as an intermediate step should not be necessary.  Otherwise awesome.
I like the layout but i wish they would let you changed more to your 'To Do's' options
Totally love this app. Though it requires some improvements here and there,  overall it's a very good app. It properly balances the functionality and look to provide a nice user experience.
Use it at work in Mozilla Thunderbird as an add-on but then can set reminders for next day on my phone of things which I've forgotten to do or phone calls I take out of the office. Great tool.
To Do List - Simple elegant, brings order to my life. Syncs on my PC, my Samsung tablet and my iPad. Essy and nice No learning curve at all
Using Google Now just say "add note Get gas soon" & set to save to Todoist - super easy way to save quick notes w/o fumbling with your phone.  A little expensive but worth it because it "just works"

This app is great for someone like me who needs separate lists for all parts of my life! It's easy to add items, navigate between lists, and check things off or add them quickly. I also like the fact that on my Android device, I can have widgets with some of my larger/high priority list. The sharing feature is nice too, because you can share specific lists, without sharing them all, and anyone can edit them. This has made grocery shopping and bill paying with my fiance easier with our busy schedules!
I cant live without it. It help me to manage a huge tasks in my work days and make them finished

This app really helps keep me on track throughout the week, and because I put it on all my devices (phone, tablet, laptop) I have it with me wherever I go. The emails are a little unnecessary, but I don't really mind.
Almost perfect. I think it would be better if there was a widget for the todo list. I also think it would look nicer if the colors for the labels were a little larger.
Only to do list app I've ever been able to use for a prolonged period now I don't go without it
Replaced Wunderlist with Todoist, and couldn't be happier. Could only be better if the app actually completed the tasks for me.
So far the app has lived up to most of it's promises. I love the flexibility and features. I wish it was a one time buy instead of a subscription.
No matter the ecosystem, this app provides an excellent solution that helps you get things done.
I love the ability to use location based reminders with my GTD. Also great cross platform application.
Used my google+ account to spam my email with lots reminder and reminders to remind me about reminding myself to add more to do items so I can be reminded. Also would appreciate a location option.
It does what is expected. Works great on my mac and nexus devices. Just add recurring tasks feature, and it will become the perfect task management app.

The app has a glaring bug: the calculation for daily repeating tasks breaks if you mark a daily task as complete after midnight. Instead of calculating one day from when the task is due, it calculates from when the task is marked done making the next due date tomorrow thus skipping today -- even though this is a daily task. This is a bug the developers know about and refuse to fix.  The location feature, like a few other features in this app, is incomplete.  It neither allows for the use of common locations (Home, Work, etc.), it also doesn't use Google's own starred locations. So, every time I want a reminder for when I arrive home, I have to enter the complete address (which autofills incorrectly).  Which renders this high-touted feature completely useless in practice. The app should either allow the selection of oft-used addresses from a list or use Google-starred addresses.

I use this as part of my GTD system and find it world's really well. It's not really a GTD app like nozbe or omnifocus, but I find that actually works in its favour as you have to create your own system within it. A system that does it for you is like having a chauffeur when you really need to learn to drive.  Todoist is a system that finds that sweet spot between functionality,  flexibility and simplicity. great app.

Although the UI does not have the ability to change or tweak to each users preference (I'm thinking different colors), Todoist is great. Clean look, straightforward, and very flexible. Highly recommended for those who are in need of a simple, yet effective way to organize their lives.

This app syncs all over that place, I love it. The app is almost perfect but one thing it doesn't do that Any.DO was good at is generating tasks from missed calls, as follow-ups to completed meetings, etc. And how about email notification on task completion.

Todoist has a great deal of potential as a to do app. Unfortunately, for me it is missing a VERY important piece of functionality. The ability to add reminders to tasks should not be a Premium option and without it, Todoist is not a feasible option for my use. If this could be fixed, I would seriously consider switching back to Todoist.
Im using this for general stuff nothing important, would buy if it was couple a quid but not gonna subcribe... and not too usefull without all the features, other then that, really nice app.

The design is really nice and the functionality is great. The features given for free are very nice but I think that reminders should be included for free as they are one of the most important ways of making sure that you get things done. Other than that the only problem I have is the fact that the extra features are subscription-based. I would happily pay a decent one time payment for the full features and not have to worry about ongoing payments.

Really helps me be organized. I especially like the reporting and views of completed tasks. Some apps assume you won't want that, I get satisfaction looking back at what I've done. Even more reporting and metrics would be cool too
Top marks for being everywhere and being relatively painless to use. But a yearly recurring fee to have tags and notes feels a bit steep.

The app layout is nice enough and it seems well put together, but let's get real, 30 bucks a year?  Not in this lifetime.  Maybe a one-time fee of $10 for the app.  I'm getting really tired of developers constantly trying to bleed consumers for niche software.
Beware of offline mode. When you reconnect, there's a high chance that it will pull the latest from the cloud and overwrite all of your offline changes. I found this out the hard way.

Clean and fast and super easy to organise everything. Kind of annoying how you can't easily view overdue tasks though. It would be nice to have an option to postpone them or  change the date instead of them disappearing.

The app is ok and has interesting features - some may even be outstanding (like the location awareness - if it gets available on Android,  too). It is a pity, that there is no way to try many of these without buying the premium version. The UI is not very intuitive at some places. And why the Windows version has no real alert feature but insteads "alerts" you by sending "emails to self" is beyond me! ||-(  However, the biggest shortcoming which is making the app practically useless to me, is the missing sync with Outlook tasks!  The suggested way to import OL tasks into Todoist via "email-to-self" can only be called unrealistic (to state that very politely)! But also the other direction, forwarding a task's completion entered in Todoist to Outlook (and thereby possibly triggering notifications to other people) would be an absolute requirement for using Todoist in any typical office environment.  Concluding: an interesting app, but waiting for the absolutely required sync-capability with Outlook (at least in the PC version)!
The app itself is good. The date interface  is still awkward. Should focus less on being pretty and more on making repeating tasks something you don't have to learn special syntax for.
I like this app very much. It keeps reminding me of what I must do.
I use this app daily to manage all kinds of lists, and it's not perfect, but it is the most versatile and robust list manager I've found for android, and it keeps getting better. Thanks, guys!
Would like to be able to change font size. Would also be good to add sharable lists (separate from individual tasks).

My first impression was that it would be great for projects in school and at work but for everyday things it just doesn't seem to work for me. I've used several list-type apps, but this is the only one that I can look at and directly correlate to an increase in my personal productivity. ToDoist has become an integral part of my daily routine. I actually paid for the premium version - and I am a notorious cheapskate when it comes to apps. For me, it's worth it to be able to have it on my Android phone, Android tablet, iPad, Chromebook, laptop and desktop (yes, I have way too many pieces of tech gear). Great job!

If you just want to dump some info quickly, this app is propbably fime.  But if the information you store is important, find another app.  This is the second time todoist has silently lost my information.  Often it will work fime for months between these glitches.  This level of quality is totally unacceptable for any serious user.

I cannot recommend this app if you want to sync with Google Calendar. I just upgraded to premium version to find out that sync to Google Calendar works once in 24h, and sometimes even that doesn't work. They should be honest about that and warn people ahead of time.

Todoist is great until you actually really start using it with multiple projects and many tasks.   Wouldn't you expect a way (filter)  to see all your current work-related tasks across projects at a glance,  without being distracted by personal tasks?  Who wouldn't? Just perfect. I used another To-Do app for almost 3 years, but yesterday I stumbled upon Todoist. I never thought anything could rival my beloved todo-app. I was wrong. I use Todoist on a daily basis to manage all my work projects and my home to-dos. I have been a GTD-style app user for five years and I have tried to organize and manage the 8+ projects I get every week at work in all of the apps listed in the title of this review. Todoist works the most intuitively, functions on the most devices and apps, provides the easiest scheduling and presents the simplest yet most informative interface of all of them.

Probably the best productivity app I've ever encountered. I'd upgrade to premium to have the unimportant but extremely useful options but a yearly fee is just too expensive. I wish it was just a one time purchase. Plus there're the bugs, whenever I sync some of the tasks suddenly become redundant.

I was in dire need of some organization and any ol' task manager would have done. Any.Do was great ... at first. But instead of encouraging me to get all my stuff done each day, it pestered me until I felt terrible. Todoist, right from the start, felt more friendly and focused on helping me -- not hounding me -- to get things done. Todoist comes with a clean and simple UI. It's easy to use. And if you use the Web or desktop clients, the Karma feature gives you a small but necessary hint of satisfaction.

The app is highly useful for addressing projects and maintaining my tasks across these projects effectively. However I find the premium feature priced high and hence the 4 stars. Functionality wise there is no other app I need to look at for my needs. I would have loved to have the labels feature as part of the free account but even without that this is perfect for my requirements

I have tried so many to do list and task management apps. This one hits the right spot between functionality and simplicity. It's beautiful and intuitive, a pleasure to use, has the features I need, but keeps the interface clean and uncluttered. I'm a freelance writer, so I'm using it to track and schedule multiple articles, revisions, queries & pitches, follow-up with clients and editors, and progress on larger projects.

If you just want some basic lists, ToDoist will do the job... that's where it ends. As a paid task list or to do manager. It fails on too many levels. Here are a few:  No Sorting: You cannot sort your tasks into due date order. This should be one of the most basic features of any task manager. You are required to use the 7 day view for this functionality, or the web version to order them. But as soon as you add a new task, it goes to the bottom regardless of due date.  Adding Task Dates: Adding due dates to tasks using terminology rather than the date picker is almost impossible. You need to write it in the exact format ToDoist specify, otherwise it won't work. If you want to see this functionality work well, check out Remember The Milk.  Reminders: Sometimes an automatic reminder will be set for a task, sometimes it won't. Even if it is set, it's hit or miss as to whether you will actually get it.  Sub-Tasks: You have to indent tasks to add sub-tasks. This is very unintuitive and means you'll often add sub-tasks in the wrong place.  Summary: Basically it's taken me more time to work around the ToDoist functionality than it's aided me as a task manager.

I was skeptical at first, but after taking the leap, I wouldn't go back to any other planning / task management app. Todoist is stable, fast, easy to use, multi-platform and, in its paid version, loaded with great features not available anywhere else (the way tasks can be quickly organized in projects and sub-projects is especially handy).

It even has simple project management and multi-level task lists, but I have to use them even for simple shopping list. Definition of recursive tasks is not very intuitive on mobile and not very powerful. Widget uses too much space for a single task, so only couple of tasks are visible. Nicely designed, but not very practical.

I was not looking for collaborative Apps, so review is from the perspective of individual use and not for teams. I've tested many todo apps, and they all are OK. But Todoist  just tops them all for me. I love the possibility to capture notes everywhere through the various plugins. Beautiful UI. Labels and filters are perfect for GTD. Great App.

The team is very responsive. I reported a bug & within 2 days a patch was pushed. I love trying new to do app but this one is my favorite. Very clean and intelligent ui. I'm subscribing because the notes, reminder, project is worth it. I'm excited to see some new addition to this app.

Beautiful interface. Collapsible sub-tasks are a life saver. I use this app to log every single thing I have to do, and ToDoist makes it so easy to stay organized. Premium isn't that expensive compared to similar applications. It is well worth the cost.

I run the IT Helpdesk at a local software startup. I am basically the only IT staff there on the day to day. I get at least about a 100 helpdesk requests/projects a week. I could not make it through a work day without this powerful little app at my side. It's like having your own executive assistant in your pocket.

A superb app and simple to use. i would recommend it especially as it synchronizes on a laptop, brilliant. However, on the phone version it sometimes crashes when turning the phone round and you lose your last note which is annoying.

I'm notorious for experimenting with organizational apps. My best friend introduced me to Todoist, and to say the least, it has been the best task management app I've experienced to date. I especially love it for its integration into Google mail and Chrome. Highly recommend it!!!

I paid for premium during the sale and now regret it. The app is quite sexy looking on the surface but has too many ui quirks to continue using it. So you have a list of tasks, some are subtasks, some are not. If you drag a regular task you'd expect it to behave the way a lot of apps do and drop it inside a subtask, but this doesn't work that way. Drag a task up into a subtask and it suddenly becomes the parent of that subtask and all the subtasks beneath it. How does that make any sense? When would I ever want to do that? Not to mention there's a long standing bug that when you go to edit a task and change the list it's in, it may or may not actually move. Right now I have two tasks that just live in the next 7 days view, and don't exsist in a list. These are just a couple of user experience bugs that keep me from being able to rely on it as a solution.
I just can't justify 30 dollars a year for a task app, even as nice as this one. Sure wish there were notifications on the free version or a cheaper way to unlock them.
Wish it had time reminders in free version... Just started using it.. Takes a little bit to get used too... Would love to be able to add sub tasks a little easier
I've tried everything from ever note to wonder list. This app is for people who like to keep things simple and no t get overwhelmed by other complex task management apps.
It looks good and works as intended. They do however show features only to tell you that you have to pay for them when you select them.
Overcomplicated and "clicky" app.  Kitchen sink approach to app development cripples utility. Requires separate account.
Plenty of free features and user friendly. Very pleased using it. Would rank it as excellent if there would be a calendar overview of all coming tasks.
Ive used a couple different todo lists and this is BY FAR the best ive seen. Simple, intuitive, and flexible. I love it
The best to do list app in the market for now. Sometimes there is a problem with synch, but it is easily solvable by restart.

Syncing across all devices, fantastic interface, intuitive and powerful recurring event management, and it's easy to use. Love it. I am a happier person because anything I need to remember to do, I put in the app.
I have tried more than 10 applications to manage my jobs. This application is nearly perfect.   Especially, the sync with desktop version and managing subtasks are those what I was looking for.
Great app for all those tasks that need doing. Syncs across all my devices (android, iOS and windows).
Todoist has everything you need from a to do list and more. It's a clean, simple interface across all platforms. And no ads like some others.
I really like the layout and that it has sub-categories. Also like that you can list projects separately. Also like that it has an undo option if you check off the wrong thing.
The free version is awesome the premium I can only image just adds huge value. Will be upgrading.
No way to see completed tasks unless I buy the premium version, and even with premium it can't show completed tasks by project/date.  Useless for productivity analysis over time.  Uninstalled.
This app keeps me on track with my crazy work schedule. I'd be so lost without it.
Awesome app. My wife and I use it to keep chores, grocery lists, etc in sync. However, I dinged it one star solely for one reason... You cannot view completed tasks on the app (only on the website).
Love the notification drawer quick add option, but hate that the app always opens in the Week view, rather than the list of my choice (Inbox).

I've tried several of the to do apps but like this one the best.  I appreciate your good ideas folks.  Keep up the good work!

I've been looking everywhere for a list like this. All you need is one widget out and you can change the list that displays just by tapping the drop-down list. I adore this app. Love. It. To. Death.

If it was free for the pro version it would get 5 stars,  that being  said even the free version was better than any do.  Any do was great buy I found it to be a little gimmicky.  The pro version is head and shoulders above most other phone to do apps. Plus is integrated into so many different platforms you simply can't go wrong with this app.

Not at all intuitive.  Very difficult to navigate. Got e-mail with free for a month upgrade. All it did was erase the all from my tablet.  Then I find out the license is the most expensive I have ever seen for a personal mobile app - almonds $36.00 a year. I uninstalled it. I hope they don't

Good app, but for its money it has too many bugs and is missing several features. The most important for me and also other users is the reminder features. When pressing the "Clear Button" which erases all the notifications on the panel, but also erases the reminders in the todoist app. They should be erased/ modified only when taken a direct action on them.  It becomes very frustrating, since every time I need to create new reminders, instead of keeping the old ones until I take a direct action on them.

It's more of a collaborative app than a mere task list. Yearly subscription charges makes it very costly application. Further there is no facility to share task list third party apps like emails and WhatsApp etc. I think we can't print the task list also.

Hundreds of paying members on the online forums have been requesting for over a year; numerous people in their Google play store reviews: Yet updates come and go without any acknowledgment regarding the ability to change to a dark themed widget and interface. The all-white is blinding to many of us checking tomorrow's tasks before bed or those of us who prefer to keep it dark to preserve battery life from a blaring bright screen.
Multi platform and all. However, reminders are premium features at $35.99 per year. Too expensive. Astrid was way better, too bad it died.
Best todo list app in the store so far!
Performance: precisely as claimed; Usefulness: substantially exceeding expectation.
Best task app I have used, almost perfect.

Awesome app!
Great!

Almost perfect. Biggest two complaints are that when you change a shared project's title after other users have accepted am invitation, it doesn't get updated for the other users. AND if you create a hierarchy of tasks and projects, the other, users don't see it. Otherwise, I've been quite happy with Todoist. Switched from wunderlist and way happier.
Needs more widget customisation options. Otherwise a great to do system.

At this point, the only reason I didn't give it all 5 stars, is because I want to color-code the tasks under each project, and have some indication of them visible from the project listing... and easily editable tasks from the app. But those are just icing on a ln already great cake.  Excellent app!

I have been using OmniFocus on Mac for years & have been looking for a cross-platform replacement for about as long. I use a modified Getting Things Done (GTD) strategy, and Todoist was able to accommodate my GTD framework (w subtasks) without any challenges. It syncs quickly, looks great, and with pro you can get context labels and email-to-project support. There are a few changes I would make if I were king of the world, but for my money Todoist is far and away the best cross-platform GTD app out there.

Easy to use to do list app.  Syncs beautifully across my platforms. I have two things I'd like it to do: it won't do is self promote the next item after I've done a task and the app lacks a clear "next action" designation.  I've been using the priorty flags fire this.

A good mix of features and easy of use. Plus there is an app for it for just about every platform, even a Chrome plug-in. That being said my Android app tends to fall out of sync and calling the refresh function does little. While I'd love this issue resolved I mainly use it on the Web and pc for work and in that setup it has yet to disappoint.

I appreciate the cross platform syncing and also the full Web page access.  I like clean, practical functionality and this app delivers. Now that it's beaten the competition I shall upgrade to the next level. Get organized - get this app.
I'm now using a combination of this and Evernote. This one, however, really helps me to get things done and track it solidly. Data tracking, emailing daily progress... I upgraded to premium. Love it.

Great flow, fast and powerful. I haven't been able add emails as tasks since my bb days...more persistent reminders would be nice. Adding any file to a task is amazing. Selecting multiple files at a time would be a bonus.
This is one of the best thing about this app. I can share projects with my team and can track their work flow.  Very user friendly and easy to use.
No other tools to match this in terms of platforms that it supports.  Cons: paid features are pretty expensive!
Fast, easy to use, light. I would have liked to customize the theme and colors, but that is not really important. :)
So far this is the best todo app I've found. It does the basics well and adds advanced features without over complicating the interface.
I have been looking for something like this for ages. The latest update offically makes this the best app ever
Need to add more customization for widget but. No transparent background or color themes to choose from.   Also no proper alarm for time based events.
Just wow! Never expected that you can write such a "simple" thing as to do list that way, so it helps me. My respect to the developers.
The fact that if you don't pay you get seriously little out of this app is depressing. Especially since it's not THAT amazing.
Easy to capture everything that matters to me and even easier to make things happen.
Works seamlessly with its cloud backend storage. Never complains about being offline, just syncs when it can and uses screen space well. Brilliant!
Such a great app abd concept. From huge projects, to simple tasks, to daily goals, todoist helps you juggle everything you have going on.
Best to do app in a while with amazing features even in the free version, thank you for this !  Gonna have the primuim version just to support,  greetings from Saudi Arabia
This app is good. Suggest the event feature to set up a meeting. And a lower annually fee.

This is the best app and cloud based task management system that I have tried. I like being able to keep a heirarchy of tasks and projects. I also like how easy it is to move tasks to a different date within the mobile app.

After searching any other to-do apps, this is one of the best of to-do apps! Simply Interface, Reminders and Supported in All Platform just perfect, and The Karma feature it makes me challenged to making many/do the to-dos that I'd made. KUDOS for the Creators!
Great user interface: very easy to add, edit, check as completed, etc. I also like the option of Today or 7-Day views. The effortless sync across multiple platforms is a huge bonus.

I have been using ToDoIst for a couple of months now. It is flexible, easy to use, works across all devices and really helps in managing my tasks. Do use the tutorials to get the most out of it. Very highly recommended.
Great features to help me keep organized remind me of the vents in emails I need to attend to.

Can't say much so far because I've only just started using it. But it really seems to be really thorough & well thought out, plus fairly easy to use & intuitive to set up. I've tried others before, but they never seemed to 'stick', so I'm hoping this app will be a lot better! }^}fingers crossed{^{  ;-) (Samsung Galaxy S4 w/Kit Kat)

I've used too many task apps to count. ToDoist is easy to use, powerful, flexible, on all my devices and beautiful. It meets my business and personal needs while keeping me very productive. Excellent product!
Great app with a sexy interface.  Easy to navigate, simple to use, but yet sophisticated enough to use for business and personal
The author is very responsive. Nicely complemented by desktop plugins for Chrome, Firefox, etc.
Syncs seemlesly with all devices, easy to use and understand. Used daily for work and personal life.

Love it! Keeps me on track and work efficient!
Awesome,  I love it! Works great,  helps me remember everything!

Já experimentei vários programas do género e este é o melhor. Em particular gostei muito da integração com o Outlook.

Fantastic, clean app for organizing my work flow as a busy grad student. My only gripe is the subscription required to unlock the full version. I'd happily pay a flat fee, but I can't bring myself to subscribe when the basic functions work well enough.

Please don't complicate it. Do not over engineer. Keep it lighting fast, ubiquitous and clean. Don't break it - you're by far the best GTD solution out there. # update to new version: problemas syncing with server. Most items do not get synced and have to keep uninstalling and installing the app in order to correct them.

I like it, but it's frustrating that you can't appear to look back at your completed tasks.   When I'm done with a bunch of stuff I'd like to see that stuff crossed out, not just disappear forever.  A "Remove completed tasks" option should be available for permanent removal.  I apologize in advance if these features exist and I just can't find them.

I used Astrid religiously until Yahoo! decided to discontinue the service, I spent about three months trying out other GTD apps and this is by far the best one out there. All its missing is the ability to time tasks and log how long a certain task or project took. Other than that, this app is dank.

I really appreciate the todoist whole of services (not only the app, it would be too limited to consider only the app though it's kinda perfect). I used then free period then I purchased the premium without hesitation,  it's very cheap if you consider the perfection and the clever details. We need more services like that, congratulations to the team

I use Todoist on all my PC, tablet and phone.   The Android app is excellent, easy to use and just about the right amount of alerts to make the app useful rather than annoying.  It's a lot more than a To Do list.  I fully recommend you trying this system.

I'd like to try the Premium features but to upgrade you have to pay for a full year. Unfortunately I'm unwilling to take that much of a hit. Let me know when you offer a monthly Premium upgrade option and we'll go from there. For now, thanks but no thanks. App deleted.

Todoist has been an integral part of my life for the past year. It helps me keep things straight between work and personal tasks. The app is an essential piece of the pie. It's had some growing pains, but has evolved into an elegant, thoughtful tool. Keep it up!

A really useful tool for keeping life under control!  I would really like the ability when you view a project to view all the tasks in all the sub projects too, like the web app.  Also more ability to use colour i.e. highlighting whole tasks/projects in colours rather than the little bars of colour at the moment would be great!  But otherwise, awesome app!

I love Todoist very much and use this service every day. The app is great - nice looking and convenient. Synchronization also works fluently. The only thing that I miss is reminders. I would like to have possibility to snooze reminders for a chosen time, to be reminded about the task later.

As soon as I saw that reminders are a premium feature I gave up on this app. I don't mind paying for an app that's truly useful, but if very basic functionality is locked away then it's not even with my time to try it out.

On the web page interface, completed items in a Project can be left visible, but on the Mobile app they are invisible.  Is there a way to keep them visible but marked completed, like on the Web version? Would be nice to have them there for reference or in case they are accidentally marked completed (no way to undo with going back to a desktop computer).  If so, would warrant a higher rating and pro membership.

After Astrid dropped support I picked up Wunderlist for it's cross platform availability. Somehow I came across Todoist and I can confidently say it beats any to do list I've used thus far. Clean, simple, and helps me get things down and ultimately done! Download this app right now!

I bought the premium subscription before I realized that completed tasks could not be viewed or undone (on Android).  People have been pleading for this essential feature for 18 months; the response was to provide a window to tap "undo".  In addition, checkboxes do not appear on task lists to tick off completed tasks.  They are present on the web version, not Android.  I'm disappointed - - but I've been using the app for a few weeks, and it hasn't killed me.  Still better than most.

I've tried multiple GTD type apps over the past 3 years. Todoist is among the easiest to use and I love the multiplatform support - - Nobody works in a simple homogeneous environment anymore.   What does it need? 1. the ability to have todoist-gmail-plugin like functionality while using my mobile phone client (I use Gmail client on Android) - - thus allowing the creation of tasks linked to emails,  directly from my smartphone. 2. A simple feature on the phone app to conduct guided daily reviews.

The user interface is nice and clean, but the usability is not there. I have been using Check It Off Pro for a while and despite its shortcomings is more usable. For example, adding sub-tasks is just weird in Todoist. The check mark icon is used for both saving and completing tasks, depending on which screen. Notes and labels are paid for features? That takes away from the appeal to stick with the free app. The usability takes away from the appeal to buy the app. I think I'll switch to Evernote instead.

My main complaint is with the reminder and notification system on the Android app. First, the default reminder setting should be at the deadline. Then, the reminders should be persistent. Any.Do has a first class notification system that todoist would do well to look at.   If todoist can make links to gmail emails on the Android app I would be ecstatic.

Cannot state how much I love this. App is easy to use and I LOVE the seamless integration into gmail/chrome. That alone has made this my new favorite organizational tool. And believe me, that's saying something.

This is clearly an excellent app. Chalked full of features that actually increase your productivity and makes your taks and completed items highly visible.  I also use the outlook extension for Microsoft office. TREMENDOUS! you can seamlessly add an email as a task. I will likely upgrade to premium for that very reason.   The free version still can't be beat either. Everything is so easy, no need to enter additional menus to assign dates priorities, all nicely ajex quick items with default times. Excellent!

The free version is easy to use and helpful.  Since my memory isn't worth the paper it's printed on, I like being able to note things down as they occur to me.  I don't know what the pay version is like.

I've played about with several Android task managers: Wunderlist, Any.Do, Astrid, Doit.im, IQtell and many more. Each of them does a different particular thing very well, even better than Todoist.  Where these systems each have a feature that is exceptional, they fall short in other areas. Having now paid for the Pro version of Todoist, I now have a tool that does EVERYTHING well and reliably, even if it doesn't 'wow' me all the time.

Nice interface, appropriately uncluttered, supports 5 levels of sub-tasks, collapsible when viewed, plus 1 more level if you use Projects as parent items. Longer text notes are only available in the paid version, but I might pay for that if I don't find any other free app that offers them on top of the same simplicity and usability. One thing I'd like to have that's clearly missing is a way to keep some private notes hidden and password-protected somewhere (e.g. in a hidden Project that doesn't show unless you enable it from Settings and that can't be opened unless you enter your Todoist account password again).

Once task are marked, they disappear into oblivion.  No option to retrieve them,  unless you log on web.   Would need an option to see them, even done, to keep a record,  even on app,  for a meeting as an example.   Marking tasks as wip would be great!   1-3 states of task completion, as :    1) Waiting for internal review 2) Waiting for client approval 3) Final delivery  Some glicht in synchronisation between web and app.   Web app is better than android app. Evernote makes a better job integrating accross

This app is useful easy and does what it promises, worthwhile to try and benefit from.  Only the upgrade seems to be a bottleneck. It come at an annual price and not a one time license cost and that too is expensive.   The basic features are good and fairly sufficient.

Pretty good app, but missing some little things:  - I want to see always my tasks sorted by due date, and manually I can do it, but no way to set default sorting and every time I reopen the app, its sorted by other way (I guess order of entry). Its super-annoying as I need to reorder manually in each task group separately!
It syncs with my laptop and phone and never lets me forget pending things.. Karma thing is really nice to get you going

Good tool. Web & android  simple yet powerful. Subtasks makes it good for detail task list next action list. Lack of labels for free versions is a big drawback as there are other free tools available.

Mobile and desktop and mail clients  and browsers. You can vote on site for what will be developed next. Clean and smooth. Simple fortunately. Doesn't try to manage your whole life, karma for completed achievements. Fun to use.

Features available in free version are quite solid; I most especially like being able to have sub-tasks and sub-projects. Being able to access my lists from mobile devices and the web is crucial for me, and the fact that they stay synchronized without a fee is a huge help.  It isn't without its flaws: creating sub-tasks can sometimes take some work, and making a standalone task a sub-task isn't exactly intuitive. But all in all, it's a stable app that works rather w well.  I will more than likely be purchasing premium subscription to service, based on my experience.

I have been struggling to keep up with my tasks and always missed the deadlines. This tool is really helping me out to stay focused, organized and be productive. A must have to for anyone who has to be pro active and perform above expectations.
I could not imagine tracking my projects or general life to do's without Todoist anymore. It works so well across my devices, including the chrome plugin. A must have app.
A great app for staying organized.  Simple to add tasks and prioritize.  Love ability to add subtasks which is missing in other apps.
Very useful. Reminds you every day. Bugs me at times  like a wife but well worth it
This app really help me to focus on my tasks and help manage projects too. With its collaborative function, I can get feedback from team members. It's really practical and rewarding.
Still working out the best way to GTD this, but so far itcsuits me far better than anything else.
I am really enjoying this app. It has helped me focus and become better at prioritizing my day. I am getting so much more done.

$30 and not even full version forever? This app could be excellent if it cost $1.50 with notes and reminder. Online backup can be extra feature for those who care... To pay $30 every year for todo app is bad business model. Uninstalling becouse this stripped bersion is not usable.
Free version doesn't allow you to set reminders for specific times or do recurring tasks.
Great free app, looks good and easy to use. The premium version has some useful features and I'd buy it if it wasnt ridiculously expensive

I want something digital that is as easy to use as pen and paper. I like the idea of digital to do lists, but I don't want to spend half an hour a day organizing them. Maybe I should buy a Samsung Note.

This app helped me finally get organised! It has just about every feature you need (other than file attachments for my phone...) plus many you didn't know you did need!  Don't worry about trying anything else, you've found it!
Beautifully organised task list, excellent sync features. My to do list at all places. Never forget something important
Missing recurrent task, need to import tasks  from other sw like gantt, or similar for instance with xml format
Simple across all my devices/machines. Works perfectly, although I can live without the karma piece but you can turn that off. I know how OCD I am!
I'll update for 5 stars once that's implemented. This app is really helpful, but sorting is necessary.
Haven't gone Premium yet but this is an excellent tool that syncs between all my devices. Truly top notch.

I'm on the go between 2 offices and out in the field.  I need a system which I can refer to at any location that contains the same up - to - the - minute information.  Sometimes I access or update on one of my 2 office Macs, my Android Tablet or my Samsung Note.  The features are what I need with multi platform access can't be beat
Has everything I need: reminders, labels,  tasks and subtasks. The design is pretty clean and has apps for every device.

totally recommended to organize ur task. liked the cozy friendly interface and that's it's linked and can be integrated with ur desktop, ur phone and ur messy outlook. the only issue is that i had to pay to get the full package of features but really it's worth the price

I've tried many others and since Astrid, this is the best I've found so far.
Went premium as its the best way to get the most out of this product. Super GTD friendly and easy to use.
I not only use this app for to do lists, but also for grocery lists and any other kind of list I need to keep track of. It is awesome.

I'm using Todoist along with Any.do and Wunderlist. They all seem comparable. It's really your preference in choosing your favorite.

I use this app to organize my entire life from remembering movies I want to see, to blog post ideas, to what I need to get done in a day. The Premium service is totally worth the money. Plus it's great to support companies that are making awesome products!
The smooth interface, clean design, and accessibility through multiple devices makes Todoist one of the few tools that hold up to their promise of simplifying my life.

This app is amazing. First of all, it is on every platform imagined. I have it on my android, iPad and Windows7 workstation. Everything syncs perfectly. I highly recommend it if you need a organized to do app.

A great app in some ways but I find the entry of dates and times too complicated. It's a great idea but I often spend longer reading how to set something like a repeat up than actually doing it.  Allow the free text entry by all means but give us some proper controls too. Update: having just spent 5 minutes trying to get a repeat to work every 28 days at 11am, but getting one for 23:59, I give up. I've cancelled my subscription and uninstalled the app. I have more productive ways of wasting time.

I had tried several To Do apps and was using Astrid for over a year until it was discontinued. Then I discovered Todoist and I love it! It meets all my needs and I'd super easy to use. I like the option of adding to do items by email. I also like it's reminder feature.

I've been using this app for about 6 months, and have come to depend on it daily.  There are some occasional bugs and quirks, like new tasks that show up as due two days ago, but the developers usually have them fixed quickly.  I especially like the availability on any platform, either through the app, chrome extension, or web page.

This is the to do app I went with, after searching the play store thin for just the right app.  I have ADHD, and this app helped me a lot with getting simple and demanding tasks done, mostly due to the highly customizable recurring tasks. Sadly I have to uninstall the app when my premium trial expires, because $30 for a year use, is a bit too steep for me, and the notification reminder is crucial for me to get things done.  So I'll get another to do app, while I wait for for a discount in the $15-20 area.

This is simply the best to do app out all the ones I have tried. It syncs across multiple devices (desktops included), has a beautiful design, is feature packed and works great.    I wasn't sure about premium at first, but I received one month free premium and I can say it's definitely worth it. Projects and labels have come in real handy already. Highly recommended.

I've tried all of the better task apps. This is best for my needs. Free version should include notes. Paid version is too expensive and should offer Goals to be added for each project. I would have purchased it if it were $4.99 or maybe even $9.99, but not at the yearly price of 30 bucks. A lot of potential in this product. I look forward to seeing how it matures.

At first I was going to entitle my review "amazing" or "life-changing" or something of the like, but I'm just not one for cliche titles like that (though it's true).  I'm a long-time practicer of the GTD methodology and lifestyle, and I have a myriad  devices with just as many operating systems. Todoist covers them all, simply and with good taste and great workflow.

I am not a big to do list person, but I do like to be able to make a list here and there. I also like to be able to make shopping list. This app has been great for both uses, looks great and is very intuitive.  The best part of the app is the ability to share. Allowing people to add to list and see list easily, make this the best app I have used to date to track To Dos.

if the widget on my acer s300 wouldn't look that awful - it would be 5 stars. And no one did anything all this time with the widget. It is no add,but i retrurned to any..do. cause its widget works pretty good. I would love to use your app as it has more features i like if u'd change your bad widget some day (hopefully). I really do like this app since it is so much more than just a to do list. It is a planner. Be it a work project or gardening, this app makes planning, goal setting and doing easy. And it looks nice. Though the full version is expensive, which is why I will keep on looking for an equally nice app for planning.

There is a group of people who want to be organised but due to being super???lazy? ok lazy, something very rude should constantly bug them, and bug them like check your to-do and tell me what to do. Review all tasks in the morning or evening something like "any moment" from "I don't name". I like to use Todoist specially due to its desktop app on Mac but unfortunately that feature I explained has been the only thing that during the last 15 years made me write, review and organize my to-dos. Max snooze for that feature is 1 hour and you don't dare to dismiss it cause of that conscience .....so it just comes back for all tasks since morning till you do it once for that day! I know a lot of people who this has been the only thing working on them!

It would take a severe amount of indiscretion to drop nearly 30 dollars on an upgrade per year. I do not use an app if there is no potential to upgrade to the full suite of features. There are many similar appealing options.

For small screen estate, the widget can only display few task resulting vast unused space underside. Font needed to be reduced, scrolling need to be allowed; isn't widget means to provide quick glance and quick add? For the main application itself, the design is superb, the usability is awesome. I like it.
I've tried other apps, but they all either don't have the features I'm looking for or are clunky and difficult to use. Todoist is extremely intuitive and can accomplish everything I need it to.

This app is clearly made to make money off of. Even the most basic features of a to do list app require you to purchase a subscription for $30 a year. Even a one time charge of $30 is outrageously expensive. Without premium, this app is about as useful as a basic free notepad app. Even reminders and notifications are premium only. And I'd honestly give this app 0 stars if I could. The developer needs to change the $30 per year charge to something way more reasonable, like $5 one time purchase.

Excellent project based task management app... Unfortunately, the tasks disappear immediately after completion, so there's no option for the task owner to see the updates on the completed ones. Will consider changing the rating and purchasing the app if this is looked into.
Now I hardly even use calendar.  I especially like that I can use natural language to enter reminders and label tasks.
Todoist is simple. It helps you when you need it, then it gets out of your way so you can get things done. Fast entries. Free features.

No way to easily see tasks past 7 days. Other than that, one of the most useful apps I've used so far, enough that I'd forgive the omission. Well designed, well planned, and well executed.

I especially like the feature to share projects with other people.   I don't like that some useful features, like reminders, are only available in the premium version. But all in all the most important features are contained in the free version.
Its not worth paying $30 a year for a premium version. There's a lot of other cheaper or even free apps that would have the same features or even better.

I am loving this app. I sprang for the full version and I haven't looked back since. I have tried dozens of todo applications and this is one of the best. Others are crowded and complicated. This is smooth to use, isn't too crowded and syncs to all my devices. It looks great on both tablets and phones and has all the support I need to get my lists down and on to the next task. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a productivity boost.

I've used various task management software. They range in size from able to handle large 20 person teams, to just small, personal projects. My previous favorite was Workflowy for it's simple, tree structure. ToDoist takes that simple design and adds so much functionality without cluttering the interface. I purchased the premium a year ago and couldn't be happier.

I've used so many different to-do apps. Each had strengths and weaknesses, but Todoist combines all the features I want in an app and then some. Asana dogs hotkeys and speed right, but their Android app and collaboration sucked. Wunderlist got simplicity down but was so slow and unreliable.

Things I really like: drag and drop tasks into a natural order; subtasks; priorities; natural language dates. Also like project view. And the support videos eg David Allen. I do like the product's name too - quirky!  I'd like it not to show unnecessary info on task eg Inbox, Date. Or maybe a Setting to have the option. I get lots of tasks and when using it on my mobile, there seems to be a lot of wasted space. It would make evaluating and moving tasks around easier. Maybe also could reduce the font size.

I started using tablets with the original Ipad and as a result got really spoilt when it comes to some of the more niche or business related apps.  I am in the market for a tasks related app which has the same functionality as Awesome Note.  categories, Calender, Reminders and most importantly Gtasks Sync (this is a dealbreaker for me).  Finally it should have a beautiful interface  and be available for a reasonable 1 time only fee.  I installed this on my nexus 7 and it looks OK.... however at the moment it does not sync with gtasks.  Looking at the forums and support this is a feature that has been requested over and over again and the developers appear to be ignoring it.  If you do not have a task list currently running anywhere else and are starting from scratch then this is fine.  if you already have a Gtasks list then you will need to consider whether you want to spend your time reentering your task list from scratch.

Please add support for:  Time based reminders (2pm on date x)  Reminder recurrence  Ability to add new label from the assign label drop down. It's there when there are no labels, but after first label you have to go to main screen

Its like sending you a reminder of what list of task you have inputed. But once it is accomplished, your list will be erased (of course). it will be more appreciative if you are able to repeat a certain list of job on a different date. Like for example monthly bill payments every 25th of the month.

Great if you just wanted a text list Syncer, Anything else and you have to shell out upto 30 $ a year or whatever it is for the Pro account,  Pretty useless.  imho Not recommended for free users.  RTM provides much better functionality and it's completely free.  You cannot do GTD @ Contexts without a paid account Cannot even add labels.  Sorry, gave it a try.. but Uninstalling.

Edit: Please add support to export list to Pebble okthxbye!  After using it for a day, I prefer this over Wunderlist, now that we can have collaboration with others. Also the comment feature is extremely nice. I like it a lot!   I just wish the price is a bit cheaper, might be OK for the Americans but for other countries, it's a bit pricey especially after conversion 😢
I found Todoist totally by accident. So far it has worked a bit like MS Project and I love you can dissect tasks up to 3 levels. It also syncs across every single device I have, which is awesome.

I like the apps design. Very disappointed to find out after paying for premium to add additional functionality most of it is not available from the app despite it saying usable across all platforms. Developer was willing to refund me but since I can't find receipt from Google play I'm stuck with it. Rather hefty price tag considering (unless I'm missing something) all it added was ability to add tags, receive reminders, and allow creation of projects. Can't even access completed items from app.

Used to be right into GTD but always had trouble making it seamless between pc and mobile. This isn't quite as powerful as some of the programs I've used in the past but it's UI is much more pleasant and the user friendly and obviously it has an android app that works perfectly; which is usually the weakest link of web-based solutions. The premium licence is quite expensive but still considering it just to get the most out of an already very usable app.

User interface is simple and useful. For me it is the  best Android option, beating out Wunderlist and Zendone based on overall ease of use and feature set. I hope it continues to grow in functionality to come closer to some features of Omnifocus, such as specific "snooze"   times and location-based notifications.

Only thing keeping me from giving it the fifth star is that i can't view my completed tasks in the app. I can go to the web site to see them, but I really need to be able to see them in the app.  Otherwise it's been fantastic using this app/service. Highly recommended.

I'm a GTD nerd who recently gave up the Mac-only Things app, which I loved. l had to tweak a few things, but am pretty happy with the switch. Todoist helps me stay on top of my projects & tasks, which is exactly what I need it to do.

I just started a new job and have 10-15 priorities related to on-going projects and a few tasks that are one-and-done. Because the app is on my phone and in my gmail, I am able to purge my mind of all "oh I should get to that soon" tasks that constantly distract me and cut my productivity. Todoist has been awesome for helping me keep organized - everywhere and all the time! I would love to upgrade but my job is with Americorps so a one time $10 cost is about all my budget can handle. Thank you everyone at Todoist!

Okay, I have tried, bought & upgraded 30 to do list managers. Up to now I had always found the managers either too complicated or too simple.   These developers are geniuses! Simple design and lots of thought  have created a beautiful interface, that is simple to pick up, and learn.  But the true genius is how flexible the app is, allowing me to create task lists for my most complex project.  Integration with Gmail is AWESOME! One click and my task is created and linked back to the email message.  Best ever

I've been using Todoist on and off for almost 10 years online. I switched to Todoodle for awhile, but the efficient simplicity of Todoist brought me back a few years ago and I love it. The Android app amplifies that. With hashtag capabilities and the folder structure, I'm able to divide my work load according to clients, location and type. The new version allows you to quickly prioritize according to date and postpone a task to tomorrow or even next week with one button.  One of the best!

The good: Clean user interface.  Intuitive. Integrates with a Google account.  The bad: No support for recurring tasks (Remind me to change my furnace filter every 3 months, and set the next due date 3 months after I've actually done the task) $29/year to "upgrade"?   It's not even a one-time fee.  It's recurring.  Put more effort on recurring tasks and less effort on recurring bills.
Best simple time manager I have used. Currently on my Android phone, iPhone, iPad and desktop. Sync seems to work very well. Haven't tried the collaboration yet. If that works well I will subscribe.
I have been looking for such a perfect tasking application for a long time, I tried many before, but now I can say I found it. Thank you todoist.
In my humble opinion even more functional than rtm or any do. Love the new planning feature. Needs a "no date option too"
Convinced my non-technical wife to use it to organize our tasks. Works great and going premium very soon.

I posted last night about a serious issue I had with the app even after redownloading it yesterday. By this morning the developers had replied and an update was released which fixed my issue. That's responsive customer service.

Excellent app. The widget is very convenient for quick task lookup. Adding new tasks and projects is a breeze and cross platform support is great. All in all, one of the best task management apps out there.
Adding a to-do the app creates a replica so it looks like you have two of the same. Not great really.
Good functions but not all the required features work unless one become a paid member.
Can't say enough. I use this across all my devices to manage my day and jobs.
Shifted from wunderlist. so far so good
Better than a great many apps/solutions focused on a similar market space.
Enjoy using on a day to day basis.
Great app!
Website + app combo makes it extremely accessible and easy to use.
Excellent way to keep focused. Works across all platforms.
I still miss Astrid but this is the best replacement I have come across
Use it every day works great
Fantastic tool for getting things done and feeling great about it!
Great app, keeps me on top of things
