I've used just about every To-do app available for Android and Todoist is by far the best and most feature complete.
*Update. Thanks for the info! Todoist Rocks!

The interface is very simple which is the best thing for a to-do task list app. What I like about it is its sync ability. My Chrome, my laptop, my tablet, my phone have the list anywhere I go. This is what tasklist app I have been searching for especially for a person like me who always forget things. Its sync app helped me to have my tasklist anywhere I go even if I didnt bring my tablet.

I really love todist. However, it is too much when basic features  like reminder costs 29usd per year.   Top to-do apps such as Any.do and Wunderlist include features such as note and reminder for free.   Some suggests I hope todoist can adopt are making the premium cheaper or making reminders free.

It's helped me slowly add different reminders and get more organized.  Stuff that I need to do a month or year from now I can add and it won't clutter my list and overwhelm me with irrelevant tasks. Organization by project and then by tag has also been a lifesaver.

I had a long review written about how annoying it is that it costs $29 to get the feature of adding notes to tasks, but I now realize that the app doesn't even work. I edit a task to change it's priority or due date, and my changes are undone right before my eyes. Very frustrating!!

You have to upgrade to the paid/premium version in order to use even the most simple/common features - such as labels and reminders..  really?  ToDoist has a nice GUI, but it lacks basic/essential functionality.  There are far more capable task/to-do list apps available on the Play Store, for free.  So unless you want to pay to get access to features that the competition offers for free, I suggest you look elsewhere.

I've been using it for a week now. I love the integration with Outlook. It does wonders for me keeping tabs on important emails through the night. Like that it both syncs with my phone app and outlook. The ease of use is great and it has all the features I need for both personal and work. Thank you for an amazing app!

I have to be able to set tasks to recur at sometimes odd intervals. Very few apps allow this. Todoist not only has recurring tasks, but allows sharing and categorizing. The comments feature is great as well. My family's new go to todo app.

I downloaded this app because it looked like it would be a great way for me to set myself some daily tasks to complete. But when I entered a task, it automatically listed it twice. If I tried deleting one of the doubles, they both disappeared. At first I thought it might be a glitch from adding it from the widget, so I opened the app and tried from there ... same problem. This is useless to me, I don't want a to-do list that's bogged down with doubles of everything. Uninstalling.
This is speedy on my phone. Really helps me focus on getting things done at the right time. Also love the statistics.
I do most of my work with the main website.  This app is perfect for quickly writing things down as they pop in my head throughout the day.

Kept leaving to try other productivity apps but always come back to Todoist	I've been back and forth to all the other major players like toodledo and nirvanahq but I always feel good when I am using todoist. The updates I see are fantastic.
Even I have money still 22 Euros per Year is not justified. Uninstall because of this Trash policy to gather money once
My productivity has shot through the roof,in part, because of this app. The premium version is worth the money for the integration options.
Don't understand why my tasks appear twice. When I try to delete on, both of the get deleted.

It did work fine until the last update.  You can no longer drag and drop the order of items.  Uninstalled and reinstalled and it still would not work.  Going to uninstall and find something that actually works.
I've synced my phone and computer and I can add tasks from anywhere. The interface is clean and easy to use and had great features.
For the way I think, the best way to organise my chores.  Projects,  subprojects,  tasks,  and Subtasks cutting the todos into manageable portions.
I would like to request for reminders on the web page. That's all.  Support is very responsive and helps to solve issues rather fast.
Not working offline on Windows, uninstalling. The guys are obviously stuck with their beloved HTML5 and too lazy to write a fast, native Windows client.
The best to do list out there. Would be nice to have an easier interface for putting time specifics though. Perhaps slightly too expensive for premium but very good otherwise
Flexible, does what you want  and need it to do. Sync with all your devices.  Needs to add windows phone app as I am switching to a windows phone.  I'll be waiting.
Beautifully designed, this task manager is powerful enough to manage task lists for multiple projects across teams and simple enough for your shopping list.
Most helpful is Todoist's cloud integration. I can manage appointments and attach related files and in an instant, have them on my Android, Mac and iPad.

*Update*: Sharing is now implemented, along with a few subtle improvements to task entry. The best Todo list manager, just got better.  Flexibility and power where needed, simplicity every where else.  Manages tasks, and does it well.  All features intuitively implemented, including powerful repeat rules and filtering. The latest versions continue to improve on the already strong foundation.
My only complaint is I wish you could go back and see completed tasks.
Love this app. Keeps all my trades and deficiency lists organized.
It's an app, it has a nice ui and great features, but I don't see why it has an expensive price premium. "any.Do" app can do the same thing and more.
Of all the to do softwares I have used this is the best next to Omnifocus for implementing GTD,
A very flexible and well thought out app and I tried them all. The only one which is always there when I need it. Browser, Phone, Computer. Well thought out feature list, simple fast task entry.
A few features I would like - ability to set start dates as well as due dates for example. However, the app is easy to use and words great across devices. Best I've tried.

This app will not even remind you to complete tasks unless you pay $29/yr. I'm not against paying for apps, but that's ridiculous. There are so many alternatives that will send you notifications for free.
to pity that so many options are locked for premium. main feature is note that locked but useful
Switched from any.do. present in more platforms, interface makes more sense, I can do by project, even in the free version. Works for me.
One of few products that is better in its mobile experience than the native desktop one!
I use it on a daily basis and I haven't gotten any problems with the app

when adding a subtask it is always being added to the same task... no possibility to choose the task to which you want to add it... nor  is there a way to move a subtask from one task to another.  inbox? what is it doing? why is there a drop down menu if there is only one choice and no way to create a new one?   and of course no tutorial...
It wouldn't bother that much with premium subscription. But it's the best I tried anyways

I've tried numerous task applications in my hunt for just the right system.  I'm certain I've found it.  ToDoist is simple enough for me to get in and get out of quickly, while being complex enough for me to organize my tasks and info as needed.  This is the FREE version mind you.  I am GLADLY going to pay the premium price (less than $2.50/mo) for the added features.  I love that they didn't cripple the FREE version to encourage subscribers like RTM does.  Great application + great ethics = win!!!
It's a great device to cut through distraction.
Syncs to a Web app and has a hierarchy structure. Suits my needs.
More than the app itself, having the web interface is great!

I've been using Todoist since the beginning and its really become a fantastic tool for managing my life. Also,  the support is extremely helpful and personal; after I accidentally overloaded my account they helped me restore everything.

I've tried various to-do systems on paper and online and this one is the best after only a few days of use. Clean and simple UI to focus on the tasks at hand and amazing availability across platforms. Just what I needed to start the new year right.
Great app! Must download if you are managing a team. Useful for personal time management as well
Switched on first try to pro account, love the minimalistic look and the super fast android tablet app that I use on kindle.
Does well for me. 4 star only because the design could look better and subtasks should be able to be minimized.  Edit-design updated and it's fantastic now!
Just starting to use it and so far I really like it allot. User interface is gorgeous. Follows Android's app guidelines and Dev seems to enjoy helping others. Highly recommended
If you think about it, you're actually getting apps for mobile, web and desktop, and full synchronisation across all platforms for less than a decent coffee every month.  Works for me!
I really like this app and have been using it awhile after trying out heaps of different To do apps. The new update seems more useful but, I can't figure out how to share a task.
It can not edit comments or notes. Why you enable the share function for four collaborators? The one star I gave because I have to wrote this rate.
This app looks simple and friendly. IMO, it needs to get a better priority intervals.

Now fixed. Support was excellent!   The last major 3.x version (todoist next) completely broke the project feature. I can't edit any of my existing tasks, nor can I create new ones... I love this app and I will be waiting for a fix to upgrade my review to a five stars!... Now fixed
I run my entire life with ToDoist. It's fantastic--tidy, intuitive, just what I want in a task management tool.
Great interface, easy to use, karma is a wonderful motivator
Great app, it's simple to use, and has great integration with your browser and Gmail! It's worth paying for the subscription!

I got this app because it looked promising from reading the reviews. However, I have never given any app request permission and password into my Google account, and surprised to see no one else having that concern. For that reason, I've not installed the app.

Todoist helps me manage multiple projects and tasks in a simple format that I can get at from all my devices. I thought I'd really want the integration w gmail and Google calendar, since those are my primary applications, but I found it so useful that I'm keeping it open on its own tab and have removed the extension from Gmail. And I love the invitation to take the afternoon off once I've finished all my tasks for the day!

I have been trying for 2 days to use this app. 1st it won't let me log in using a Google Account, now it won't add a task. Very disappointed. There is no way I could consider spending nearly $30 / year for this if the potential for these kinds of problems exist.  Support requests have been answered but nothing seems to have been resolved.  I'm sticking with Business Tasks for now.
I'm using galaxy s4 and haven't received 3.0.4 update so I can't add anything since it just gets stuck on projects
This is literally the greatest to do app. Obviously you need to pay for the full version but it keeps me on track with all my projects for work school and home.
Even manages to make me feel bad about not meeting deadlines.  I needed that!
Great app but any do works great!

Very short learning curve for me, as well as people I sent tasks too. I am hopeful the sync features will work well with my outlook tasks.  I like the date feature "every xx days" that makes the task reoccur x days from when you last did it, so if you get behind repeating tasks don't get stacked up / appear multiple times.

Tried many apps, ToDoist is great. Would give 5 stars IF ONLY there's a direct integration with Google Tasks rather than adding the ToDoist calendar's link within Google's Calendar. After subscribing to paid plan I found out that there's no direct integration like Any.Do. Hopefully this integration will arrive in future updates.

I installed this app on my phone and in my Gmail.   I even tried Firefox.   I then added tasks in each application.  Even though all apps are signed up under one Gmail account, they did not share info.   If I have to mess with it constantly to make it work. ... it's not worth having.

I would love a chance to really get into this app and evaluate it, but I'm sorry... notifications are not a premium feature. That is a real shame, as I am looking for my ultimate productivity app and I am more than willing to pay for one that actually works for me, but I'm not willing to pay 30 dollars to SEE if it works for me.   A suggestion, if you insist on keeping notifications as a premium feature. Offer a 1 month trial of the premium service, either free or at a lower cost, like 2-3 dollars.

UI is cleaner, and scheduling changes are good.   Collaboration tools are excellent, though would like them extended to tags or even individual tasks as well as projects. (Could only figure out how to invite people to projects. Am I missing something?) Since I delegate to folks in my office using tags for each person across many projects, it'd be excellent to invite each person as a collaborator on his/her own tag.

When accepting project invites through email: "invalid secret code"  When trying to share using People app on HTC One: "couldn't read your contact"  Duplicate tasks and duplicate names under collaborators.  Also, a subscription for premium is a big turn off.

I am in love with Todoist, and the organization behind it is slowly getting better. Their faults: releasing updates without telling you what the updates are (*EDIT: thanks for adding this in!), and "visual scheduling" was over-hyped.
Tried many to-do apps, but todoist is the most I liked for the useful interface.
Please learn and feature a function from Google Tasks, which allows us to sort projects (and maybe tasks) alphabetically for easy search ing.
Todoist got it right!  Love this app and love their product.
A useful little app, but which loses points for pestering its users to rate it

However, a premium "subscription" costs $30 a year. It's definitely not worth 10x more than the next paid to-do app. Uninstalled.

You can set it up to email you a to do list daily or not. Check off what you get done and the rest rolls over to the next day...keeping the due date so you know how late you are. Excellent. Now it sorts by priority, too! They listen to suggestions and requests!
I use todoist to remember everything from shopping lists to daily chores.  The cross platform support is awesome; I use the chrome plugin all the time.
The truly ultimate todo app. Too bad I lack the discipline to use it regularly.
Does everything the website does, quick offline availability and it looks good too. If you pay for Todoist you'd be crazy not to use this. Crazy, do you hear? Crazy!

Todoist has been a great and handy app. With the one month premium trial, I was able to see all the app had to offer and I must say it is better than any other app I have for this task. However, mobile push notifications seem to have stopped working these past couple of days and I don't know how to fix it. I hope this issue can be resolved. Thanks

I've been using Todoist (Premium) for a couple of years, and so I was very happy when they finally came out with an Android app. The app really cleared up a lot of problems that the mobile website had (like not displaying sub-tasks properly). Since then, the app just keeps better. A definite recommendation, especially if you have the Premium version of Todoist.

I only give a three star rating as I am not able to compare with other similar utilities. This was the first to do app I d loaded and have been more than satisfied with the features on the free version.  I can manage without the premium features so unfortunately the developers are missing out on my dollar.

Like many users, I have tried various apps in this category. Some have been a waste of time others very good. This one however is by far the best I have found. It is reliable, and so simple to use. I have a laptop, tablet and smartphone and the syncing between them is super fast always accurate and flawless. Well done to those who created it!

This app is great to manage our grocery, hardware store,  spouse-to do lists, etc. We can use the online access for fast entry of lots of items. It updates to our phones. It allows us to add to each other's list so we don't have to "remind each other" What to get at the store.

I really appreciate all the functions even in the free mode. It has helped me alot developing my business. Totally recommended. My first review since the beginning of using android. It is just too good not to give a co mment on.

I was an avid Franklin Planner user.  It was my goal to go completely paperless.  I tried a couple other to do list tools, but nothing worked as seamlessly as Todoist.  I have integrated with Chrome, my Android phone, my Nexus 7, and Outlook, allowing me to link all of my tasks and access them pretty much anywhere.  I love the color coding, which allows me to determine what project each task relates to visually.  I also like the Karma feature that rates my planning performance.  Great App!!
I have tried them all and I always end up back here. Nothing else seems to compare with Todoist 's ability to hit all the right requirements (attractive, intuitive, solid multi platform syncing).

There is more place for improvement ,ex. If isetsome task i would like to have rule that every n days create this task automaticaly. There is also huge number of win.phone users so app for this devices is more than recomended if TD aiming tobe one of the best product on market. Overall impression verry good product,i'm happy that i found it after more than 4 moths of searching and testing.
I migrated to Todoist after 5+ years on RTM. Love the mobile integration, powerful API and pace if innovation. Right now the best TODO app in the okay store.... And trust me, I reviewed the all.

Todoist is definitely one of the best to-do systems available right now. I've tried a variety of apps for task management, but most have unnecessary features, poor UX, or technical errors. I used Wunderlist before, but I had consistent problems with the web app not syncing properly.  I haven't had any such complaints yet with Todoist. I use every feature in it--aside from tags, I haven't found a use for them that other features don't cover--and I haven't found any bugs that aren't solved quickly.

Supports everything needed for GTD, including "recur after last completed" repeating events ( perfect for chores) and subtasks. Todoist is probably the best option for a todo list out there, and in my opinion it is way better than Wunderlist.

I am so glad to finally find a task management system that works!   I've tried so many of them, only to run into a fatal flaw that ultimately rendered them unused.  This is a system that works for me.   Here's what I like: 1. It can integrate with Outlook, so my list is right there all the time. 2. I can automatically sort by date & priority, then I can quickly drag and drop to arrange tasks in a sequence that works for me. 3.  When I think of new tasks while driving, I can voice dictate new tasks using the Todoist Add Task Widget.  When I get to the office the new tasks are there written up in my task inbox. (voice dictation is dependent on other software.).  I'm a a child of the Franklin Planner in the 90's, but like element of the GTD system.  ToDoist is a perfect balance, allowing me to adapt it to my different context.  It is simple enough that it actually gets used.  It is adaptable enough that I want to use it.  It is powerful enough to turn mountains of work into real productivity.  I am captivated by this product.
This app really helped to keep me on track this Christmas with tasks I had to do with family coming to celebrate.  Great to have reminders of what I had to do or what I missed.

I've been hunting for a good todo list app for a while that would sync well between my phone, tablet, and PCs. I was using Wunderlist for the last 8 months and shifted to Todoist after trying it for a week. Better and faster syncing plus I find the UI easier to use.

I just want a list. I don't need due dates, priorities,  colors and categories. I can do all the organizing on the fly when reviewing the list. Todoist let's me get away with that; it handles the remembering and I manage the rest. Lovely. Synchronizing against all my screens moves it to firmly into the "perfect" category. - By the way, the app DOES support all those other features for those who want 'em, but it supports my zippety-task model well without putting the other stuff in my way. The pull-down "task anywhere" feature is pure gold.

So far I am loving it! Something I do like however is the privileged of trying pro versions of any app before I buy it. I have learned a hard lesson on buying and not trying an application. That last  remark not related in any way with this particular app.  Thank you for a great free app!
Really like this app. Works great across platforms. Simple and awesome UI.  Only reason why this is not getting 5 stars is because the annual fee is quite high.
Excellent app if used in conjunction with the website. Easy and appealing way to keep track of all the things you need to get done.

The free version is great and easy to use. The Android app version is good, but could be improved by some slight tweaks. It would be nice to have some drag and drop functionality as well as a more intuitive interface.

Helps me remember all the things I have to do now, someday and later. Can organize them many different ways and has a clean simple and intuitive UI. would definitely recommend, can't live with out it!
It does exactly what i need it to, organizing tasks is a super simple and efficient manner. No hazzle with anything, creating and viewing the tasks is only one click away.
Have worked with many products. Very keen on Evernote but in fast pace work environment it takes too long.  Todoist is a great tool under these conditions and recomend it highly.
Todoist is a clean, simple to do and project management app that gets the job done without clutter and excess. It has just enough features to track day-to-day tasks and multiple task projects.

Needs getting to know and  really needs the full Pro version to get maximum benefit but it is realy useful and is worth it in the time saved once you get organised. Needs personal discipline though otherwise you can spend a lot of time organising and not doing!

Wasn't sure if it would be worth the subscription price for full features but I couldn't be happier. Have it on all my devices, computers and email. Love the connectivity, features and design of this.
Though a lot of features are only after you pay. Will use some more n perhaps part with some $ later
Only thing is - if you want the premium version you have to pay £19 per year which is a complete joke
I can't figure out how to get the reminders to work, but it looks like I have to pay 28.99. Not going to happen.
Very good, easy to use. Would be nice to have some color coding or small icons to differentiate between different projects
This app has really helped me in my productivity. Todoist karma helps me to been on track and earn more points, which some how pushes me to accomplish more.
App is wht I needed the most, removes unnecessary tension of missing something..thank u for the help
I have been looking for the app with everything for a couple years now. I love the project lists, the notes, and the tie ins with chrome and gmail.
Basically it's useless unless you pay for it, and all features you get from paying are available on other free apps. I don't mind paying for quality apps, but this is ridiculous.
I like how even though I didn't complete the task today, it still shows up in the list the next day.
Very good for every day use. Not been using it long but not come across any glitches. Keeps me organised and able to use it on my mobile which is handy. "Happy"
Todoist is everywhere, in outlook and Gmail on my tablet and web. It's functionality is also great with priorities, colors, categories, tags, and alarms. It even texts me the alarm. Great program!

The description for this app is extremely misleading; you will have to pay and "go Premium" in order to do any of the basis features that a slew of other to-do list apps offer for free. Yes, you can sign up for a free trial month, but when you inevitably forget to cancel, you will be charged $29 for a year (or $4 per month) , which is way too much for a service like this. Bad business practices and a very average app, in my opinion. Uninstalled.

This app is great. It has all features you need in a todo app and the sync function is very reliable. I bought a premium account to support you guys, keep on the great work (one little thing I'd like to mention: please add a dashclock extension ;) )

Love that this app is functional across several platforms: android, Web, desktop, Outlook, Gmail, etc. Best I've found so far since Astrid went defunct. Wish it was a little more compact visually, but overall love the functionality - tagging, projects, priorities, color-coding, ability to set several reminders and notifications, create subtasks, and more. I like it so much, I paid for premium membership to get the extra perks. Give it a shot if you're looking for optimum functionality and customization.

I would have stayed with google tasks if the would have a decent offline option. The offline computer app of todoist is quite great. But this mobile app has for me two issues: I really don't need so many folders. I want to be able to customize it. The other thing is the interface for entering new tasks has a rally small screen. It's a pain.

I've tried a few organizers.  This one works because it's simple.  A basic checklist lets you see up to 7 days out.  You can define projects, create custom task labels,  prioritze, and get reminders. I prefer this to others because it's quick and easy. .. making it more likely to be used

You want a great todo app with lots of promise? Wunderlist! The good features of this app is in premium, if not for those features then it's just like any old todo app with a slightly prettier widget.  (if you're wondering why only one star, it's because of a past bad experience I had with them which cannot be detailed here)

Has some really nice features. Simple yet powerful. However, in today's saturated Android task list manager market, there's no excuse whatsoever for not having alarms (ie notifications) on tasks free! That's pretty much STANDARD... I shouldn't have to pay just to be notified that I have a task set for a certain time! And I don't need to be reminded by email, just a notification... It's on my phone! Skip all the productivity tracking and all that stuff and give me free notifications and auto sync!

So I've been using any.do for a few months and decided to give this a try,  the interface is clean and I tried it to see if it was any better. These guys seriously want me to pay a monthly fee for the same thing that any.do does. Sorry, it's nice but other apps do it for free,  moving back after 1 day of use.  The developer states that they can't maintain cross platform for free, so how do other apps do it? Wizardry?

As an organizational tool this app is awesome. I especially like that I can break a big task down into smaller tasks that I don't have to "see". This really helps me as I'm very visual and too many tasks tend to overload.
Is all i get when i sign in.frustration.I'll give u until i get up in the morning,then if its not working, i will uninstall. APPS HAVE TO WORK ALL THE TIME

Needs an undo option for accidental completions so I don't have to go an add the whole thing again. Also, if I complete a task late or simply forget to mark it done the day it's due, I don't mean that it's done for that day, just for the previous. Maybe add a do it today option on mobile app? Also, on repeated tasks for example I water my plants every Fri. If I mark it off Saturday & still plan on doing it Fri, it automatically moves it Saturday. If you could fix these things it would be great.

What's the point of a task management app if I can't set reminders? The free app is supposed to give a notification reminder 30 minutes before a task is due. Need it 10 minutes before? Forget it. You have to get a *paid* subscription to be able to set reminders in a flexible manner.  "But you can try the paid version for 30 days. Don't like it? Just cancel. No harm no foul, right?" Nope. It took me more than 30 days to find that Astrid randomly lost my tasks, and more than 30 days to find bugs in Wunderlist. Moreover, I wrote "supposed" above because when I twice tried to trigger a notification in the free app neither times did a notification show up. That sure inspires confidence in the paid service.

I upgraded to Android about a year ago and have been missing Omnifocus for mobile. I'm happy to see how this ubiquitous service is always in front of me regardless of computer or device. Also, being able to add contexts is huge for me, and this service integrates that.

After using Astrid, Wunderlist and Due Today for quite a length of time each, I've finally settled on Todist and subscribed too. Each of these apps has a shortcoming and none are perfect, but this one works best for me. It syncs well across each of my devices, including the web, has contexts for GTD, is simple and fun to use, supports projects and indented or nested sub-tasks. Fantastic. The latest version has amazing functionality that is merely on the wish list of other to-do apps.

I am excited to stumble upon todoist for it looks very promising. I thought it will be better than Any.do or Wunderlist. I love the labels options. Everything was fine except for the reminders which was really a HUGE let down. I have tried setting up reminders but none of them is showing up. It will be better if the reminders options are in the same page just like in Any.do. I am sorry that I had to give it 1-star (for now) due to its serious glitch in the reminder section.

The UI and daily reminder are great. Still waiting for customisation of the default notification time. Also the default notification should appear during the creation of the task rather than requiring the task to be saved first before it appears and can then be edited. Also the snooze time should be selectable when the notification appears.

really nice app to manage your schedule. better than most out there if not the best. what is missing is the ability to get reminders at chosen time of the day . n also some functionality shud be added to projects as well rest awesome

I love the android app, the minimalistic design and all its features. I even got the Chrome app extension since I go between my tablet and laptop a lot. It wasn't long until I came across the first bugs, involving the calendar. When I create a task on my laptop for Oct 31st, on my tablet it synchs as Nov 1st. When I go to change the date on my tablet, it doesn't work. When it does, the same task on my laptop doesn't reflect the change once synchronized. It gets really frustrating really quick. Why do all tasks I create on the website get bumped a day ahead on the android app? The timezones are the same on all platforms. Also, the sorting the tasks by date seems to work whenever it wants. I would really want to use ToDoist for both the personal and professional spectrums, I even wanted to go Premium, however its reliability right now worries me into avoiding it.

I've looked high and low for to do list apps, from Don't forget the Milk to Buy me a Pie, but this one takes the cake. Ingeniously intuitive design with a wonderful widget, nothing can compare. Keep it up guys.

Since the developers fixed the syncing problems I have upgraded my rating and gone back to using this app because no other to do app that I have found is as good. This app is extraordinarily useful for helping me keep up with a very busy work and personal life.  It is an essential tool that I use every day. I love the clean, simple interface and I especially love the Chrome extension that helps me easily keep up with my to do lists right from my browser.

It is a simple and suprisingly effective assistant for getting things done. You can organize your tasks into projects, and break anything down into smaller, indented, sub-tasks complete with priority levels. The free version is sometimes a bit TOO restrictive and the app sometimes "proactively slams those restrictions in your face" too much for comfort. That said, being able to access this to-do list from any of my devices more than offsets this. I would consider a purchase if I were in task management.

The simple interface is almost misleading as to how powerful the search and overall usefulness of this app really is but this combination makes this my favorite to do app. Definitely recommend to anyone. My one and only problem is not it's fault at all but I can't access the website from behind the firewall at my work computer. Ugh, this makes it more difficult for me personally. :-\

A great way to keep track of your tasks across all your devices. The app isn't perfect but it's pretty darned good. Would be good if it didn't need to reload tasks every time it's run, and if the '7 days' view included overdue tasks like the web view does. But overall, it's really good, especially in view of the fact that it's free!

Quite simply the best out there; quick and easy to use yet powerful and feature rich. If only every app were like this...  Really don't understand the whining, freeloading cry baby reviews for this. It's well worth the money. Review it low if you don't like the app but don't put others off because you are too tight to pay a small fee to stay organised

The only feature I'm not fully satisfied with is a UX for hierarchical task structures. List view doesn't clearly shows level of hierarchy and task interdependencies, especially if subtasks are planned for several days.

I've tried almost every task app available over the past 4-5 years but never, until now, found one I really *wanted* to use. As someone who is highly disorganized and has procrastinated since childhood, it's been hard finding an app that I wanted to open. Todoist has an interface that I like, that I want to play with, and that is simple to use. It's not cluttered, and it makes finding, viewing, and editing my tasks easy. Being able to view tasks on the Android, iOS (haven't tried that yet), AND the web is a nice feature. I did upgrade to the premium feature after playing with the app for a while, mainly for the reminders, the notes, and the productivity graph. I expect this is going to be *the* to-do app I actually use on a daily basis. At some point in the future I'd like to see weekly exports of tasks sent via email, but I still love the app just as it is.
I used several to do list apps and I think it is the best. It seems like I am going to upgrade my account.
The app is simple so there's virtually no learning curve. It's also quite flexible to adapt to different workflows. Overall great user experience.

This app does everything I want a to-do list to do, easily sort things into days without wanting to know when in the day I'm supposed to do it. The whole program is intuitive and the tutorial is not obnoxious.

This is a neat application but I am running into some roadblocks, partly because of how I am trying to use it as a broad brush Project Task tool. There's a lot of good things to say about it, but in the interest of brevity I will list the things I wish were different:  1. Management of projects and sub-projects is a bit ham fisted and two many clicks are required to make basic structural changes  2. Sharing is not well supported and I ended up just using a separate user id for work and sharing it and it's password with my colleagues. No integration with Wedoist.  3. Exporting data, for example for import into a project plan structure or a word document, is not at all supported in the free version and it's not clear if it's supported in the paid version by somehow Jerry rigging it off backups  4. The website is not very clear on what Premium actually offers; so I have not bought it even though I would if I actually KNEW it was really going to meet my needs

Between the Web app and android app,  todoist is an excellent service that doesn't get mentioned alongside Astrid,  rtm, or trello like it should .  I pay for the premium service even though the free one is almost fully functional.  Nested items,  projects,  @ tags,  and priority labels are great features
By far the sleekest looking tool I've ever seen which has a great deal of functionality as well. Simply the best option available on market IMHO.

Functional and readable, ToDoist is just the latest goal setting and project management app I've tried. It's not as intuitive as it could be, but the develop seems bright and responsive to this product's demographic.
Todoist has really put serious thought into what you need to keep track of the things you need to do. So far I haven't found anything that I would change.
Perfect cut down and easy to use simple todo list generator... you always have acess with the app or the website
As a former Astrid user this is a good substitute but not as full -featured or user friendly. I'm sure the paid version would better suit my needs but don't like it enough to pay.
Genius - strikes the right balance between features and usability. Clever enough, but also accessible.

Todoist is now in my top 10 favorite apps. One of the best features is that my lists and projects sync between my laptop, phone and tablet, plus there is a really amazing chrome extension.   Love it. Frees up my mind, cause I just add a task and add it to a project and chose a due date and voila.

After a long search for To Do app that really helps I discovered Todoist. I've been using it for almost a year and just keeps getting better. I have it as Google Chrome extention as well as on my phone and tablet. Keeps me focused and up to date with the many tasks of running my business. Highly recommended.
Update: sync issues are fixed. starting to like it despite the occasional bugs on some platforms.
Good app with nice design. Just need to iron out a few bugs.
I would rate this as a decent app which does almost everything in free version . I would like to have a feature where I can add tasks to todoist directly from gmail or outlook.
Everything about this app is great, the only thing I don't like is the subscription business model.
Im on my phone more than my computer so it is great to be able to do everything on here. Cant live without push notifications
only one thing i would love to recommend is if we can adjust the event time which is at default 1hour it will be awesome.

Excellent task manager/scheduler! I switched from another software and I love this one! Only downside is not being able to have an option to switch to a calendar view format when I need to see my busy month at a glance.

This is a simple, clean, user friendly interface that works on Desktop and Androis with no complications.  I love this.  Exactly exactly what I wanted.  Deleting other complicated project program with no desktop application right now.  Thank you!!!!!
Best app to maintain to do list. Even free version offers a lot. Great tool to get organised.  Keep it up.

I've used a lot of GTD-influenced task managers, this one is pretty awesome.	Syncing works flawlessly and the "quick add from anywhere" feature makes the activation energy associated with adding a task as low as it should be.
Simple to use and embedded where I need it on my devices. Ideal for collecting my tasks and providing prompts as required.
Easy to use and well designed. Happy to have found this and recommend it to anyone that want's to get things done!
Functionally good App, however their non-stop emails has been a pain, they will just flood your inbox.
The best! Drag sorting on mobile just like web , Project folders, API... you can work how YOU want; not by someone elses workflow.
Lots of features and works great.
Complicated recurrence entry, no assigning of task
Clean, nested projects and tasks. The Chrome extension is a killer feature.
Very helpful, helps me organize and keep track of tasks, even bills
Very nice and neat! Would be better if project view is sortable by due date as well

Would love it even more if it was integrated with Evernote.
Able to see current progress on tasks with just a few taps.
A very well thought out app / system. Cross platform goodness ;)
I love it
good tool. i got the premium version.

great to use...

I have a lot of different things that I'm juggling at the same time - two side businesses, a management position, and a leader of a non profit. So getting things done is a must. That's when I bought into this awesome program! The cross platform is perfect for all of my devises. The labels, projects and notes make this app far superior than anything else out there on the market. It's a must have for anyone who wants to see their productivity go up,
Updated review: I love Todoist and use it across several platforms, but now what impresses me is their customer service.  My widget was crashing and they were prompt and thorough in helping fix it.
Really useful,  keeps me organized. I wish there was a way to share my task list with my spouse though, without using Wedoist, which isn't really what I want.
Simple to do list app with tons of options if you want to set priorities or categories. I wish Google would buy this company so this could be integrated into Gmail. Nice work
Great usability, pity the free version doesn't offer sharing an google calendar syncing...
Amazing user interface. Smooth as butter! Really my new favorite even over any do.
So easy to use and it can be added to outlook!  Love it, love it, love it!

A to do app, with upgrade prompts all over, but no working sync despite 4 updates in 5 days.   Best bit: after I updated to v 1.2.6 on both tablet and phone, and was frustrated to see it still not syncing, the app showed me a prompt to give feedback! LoL! Here you have.
I wish the free version had more of the premium features. The subscription fee seems high.
Works well for me
Great
The app is simple but have all the features I need !
Most android faithful interface I have found in a to do app.
Everything I want in a to-do list, syncs across devices, template tasks, nested tasks and projects, notes with links, perfect
Great app.  Works across multiple platforms, and has reminders
A great app for keeping track of multiple projects and tasks. Neat and efficient. Even helps inspire you to complete tasks with features to track your progress.

Basic features such as reminders are not free. Looks clean but too expensive. I'm not using 9 platforms to manage a simple to do list; therefore, your justification for a $4 monthly fee is invalid. Maybe a non-crippled trial version would be a better approach.

All you whiners complaining about the fees go find another app. I have tried a dozen and none can touch this one except Astrid and now Yahoo is going to shut them down. You get what you pay for and this is a well thought out, well crafted app with the best support of any app I've seen. This app crushes Any.Do on android. I don't mind paying for quality. The crying over fees on here is pathetic. I find it refreshing to see people making a living by producing something worth using.

This service has gotten me through college. Simple, yet flexible. My only request would be a prettier Web and app gui as well as an easier system for managing @labels. Other than that everything couldn't be better in my opinion

This is one of the better apps for syncing across devices. However, if you buy it be prepared to spend lots of time figuring out how to use it. It is not intuitive and there are many annoying issues...Way to many to go into here.. The web site has help videos but the content is superficial...i.e. stuff you can figure out for yourself. For the nitty gritty you're on your own. Also, in order to take advantage of all the features you have to fork over an additional $29.00 per year. Yikes.

The one killer feature for me is the Outlook plugin. This makes the app. Combine that with excellent syncing and a "Karma" system to keep you checking off the boxes, in my opinion this is the best to do app out there today.  Loses one star because it is hard to find information about security of the information stored in the Amazon cloud.
One of a number of list apps that I've tried-quite good. 1 issue: "quick add" does nothing in notifications. Gonna disable it.
Charging for push notifications on a to do list app is ridiculous

Easiest to use and natural flow todo app. Just needs function to collaborately work on tasks and you will get a 6 star from me. I am probably switching to astrid todo app because it offers collaboration and willing to sacrifice the ease of use on todoist :-( let me know when you add it and ill be back!!!
It would be helpful if the program could distinguish between items that have been deleted and items completed.
Using it for a week, very nice tool. Probably this week I will migrate to premium. The project hierarchy is great.
Great App and great product, keeps me nice and organised!

Great app, the one I'll stick with after the Astrid/Yahoo fiasco. In my view though it loses a star for not offering reminders in the free version as Astrid did/does and another star for being way too expensive were I to choose to upgrade to premium. The only extra I need is reminders and I'm not paying through the nose for that while I can find a way around it.

It's a pretty solid and good looking app. Support is quick at supplying at least an answer. Still waiting for collapsible subtasks and subprojects. Would really love sequential tasks though.  Edit: uprated to 5 stars since collapsible tasks and projects were implemented. Sequential tasks would be awesome, but seeing how they don't implement next actions, I didn't rate the app on it

If you do a search on Google play for (Todo list, ToDo's, Task, Task List, Etc.) all applications that are returned I have tried and most I have purchased. I am a Todo / Task freak and at the end of the day after trying all on the market I kept coming back to only 2 (Todoist and Any.Do) In the last week or so I was committed to choosing only one to stick with  and I just deleted Any.Do (GREAT app but someone has to come in second). I could go on and on about what makes Todoist better than all the rest but my suggestion is to do what I did, download it a see for yourself. Now comes the only negative part I can come up with, I am very aware and in most cases agree on developers compensation for their time and talents, however having said that, the "premium" version at $29.00/yr. is steep in today’s age of dirt cheap hosting / and all the technology that goes along with what is offered in the premium it should be MUCH less or free, but I am overjoyed with the way Todoist is right now and hope it only gets better. Many thanks to the developers for the great app and hope no offense was taken on the ONLY thing I could say about it.

I thought I'd try this out, but BASIC features like having a note against a task are only available to "premium" users. I can understand limiting some of the more unique features, but at this point it is so badly hobbled I can't even give it a trial run to decide if I want to give them money at all, so onto the uninstalled pile it goes, and back to Any.DO I go! -------------- More notes to the devs: (1) I will not pay monthly for this, or any app. Make a one-time-fee version that doesn't have cloud storage, which I don't even need, since you keep quoting that as the reason for the need for an ongoing charge (2) Those who might actually be willing to pay will be turned off by not having access to a proper trial run. Other apps have won me over by allowing a week or so of usage as if I had paid, so that I actually know what I'm going to get. This might be a good model to try out after glancing at the other low reviews.
This is the only task app that I have kept using.  The integration with outlook, chrome, and android makes it so useful.
Pulled the trigger and it was worth it.
Best to do tasking app for me since transferring from Astrid.
I rarely get a notification around the time a task is due. I do get the summation notification though.

The strongest feature of Todoist is the apps reoccurring task feature. The ability to set a repeating task with different days of the week and times of the year is unparalleled. (However, I would like to see the addition of quarterly date ranges and the ability to set a tasks final deadline and a reoccurring one for constant reminding, among other options.)  The quality of the apps experience makes me a convert to the subscription-based payment model. Now they need to make a calendar app.

I think you've done an incredible job at this task management solution.  I would only suggest that for the due-date section on mobile devices be a full calendar pop-up rather than the M/D/Y scroll wheels.  Aside from that, I would gladly pay for the premium version but I simply can't justify a recurring charge for it.  I believe in supporting excellent developers, but the recurring charge in my mind is a little too much.    This app was suggested to me by a friend who, I quote:  "I wonder how the devs would feel if they knew I put a 'todoist' task that said 'Find Toidist premium .apk'. Recurring charges for apps is a little too much"

With the vast selection of calendars available and other free apps like Taskos who update frequently as well.   I can't justify paying for this especially not as a reoccuring payment deal. Ads could support the functionally of the "free" version.  To be honest with almost no functional services like push notifications in the free version I can't justify wasting my time to even test it thoroughly.

The Android app has finally reached the same high standard as the web version.  The only nuisance is the Google calendar sync delay of up to 24h - a limitation in the way Todoist implements sync, which some apps (Springpad, GQueues, for example) manage to avoid.

Two main things. Support is totally outstanding. Quick response to questions. Second, I have tried so many apps to manage m projects and this is the only one that covered all my need and then some.  Well worth the money.  Recommend to anyone who manages multiple projects.

I love the app - in fact this is the second time I've subscribed. I came back to this app after trying all the other ones, and loved this one too much. Here's what its missing though: recurring tasks, a "quick-add" feature like rtm's that parses plain English and allows #tagging. Also, the notes function could be improved- if I don't have any notes yet, I should have to press the plus button, I should be able to start typing. Also, the notes box should be multi line. Maybe with markdown styling/ WYSIWYG
The TD app does everything I need it to do, without a lot of excess nonsense. Highly recommended.
Has helped with productivity tremendously.  Haven't taken the plunge on the pay version, but will likely be necessary.  Cross-platform utility is wonderful.

Really useful. I like how you can prioritize and the different ways you can display and sort lists.	I wish I could figure out how to get the things I've checked off to disappear from my phone. They don't show up on my computer.

Although I don't use the app much, it's great. Useful to be able to sync my phone and laptop, and that I don't need internet to use the app. Useful if I have a to-do list when I'm on the go, or as a shopping list :)
When I'm busy, tasks fall out of my brain and todoist is there to catch them
I love the cross-compatibility with just about everything. It's convenient and it does everything I need it to. The latest updates and fixes have nullified my issues. Thanks guys!
I've tried many to do apps and have been looking for an app that makes it fun and pretty to key in tasks. Todoist fits the criteria.
App sucks. Tried logging in using google account and it just brings me back to the choose which account to use. Back button doesn't even work to get out of that screen. Please fix this.

Finally a task management solution that does all I need it to do. Online management portal, and simple yet powerful interface. It does what technology should do! Simplify. I use this to manage my personal and office related tasks. Also WeDoist has been very helpful at the office. This development team knows its stuff.
I've tried several, lots that I like about this...almost ready to pull the trigger on buying the full version!
No matter if you use it on the web, on a phone or tablet it works. Some of the features are not the most intuitive but if you spend a little time learning the conventions then it will fly.

You can easily share your projects and tasks between your laptop phone and desktop. For me the projects and tasks are displayed the way I think.  Free for now. When they start charging I will gladly pay a reasonable once-a-year fee.
I love this todo app list. Definitely wanna Pay for this if There's additional plan with lower yearly payment option including basic feature like auto syncing and gtask integration.

I really get a lot more done. I love that I can sync with crome, my phone, and outlook.
Great project for easily managing and organizing tasks. Cross platform support is seamless. I use daily (hourly) on my MacBook, Windows desktop, and via the Android app on my Samsung G 3.

This is all from the FREEE version, I expect the pro version is 5*

Paid for premium...not clear  how to sync with Outlook.  I can't easily sync to google either. Other apps do this better.  Notes are limited with no options.  Is this a work in progress? You can get one month from me but that would be it. Maybe it is better to get things working before charging.  Update....I can sync with google now but it puts my tasks in the calendar. This app is just too much of a pain compared to the others. I can't see posting $4 a month so it is time to move on. Thanks for responding.
Great application, i use it to track my shopping list among other lists. I especially like the lock screen access.

Can't give 5 stars bcz most of features are for premium users.  There seems a bug. I've emailed it with screenshots. On scheduling a task on 15/April i.e. Monday, it shows 15/April as Sunday. Plz fix it then will give one more star.

With the recently added widgets, been fantastic. Probably one of the best if not the best to do managers available. I have been keeping much better track of my task and the new karma feature is novel.

Good but lacking the "next 7 days AND OVERDUE"  vue,  it would be useful to be able to drag an overdue task on a day of my choosing. and the "all project" like the outlook plug in and the Web app.  If fixed 5star

Really slick app, but to really get the most from it I need the use of the home screen widget to constantly remind myself of my outstanding tasks. Best thing it feels very simple but it's surprisingly flexible, for example you can create as many hierarchical levels as you want which actually is not that common...
I love todoist. It's quick, easy, and simple but still offers plenty of features. I love organizing in outline/hierarchy.

I think this app does a great job of organisation of tasks, reporting efficiency. I think a glaring flaw is I can't give task alerts, put a time deadline. That is what I need, I need to be reminded. Good otherwise.
Really helps me to organise things. Synced it with the one in computer and it is real comfortable.

They concept isn't great; execution could be better. Interface and convenience are the two areas that I would like to see improvement in.  However still useful at the moment :)
I really like the UI - clean, easy. That said, Postpone seems a bit flaky, I'd really like to be able to edit reminders like setting due date and I'd LOVE a quick add widget.

I have a gazillion things to do at work, home, and PTA & a to list is essential! I have a windows computer @ home, a mac @ work, & an android phone. I was using remember the milk which was good, but I was constantly searching for a mac desktop app. Todoist has everything and I'm ecstatic! The mac desktop app & android widget is sleek, scrollable, the widget is resizable, & entering new things to do is a breeze. I gladly paid for the premium!
I love the app. It's functional and well-integrated into Android. My only annoyance is that the widget is massive and unresizable. It'd be awesome to have that fixed.

I have used the Todoist web site for five years, but it was the release of the apps for the iPhone and Android that made my actually subscribe to the service. The apps work a dream. I love writing up my shopping list on my desktop PC and then getting my phone out in the supermarket to pick up all my groceries.

I've used every todo product that I've been able to get my hands on. Some were too basic, some too complex. Some had too much "feature bloat", some hardly had any features at all. Todoist has found the perfect balance between function and form and that makes it a winner in my opinion. 5 stars!
I'm really impressed with how far this app has come. It's incredibly sleek and polished, with tons of features. Highly recommend.
Favourite task list app! Use it all the time...Wedoist is rocking too! PS Synchronicity between the two would be great! ;)
Looking forward to more functionality.

I've used a lot (and I mean a lot) of task apps. This is one of the very very few that I really like and the first one I've paid for since RTM. The syncing between platforms is huge. Labels, sub tasks, and ease of use is all there. I love it.
Awesome app! Helps me keep track of my daily activities. If you have trouble remembering everything you have to do, this is the right app for you!

Overall a great app. My main request is for a widget to go with it, similar to gtasks widget. It should list a project, label or a predefined query.   EDIT: Thanks for adding widgets!  5 stars! Absolutely perfect!  Had posted a 4 Star review asking for a widget -- now there are two great widgets!  My productivity and notetaking abilities on my phone have skyrocketed!  Synced with Todoist on my PC and Mac -- astouding!  So simple and easy to use.  It blows away anything else!

I needed something that plays nice with PC and allows sub tasks and projects.   Astrid does the former but not the latter. And since Due Today's Windows version became entirely unreliable to me, it only does the latter.   Todoist is perfect. It's also beautiful and way easy to use. Well worth the modest price for a premium account.

I have multiple projects on the go all the time. I can give them separate to do lists, prioritise jobs and easily send reminders to my Android phone without emailing. I can have a sidebar on Thunderbird and Firefox open when I want to keep myself remonded. Only problem is I've no excuse for forgetting things! Great app.

For 'premium' features which are free in most other Task List apps you're stung for $4 a month! Even as a basic user you don't get a reminder function for your tasks. Shame as the UI looks pretty slick.

It's ok, the app works, but what you want from the todo app is to be intuitive and quick to use. There are still some things that makes me swear while wrestling with the interface. For example, why it's difficult to find the way to delete a project, or why the device back button closes the app instead of bringing me back where I've been within the app? I think there's lot of space to improve the overall usability.

GOOGLE tasks too simple, Remember The Milk has usability/interface issues. I keep finding more reasons why this is so good. Perfect balance of simplicity with powerful features that don't get in your way. Only feature I would like is a shared list (ok if only with other paying users). Great front end on Web and android.

I am a college student and always trying to find the best ways to organize myself for maximal efficiency.  The features of Todoist are extensive and flexible enough to accommodate any commitment, project, or class.  The indenting ability is key for tabbing out projects and remembering those little things you have to do.  Finally, the overview and search capabilities are perfect.  With tags you can remember all the things you need to do between 9 and 5 and crank them all out.

The app might be okay but the limited sync capability made me uninstall instantly. I might part $2 or maybe $2.50 once. Otherwise, I'm not interested when there are plenty of free alternatives.  Thanks to the dev for the response! I've reinstalled and updated my rating!! I'd give 5 stars but tend to experience crashes on my android. Web interface is great, though and the app is easy to use.

I really like the app.  The only issue I have is with the way in which completed tasks are not synced across all devices.  When I mark a task complete on my phone, I  still get an alert on my tablet.  Then I have to mark it complete again.  This is a bit annoying, but not a deal-breaker.

Seriously, you want a monthly subscription... That's just greedy.  Who does that?  This needs a non cloud based option for free.  In response to the reply: I'm a developer and know that it doesn't take massive hardware and clustered servers to run something as small as this.  Honestly, a godaddy hosting plan would probably be enough.  No need for expensive data centers.  I'd love to see a detailed description of the code base and "cloud" layout.

If like me you have a lot of tasks that repeat regularly then this is a great app for you. It allows me to maintain daily to do lists that help me keep up with all the regular chores in my life. I couldn't function without this now!
Clean, simple UI. Topnotch customer service. Expect me to use this for a long time if it adds more useful features.

Most of the others are toys, so far, but I've been using this for 2-3 years, before I got my Android tablet. I upgraded to the previous version, so I'd have more options. It gets better and better. I can now drag tasks from one project to another, color-code them according to priority, or type of task (something that I must do outside or several phases of the same task, for example). It's quite flexible and intuitive. It helps me avoid forgetting things, keeps me from feeling so overwhelmed by constantly thinking of things I need to or forgot to do (and because I can break things into small, manageable tasks), and I love clicking things off my to-do list. It also saves me time, because I enter labels by store or town, and then I can quickly sort them to group tasks together. It will send updates to email, but I access it on my office computer and my tablet, and it's great that I can do that both places and it's always in sync. No, nobody is paying me to write this rave review! I tried several similar apps, and this one's the best for me. And it even makes weekly productivity graphs for you! Perfect.
This asp would be perfect if the reminders were more reliable and it had widgets. A to-do list without widgets is not very handy. But I absolutely love the design.
This app is smooth and well put together. The design that went into it blows the other Todoist apps out of the water. Definitely worth upgrading to premium if you're a heavy task list user.

At first I really liked using todoist,  but there are some things I really don't like about it. One, that you have to pay for certain features which are just standard in any to do-list app like searching for a task or setting a reminder. And paying isn't a one time thing either which would be maybe worth the investment,  its a subscription. Second, i don't like the fact that you have to assign a category to every task, especially when the long list of categories isn't collapsible in the app,  only online.

... hampered by the fact that too much of the functional tweaks are paid ones, COMPARED to dozens other to-do app I've tried and used. =( Seriously, the UI/UX is informative, the paid one is very multifunctional yet still as simple as possible, and the categorization/tagging feature is a hoot. I WOULD SOOO USE IT if not for that fact.

I use To do it for both personal and work items, and find it invaluable for keeping on top of things. The fact that I can use the in-browser app, android app and calendar integration means I don't have an excuse to postpone my tasks until tomorrow.

Fairly basic in comparison to the web or browser add-on.  Would like to be able to start in a given project, as opposed to just 'Today' by default.  Would also like to be able to add a task in a particular spot (as opposed to the end and re-dragging).  Would also like the ability to collapse sections (ones with sub-indented entries), as in the browser add-on.

This is rather good start, with nice and mostly usable interface. But some things need improving. The start of the application is painfully slow. There's no way to set reminders from the app. Deleting a task requires 4 clicks. No way to collapse elements in the project tree. The design of the task list is not inspiring. Say, Any.Do is much nicer in this respect. Or in fact, just optionally hiding the project label.

Changing my rating since they changed the uneblievably stupid limitation of 1 sync/day (what were they thinking anyway?). Now it's a nice enough program, with lots of options and possibilities, but somewhat awkward for simple use.  The app itself is not bad, offers some nice features and shortcuts, but it lacks clarity and simplicity. Does need some reworking - maybe it's superb to handle large 'projects', but for simpler stuff  (I bet everyone's first 'project' is a shopping list) it's somewhat awkward.

I have the two-factor login enabled and this app just tells me that my email & password are not correct. I've verified that everything is right, but it refuses to use my existing Google account to login. I tried the website for support, but it appears I would need to register there separately as well in order to even ask a question or confirm my current guess about lack of two-factor support. I'm not interested in creating and tracking another account. So much for increased productivity, as far as I can tell from the outside this app and company haven't thought out their solution beyond an initial glossy front-end.
Works well and looks spectacular. The sync service and labeling premium features are too expensive for my type of usage. It might be worth it for power users though.

Sure, in its first release there might have been some features missing, but the devs are making up for it, with regular updates that actually address the small issues some users have. Carry on the good work!

This Web application has improved my work and personal life. Any time I have an idea or task I simply punch it in. I have been using todoist for years, it is the only thing able to keep me organized, and I have wanted a usable app for so long. App looks great, and performs well.  I am a little disappointed over no automatic refresh except for pay users, but not a game over. Still a great value for what I'm paying ($0).

I love Todoist. It's the only thing that's managed to keep my office and home tasks in check.  Unfortunately, this app doesn't really do much to compliment it without a premium subscription. Cannot sync more than once per day, interface is clunky... I much prefer to use the mobile website which is clean, intuitive, and best of all, refreshes for free.  Will be interested to see how long this model lasts.

Well, yes I would prefer an ad supported version, but this was the only thing I was missing for your todoist to be perfect. Bravo and I will upgrade to premium just because this completes the circle.  But I can see other peoples' point of view, this will annoy a lot of people.  You should either: 1) make the app paid 1 time with unlimited sync 2) make the app free ad supported (with 1h sync it might be acceptable) 3) both options <- i would vote for this  Free but with a very, very serious limitation is not the way forward I think.

Look, I understand you need to try to make a profit, but like others have said, why not just provide a flat one time fee for the droid app vs having to fully upgrade to a premium membership? I'd be willing to pay $5 for a highly polished app that syncs with todoist, but this isn't even a good app (see below) and I really don't need al the features of the full membership.  For now, I'll just go back to using one of the free apps that syncs with todoist.    In reagard to the features: 1) Where is the way to quickly mark a task completed? It actually takes two clicks? that's just dumb. The other free apps supporting the todoist api have a simple checkbox.  Why not have the checkbox and the advanced options you have when you click a task? I'm guessing 99% of the people that use a todo app are using it keep a quick list of things todo (like a grocery list) and want a quick way to check them off that they're completed. 2) the tasks take up wayyyyy too much vertical space (at least on my galaxy s2)  I want to see more of my tasks without having to scroll.  Note: I love the ToDoist chrome plugin

As a long time Todoist user (and a relatively new smartphone user), this new version is great. There is however one feature not present on the smartphone app. My preference (on a computer) shows Overdue, today and tomorrow. This is not available on the smartphone version and I encourage the makers to add it to make it a perfect reminder program.

Two clicks to mark task completed. Can't configure the startup view and/or project. Only one sync per 24 hours in free version.  Waited a long time for official app. Was going to upgrade to premium once released. Not anymore. Third party options seem better for me.

Works and looks great on phone. Been trying to use free apps (Budoist, Tisktasks), but nothing comes close to this! Very well polished! If those two things get added in future updates, it'll be sweet!
