Finally, a decent native app for Todoist! Great work guys; particularly like the drag-n-drop reordering (long-press).  Only a couple of things would make this even better - support in notes for basic formatting (*bold*, /italic/ _underlined_ etc), linkable phone numbers in tasks or task notes? Also, hiding items that aren't tasks (subtasks I've created with a * before them) shouldn't really show up in "items with no due date".  Otherwise, great stuff!

I tried to use the option for syncing the app to my Google account,  but instead of actually syncing,  the app sat with a thing that said it was working on syncing and wouldn't finish loading.   I tried exiting out of the app and reentering,  but it still said it was syncing.   I even checked to make sure WiFi was working,  and I found that the WiFi was at its peak of performance.   The loading continued and has not stopped.  It will not allow me to cancel the request to sync it with my Google account.

It's not a very intuitive interface. I wanted to add a sample project with a few mock tasks and couldn't figure it out within 5 minutes so I uninstalled. The quick task widget only allows scheduling for the next three days, so putting something out into the future was a no go. I don't need a ton of bells and whistles but a good, ucd interface and decent scheduling capability are important .

I like the app but why would anyone pay $28.99 / year for features that you can get elsewhere for free.   If they charged a reasonable fee up front for a full version of the app,  I would go for that.  But,  until then,  Todoist still can't touch Any.do. Uninstalled!

Disappointing. Free version has no access to any of the actually useful things (such as setting reminders and putting tasks into categories). If you want access to these things you have to pay a yearly fee. Definitely not worth it when you can do all of this on Google calendar, Samsung calendar or other equivalent for free.

Hi the problem is that sometimes when I complete tasks on Android they still show up as incomplete on Windows. This is even after Syncing a couple of times. I am a premium member. Thanks for the prompt response. Would love a feature to keep strings of daily tasks for habits like 21 days.

Very well polished app with great companion webapp. Very smart with location reminders, way better than GKeep. My only real gripe is the HUGE font on the widget. Each item is way too big; I'd like to have the option to size down my font so I can fit more tasks on my widget without scrolling.

Getting better all the time. Win10 app still buggy, frustrating to have 
huge project's tasks shuffled together. But "Android APP" and "browser 
based app on Win10 laptop" are good. Fine-motor skill needed to do task 
reordering on phone but it works. 10 second or so UnDo button after making 
a move so oops is not so tragic. 5 ☆

UI-wise it's very pretty, but a key feature is locked behind its Premium mode - reminders. This is the only thing I require and since I'm not eager to pay 28 pounds a year for a task app, I unfortunately have to skip Todoist. Check it out yourself, maybe you'll find the other Premium features worthy of a subscription.

This app does a good job of keeping up with my honeydo list, but, without the expensive subscription, lacks some important details. For example, daily notifications only list the number of items current/overdue; one must actually start the app to see the list. It's too easy, then, to just ignore items. Uninstalled and will try something else.

I like todoist but it takes forever to switch projects. It's like there is an animation and then it finally switches to the next project. Would be way better if it would just switch. Please fix. Ive been using free G-tasks in the meantime. (I have a todoist subscription)

I installed to see if it is different from other to do apps, its not, the ui is still disappointingly old paradigm, and the fact that filters and labels which are local features are premium only for 28 dollars a year bothers me. I don't mind paying for cloud synch, but I'm not going to pay that much just to see if lables and filters work how I want, though they don't look like they work how I want anyway.

I love this app becuase it is very easy to create and do tasked becuase you can create different groups and sub-groups but I wish that it had reminder support for free or they made it that you buy it out right instead of paying out each year,If so then would get an easy 5 stars

I don't ever write reviews... And I usually dislike when I'm prompted to; but honestly this app deserves my time as it has saved me so much. Todoist is the pillar of my productivity after using it for multiple years. It takes time to find your flow with it but the customizations give you many opportunities to tweak the system to your liking.

I didn't like this app, before you can even do anything it wants you to login to it.  Secondly, they have a pro version but instead of selling a better app (at a one time fee), they want a yearly subscription.  For these 2 reasons I uninstalled and went with something else.

Way, way to expensive for me. I wanted to use this now and again. Maybe people who are heavy uses may find the £21.99 a year reasonable but for me I would only pay a tenth of that. The free version is not great as it doesn't allow sync to google calender. I found an app called Wunderlist that allows me to sync for free so although a nice looking app, uninstalled

had an idea of utilizing this before since my life is totally random and i dont have any sort of fixed roune stopped halfway cuase its not really helping until i saw an animer that pushed me back.. no game no life.. anyway hope i can pull throughthis time

Ive tried many to do apps before and think this one is a great combination of simplicity and functionality.  Gret interface too.  To monthy fee to unlock the really useful features kills it for ke. I buy the pqid version of apps i use, and pay premium for apps i love. But i cannot justify subscribing, paying who knows what over time, and losing the features when i thougt ive paid enouh. Sorry devs.

It's quick and easy to jot down a note and shedule it. Easy to move or 
reschedule. Also, their help is helpful if you have questions. I asked how 
to get a task to stay on a regular date even if I put it off for a day. 
Turns out the answer was to right click and its treated a little 
differently without indication. I guess what I want to say is there's more 
than meets the eye, even for free and it serves all my work to do lists.

I'm using free version and it's ok. Would be great if I can have the following:  1. Sort by date then by priority. Right now can only have either or.  2. And once you choose how to sort it should stay that way but it doesn't. So Everytime I have to sort the way I like.  3. In each task if we can add notes that would be great as well.

I have used many To-do apps in my search for the perfect one. I've used everything from Google Keep to Wunderlist and this one blows them all out of the water! It does it all from repeatable tasks to sub-tasks and notes for tasks, priorities, labels and color coding. The $30 for Pro for a year is easily the best $30 I've spent all year. Kudos to the team for their work on this one!

I need a tasklist with a calendar interface. It would be way more efficient to click a day and a time instead of having to type "Oct 7th at 8pm".... Taking 300%-500% to longer to schedule a task becomes a big deal when you're trying to add 50+ unique tasks.

The new interface is terrific. However, not having reminders in the base app and charging $30 a year for them is a deal breaker. Reminders are a critical part of any task management app, and to pull those out and incorporate them into a premium package that cost $30 a year seems wrong. Most other task management apps include reminders. I might be willing to pay a small one-time fee to add reminders, but not a costly subscription model bundling other features I don't need.

If you are not premium, you can not get the basic things like notifications when you have to do a task. This is a basic thing that the others apps offer for free, so I don't know why I have to pay to get this feature.  I'm switching to another service until I have at least one kind of notification without the need to go premium.

If you want a notification a task is due, you have to pay $30 a year.  There's no leeway on this.  I'm fine with all the other awesome organizational and syncing things being behind the pay wall, as well as emil and sms reminders.  A reminder popping up in my notification shade I should not have to pay $30 a year for.

Google Keep can give reminders for upcoming events without costing £20. Charging that not only once but *every year* is ludicrous for the average non-business user. I just want to be reminded of my due to-do list items - that shouldn't cost more than £1 a year. I suggest the developers offer a personal version without the fancy team and multi-user features for a few pounds a year at most.

Orang OCD macam saya kena ade ni. Just change from manual handwriting planner to app. Easy to use for tech newbies.  And u can use on ur pc or mobile phone. Will upgrade to premium just to pay to appreciate their works.

This has got to be the dumbest developer in the world....lets make a reminder app, but make people pay 30 bucks a year for actual notifications and NOT put that cost in our description of this crappy app. Lets put "get instant notifications for updates" in there to be vague and hope no one gets to the premium description telling these idiot consumers that they have to pay 30 bucks for push notifications, emails or SMS reminders. Good luck to the people who actually paid up.

Beautiful design and had really high hopes until I saw reminders were a premium feature. This is a core requirement for any to do app and putting it behind a paywall really ruins the usefulness of Todoist.   I'll stick with any.do - Uninstalled in under 5 minutes

This App seems to be functional.  There is nagging to get the premium (ie complete) product.  I was expecting this to be something like a $5 or £3 one off payment as most are. In reality it is $30 a year which to my mind is an outrageous price for something that MIGHT be a bit better than free or very cheap alternatives.   The urging to buy the complete product got on my wick so i have uninstalled  and gone for "ultimate to do list" .  which seems very good for a reasonable one off payment.

Nice to have a well executed to-do list. However, it constantly has premium features (like reminders and labels) that you cannot use in the way. You might try to use these simple not premium features and be asked to upgrade to use. The cost is far too expensive ($28/yr) for a single user who just wants a reminder. I'd pay $5 once for more features. I can use the built-in (free) Google launcher reminders.
Have been using it for 2 years now. App is great. But adding new task fast is little complicated. You have to click it once more to change its default folder from Inbox to the folder you want.

This app is really good and I loved it, however, the fact that reminders are a premium feature is not a good thing. I know you guys need to get users to sign up for premium but reminders are a very basic task and it would be so much better if it weren't a paid feature.

The app had an eye-catchy design and a start up planner on how to do your task. It has a friendly approach so that's a plus. But, the good part was in premium. So a free user like me has a hard time to cope up with my task because it doesn't have any reminders. Yes, I know, it needs to have a paywall so the creator behind the app can earn money for themselves. But, I'll just put my critics here to tellfree users like me. Anyways, good job. I really like your app.

I was searching for a  minimalistic to-do list and this most certainly is one. To be honest I only messed with it for a short time, but the UI was smooth, minimal and organized. I started filling in my tasks and went to add a reminder for one when it prompted me to upgrade the app. You have to pay for reminders? As I said, from what I can tell this is a great app, but I'm not paying $30 (for a year) just for the convenience of reminders.

After much hesitation and searching,  I jumped from countless todo apps to Todoist and now I am wondering why I didn't do it sooner. If you follow gtd or just want plain todo tracking app, Todoist will fit your needs. App is extremely intuitive and flows naturally (Reminders,  labels (contexts),  folders and priorities are based on natural language interpretation) as you download stuff from brain to app. Best feature is Google Now integration that captures Note/Due Date better than Siri. Thank You 4 app.

The biggest thing you need with a task app is sync between systems, but you will not be able to test that more than once a day.  No X day trial of full features and WOW $30 a year.  What I could test looks nice.

The app wasn't bad but in the free version you couldn't set reminders...which is something I wanted to test before paying.  Also I got bombarded with emails about getting premium etc etc. I have uninstalled the app since the free version was more of a hassle than a help. Not to mention I can use my Google calendar for alerts and it's free.

Another app that is overly complicated and forces you to give them all your information, so that they can sell it to the entire world, before they will allow you to use the app.  Personally, because of my line of work, I am NOT allowed a Facebook or Twitter account. I wish someone could learn to make a simple, useful, easy to understand application, without sucking every drop of blood from you!

Finally a fantastic free service. I tried many many others, and todoist 
really jumped out. Works flawlessly with my workflow, with an integrated 
mail add-on, a phone app, windows desktop program, and a browser tab. 
Simple and efficient to add tasks, type in text based due dates such as 
"everyday starting in 5 days" and it will recognise it, use # to 
categorise, it's quick and easy and that's the most important thing for an 
organiser. Will be purchasing the yearly premium service, not that I need 
it, but because these Devs deserve it

The ToDoist staff have turned the tides on my previously negative review. I'm a long time ToDoist enthusiast. I operate on my own and reached enlightened status over a year ago I think. Stopped counting after I reached that one. ToDoist, why not add some other states to reach? I know it's weird, but I've always been goal oriented and reaching that intangible status actually made me more productive. Aside from that, thank you for all the recent changes. And continually improving your product.

3.99 a month just to be able to add notes to a project is a blatant rip off.  Shouldn't cost more than 2.99 ONCE for this 'option'  Syncing may be a 'premium' feature. Adding a note is not. Requiring a premium fee every month for BASIC functionality is still a ripoff no matter what your excuse.   P. S. Dropbox is free.

The app looks nice, but the scheduling interface is extremely confusing. There is no option  to open a calendar and pick a date or time, and recurring items are almost impossible to schedule (as in, every month on the first). I gave up on trying to figure out this interface, and the help is almost nonexistent. It's anything but intuitive.

Only using free version, but it's the best to do app I have used (in 8+ years of Android use).  I'm not thrilled with subscription-based unlocked, tho.  The prospect of having my data held hostage over money turns me away instantly.

I downloaded this app after a recommendation from Mike Vardy of the Productivityist.  His advice and Todoist have changed my life! I feel way less stressed with my new task focused schedule,  I could not do it without Todoist.  Functionality is great,  and I love that I can add labels and sort tasks in different ways. A++.

This is the best note taking app on Google Play. Hands down. I've rated it 2 stars for the fact that just plain simple notifications are a premium feature. It is unbelievable some of the things that come free, but just a reminder for a task is a paid feature. I'm a college student in need of a good note app, and want to use this one but I can't. I need reminders! With out paying $30 a year for them. Therefore, I have to continue using keep.

I've tried this many times before but the inclusion of Amazon Echo UK integration is fantastic and works very well for my needs. Will now definitely keep using this program now and has actually helped be start getting things done..

I downloaded this app so I could have a free organized to-do list that would remind me when I have something due coming up but found out quickly that its reminder feature (via push notifications) you must have premium to use (meaning you'd have to pay extra). It defeated the purpose of having it for me; I am not willing to pay extra for it so I uninstalled the app.

Todoist has been my to do list app of choice for nearly 3 years. I've tried others but come back because it's so good. Fast, lean and flexible app. The paid features are worth it and cost less for a year than you'll pay for a dinner out. I am not compensated by todoist, I just think it's the best option and I'm not a cheap ass

On iOS and OS X, OmniFocus reigns pretty much without threat as the best task manager, specially for those who follow GTD principles. For those of us who want a solution that works cross platform, there haven't been any serious options. It wasn't until quite recently Todoist got to a level of functionality that made it a worthy replacement. After 2 years of looking, I finally felt that there was a task manager that would allow me to switch to Android. Go for the paid version, it has better functionality.

Beyond creating Projects which are more like folders and adding tasks with a due date, almost every other feature is listed as a Premium feature and unavailable including reminders. Hence the 3 stars which is generous IMO. If you are not making all those features available the version labeled as free on play store, then as far as I am concerned, that is not what was advertised. Such  bait-n-switch tactics reallyname me mad. It may be a great app in the premium edition but it doesn't have the basic features for a decent to do app. Uninstalled it! The hunt continues...

After trying out a bunch of todo apps, I've settled for Todoist and it 
hasn't disappointed me so far. The app is intuitive yet rich in features. 
Sync speed is top notch, better than any app I've tested. The design could 
be revamped to be more exciting, maybe follow Google's updated material 
design language. There's nothing to complain in it's current state however. 
Highly recommended. Looking forward to using Todoist for a long time.

The computer application from what I've seen so far is good but I've tried both Playstore & Google downloads on my phone & after 2 days am frustrated as I can't get it to install. I have a Samsung 6 but my work partner has a Apple & he said he was having similar problems. Would love to give this app a serious try. Help!

I reluctantly started using this app because it was required at my office. I am really glad that we made the move even though the learning curve was a little high. This app is very flexible and allows you to tailor the use toward personal or corporate needs.

Would appreciate it if more features are included such as: display tasks according to dates for longer period of time (not just next 7 days), able to sync tasks with google calendar or outlook calendar app

Though every other feature is for premium account, it still gets the basic job done. My fav feature is the web-to-phone synchronization cuz i hate typing stuff into the phone. Todoist lets me type on my laptop n transfers the list to my phone. Greatest relief eva!

Love this app and keep trying to get the tech-phobics in my office to try it. Super easy to use and for me the best feature is the integration with gmail. I've tried all of the major task managers out there and todoist wins hands down for me. I have now upgraded to premium but you don't need that at all to make it work for you. I used the free version for probably a year.  Love this app!

Can't say much, just didn't like it or the way it appeared and worked. Wasn't for me. I really don't understand why it was so highly rated in on-line reviews. I needed certain features but not all the bells and whistles of some apps. You need to see what you like, need and how easy it is to use, yourself.
Seems like this app is a joke because I can neither log in, sign up or sign through google. It just freezes on "Please wait" :D looked promising, turned out terrible.

Excellent thinking by developers, seriously had helped me better operate my daily life and  professional life.Some things i want developers to have a look at : 1. Expand collapse all function for subtasks,say i have 25 tasks and 5 subtasks for each of them, then while reviewing clicking each one of them manually makes things a bit complicated   2. Adding sub task difficult right now since it is added to last task by default , can Customized right swipe to the task be included to add a Sub task  OR just like clicking a task displays priority, label etc, can we have option of subtask displayed instead of being under menu 3. Add a switch to hide particular list from main list/parent list/filters too ? Some lists are just common items or maybe just including them in main list might disturb the logic flow.  4. Instead of having click the + icon can we have a quick add bar at bottom. 5. Comments are good, but can we have description segment for each task....  These are in no way shortcomings of the app but some of personal suggestions only.. Thanks a ton for developing such a quality app and keeping most of its features free and best of all adfree which not even 1% of apps are doing... I m surely looking fwd to being it's premium user.....

Clean design, excellent synchronisation, so far robust, subtasks and quite complicated recurrences. This has replaced remember the milk for me. Very simple and clear way to add tasks on the phone or tablet. One star knocked off because of the slightly convoluted and unintuitive methods for making a subtask or doing complicated reminders such as "recycle garden waste every 2 weeks from this thursday". Both things can be done but are much easier on the web.

It doesn't sync with Google Tasks, rather only with its own proprietary servers. It is also essentially a demo in my book, as notifications are central to task management and that's a premium only feature. It is, however, pretty. And if you don't mind paying, and don't mind lack of Google Tasks sync, then it may work for you.

The app is probably good for large groups that require advanced collaboration options. For personal use,  I would rather stick to Keep. It allows me to create notes,  sync & organize them, share them, add images  and set up time/location reminders. All this for free with just your Google account. Now why in the world would I create a new account and pay for using your app?
Unfortunately free version is a little bit limited. After using full version I feel lack of functionality. But still using it because it's cool and simple

Completely aggravating. Put in a reminder for an event, then adding the time; if I add any other numbers to the reminder (such as an address) it starts pushing those numbers into the date/time part of the reminder in the highlighted red box. Useless and deleted app.

Probably has the potential to be the best app in its category on Play Store. Too bad they make you pay $30 yearly subscription fee for basic features like reminders and notifications. I don't mind paying for apps. But $30/year is ridiculus.

Have just switched to Android from iPhone and biggest concern was being able to find a replacement for "Things", an app I thought was irreplaceable. Turns out that ToDoist is much more feature-rich, but can be either as simple or complex as meets requirements because the more advanced features don't obscure the basic functionality. Have always avoided subscription software until now as well, but have subscribed to ToDoist (5p a day!) because the service is constantly updated, rather than expensive updates.

It's been over 30 minutes and it still haven't installed. Something is wrong. For all i know its just stealing my information. Who the heck knows. Apps don't usually take that long to install. I've washed dishes, cleaned the house, checked my emails. WTH?

Couldn't go beyond creating an account and adding a task. Bam! What a surprise! You can't have reminders without having premium subscription! This is a very basic feature (maybe THE feature in GTD) and practically makes the free version useless. I won't proclaim myself as a power user, so I don't need to make 200 projects in this app. I need an app which allows me to create a few projects and add reminders for each task. And I think that should come free. Can't really see the greatness of this app, sorry.

I tested this in a Windows-syncing-with-Android configuration. The Windows installer failed initially, which was disturbing enough on its own. Then I had a sync bug (task duplication) in a trivial case within the first few minutes of use. Quickly abandoned after that, as that's totally unacceptable for productivity software. This seems to be one of those apps that's better at self-promotion than fulfilling its remit. Working on every platform too often means you don't work on any of them. There are competitors that do all this and more, better. Except perhaps the marketing.
Rip off garbage. Did not refund my 28.00 even after uninstalled in one minute of installing. Reporting to Florida attorney general office

Deleted my 2-star review just to make it 1-star. It was 2 stars because of app limitations etc.  Now on topic. I've deleted this app about 10 days ago. For the next few days i went on, following the email link to unsubscribe from "todoist digest", telling me i "unsubscribed succesfully" just to have it come back the next day. I also added it to spam from my email client, but it kept on coming. Finally it stopped.   I thought it was because after unsubscribing three or four days in a row they finally got the message. It wasn't. Ten minutes ago i checked out my spam folder, just to find eight more messages, one every day. I "unsubscribed succesfully" yet again and now i'm looking into other ways of reporting them for the constant spam i receive.

One of my colleagues mentioned this service and I decided to check it out. Simply put, there is no better task management solution out there. I now have all of my tasks broken down by project and synced in Outlook, on my phone and tablet, in Chrome through the extension and I can also do everything on the web. The premium service is totally worth the money as it allows for push notifications, turning emails into tasks in Outlook, adding notes and attachments to tasks and so much more. I cannot say enough great things about Todoist!

I LOVE the interface. But decided to not use it in the end as it doesn't have the subtask function which I find essential. Am aware of the project function but it's troublesome to create a project for a task that you plan to finish in a day. Would definitely use this if there's a subtask function.

What the creators of this app think it'd one of the apps strong selling points is what actually makes this app a nightmare to use. I am referring to task scheduling using "plain language". Google does not allow enough space here for me to list all of the problems this creates but if your app has a tutorial on the syntax required to schedule tasks, then you have a problem. Another thing... Where I live, all months do not have 30 days. Some have 31 or even less. Ev month should not turn into ev 30 days.

I don't like an app that says it's free but useless unless you purchase the pro app. Call it a trial and let me try it so I can decide if it works for me and is worth purchasing.  Not being able to make notes, in the free app, makes it useless.  Installed and uninstalled - Bam! Moving on to another solution.

New phone,  thought I'd try it again.  Couldn't get the thing past the setup screen.  Tried using my Google account and tried setting up a new account.   Both methods hung up trying to do something.  I give up on it. LG G3

Customer support was fantastic and gave me a few trial on the premium so that I could test all the features, but the reoccurring task options were too limited, for my needs. UI was legit, as was most of the other options. I don't mind them charging for the full feature set either, I just couldn't justify spending it without better reoccurring task options. I recommend SplenDO or TickTick.

Todoist helps me keep track of a lot of my important projects that will fall by the wayside if I don't have a reminder. Also I get a sense of accomplishment when I complete all my tasks in a day. It's a really useful tool!

Loved it at first until I discovered you have to pay a one year fee of $30 for something as basic as notifications. Despite it seeming worth it, I won't risk another wunderlist. (notification fail) which is why I thought I'd make the change in the first place. Still from my initial testing  I liked it alot.
This version (free) is missing any kind of notification system making it basically unusable as a to do list.
Have been using omnifocus for a couple of years.  Paid quite a bit on that platform.  Was looking around when i changed to a android. Will still use todoist if one day i used back a iphone today

Not intuitive! Am usually fine without a "How to" but this app is just to complicated for me. I prefer To Do from microsoft as it's simple enough but does the job. There are no ways to make recurring tasks with reminders (Birthdays?!) and only 5 folders are allowed in standard which is useless. I refuse to pay monthly for a simple app like this. Maybe 20.- for lifetime. When you first start out there are a million notification mails and tasks set up by the app that you have to delete manually.

I thought I'd give it a shot because I like to change the way things look on my phone. Everything was going fine until it asked me to upgrade to a premium version for just a REMINDER to my task! I mean.. Seriously? I could just 'ok google, remind me at xyz to do abc' and even that's free. Sad.

This looks like a great app.. However the unavailability of 'Reminder' which is a basic feature for any task manager is missing in this version.. Agree that this is a free version.. However I feel like basic features should be added to the free version and the premium features can be charged.. I was unable to try this app for more than a day due to the lack of reminders..

the app is good for remaining organised but the prob is i cant hear any notifications/vibrations on the start of any task.. We shudnt hv to chek mobile every nw and then to know whether theres any upcoming task or not.. please fix this.. otherwise a nice app..
This is very beautifully designed app, but main function missing here is it doesn't sent notification in phone and rather mails it... try bringing it for all users

From scheduling a giant "To Do" list to managing multiple "Projects" this application is simply INCREDIBLE!  Keeps me on task,  coordinated with key colleagues,  customers and friends.  To the design Team "Thank You for your hard work designing a dynamic tool for the well organized to the folks with Adult ADD!" One of the very very rare applications that does what it says it will do and haven't had a single glitch with the app!    P.S. -My wife wants me to thank you!  This app is good for marriages too!

I paid the subscription and then cancelled it a day later. This is almost two months ago and until today, although promised, they didn't refund me the yearly fee. They mention you can request a refund within 30 days. Yeah right .... rip off. So everyone be aware if you subscribe that you won't get any cent back if you change your mind.
Have been using this app on a Mac PC iPhone Android tsbket/phone and iPad for a couple of years now.  Just haven't found anything that comes close to ToDoist

Not nearly as intuitive as I was hoping it would be. I like the sales pitch of Todoist, and I was about to purchase a year of the service via Humble Bundle, but this app turned me off it. Not nearly enough options when creating tasks. I didn't even see a way to have a task repeat every day or week.
If you are looking for something to push you acomplish goals with more efficiency, this is the app you need.  It is really user-friendly and helpful
Clean it up. Get rid of all the auto crap. I want my home page to be open projects, not a specific project.

This app is slick. I love the interface. I would use it constantly if I didn't have to pay 28.99 USD a year to categorize my tasks. That's a basic function of every other to do list. Freemium at its worst
I thought it would combine my Google calendar, which already works great for me with my multiple email accounts. Todoist isn't worth the effort.
Apps for all devices, simplistic and smooth. Just have A hard time paying a subscription for a to do list. Should be a once time fee. I'd pay, but Im having a hard time justifying $31 a year.

This is probably my favorite to do  manager - and I've tried a lot - but I'm going back to 2do because there I can get all the functionality I need for a one-time upgrade fee. I want Todoist to provide task alarms/notifications, but not at the cost of $29 a year. Ouch! But they seem to be getting subscribers, so hard to fault their business plan, even if I don't like it....
I Like that Karma Points as well as The Reminders And the Simplicity of it makes it too easy to Keep Up With What You've done Or forgot to do.

Instead of helping me manage tasks, this is just one more intrusive app reminding me of stuff. I need something that works with my calendar, not outside of it. I can see how this app might be useful to some, but it does not enhance my online experience. Two stars.

I don't even see most of the features I expect to find in a to do list.  I'm not interested in a trial to the premium service. If you didn't impress me with the free version I don't want to try anything else.
Recently taken on extra position at work and love how I can divide out talks and prioritize the m. I see this from all the computers, tablets and phone with syncing streamline.  Great app

Very nice looking app, like the idea of the projects and being able to share. Unfortunately a vital part of this is not available without paying for it. Reminders!! Very strange as this would normally be standard. Uninstalled & very disappointed in what looked like a promising app.

I have compared all best To Do apps. Todoist stands out from all of them. I really want to use this app but it's free version is not doing the most basic thing - REMINDER!
